review_body: Have stayed here many times. Usually book here or 2 others nearby depending on price that weekend (our damages for 2 nights were only $480).We like the location.Staffing is good. Of course you will be in a very small but efficient "modern" room.Have a free happy hour every night which is lively (we were out those times). They have gratis continental breakfast every morning - coffee, juices, fruit, and some pastries. Not gourmet but you save quite a few $s compared to nearby eateries. However, the eating area can be quite packed.Overall a good lodging although we had a burned out light and the shower had developed mold.Check them out.

Corner suite, great bathroom, great location and service was fine. Give the breakfast a miss there are lots of great local places to eat. I was there on business and it was pretty much impossible to do any work without properly working wifi, constant drop outs. Spoke to reception they were pretty resigned to the fact it was a common place occurrence in the evenings and that was that!If I was there on holidays wouldn’t have minded so much.

My wife, extended family and I stayed at Nolitan NYC and were well taken care of.The thoughtful staff particularly Steven, Sherieka, Kaltrina and Samantha under the leadership of the GM Bogdan made the stay most comfortable. They are thoughtful, kind and attentive from your entry to your departure. We look forward to our next stay under the leadership of the great staff and location.

My wife and I had a wonderful time staying at the Nolitan for part of our honeymoon. We were treated very well and enjoyed a nice complimentary bottle of Champaign. The interior of the room was beautiful with a great view of the city. Additionally, the staff was welcoming and were always ready to assist us with any questions we had about the area.

Perfect place to stay if you want to go to the Met or down to Twin Tower Memorial. Comfortable room, everything you need and very helpful staff! Bed was comfortable and accommodations just perfect! Thanks for relaxing stay!

We stayed here only one night for my sons 4th birthday. But it was one of the better experiences I’ve had at a hotel in New York City. The hotel is located near some great food spots and shopping. We were greeted by Toni Hudak upon our arrival and she was fantastic. She gave us all that we needed to know about the hotel and even suggested eating at the restaurant located in the hotel called The Usual. We ate there for lunch and it was delicious. Toni also helped us out with getting cupcakes for my sons 4th birthday. She was so nice to go out of her way and have it ready for a surprise. Not only was she very helpful but she is very friendly & made our stay an excellent one. This hotel is lucky to have an employee like Toni! The room itself was very clean and we had a corner room with a direct view of the Empire State Building. They also have a happy hour for guests with free champagne, wine & cheese plate. The next morning they served complimentary breakfast (pastries, yogurt & fresh cut fruit) which was great! Toni was there & she even got juices for my 2 small boys and let us know tea/coffee was ready for guests. I definitely recommend staying here because we will back for sure! Great staff & hotel!!

We stayed at The Nolitan in December 2019 for our honeymoon. I have never been to New York before and we had a great stay at this hotel. The location was perfect, i adore Soho and it is so close to everything and easy to catch the subway. The hotel itself was very 'New York' the lobby is cosy and cool. The bar 'the usual' offered happy hour for hotel guests every night which included free wine and a cheese platter, we loved this! Our room was small but very modern and had a great view. I would definitely recommend :)

Great location near Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown. It's the best place I have stayed in the city. Nolitan gives you modern luxury without the uncomfortable stuffiness. The King suite was very comfortable and simply well arranged. Stocked bar, snacks, robes, slippers, clean, no hotel scent comfortable bed and great view. The Usual restaurant connected to the hotel was very good as well. I would stay again and again. The staff was very professional.

destinyh165
New York City, New York

review_body: This is my third stay at NolitanNew York is very busy, fast-paced, and stressful when you just want to sightsee.It slows down once you get to Nolitan. You can plan your trip out from the comfort of your room here.The rooms are clean and of a unique design great for couples, Very cozy. The restaurant downstairs has great accommodation at the bar, you do not have to wait long for a drink. Management is very helpful and accommodating with directions and room service. You can rent a bike to see the city. valet parking, good drawer space. Looking forward to staying again. Walking distance to D, B,6, N, Q, R, W, J, Z subway trains.Nice urban vibe of the city. Close to tourist shopping areas.

My wife and I stayed a this hotel, a Sunday night, and it was a sublime experience. We were greeted by a friendly staff who seemed to anticipate our every need. Before heading up to our room , we wanted to try The Usual, the restuarant adjacent to the lobby of the hotel accesible through the side door. We were able to leave our bags at reception while we ate and had drinks, very fine. Once we were done, we headed upstairs to our room 705. It was cozy, with a modern-idustrial feel. This was a balcony room, and although freezing, we had to spend some time out there taking in that view (The Empire State Buiding and Chrysler , among others). They have great black out curtains to keep the city out once your ready to hit the hay. The mini bar is decent, stock with gin/wine/whisky and some soft drinks. There is also a snack drawer that you can pick from if you get a midnight craving. The pillows were great, with the perfect level of firmness. The next morning, just as you get out of the elevator on the lobby level, breakfast is available. They have muffins/pastries/yogurt/granola/fruits and a quality cup of coffee awaiting. Quick out was quick and easy, just the way i like it.

A very well managed facility. Rooms are very warm, cozy and simply comfortable. It has a very modern, chic and luxurious feel. It becomes very clear that all simple considerations you would want from someone accommodating you were all evident. Whether they were sections within the room or items to use in them, to the little notes associated with it. the quality takes the Nolitian's desire to care for its guess is shown in the quality all around and takes it to another level. My wife and I would love to stay over and over again!

Stayed for two nights at the Nolitan. Check in and service staff were excellent. Situated north of little Italy, west of Chinatown and the lower east side, south of SOHO — this is literally the perfect spot. You can take a quick 30 min beautiful walk across the Williamsburg bridge and be in Brooklyn in no time as well. Breakfast is a perfect start to the day with fresh baked muffins and croissants - not Costco items that are reheated. When the rooftop opens up this will be one of the best views of the city.

After staying for a couple of nights in 2017, we were excited to return to The Nolitan for 5 nights in November.- The location is fantastic, my favourite in the city - so close to so many of my favourite places (check out Charley Street, Black Seed Bagels and Eggshop, all literal steps away!). It's a short walk to so many amazing places, and a couple of blocks from a number of subway stops. - Staff were great- The little extras that were improved from last time - the basic breakfast and lobby coffee plus happy hour every day - The design of the hotel - rooms are small but they are functional and well thought out. Plenty of bench space in the bathroom, loved having a balcony to open to fresh air and really love how much natural light the rooms get. - Incredibly well priced when we stayed. The street is pretty noisy so level 5 and above is best. There aren't power outlets at the head of the bed, which is a bummer but totally manageable. Next time we are in the city, we will definitely be back - can't recommend it enough.

I liked this hotel. The price varies wildly (I payed about $180 when I stayed but when I looked at staying there tonight it would have been $500), so whether it's a "value" is very variable. But at least it's a cute hotel. I think I had a view of a wall though.

I think we had the impression that this was going to be luxury boutique, but found the hotel fell short of the mark given the price. Probably the most egregious flaw that stuck out to us was the chill that permeated the hotel. Upon arriving at night, we decided to eat dinner at the restaurant in the lobby. I’m not one to easily get cold, but the restaurant was so cold that even though I was wearing a sweater, I was anxious to get my bill and get out. Arriving in our room, we found the same experience. Cold room, cold floors. Turning up the heat helped a bit, but the heat would constantly turn itself off and we were back to the same problem. For me, a hotel room should offer a respite from the outside world, but I often felt like I was camping because of the chill in the room. The hallways outside were also especially cold. The weather outside was in the 30’s-40’s so it's not like it was absurdly cold outside, but the pervasive chill made me just want to stay under the covers in our room. Another unsettling aspect was the noise from honking horns on the street. It wasn't pervasive, but from around 3:00-7:00 PM, traffic was backed up on Kenmare and you could clearly hear cars honking their horns for the entirely of that time.  Another miscue is the layout of the room. The layout seemed very inefficient and clumsy. For example, the water closet (toilet) is located by the front door but the bathroom and sink are located around the corner and on the other side of the room, meaning that you have to walk all the way around to wash your hands. The bathroom had its own problems. The towel rack is awkwardly stuck on a wall behind the head if the bathtub making it extremely difficult to get to. We had to shimmy between the tub and the wall to get to it. The shower head turns on when you turn on the water, meaning you'll get a shock of cold water on your arm when turning on the water. Another awkward placement is the curtain to look outside. It’s located behind a chair, meaning you once again, have to shimmy behind the furniture in order to get to something. The room lights were also awkwardly located and took a while to figure out. Finally, the corner of the wooden bed frame stuck out at shin level, and given the tightness if the room made it possible to bang your shin. The TV remote was unresponsive and difficult to change channels. Sometimes the TV would unexpectedly turn off. The Wi-Fi was slow and practically useless. With these criticisms being said, there are some positives. I do like the neighborhood, which is close to Chinatown and Little Italy. They offered a limited continental breakfast in the morning. I had a croissant which was pretty decent. I did like the bathtub. It took the chill off from the cold, cold room. If this were a budget priced hotel, I could forgive a lot of the above criticisms, but I don't think you can put a nice lobby in a hotel, throw a few nice touches in a room, but have glaring errors in basic hotel needs. Most hotels give you a sense of relaxation after a day of being out, but this place just made me want to go home to a warm place where things actually worked.

The Nolitan Hotel is one of the best hotel near Soho and Little Italy. We stayed at 8th floor and we had nice view to Empire State Building. There were several bikes around the lobby that they were for the guests to use (we didn't take them). In price included the breakfast (not many different things but it was good to start your morning). Would 100% recommend this hotel for its clean rooms and the perfect location in the city and near the nightlife and sub stations.

I stayed in the regular Neighborhood room on the 5th floor. This hotel is great for a solo traveler, but I wouldn't recommend staying here if you need to share a room with friends or family.Here are some pros and cons about my stay:Pros:-Staff: The staff was friendly and really helpful.-Location: The hotel is within walking distance of SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown. You won't have any problems finding a place to eat or shop at. The Usual (restaurant) is also connected to the hotel.-Amenities: Some amenities my room came with are a hair dryer, slippers, yoga mat, mini bar, iron, and ironing board. I do wish the room came with a free water bottle. I did see an Ethernet wall connection, but didn't test it. The speed of the free WiFi was moderate. The AC/heating unit also worked well.-Other: I had a few deliveries sent to the hotel. They all made it to the hotel and the staff held my deliveries if I wasn't there to receive them. Cons:-Room layout: The shower and sink area and the toilet room are on separate sides of the front entrance. The shower and sink area also didn't have a door to close it off. The front door is visible from the shower door, which is all glass. If two people shared a room and someone was showering, the other person wouldn't be able to go in and out of the room because the shower might be visible from the outside if you opened the front door. I suggest installing a sliding door to block off this area.-Outlet locations: There are no electrical outlets next to the bed. I use my phone as my alarm so thankfully I brought an extra long charing cable that reached the bed. I wish there was at least a USB charging dock on one of the bedside tables.-Outside noise level: The hotel is on a busy street so you hear cars honking until midnight. I sleep late so that was okay for me. If you sleep early and are a light sleeper, you might have trouble sleeping. However, the inside of the hotel was very quiet.-Other: The rooftop area is closed. I was told they are renovating it to be a bar.

The Nolitan is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in NYC. We were warmly welcomed by the generous staff and impeccable decor outfitting the hotel's lobby. I noticed several bikes around the lobby thinking it was part of the decor, only to find out on my last day that they were for the guests to use (huge bonus points). Now, when in NYC you can't expect to have a massive room for the money you spend; after all this isn't Columbus, Ohio or something. The rooms were on the smaller side, however the clever branding and amenities made up for what lacked in size. Aside from all of that, they had complimentary breakfast. BREAKFAST! In a New York hotel! Crazy. Would 100% recommend this hotel for its charm in the perfect location in the city.

This is not only a great hotel, the location is on point for a perfect city experience!! The hotel has an edgy, modern feel, it's immaculate and when you sleep better in a hotel than home that's something to be said about the comfort of the bed!! The staff is there to please and accommodate, Samantha is particularly helpful arranging transportation around the city. The hotel is in walking distance to little Italy and Chinatown, cafes, restaurants and cool shopping!! Don't overlook staying here for a most memorable visit!!

New York City, New York

review_body: We loved our recent stay at The Nolitan! We were gifted with room 908, a corner room with a lovely view of the Empire State Building. The room was clean, fairly spacious compared to other NYC hotels, and the staff was super friendly and helpful from check in, to housekeeping, to the members/staff of the adjoining restaurant. While there was construction happening on the rooftop bar area, we did not experience any noise issues, and only found the carpets in the elevators were often messy from construction debris being transported therein. The bed was very comfortable, and the ceiling fan in addition to the A/C was a bonus! They even provided us with a coffee maker upon request, as the rooms are not outfitted with them standard. This was our first time trying a new hotel in NYC, and we are looking forward to returning again one day soon! Thank you, Nolitan staff and management.

Some of the reasons I loved my stay: - quiet but effective AC- terrific black out curtains- ceiling fan - spotless room- perfect weight of high quality cotton sheets - complimentary (quite good) coffee in the lobby each morning.

If you’re looking for a beautifully designed hotel, functionality without skimping on luxury and detail, knowledgeable attentive staff in one of the most vibrant, interesting neighborhoods of Manhattan, The Nolitan comes highly recommended. The lobby is beautifully designed, with a great selection of books where you could sit for hours and watch New York street-life pass you by. The hotel offers complementary bikes to their guests! The room (try to get a corner suite) is clean, with lots of smart details (an iron plus board! A closet!), the bed large and comfortable with luxurious linen and the spacious bathroom comes with a bath! The restaurant on site, The Usual, is a gem. Do yourself a favor and sample as many of the dishes as you possible can. I recommend the beautifully prepared pork chop with crispy fried rice and kimchi and the hoe cake slathered with maple butter. But you can’t go wrong with anything you order off the menu. Great wine selection too.

The Nolita Hotel is a diamon in the middle of New York. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are not o ly beautiful but also elegant and cleverly design. They even have a bath! All is taken care of to the detail. The views are super and conveniently located close to important tourist areas. Please, please, please, do not forget to eat in the restorant,the food is amazing.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Nolitan for the very first time in July 2019. I was lucky to get the last available room. This is a hotel for people that don’t really like your average hotel. The design is stylish and unique enough that you don’t really feel like you are in a hotel. It’s almost a shame that there is so much to see and do in the near vicinity because the room has a way of keeping you in it. The combination of beautiful, industrial design and mid century modern furniture create a relaxing space to hang out and watch the scenery out of the huge windows. Nolita is a really cool neighbourhood and the Nolitan has bicycles for the guests to ride and check out the city. Their downstairs restaurant is pretty awesome too! Get a ho cake and some fried chicken! Or enjoy the restful aroma of the wood smoked salmon fillet which is so moist, rich and tender.Anyways, I had an awesome time here. The staff are nice, rooms are super clean and feel brand new, beds are comfortable with really nice down pillows. If you are in the area and there is vacancy, I would say book now!!

I stayed for a week in The Nolitan, party vacation and for the most part business. I loved the location, very central and Subway stops are close by, neighbourhood is the best, restaurants, grocery store are around the corner. The design of the lobby and rooms is great and best of all is the staff: helpful, friendly and personal. Can’t wait to go back!

Needed stay over in the city rather commute back to the suburbs. Got a reasonable deal last minute - $257 including taxes. At that price point you never know what you will get....In this case I was pleasantly surprised. Good location at the corner of Kenmare and Elizabeth in Nolita. Chinatown to the south and Little Italy north/east.Great area for strolling and taking in the varied neighborhoods. Tons of great restaurants and bars. Hotel lobby is nice - could relax in sunken lounge. My room (901) was top floor, back of building on Elizabeth street. Perhaps the quietest spot in the building. Rooms are small but nicely appointed. Was clean. Bed reasonably comfortable. Bathroom, while small, was clean and highly functional.I would definitely stay again under similar circumstances without hesitation. Would be a good spot for visitors who want to try a different neighborhood rather than the mid-town helter skelter.Four stars not because of it isn't nice but 5 stars is reserved in my opinion for excellent "high end" hotels. This is a high quality mid-market hotel.

New York City, New York

review_body: If you open up a design/architectural magazine and come across a space that is just inspiring and elevates your mood wanting you to pay it a visit that’s the Nolitan! Here mid-century charm meets the essence of a museum experience without being high brow and snooty. On the contrary it has the approachability and friendliness of a neighborhood coffee shop! The rooms are exceptionally clean, super comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay at a corner room full with free standing bathtub and spectacular views towards Nolita/SoHo all the way down to midtown. You wake up bathe in soft light thanks to the diffused glass panels that give you all the privacy you need without closing you in. This hotel is so perfect for this beautiful neighborhood that keeps reinventing itself again and again thanks to its timeless and yet very modern esthetics. While there, an absolute must is the gorgeous rooftop where you feel elevated above all the buildings having unobstructed views to Nolita/SoHo/midtown/ and wall street/freedom tower on its north/south axis and SoHo/Williamsburg bridge on this east/west axis. The fact that you have all you could ask for (including free bike checkout) makes this a one stop hub for all your NYC excursions. Literally the entire island is walking distance away from its super convenient location. So if you are looking for an affordable hotel that is super clean, perfectly located and just a stunner in terms of its design aesthetics, you have found it in the Nolitan!!!

cool lobby and very modern feel to the entire hotel. the room we were in just wasn't comfortable. very small. toilet behind one door, sink and shower in a different spot. really don't like using the bathroom, opening a door, and THEN going to wash hands. It was an annoyance, but really the big reason I don't think I'd stay here again is that the room is just too small. Cramped. Great location though. Lots to walk to.

Incredible hôtel in the center of everything. Staff was great & manager very understanding. Rooms are generous with a balcony and a gorgeous view! fully recommend this « human sized » hotel, where you feel like at home. In addition, 2-5min walk to any subway line to reach up town, downtown or brooklyn.

Super great staff that was really accommodating during our stay. We had a ton of wardrobe for a photo shoot, Steven was super helpful during the daily loading and unloading (thank you!). Jason and the ladies at the front were also super wonderful!

Very nice little hotel in the perfect area- Soho near lower east side.Great staff at the reception.Room is small but well organised. One or 2 extra shelves or drawers would be good.Nice complimentary aperitivo in the evening.You do hear street noise but it’s not too bad (at least in April it’s ok)Would definitely stay here again!

I just spent 10 days at the NoLitan during Easter break. I found it to be one of the best hotel experiences in memory. In the age of aggregated online booking the personal touch has been lost in a lot of hotels. Not the case with the Nolitan. From the GM (Bogdan) to the cleaning staff everyone makes you feel welcomed and at home. The location is as good as it gets for Manhattan. Nolita is central and still has a NYC vibe with lots of amenities close by. Rooms are very clean and the hotel has everything you need... nothing you don't. Highly recommended for business or pleasure or as in my case... both.

Had a fabulous stay with decent sized rooms for NY at a good price. Breakfast and coffee downstairs. Helpful staff. Clean. I would definitely stay there again. Nicely appointed rooms. Be enjoy The Big Apple Y'all.

My wife and I stayed here one night. We live in NYC but like to vacation in our own city every once in a while. This place came highly recommended by friends who have stayed here in the past. The front desk was kind and attentitive. The layout of the lobby is welcoming and free flowing. Once you get to the room, the temp has been preset to be comfortable. Although not all that large, the room is an appropriate size. The small details, like the ropes/slippers, to the welcome packages in the drawers, make it a pleasant experience. The minifridge is stocked with drinks. I am a bit particular about having a hot shower, the water temperature was great, easy to control and very responsive.

Great location, but beyond that, I wasn't impressed. The room was tiny and not thoughtfully laid out at all. If I wouldn't have had the balcony I would have gone insane. The staff was erratic-friendly but not really helpful. It felt like you were imposing when asking a question. They didn't have any area maps. Told me about a good one they had but they were out of them...Very disorganized at that front desk with some guy always popping out of the back room to join in questions. Odd. But what was really disappointing was upon check out was when I asked about transport to midtown, they offered to call black car. I said I need a cab, the guy pops out from the back and says well, walk to Bowery, because they don't come down our street. Which is not correct. Bowery is two blacks away and I had an enormous suitcase. Very poor customer service. I will skip this place next time I want to be in the area. The location does not overcome its shortcomings.....no matter how hip they try to be. They are trying too hard in that way, and dropping the ball on customer service. I will say one young lady with long hair and glasses was friendlier than the others, but she almost looked guilty from breaking out of the personal conversations going on to help me.

So the rooms are quite good and the hotel is super well located with really really friendly staff. The hotel is next door to ‘The Usual’ restaurant which is very good and serves until 12am - so very convenient.The only thing the hotel should reconsider is the breakfast. Really basic and every single day the same...

I am always iffy with hotels in New York, but this experience was amazing. Everything ran absolutely smooth for once, which is rare. I take many business trips so I know a good hotel when I find one. The manager Rebecca was professional, courteous, and just a sweetheart! She answered all my questions, listened to me complain about work, and recommended me some good restaurants in the area. I can’t wait for another business trip to New York so I can stay here!!!

I loved my stay here. We stayed 6 nights and really enjoyed it. The hotel itself is stylish, clean, safe and quiet. The staff is excellent and very helpful and friendly. It's a perfect location; great neighborhood with plenty of restaurants and shops; it's also super close to subways, so a great home base to explore. Breakfast was simple, but delicious. I really enjoyed hanging out in the beautiful and cozy lobby both in the morning (that's where breakfast is served) and at night. A great value for what you get. We ate at adjoining restaurant a few times...once for a meal and couple of other times for snacks. They offer a glass of wine and some snacks at Happy Hour, which we enjoyed. Brian, the bartender at the restaurant, gave us some really amazing insider tips of what to do in NYC and went above and beyond for us. I can't wait to visit again and stay at this lovely hotel.

Excellent Hotel! The rooms are very comfortable, super clean and modern European style. Something that I loved is customer service, hard to find in NYC. The breakfast is very convenient. Near to subway, restaurants; everything near by. It was our first time staying and we will definitely love to stay again. Highly recommended

Beautiful room/ great design. Was not sure what to expect but were very pleased with our stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. I was a bit concerned over the noise since it is in the middle of downtown, but had no issues sleeping. No complaints whatsoever.

The Nolitan is a really nice hotel, great-looking design on the outside with a gorgeous lobby space. The staff is fantastic, super friendly and very helpful. The rooms themselves are nicely designed as well, they have an industrial chic feel to them. I do have to say the rooms are very nicely equipped with slippers, bath robes, an umbrella for rainy New York days. These are all things that someone traveling would always appreciate and the Nolitan has thought ahead for its guests so well. The bed I had was comfortable and the different pillows were also nice for those who prefer softer/firmer while sleeping. There's also a nice breakfast spread in the morning with coffee and things like muffins and other baked goods. If you're hungry in the evening there's a restaurant downstairs called the Usual, the food there is great as well. If it's not too cold out I would also recommend going to the rooftop for an awesome view of the neighborhood.

The hotel is in the center of Soho and little Italy and it’s surrounded by tons of great places to see. The hotel restaurant has awesome food and drinks too! The service was great. Rooms were clean and bed very comfortable.

Although I only stayed with my wife for one night, it was really a very good place. When we entered the lobby, we saw a friendly smile at the front desk (9pm). Although our English is not very good, they still Very patient to help us stay at the hotel, also told us that there is wine next door to enjoy, then we went to the room, which is really clean, hygienic and quiet, the bed is comfortable, fully equipped, there are drinks, drinks in the refrigerator, snacks for bedside tables ...Woke up the next day, there was also a nutritious breakfast in the lobby. After that, we also took some souvenirs. This experience is great. I will definitely come here next time I stay at the hotel!

The Nolitan hotel is a great place to stay. This is a great hostel and wonderfully convenient location. It locates on Soho, Little Itality and China town are a bit away. Clean rooms, bed is very comfortable.

This hotel is absolutely to recommend. Very attentive, friendly staff. You are in the heart of everything, and hundreds of excellent restaurants are around. Especially the restaurant in the hotel is to recommend. Reasonable price, so we will come back.

Great New York experience again! I wanted to keep this place my little secret, but sharing is caring.If any problems (I really didn't have any) They had only one pair of slippers inside and one robe which is standard that's fine I get it. They can always bring more up, just ask them at the reception desk. They were warm and friendly. Before I could finish my request the receptionist was like "Right away sir !we are sorry." Great service! All the amenities where functioning. If you need something just ask. If they don't have something they usually say."Let me see what we can do" I appreciate that effort. Other hotels I have been to usually are like "really we thought we put one in there" well your wrong fix it. I hate that especially if you get a deal on the hotel. They make it like your taking money from them. Um, I'm sorry I'm a customer.Do your self a favor, First time or not to NewYork city if you at Nolitan Ask to go to the roof and get a view of New York City. They have what I call a nice "infinity lookout" the parapet is made of glass windows. You can just look out and enjoy the view. if you're by yourself just listen to some soft Jazz music. Nice controls for the room for the right setting. The bed was nice and comfy. It didn't feel like I was l floating on air or anything but, it did feel like a nice warm hug. your know The type you get when you where a small kid after walking all over Disney land till your little legs can't walk anymore, and your parent pics you up. Their walking pace the body warmth and sound of their heartbeat puts you to sleep...... Like that! The window curtains are blackout curtains, I forgot not only what day it was but the time the curtains were so dark. The outside noise was defined enough to the sound of a white noise fan at night which is as good as your gonna get in New York. I was on the fourth floor. I recommend higher floors for any New York hotel. Listen you came to New York right? Capital of the world. It doesn't sleep keep that in mind. Get a higher floor where ever you go, not just cause of sound but you want the view. It's like looking down on the big skeleton clock and at night, it's like a skeleton clock with neon gears.I tried Bnb's apartments before and they are a hit and miss I just rather come to Nolitan.Do yourself a favor. If it's your first time visiting the area, ask downstairs for bike check out go to a central park for a ride around. Or walk through the neighborhood by NYU. I have seen more movie stars here than in California. Jason Mamoa was walking down the street on Mott and Prince coming from the pizza shop on prince street. Just like that. Maybe it was timing but then I went to Prince street pizza shop and saw his pic with others that come and visit. oh, there pizza is good too...get the square slices. Come at (11 a.m).If you're a foodie, NewYork this is the place to be! Any spot of your epicenter to start your trip, I would use this Nolitan hotel. if you want a New York sandwich to go to Parisi bakery. You are not too far from Katz delicatessen but everybody goes there. (Please keep in mind if you wanna try these places out. You gotta go around 11 a.m before the lines start. Plan ahead know what you want before going, or you will get cursed out of the line..... like I'm serious). They have some Michelin star rated restaurants near Houston street. It would take me a good 5 months just to try out all the places within a mile radius from the hotel from just walking up and down Mott street. you find all these cross streets with restaurants that have been in NewYork for years perfecting their craft. If you see a line its good. Just go the next day though( you can tell I don't like lines).If you don't want to leave the Hotel The Usual Restuarant dinner is great! I have no fav all around good. I would like to highlight the service. I came late at night before the cap off. They had a good midnight desert. Big brownie cookie in a little skillet with ice cream on top. They have a good selection of wines. A cabinet of liquors and wines from the bartender's waist all the way up to the ceiling. The environment was warm and quite. I was craving some chips. You know just one of those midnight cravings. I asked the bartender " Hey man you got any like leftover chips or something" He looked at me and was like" you know what let me see what I can do" boom homemade taro chips! He went the extra mile I will come back Thank you. I also had a stain on my suit from a restaurant I was previously out. A bartender had to tide pens on hand and club soda.For the Nolitan hotel, morning breakfast was light and enjoyable. it's not like bacon and egs farmer breakfast. It was a nice business breakfast. crossaints where warm, love the cranberry muffins. everything was fresh. Love the chocolate croissant muffins. basically its enough to get you going not too much to wreck you from going out and enjoying the sights.My wife and I where an 8-min walk away from the 6 Train. 15min walk BD trains. 8 min walk Broadway for shopping and 8-min walk to Canal street. My wife was happy lots of places to shop and window shop.Your not to far from little Italy or china town. So if your idea is seeing New York without having to stay in Jersey or by the airport or 42nd (42st street is a tourist trap don't get a hotel there! not my cup of tea you will be up all night)Nolitan hotel is the place you want to be. You won't lose time. Other hotels might be cheaper but you pay for it through travel that's what happened to me last time at another hotel I got burned I learned and I move on. Here you forget the rental car, you take the subway or worst case, call a cab. You do not want to rent a car. You will look forever for parking.Close by if you want NewYork pizza you can go to Lombardi's for lunch then rice to riches for dessert.All in all, if I'm New York Manhattan and want to cover a lot of ground in little time. I'm using this place. It is my second time staying here. I look forward to my third visit one day. Nice Job Nolitan!

The Nolitan is within blocks of all the hot spots, Chinatown, Little Italy, SoHo, shopping, restaurants, and it seems all the train lines in the city are within blocks of the front door. If you're looking for great customer service and knowledgeable staff in NYC look no further than the Nolitan Hotel. The staff was pleasant, helpful and responsive. The restaurant just off the main lobby, called the Usual, is great! They have a well stocked mini-bar and plenty of great food and drink options for the rooms.The complimentary buffet style breakfast is a nice touch. The general atmosphere has an industrial chic feel, but it has a warm inviting appeal. A unique stay for sure and very comfortable, definitely will stay again.

Stayed at Nolitan for 5 nights over New Years. My husband and I didn't have much interest in staying right in the middle of the most touristy areas, so this hotel was perfect. It was in a nice area that wasn't super busy and there were lots of nice restaurants around. The receptionists were super friendly and helpful. Everyone working there were great really, shame they had to deal with the party that completely thrashed a room on New Years.The room itself was small but still a good size for 2 people. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were too hard to my liking(everyone has different pillow preferences though). Really didn't see the point of the window from the room into the shower or the lack of a door, but I guess I'm weird for wanting guaranteed privacy in the bathroom. A lot of the channels on the tv didn't work properly. Not a big deal as we didn't go to New York to stare at a screen, but it can be nice to watch something before going to sleep. The restaurant attached to the hotel was amazing. Best fried chicken I've ever had.

In New York your choice is to stay near Times Square and experience tourist hell, or to experience real New York. We choose the latter.This is trendy boutique hotel, in a trendy part of town. You can get everywhere you want on the subway, don’t be scared to use it. Staying here you are on the edge of Soho, China Town and Little Italy all of which are worth a visit.The hotel itself has everything you need. Staff are great, views from the roof are a wow and the breakfast is surprising good so try it. A nice touch is free cheese and wine in the bar next door for hotel guests.We would definitely stay here again.

Sooo noisy! Day and night non stop you hear cars honking!Also I'm in wheelchair and I was guaranteed a accessible room. I couldn't even reach the bed with my wheelchair! This hotel is NOT accessible or wheelchair friendly.

A lovely little boutique hotel. The staff are lovely, Desiree and Daniel standout in my mind, but absolutely everyone was lovely. The complimentary gym access was a real win. The gym you get access too, GymNYC on (the famous) Mulberry Street, was excellent, and never too busy to use and enjoy. I can’t recommend The Nolitan Hotel enough. I would definitely stay there again.

I stayed at The Nolitan for the past week - we were doing a pop-up shop on Elizabeth, so I had three cars full of inventory and furniture when I arrived. The staff at the front desk was so helpful - they stored everything for me for the night and helped unload and load our cars. We were there for the entire week, plus had an additional room for the weekend and it was great. Everyone was so nice and accommodating, plus supportive and friendly of our busy week! Loved the free wine from 6-7!

Short trip, best accommodation. Directly in one of the best areas Of NY, Great rooms, Good Breakfast, super roof top.We stayed for 5 night, walkable distance from Broadway av.Near you find all, shops, restaurants.Running on Williamsburg bridge 7 am... PRICELESS!

The location is great for travelers who have been to NYC before or for those who prefer a trendier neighbourhood... There are lots of good restaurants, bistros and bars at walking distance, and the area is very "cool". My room was small and I didn't have a great view (5th floor), but it didn't get noisy at night, which is not that common for NYC.They have a happy hour for guests from 6 to 7pm and a simple breakfast at the lobby. There's a rooftop with a very nice view, both at night and in the morning, which is great for relaxing for a bit.The bar staff was very nice and friendly! The staff at the check in was not as nice, actually kind of rude, but I didn't really mind.

Great location, one block from the subway. Staff was friendly, room was small [not tiny for NYC standards] but efficient and clean. Our request to be placed away from the elevator was honored. Housekeeping was good. Aveda products in the room, slippers and robes.The only downside was the noise from the street. We were on the fifth floor and was extremely noisy. It is NYC, of course, but the hotel does not have special windows [tripled-paned or soundproof] or noise-reducing curtains like other hotels in big city.

The Nolitan is a nice little hotel in SoHo. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. No frills and some of the furniture needed updating but overall a good value for NYC.

What a fun hotel in NYC. I used to live on the UES and I never ventured this far south, so I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at this hotel. The breakfast room is really nice too. I would definitely stay here again just based on my experience with the front desk staff. They were all so friendly and helpful.

Great staff, cool bikes, comfy room. What more could you want for a quick night in Soho? Love that they have Aveda products. Got upgraded to a balcony room which means louder on the street, but wasn't too bad.

Great place to stay all around. The staff has been super friendly and helpful. Even at 4:30 a.m. when we were up & heading to the Today show. You cannot beat the location! Great shopping and good spots to eat nearby. The rooms are tiny, but well appointed w/ a hip modern flare. I love that they make the best use out of ever inch of the room. i.e. under bed drawer storage. It is NYC & they had a great space planner. Overall the design of the hotel is well thought out, great attention to detail & clean. We ate dinner here and that was great too. Well done Nolitan! We will be back. (Also I didn’t notice the noise at all, per other reviews. I’ve stayed in much higher priced rooms in NYC and had a much noisier stay in them).

I really liked the location, cleanliness of the rooms and decor. Price was pretty good. Construction near by had drivers on the horns a lot until midnight for several of the nights but hey, that’s NY. Bring ear plugs! Would definitely return to this hotel!

So, to start, the hotel was very noisy, I could not sleep !!! It seemed that the cars were inside the room, the horns were super high. I had to take medicine erect night to sleep. I was Always leaving the hotel at 07:00 in the morning, and none of the mornings there was a person at the front desk.

It's been my 12th-time stay at The Nolitan Hotel, of which I call "home away from home". Here is why I keep coming back: 1. The staff is lovely, service oriented and overall great! 2. The rooms are clean, new and made by the best materials and in the exact size, you need for a short stay in the city. 3. The location is by far the best in terms of distance from subway, best stores (Ayr, KOIO, Outdoor Voices, DryBar) Restaurants (Mikakus Sushi, SweetGreens and Jacks Wife Freda)4. By far my favorite hotel in the city!
user_name:
danielgL9541TL
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed at The Nolita Hotel for a quick couples getaway into NYC. The rooms were super modern and spacious with an awesome shower and bath tub. Everything was very clean. The continental breakfast was amazing, delicious coffee, breads, and juice. The location of The Nolita Hotel was in the heart of downtown and felt had an incredible NYC downtown vibe, while the staff were always polite and helpful. I would highly reccommend this hotel.

Great boutique hotel in the heart of it all. Just a few blocks from Broadway and all the shopping your heart desires, a beautiful neighborhood to explore, and so many tempting restaurants...The view from the rooftop should not be missed. Take a glass of wine up and take in all the iconic NYC architecture — ESB, Chrysler, WTC, City Hall, etc... And it was July 4, so we also (bonus!) enjoyed a great view of the fireworks over the East RIver. (And got to applaud an “I will” for the young man who got down on his knee and proposed up there!)The common areas have a great vibe — super chill and relaxing with a friendly staff eager to make your stay memorable.We live a half hour north of the city but used the Nolitan it as a little getaway close to home (the pied-à-terre we wished we owned). After a day/night of playing in Soho, we enjoyed a great night’s sleep on our super comfy bed/pillows (and SUPER chilly room, which felt great after one of the hottest days of the year) and awoke to enjoy a little continental spread in the lobby so we could ease into our day and not feel the need to rush out for breakfast.A cool gem in a great central location.(TripAdvisor “click to rate” options weren’t working when I left this review, but I would have given Service, Location & Sleep Quality fives.)

This hotel was booked for me for a recent business trip. It is sort of hidden on the street, but once inside it was comfortable, making you feel like you belong:)The staff was great, not sure why they didn’t tell me about the morning and afternoon reception offering, but it was a good surprise! The room was small, but for 1 person it was just great. Just know that it is all cement, walls, floor, ceiling. But was decorated boutique’e. My only complaint was that I was on the third floor and could hear ALL the street noises, until they calmed down later in the night (and when I turned my sound machine on). Convenient location and good value:)

We enjoyed this boutique hotel a lot. We had a suite on the 9th floor and an awesome view to the Empire State building. The noises from the busy streets are not disturbing at all.The extra services like breakfast (best cereal ever) and evening wine/cheese are awesome.Staff is friendly and professional.Bikes are on first comes -first serves basis available. We had a wonderful ride through LittleItaly, NoHo, SoHo, Chinatown, Hudson River and Central Park.Enjoy the nice boutiques, liquor stores and restaurants just around the hotel. There is so much to see and to do, we will come back.

Stayed here late last year and again last week. Loved it the 1st tine but not as much this time. It was hot outside - the lobby was always kind of warm. I could never get my room temp below 73 even with the ceiling fan on high and the temp set on 68. All i wanted was a cold room. The phone in the room didn’t work. It’s a nice hotel with small but good rooms. The rooftop area offers a great view but unfortunately the bar up there isn’t open (would be a nice place to have a drink). No gym on site but guests have access to Gym NYC a few blocks away. I was definitely not impressed with the gym. Very old equipment with a few out of service. Gym was a bummer. Hotel now has a little bit of food out in the morning and a little cheese and wine in evening. I like to ear at Butchers Saughter across the street for breakfast (sooooo good) so I only got a little fruit each am. Kind of weird that they have bowls and silverware out but no place to put the dirty ones. People just leave their dirty bowls sitting on the couch. Suggest that they either use paper plates and plastic ware you can throw away or have a places to put dirty dishes. It looks pretty low end the way they do it now (although I do give them credit for trying; it could be nice with a few changes). Overall I’d still recommend the hotel. Neighborhood is great and it’s reasonably priced, but I may try another place in the area next time to compare especially if in the summer as I want a cold room.

This modern little hotel in Nolita is a great place to stay downtown. The rooms are small but modern and comfortable, and we were impressed by the unexpected extras - the continental breakfast in the lobby each morning and the wine and cheese each evening. The food presented was excellent, and constantly replenished, and we found this to be a lovely way to start and finish our days. We also appreciated the in-room yoga mat, and the prompt provision of a kettle when requested. The sharp edges on the bed frame, however, were not so good, and we got lovely bruises on our shins.

Lovely hotel. The cheese and wine every evening is a lovely touch. The superior queen with balcony is a good room. Comfortable with everything u could need in a hotel room. Great views although the noise levels can be a little much at times. View from the rooftop is exceptional. Would stay again.

We had a brilliant stay here. Service was excellent, the room was lovely, the food was great and the location was absolutely perfect for our 4-day break in New York. The only possible fault was the poor quality of their coffee but as the coffee shop next door served quite possibly the finest coffee that I've ever had this was not really a problem!

Nolita is a very trendy district mostly for those in their twenties. I stayed here because my business meeting was nearby. Reservations by phone were simple and straight forward. The folks behind the reception desk upon arrival were friendly, helpful and efficient. They remained so throughout the stay.The room was modern, smallish, not elegant, but comfortable for 1. Some quirks. The electrical outlets are not located for the digital age. There was an in-room safe but it was not functioning. The bathroom was again modern and large enough. However, the flow from the shower head was light and, at times, there just was not enough hot water. There is one stern chair in the room somewhat like one would find in a waiting room of the motor vehicle agency. It also has no rubber on the legs so moving the chair on the wooden floor made a Loyd sound.. The bed is comfortable. My room faced a street and it could be very noisey at times.Very little is inexpensive in Manhattan and this is no exception.However, given the overall experience I would not mind staying here again.

Nice hotel on perfect location near Soho, Little Italy and China Town. Clean rooms, friendly & helpful staff. They really helpt us when my daughter forgot her bag in the cab to the airport. Next time we come back!

The service here was so amazing! After a long day of shopping, I returned with my newly purchased computer mouse, since I live in Sweden I was a bit worried that the mouse wouldn’t work when I got home. (Cuz i couldn’t return it back home)I ask the personnel behind the counter if I could try it out on the hotel computer. And surprisingly enough they welcomed me into a room in the back and helped me try it out. But because of the hotel computer system the application needed for the mouse to work was blocked.No problem though, this nice guy pulls out his own laptop! The testing was successful, the mouse worked!This hotel was awsome even for me as a teenager!

emmy150116
New York City, New York

review_body: I was very nicely surprised by the hotel - great location, cool design, nice rooms + the staff were extremely helpful and gave us great tips to enjoy the all the great cafes and bars in the neighborhood. Clearly one place we look forward to going back! Can't wait until they open the refurbished restaurant and the rooftop terrace!!!

Everyone seems to think this hotel is conveniently located, but I think the location is the only downfall. It’s not in the best of neighborhoods and Uber is expensive to get anywhere near Times Square or Rockefeller.As for the hotel itself, EXCELLENT! Very unique decor when you walk in and they play old school r&b jams which was a nice touch. The girl at the front desk was very polite and made early check-in a breeze. The room was really nice and very clean. No foul smells at all! The only slight complaint I had was being able to hear neighboring rooms talk through the vents. Didn’t bother me though. Oh and a beautiful balcony!I’ll be back for sure if I need to stay in the area again.

This hotel is very well located in Soho, which allowed us to walk to a lot of places. Subway is just a 5 min walk too. Rooms were cool and clean and well equiped but a few points made it not amazing: the super cool corner room is not so cool if you're on first floor (my case), which forbids you from opening the curtains; rooftop feels abandoned; breakfast feels more like snacks and should not be charged for (mostly a few pastries, fruit salad, yogurt, granola, coffee, juice) being served in the small lobby when it's hard to find sitting at the time. Other than that, it is a safe choice if you're not sure where to stay. Given the price, it felt a bit overpriced.

We found from experience on our many visits to NYC that choosing a hotel can be a hit-&-miss affair. On our recent visit to NYC we stayed for 5 nights at The Nolitan, (following a personal recommendation), and were most impressed with the hotel. It was our first visit to the hotel and our room on the eighth floor was brilliant - clean & comfortable with everything you would want. The staff on the front desk were always helpful and friendly. The continental-style breakfast in the lobby area offered coffee, croissants, muffins, and fresh fruit salad, all very fresh and tasty. The hotel is great value for money and we would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Bogdan and his small team have nailed it. Anything you want, they got it. They're attentive, knowledgable and always willing to assist. The Nolitan Hotel is in prime location with well maintained and styled rooms. Evening wine and cheese and turndown service are some of the special touches that make a difference. Our doggie was very happy and made to feel at home - just as we were. We recommend the Nolitan unreservedly. Thanks for everything guys and can't wait to see you all again!

I live in the neighborhood and put my family up at this place when they are in town. I just put my 80 year old mother there and they couldn't have been more helpful and pleasant. The rooms are spotless and have a crisp, clean European feel to them. My mother (quite a traveler in her own right), loved the place and insisted that i post a review. A nice continental breakfast is offered every morning and a happy hour in the evening. The hotel is a great base to tour around Soho / Nolita and downtown and is close to many subway lines.
