New York City, New York

review_body: The good: location, newish/clean, very friendly staff; free WiFi and continental breakfast.The not-so-good: Even though we were upgraded (due to Tablet Plus membership) to a room on the 7th floor with a mini-balcony - it was noisy throughout the nites - construction trucks, taxis honking, etc. And the upgraded room even by NYC standards was "cozy".

I booked a 10-day stay at the Nolitan, and eventually I was allowed to check out after 2 days (although we complained as soon as we checked in, you need to give an additional 24 hours notice). Reasons:- I had booked a specific breakfast rate, to discover that breakfast consisted of a tray of coffee/pastries in the lobby area- The restaurant is closed as it's undergoing renovations (hence the underwhelming breakfast)- The wi-fi signal on the top floor where our room is not working- None of the room safes work. I reserved a month ago, the hotel had all the time to forewarn me. I find that transparency is always the best course of action. Lastly, I sent this complaint to the management (which they suggested when I check out) 3 days ago, and have not heard back. No doubt they'll reply to this message.

We loved the opportunity to share with our friends and family this great location. It was a perfect location for amazing food and shopping. We wallk everywhere and never even needed the Subway. The hotel itself was wonderful! It's staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable with great beds. Every morning they served coffee, juices, yogurt, fruit and pastries. Every evening they served wine and cheeses and others appetizers. The lobby was comfortable to meet your friends and drink your coffee or wine as you figured out the next daily adventure.

Awesome boutique hotel that is located near everything you could ever need. Great amenities, super clean room and a comfortable bed. Staff is really welcoming and have terrific recommendations for what's around the area.

Stayed here for a week and the service was wonderful, very helpful staff including Rebecca who gave us advice on where to eat/shop etc...Rooms are small but very clean..and perfect location for restaurants and shopping nearby...will definitely stay here when I return ..thank you

As a tourist, I thought this was a great place to stay. I've stayed in other NYC hotels, and this has been the best. The location is in a great area. Plenty of new restaurants to try nearby, some within walking distance, others within a short train ride away. The room was very clean, and all the staff was friendly.

This truly is a beautifully quaint hotel in a city that can seem cold and impersonal. From the second you walk into the lobby, you realize this is not a florescent lit, generic chained hotel, but a cozy and comfortable one of a kind gem. The lobby's sitting area is filled with books and comfortable seating that makes you feel like you are in a cute coffee shop. In the morning, it is filled with delicious pastries, fruits, and juices and in the evening you enjoy the best complimentary happy hour you will ever have (with plenty of cheeses, olives, grapes, crackers and best of all wines). The rooms are clean and comfortable and perfect to relax in after a long day of walking in the concrete jungle. The staff was friendly, which to be honest, was a nice surprise. Being from Texas, I feared they would be like the 'rude New Yorker' stereotype I had seen in movies, but they proved me wrong. We loved how close public transportation was, its a block away! We also got to know the neighborhood; the Nolitan is around Soho, Little Italy, and Chinatown so we got to take advantage of all the delicious food! Overall, I would definitely be back!

Upon arriving to the Nolitan, I was greeted by a very friendly front desk. They were extremely helpful and welcoming. When I arrived the front desk, they told me that they had wine and snacks served in the lobby from 5-7. I was able to enjoy this one of the evenings. The design of the lobby is very original and had a great atmosphere. I loved the fact that you can sit in the lobby and feel like you were all alone although there were many others there. I was able to stay there most of the evening to read a book in the warm lobby on an extremely cold day.I really loved the design and decor of the rooms, they are very simple and stream lined. The view from our balcony room was awesome! We could see the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building clear as day. The beds were extremely comfortable! I loved the personal touch they put on the rooms. It's definitely not your typical "cookie-cutter" hotel room. The location is perfect, there are multiple train stations within a couple blocks of the Nolitan. The area around the hotel has just about everything to offer. A few blocks to the west, you have some of the best shopping NYC has to offer. A few blocks to the east, and you are in the hearts of Chinatown and Little Italy. I also found some COOL restaurants. I highly recommend La Esquina (if you can get in). I will definitely come back for my next stay in Manhattan!

This is a lovely boutique hotel right in the heart of NOLITA. The rooms are really charming. It has wood plank floors with a balcony view of the Empire State and Chrysler BLDGs. The whole Manhattan skyline was right before my eyes. The bed and linens were so comfortable and clean. It has a mid century modern feel with a bit of hipster blended. The bathroom is fully stocked with Aveda products and each room has slippers and a robe. The room also has a mini fridge with drinks available and a snack bar for purchase. My favorite amenity is the happy hour. Between 5-7 the hotel offers wine and cheese and an opportunity to mingle with other guest or play games in the lobby. In the morning, they had fresh coffee and pastries and the carrot juice (surprisingly) was SOOoo delish. We stayed during the bombcyclone of 2018. It was windchills of negative10’s, but with so many fabulous places were in quick walking distance. The famous NOM-WAHS was just a block away and the trains are really close. I would like to come back when the weather is better because the hotel also offers bicycles and locks that are included. The restaurant next door is under construction, but when it finishes, I am sure it will be equally spectacular as my stay at the nolitan. I 100% would recommend staying here. The staff were also very helpful with any needs bar arose too.

Hotel staff was super friendly. Room was clean and modern. They have a very comfortable lounge area. It was a good place to hang while waiting for our Lyft. Also, the hotel is close to the 6 train (w/in walking distance). Would definitely stay again!!

I stayed at the Nolitan with a friend over the Holidays. The hotel is absolutely adorable and is located in a fantastic neighborhood right near SOHO. The staff made this stay even more enjoyable. Specifically, Sheldon on the evening shift. He always had a warm smile and a fantastic restaurant recommendation! I will be staying here in the future- no questions asked.

We came to New York for New Years and this hotel was adorable! Great location and Sheldon at the front desk was so sweet and helpful. Every recommendation he gave was spot on. We’ll definitely be back!

A charming modern hotel well located in the middle of buzzing SOHO, close to Little Italia as well as Chinatown. Nice looking, quiet and comfortable rooms, spacious enough by NYC standards. Well equipped room and bathroom. Friendly staff. The restaurant was closed when we came in. Ideally located for those who want to spend time in South Manhattan, a place to choose for a romantic short trip to NYC.

Good hotel, with ok value for money.Nice details such as the complimentary cheese and wine in the afternoon.Staff really makes an effort to accomodate our needs - as was the case of moving some furniture to fit the extra bed we needed for the child.Clean and well maintaned

Staying at The Nolitan Hotel has been by far my best experience among hotels in the Lower East Side. I got the "Timeless Romance Rate" which comes with champagne, chocolate dipped strawberries, and white rose petals to spread on the bed. The staff made sure that upon arrival the strawberries were fresh, and that the petals were refrigerated so that they didn't wilt. Another part of the great service was that I emailed The Nolitan the week of my arrival to make sure everything was prepared and I even asked them if they could help me surprise my boyfriend by allowing me to check in with my friend to decorate the room with Christmas decor, but pretending like I was checking in for the first time when I returned with my boyfriend. The staff was super helpful, friendly, and genuine. When I needed extra supplies like slippers they immediately brought it up. Whenever my boyfriend and I bumped into staff through the halls or on our way in or out of the hotel they greeted us with a smile and asked us if things were going well.The Nolitan Hotel also has an awesome minibar, and a wide variety of amenities, which I didn't use, but was great to know that it was available to me. For example, you can ask for a lap-top, I-Pad, and even rent a cool vintage looking bike to get around the city!I booked the suite so I had a bedroom and living room. The living room was very spacious and clean. The couches were clean and comfortable, and so was the pull out bed. There is an elegant modern chandelier hanging above a luxurious brown ottoman. The T.V. was bigger than I expected. The closet was very spacious which had a minibar/minifridge. I've been to hotels where you can't put stuff in the minifridge because of how it is set up, but I was able to use this one to put in additional drinks.I also got a beautiful view of the Empire State Building lit up in Christmas colors to top off a romantic evening! The bathroom was amazing in that there was a tub and a shower stall next to each other. There is actually a curtain separating the bathroom and bedroom and I makes the bathroom seem much more spacious when you can bath while looking into the living room. I really liked that the toilet was in an room on its own (water closet). The bathroom mirror was wide and clean as well - I can't emphasize enough how clean this room and hotel was.The bedroom was very spacious with a lot of drawer space to put your belongings in, which came in very handy since I had brought quite a few Christmas decorations. The bed was clean and beautifully prepared, and the flower petals added an elegant and romantic touch. There is also a T.V. in the bedroom. I just wished it could have been as big as the living room T.V. and not pop out as much as it is positioned between the bed and the wall. You don't get much of a view from the bedroom as there is a condominium being constructed next door, but that didn't bother me much since I had a nice view in the living room.I also would like to mention that the lighting in this suite was very soothing. I like that there were enough light fixtures to make the place bright, but it still had a dark, cozy, and relaxing feel to it. We also got complimentary breakfast which ranged from freshly baked croissants, yogurt, fresh fruit, and juices. And from 5PM - 8PM we were also able to get complimentary wine, cheese, and grapes from the lobby. Also, I must say that I had very respectable, quiet, and clean neighbors (non-smoking) neighbors. Overall, The Nolitan Hotel is definitely a contender among the hotels in the Lower East Side. Not only are the rooms luxurious and affordable, but the staff went above and beyond with their service, kindness, and sincerity - something that not all hotels can provide no matter how high-end it is. I can't thank them enough for helping my boyfriend and I have a memorable and very merry Christmas weekend!

We just came back from NY where we stayed one week at The Nolitan, where we felt at home with a personal and sensitive treatment from Stephanie, Sherieka and the rest of their great crew. They recommended us the best things to do or restaurants to go. The deco of the lobby and the rooms are perfect, minimalist and comfortable. And great taste. And the best mattress and pillows of the planet. And the view and the terrace with small tables to have a drink and relax also very cool. Everyday we found chocolates in the room and a little reception in the lobby with wine and some cheese and snacks. The location is also perfect, close to little Italy and Chinatown and in between the east side and the west village and close to the metro and far from the noise and the crowds of middtown. We loved it and we definitely will come back to The Nolitan next time around!!!

The Nolitan gets so many things right! Excellent location, friendly staff, a mix of modern and urban design. Flares of Italian amenities like wine, cheese, olives and crackers platters served in the lobby. A perfect start to exploring the many restaurants near by. I love the see through shower. There is a courtesy curtain if you need it. The bed is super comfortable and the sheets crisp and soft at the same time. The balcony is great to observe life below as you sip your coffee. Breakfast is provided downstairs. Perfect weekend in a great location.

We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our trip after returning from Philly and I can't believe we didn't stay here the week earlier.We booked directly through The Nolitan's website and from the get-go were incredibly impressed by their processes. Check in was a breeze and the lovely staff suggested we check out the rooftop for views - which were, as promised, not to be missed.We had a neighborhood room on the 7th floor facing Kenmare street and noise wasn't an issue. It was lovely to get a glimpse of the Empire State Building each morning and evening.The room was what I consider to be standard NYC size and we were really comfortable in it. In a big plus, the toilet is separate from the rest of the bathroom so there is plenty of space in the bathroom itself. The bed was really comfortable, the design was sleek and fun and the turn down service (closing of blinds, slippers out) was a nice touch Everything was very clean and tidy. The lobby sitting area is as gorgeous as it appears in photos and if we had longer there, I would have no doubt I would have hung out in the space a bit longer.Location is AMAZING, I loved being mere steps from the beautiful streets of Soho and Nolita, it's really my favorite part of the city. Absolutely take the stroll down to Maman on centre street for morning pastries and coffee! The subway on Grand street was just a few blocks away in Chinatown.I can't recommend this place enough, I would book again immediately.

The service at the front desk alone made my night and day. If it wasn't for Michael M____ I don't think my problems would have been solved it amazed me how some one could be so kind hearted especially in New York City

I chose the Nolitan because I read great reviews and I needed to be close by for a work event. Location is great - near Soho & Little Italy. Check-in was easy, friendly and I got a room earlier than I thought which was nice because I got into city early in the am. The first thing I noticed when I walked into the room was spotted dirty windows. Rooms are small, but typical for NYC. Toilet was not with sink & shower - it’s in a sparse white closet with broken floor tile. Some good attention to branding/detail (slippers, robe, etc). I lied down to rest before going out and woke to a maintenance man walking into room to check the shower. Didn’t knock...he quickly apologized and left. (Not sure what was wrong with shower - worked fine later). Rooms are VERY noisy from street traffic, but they supply ear plugs if you ask. Beds are comfy and air/heat is quiet. There is no restaurant or room service - but all literature and website still says there is. Coffee and some pastries are served in the lobby. I booked the trip through Tablet Plus which offers an upgrade, a bottle of wine & some other perks. They had no record of it so I didn’t receive any of those things. Was a little annoyed, but that may be a Tablet Hotel issue. Not sure I’d stay again. Nice front desk staff but, the overall vibe is a bit depressing to be honest.

Enjoyed the stay- very helpful, professional and friendly staff all around. Clean, comfortable room and bed, utilitarian room style was unique and interesting. Heat and AC was quiet. Bath had a tub, too. Had a corner room on 3rd floor. Great views of street life but would certainly opt for a higher floor due to street noise (not unusual for NYC). Good location & would certainly stay again.

We just stayed here for 2 nights. I'll list the pros and consProsGood location, Easy walk to Little Italy and Chinatown. We walked to 9/11 Memorial, Union Sq and the Brooklyn Bridge. Clean hotelCute lobby areaGood coffee and breakfast in the AM. I thought the quality of the coffee and pastries were excellent (It would be awesome if coffee was avail all day) Room was typical NYC size. Our room had a balcony and while there wasn't too much to see, you could see the empire state building which was cool. ConsThe road the hotel is on leads directly onto the Williamsburg Bridge. Not sure if there was construction going on but the traffic going east was bumper to bumper constantly which meant the horn honking was OUT OF CONTROL. During the day all you could hear was construction vehicles from across the street. I would say from about 1am-5am it was mildly quiet but that was it. It's certainly not the hotels fault but be aware that while NYC is a noisy place, the noise is super amplified near this hotel.

We are in NY for 3 days before goes to Orlando.We choose the Notilan hotel because j’m in love with LES.The hotel is cool , j think for traveler that want to stay in the middle of all.Ask for corner room at high level , from 6th floor.Amazing view, clean room, bathroom super comfortable.Just the breakfast is not so good , too poor and miss room service.J’ll come back

Business trip to SoHo area and selected Nolitan since it was close Andi within my company travel budget. There were two coworkers with me and we were all very happy with our rooms. They are small as is the norm in nyc but they make great use of the space. The safe is hidden in a drawer under the bed - perfect! Shower is glass and visible from bed but there is a curtain for privacy. Location is fabulous with lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Hotel restaurant is fine and Butcher’s Daughter across the street is great! All rooms face Kenmare St to my knowledge and while there is some street noise, in my experience that is true of most nyc hotels so bring your earplugs and you should be fine. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a great area to do the same!

The room was wonderfully designed, I liked the room. It had a nice bed, a good spacious window for natural light, and it had everything I expect from a hotel room.A good plus is that I could request earplugs at the desk free of charge. A very appreciated convenience for the city.Unfortunately I think there were just a few things about the experience where I was unlucky. For starters, when I walked in the room the first time, the bathroom was already locked from the inside. I don't really know how this happens but this was easily solved by calling the front desk. However the more impactful thing for me was the poor quality of the so called "high-speed" internet that is included with the room. I think there is a chance that the room I had just had poor coverage but the internet was so slow that an instant message took a minute to send. I could barely call people with VOIP which was something I really needed to do on my trip. However, when I woke in the morning, and head into the cafe, the internet quality was great, which is why I think it might have just been the room I was in. Again, a little unlucky, but if they can, they should try and ensure consistent wifi quality.The third, and somewhat most negative experience I had with the hotel is that the room was reserved with another card than my own but they charged the stay on my card, the one I used when I checked in. I discussed with them and arranged authorization to pay via a money order instead of my card. Not only did they give verbal and written confirmation that they wouldn't charge my card, but they charged my card anyway a day after receiving the money order. I'm still dealing with this a week after I stayed. I've never been charged the night with the card I check in with at a hotel before. Maybe this is more normal to them but they should be clearer about their procedure to smooth things over.As much as I loved the room, there were too many issues with service and payment for me to give this a perfect rating. The frustration with just trying to pay the hotel at all was enough to spoil the experience.

This is a great hotel and wonderfully convenient location. The lobby lounge is also a lovely retreat. The staff are very friendly and helpful - genuine and authentic. They had overbooked the hotel and we had reserved a corner room but were moved to a balcony room on a lower level. In the end this was not a good option and I should have pushed back as it was very noisy. Like really noisy and small.Things that we liked :)- very clean- great shower- thoughtful amenities- funky room- comfy bed- Celine got fan was great to keep the room cool- close to Little Italy - front of house staff are amazingThings that were a miss:(- the balcony door seal was not secure and let in audible noise- level 4 makes road traffic very loud- not a large room - lighting a bit dim near door hard to see luggage- the booking came with breakfast but it is limited to two choices. Service in cafe is appealing. Don't include breakfast with booking as there are plenty of nice restaurants and cafes close by

We stayed over for 3 nights. Found a Wonderfull hotel on the perfect location. Staff is very friendly. Very willing to arrange transport, boarding pass print out, bikes etc.Breakfast is good.Rooms are practical, clean with great balcony view.Rooftop is gorgeous. Location is the best, literally meters away from Elizabeth and Mott street and minutes away from Soho. Try the bikes, they're amazing. We'll most certainly be back!

Steps away from the festival but far enough to avoid the massive crowds and sounds. Easy access to the subway so you can get to any attraction in New York quickly and easily. Fantastic staff, very helpful and knowledgable. A safe place to stay, no problems walking the street at night and the hotel is safe and clean. The rooms are modern with Euro-style bathrooms and very comfortable beds.Several local restaurants and bars available to suit any of your meal requirements at any time of the day or night.Hotel Secret. . . Take advantage of the Rooftop patio!! Buy some local food from the various neighborhood vendors, a nice bottle of wine and take in the ambiance of the New York skyline from the roof of the Nolatin Hotel (best kept secret).

Stayed here on a girls trip and had an excellent time! It's conveniently located within walking distance of Chinatown, Lower East Side, West Village, Williamsburg, etc.The rooms were decently sized, and I loved the Aveda products, nice robes, great minibar, etc. We stayed in connecting rooms (#502) that was perfect for our group of 4.Only cons were the construction across the street was annoying on weekday mornings, and the restaurant (connected to the lobby) isn't offering room service YET. Apparently that's coming soon.

This isn't my first time at the Nolitan Hotel. Sure, I can rave about the room, which is elegantly utilitarian and incredibly comfortable. I can tell you that the breakfast downstairs is to die for, (and I highly recommend those pancakes). Or I can express my thanks about the staff being super helpful in just about every respect. But I'd prefer to talk about the view from the roof. It isn't a high rise by any means, but given it's locale, it doesn't need to be. You get almost a 360º view that accentuates New York's iconic skyline from a middle point that can't truly be seen from a skyscraper's vantage point, nor experienced from street level. Grab a drink and watch the sun set over the skyline. It's truly something else.
user_name:
Dakota L
White Plains, New York

review_body: My husband and I recently stayed at the Nolitan and we were so happy we did! The staff was incredible and the room was extremely comfortable. The hip vibe and great view made our trip to NYC so memorable. Just loved the decor and the location is perfect. On top of it all, the restaurant downstairs ('MARE) was just incredible, we have never had more delicious pancakes! Breakfast there was a treat! The Nolitan is a little haven of relaxation and comfort with a New York twist. We highly recommend it to New Yorkers and visitors alike!

We had driven to NY to pick up some things from my son's apartment, and happily checked the car in with the Nolita valet for a few days while we had fun in the city. When it was time to pack up the car (shortly before our dinner reservation), the garage noticed that the tire was flat. Now - most hotels would have said call AAA and best of luck to ya, but not the stellar team at the Nolitan! The manager, Sheldon, personally walked me to the garage and - by golly - we figured out how to change the darn tire (I did get AAA on the line, but it was going to be an hour wait). After we checked the damaged tire into the concierge (I'm pretty sure that was a first for them) we were able to make it to dinner on time! The great service didn't stop there. Fortunately, there is a tire repair shop right across the street. Now your normal hotel would have handed over your tire and pointed across the street. Not the stellar Nolitan team! Then even rolled my tire to the repair shop, so I didn't need to get dirty. Tire fixed 20 minutes later, and I was back on the road to Massachusetts. Above and beyond the service, the hotel is in a great location with lots of restaurants, coffee shops, and shopping a stones throw away. I had the best omelette of all time at the Egg Shop, right next door. The only down side is that the Nolitan is on a busy street, which can be noisy if you are a light sleeper. But the hotel provides ear plugs or a noise machine should you need them. We will definitely be back again! Many thanks to Sheldon and the staff. I hope management gives them an award.

this hotel is perfect in every category.-location is great (restaurants and shops all around), plenty of subway stations in walking distance. you can take one of the hotel bikes (for free) and cycle across the bridges to Brooklyn-rooms are bigger than in most NYC hotels, clean and stylish-personal is friendly and extremely helpful-rooftop (picture) is magnificent.you overlook the whole area and stare straight at the Empire State Building.All in all I feel very lucky I found this hotel, it is just perfect!Enjoy your stay

I recently spent two nights at The Nolitan Hotel on Kenmare. I am a frequent guest at another hotel close by but was not available on my last visit. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and Hotel room clean and comfortable. The location is great as various subway lines are in close walking distance. Hotel is at the doorstep to Little Italy. The only negative is the noise from Kenmare street if you have a balcony room. Trucks start early in the morning and can very easily disturb your sleep..

I get it, there's a certain romantic ambience to NYC's street noise. But drivers honking their horns for long periods of time and trucks reversing all day and night is neither romantic nor ambient; it's noisy and disruptive.I was appointed a 3rd floor room that offered zero respite from the perpetual noise. Immediately after stepping into the room, I requested a room change but was told the hotel was fully booked and that maybe I could switch rooms the following day. I admit I wasn't excited about the prospect of unpacking and packing twice for a 3-night stay and with only 8 floors and no noise proofing, I didn't think it would make much of a difference. I was told that all rooms face Kenmare St but upon looking at the evacuation map on my door, this turned out to be untrue.The room itself was thoughtfully laid out in an industrial design. The tv worked, the toiletries were nice, and there was a minibar.The housekeeping staff were friendly while the front desk staff were operating at a minimal service level. Upon checking in, I signed a hotel policies form listing check-out at 1pm but was curtly told that check-out was at noon...while signing a form that says 1pm...they cannot be bothered to update their forms? It's hard to trust staff members who offer information in direct contrast to written materials provided by the hotel.You're paying for the neighborhood by staying at this hotel. Admittedly, SoHo is incredibly charming but at this price point in NYC, you can do better.

Only stayed for one night but staff was extremely accommodating and stay was fantastic. Really liked the urban hip style of the hotel, very welcoming. Had great views at night and during day! I would definitely go back for a long trip and would recommend to a friend.
user_name:
sagethecageman
Upper Saddle River, New Jersey

review_body: I have to say, as many places, hotels (boutique and large) that this hotel staff was incredible and truly in a class of their own. Great advice on places to eat, even suggesting to grab something to eat and get it to go and eat on the roof top terrace, with some very amazing views of NYC of both Downtown & Uptown. I know we will be back to stay longer.

First things first, shout out to Jake at the front desk, he'll surely be your favorite new best friend!!! Rooms are bright, spacious, and clean. Perfect location, walking distance to tons of cool shops, restaurants, bars. Everything was great, I can't wait to get back!!!

We were looking for a hotel that gave us the feeling of living in New York. Nolitan was spot on. Staff was accommodating and nice. The balcony was a nice touch. The rooms were very small but modern and we weren't trying to stay in all day. Great location with a multitude of restaurants (Italian and Asian) very close by. Easy access to subway station. D train takes you right to the heart of the city. Cost was consistent for 4 star hotel in Soho and uptown near Time Square. Comfy robes in each room.

Such a pleasant surprise! :) we love NYC and come here every few months on vacation to visit friends so we don't usually get to picky with hotels but the Nolitan and their staff made this specific trip 10 times better we encountered a few unfortunate hick ups with our travels but their staff truly made up for it! Jake at the front desk takes the cake though, thank you!! From day one and every day after always with a welcoming and great attitude went above and beyond! Location is spot on, fabulous recommendations (thanks Jake!), quality breakfast (simple but just right- I mean you are in NYC, who wants to feast on breakfast in the hotel- go enjoy the neighborhood but this will give you a solid start!) ... can't wait to come back :)

Immediately impressive hotel, and a relief to arrive at after flight plus traffic. Glass and polished concrete throughout and the lobby is very gram-worthy; #livingroomgoals Friendly staff who don't mind a chat about what is around, and there are ample options. Restaurants/bars are especially chic in the streets north of the hotel and Little Italy and Chinatown sit immediately south. The Room is not large, but you're on the island so that's to be expected. The room is well organised to maximize space, and is well furnished. Bed is comfy, bathroom and toilet bright. The shower is fun for couples. The breakfast is a tasty treat and a good option to get you out the door and on your way to a more substantial proper breakfast if you need it.

Just got back from a short stay at the Nolitan Hotel in NYC. It very well located for many neighbourhoods of lower Manhattan. Good rooftop and our suite was amazing. Perhaps the most noticeable difference compared to other hotels we've stayed in... the staff. They were welcoming and ensured we had a great time including a bottle of vino to celebrate our birthdays ! Issac and Sheldon were suberb hosts !

I picked the hotel due to the placed i wanted to visit in the city, and couldn't have picked a better spot. The staff made me feel welcomed upon check in, and every time i would pass by someone, they wouldn't hesitate to greet me. the rooms were immaculate, and amenities great. the view from the roof was great. i don't have enough great things to say about this place. definitely visiting again. thank you for the wonderful experience.

A cool place, in a funky up-and-coming sort of area. Literally a block away from Little Italy, and not far from subway stations to take you midtown, uptown or wherever you want to go. On a sunny day, great views of the city as well. Staff were great, with a special mention to Sheldon who helped out with subway travel, flight information, where to go souvenir shopping and just a good guy to chat with. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone staying in Manhattan.

From the moment we checked everything about our stay was perfect. The staff were incredibly kind and helpful. The room and balcony were great. And the roof was amazing! Huge shout out to Michael. And also Sherieka, Stephanie and Daniel! Thank you guys for making our staycation totally perfect! We will be back!

I wish I could add another row of five more pretty green dots, because these people hit it out of the park. Far, far beyond my expectations. I just can't say enough good things about the Nolitan, but I'm about to try.First, they rescued us from being left "homeless" by an AirBnB host who wouldn't address a door that threatened to lock us out if we left the apartment. Sherieka was wonderful on the phone and offered us a better rate than Trivago.com. Once we got there, they let us check in early, gave us an orientation to the neighborhood, and proceeded to generally treat us like royalty. The next morning, Sherieka and Michael chatted with me over breakfast in the lobby and gave me lots of recommendations for what and how to do NYC, including using the subway. Theirs are the only two names I have, but everyone there was gracious, professional, and helpful, including the evening clerk who poured me a glass of wine to enjoy up on the roof.The rooms are gorgeous, sleek and modern without feeling cold or austere, and the beds are comfortable in the extreme; only because there was so much to do and so little time did I not want to spend more time there. The building is insulated well enough that outside noise is minimal, and there was absolutely none from inside. The lobby is spacious with lots of comfortable chairs, the background music is great, and there's a great selection of reading material; all of which made an hours-long Saturday downpour more relaxing than frustrating. Also in the lobby are four complementary bikes, skateboards (!) and a supply of umbrellas.When we stayed, their restaurant was temporarily closed, but continental breakfast in the lobby is above average: fresh fruit, Greek yogurt, really good granola, and pastries. And as one last wonderful amenity, they have a car service to LaGuardia for $55 including tip, and watched our luggage after checkout until time to leave. We left with hugs from Sherieka, knowing our next trip to NYC will be timed for when the Nolitan has a room for us.

I really looked forward to staying here. I love the neighborhood and the place looks awesome. So I was pretty disappointed by the rude and slow service. I actually just checked in today and the check in was rough and probably the worst I have ever experienced. So I called the manager (twice) and it has been two hours without a return call. The room and balcony and hotel are gorgeous but I probably won't return due to the staff.

I honestly would like to keep this hotel a secret, but I don't think it's possible, so here goes the review :)Gustavo checked us in the hotel after a tiring evening flight, and we immediately felt welcomed. He had plenty of good suggestions for dinner and also offered to have our minibar taken out, if we didn't want the baby to accidentally play with it (massive help!)We stayed in a corner room, and the space was very sufficient for the 3 of us, the bath tub allowed for the views of Empire State building, and general people watching is just great on that corner. You can also track how busy The Butcher's Daughter cafe is, if you are inclined to visit, but there are so many great places to eat around, you just might skip it altogether. Two Hands cafe, Cha Cha Matcha, Black Seed Bagels, De Maria, Pietro Nolita, Happy Bones Cafe - all under 5 min walk and fantastic at what they do. Little Italy, of course, and Chinatown are all at the doorstep. New Museum, MoMA Soho design store, Balthasar or Katz's - 10-15 min walk max. All the staff were very friendly and would constantly help me with the door and umbrellas (stroller and a baby equal full hands all the time). Isaac was the champion of our check out, helping us with the taxi and entertaining my baby as well :) Many thanks for a great week and we are definitely looking forward to our next stay at the Nolitan!

I have stayed at The Nolitan numerous times and it is a consistently awesome experience. The manager and staff are friendly and incredibly accommodating, the location is perfect for downtown exploring and shopping, the rooms have a cool New York vibe and the clientele are diverse and interesting. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC!

Nolita (north of Little Italy) is a fabulous neighborhood of small shops, many restaurants, low buildings that all make NYC more quaint and friendly. The Nolitan Hotel helps with the vibe of this neighborhood. The staff we professional and helpful. The room was a big size for NYC standards, and The beautiful bathroom with the most awesome bathrobe I wanted to take home! Love that it is attached to Bread a delicious restaurant that serves morning to night.

Another great stay at the Nolitan. This place has fast become my favourite hotel, great area and the hotel itself is full of friendly people. All of the staff I met were as per previous stays absolutely great. I have to give a special shout out to Gustavo. Gustavo was there the first time we stayed at the hotel, since then one of the main reasons we book the Nolitan is due to Gustavo's professional and friendly mannerisms. Thanks again Nolitan.

we spent a few nights here recently, visiting our daughter who lives in the area. the staff were incredible! Gustavo in particular went out of his way to make sure we had the kind of room we wanted, including calling us before we left home to make sure we were happy with the arrangements. he continued this very personal approach throughout our stay - for example, he researched car service for us and arranged pick ups so that we didn't have to worry about making trains and planes etc. he, and the rest of the staff, knew our names immediately and checked with us regularly to make sure everything was going well for us. in fact, all of the staff went out of their way to ensure we had what we needed to make our visit work. i would definitely stay here again.

Hotel was great for a two day layover cross-globing. Fantastic location. Hotel service was great (Gustavo at front desk made the difference on service). Wife will love location for a weekend shopping weekend. Will be back.

We could not have had a better stay here at the Nolitan. Aside from it's perfect location, the staff was incredible. Jake made us feel right at home and welcome within moments of walking in and exhibited true hospitality and care for the guests. The rooms are also great with really comfortable beds, pillows, and bathrobes. I would definitely recommend the Nolitan for anyone traveling to NYC and would stay there again myself!

What an amazing experience at the Nolitan The staff was superb. Super helpful and very accommodating. Jake took care of us from the moment we walked in to the end of our trip. The location was perfect, in walking distance to great brunch/dinner/bar spots and great shopping. Thanks for the amazing stay, will definitely be back!

Saying that on average New York hotels are overpriced versus what you get is am understatement. In most other cities in the world with the same amount of money you will get bigger rooms and a more personal experience. The Nolitan was a welcome exception. The staff was exceptionally friendly, the rooms quite roomy and with decent (and ingenious) storage space. Enough for 2 people for 3 nights or so even in winter. The roof terrace offers breathtaking views and the staff invites you to bring your own drinks there (how flexible! Unheard of). The hotel vibe is in general one of peace and wellbeing and makes you want to go back.For breakfast the Butcher's Daughter is across the street and especially if you are vegetarian or gluten free it's a dream come true.

My stay at the nolitan was beyond exceptional. It's great location was 15 to 20 minutes at most from everything in Manhattan. The room were spotless and the amenities made me feel like I was at home. The receptionist Jean was totally amazing with his great service and made sure we were well taken care of. This is truly a great hotel.

We spent a great night at the Nolitan last night. The hotel is extremely updated and clean. Feels brand new. The staff is very attentive and friendly. The beds are comfortable and even the balcony rooms are quiet for a city hotel. Decent size room for NYC - enough for you to move around anyway. The attached restaurant has great food so check them out.

It was a very nice beautiful hotel. The rooms could be bigger but the decoration was beautifull, the restaurant of the hotel excellent and the stuff very nice and helpful. Also the location and the area were really nice and full of life and of course very safe.

I stayed at the Nolitan Hotel with my partner and we absolutely loved it! The room was actually a bit bigger than I was expecting as I had heard that New York hotel rooms can be notoriously small however our room comfortably fitted the two of us and our large luggage. Our room also had a beautiful view of the Empire State and Chrysler building.The service here is absolutely amazing, the people at the front desk were full of helpful suggestions and the housekeepers were also fantastic. There was a clean in the morning and a turn down service at night with Godiva chocolates and notes of the following days expected weather, it was all about the little touches here! We also arrived to a complimentary bottle of sparkling which was just lovely.I used the gym as well during my stay, the gym is only a short walk away and was very well equipped - cardio equipment, free and assisted weights.We also ate at Bread which is the downstairs restaurant which was quite good. The restaurant also does the room service for the hotel which was tasty and very timely

I really enjoyed my stay at the Nolitan Hotel. What impressed me right off the bat was how friendly the staff was. There was no problem checking me in and they even walked me to my room. The room was cozy and inviting. My friend and I also checked out the rooftop at night and the view was spectacular. Had a great view of the bridge and surrounding buildings. We had dinner and breakfast at the hotels restaurant, Bread, and were equally impressed. The food was delicious. We would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Stayed again while in NYC. Still a great hotel. Great location, clean & comfy. Nice amenities such as slippers. Very rare to find this in hotels in the US.Easy check in, easy check out.New restaurant "Bread" downstairs. Great food, good staff.

Douliketotravel
New York City, New York

review_body: very comfortable room, modern, but warm & easy to know where everything is. staff dropped off a coffee machine in the am & provided us with what we needed for a unexpected stay. will definitely go again!
user_name:
bagabondonyc
New York City, New York

review_body: I decided to take my wife out and stay in the city. We had dinner and walked around SoHo and Nolita. We decided to stay in the Nolitan. Very comfortable and very chic hotel. Excellent service and amenities. Their restaurant Bread is very hip as well. Great bar and nightlife vibe. Highly recommended.
user_name:
sam_gtx
New York City, New York

review_body: The Nolitan is a nice boutique hotel, perfectly located in Lower Manhattan. It has a nice atmosphere, young, somewhat inexperienced staff and beautiful but small rooms. My room lacked a glass, nor did I get a bottle of water. Although the room is beautiful, items like these should be standard issue. It is perfect to use a as base for exploring Soho and Manhattan, but I fiend it less suitable for the jet lagged business traveler. Breakfast is said to be served from 07:00 on Saturday, which turned out to be 08:30. The location at Kenmare street is very noisy, also at night, and you won't get a decent night's sleep without your earplugs. Breakfast is not traditionally US, but nice and light. If you value location above a quiet room, this is the place to go. On a business trip, i would rather settle for something more traditional als less noisy.

This is a great hotel to get into the soho social life. Very Professional staff and accommodations were excellent. Check out the rooftop for a great view of the bridge and the city. I highly recommend Nolitan Bread for dinner too!

What a excellent time! My wife and I enjoyed the Nolitan.It's funny my wife and I are both newyorkers, and we were wondering how this hotel would give us a different view of Newyork. Well it did the roof view was breath taking. The service is so accommodating. If your a tourist you need to stay here to get your monies worth of your trip. Other places you have to pay for taxi.Here you can walk and enjoy the view. Or take the subway straight to grand central.There was this electrical failure that happened on the city block. The Hotel immediately took action on their side had prepared dinner by candle light and it was simply the best romantic dinner my wife and I had. They have a great bartender and they made a fresh ginger ale from scratch for one of my friends because he was a non alcoholic. My wife and I had tried the french punch. It was a punch! We order a cider and also had the fresh ginger ale ;)I have been to many hotels in newyork. I have been to many expensive ones as well. I didn't like the other hotels customer service. Or their so called "perks" which weren't perks at all.At Nolitan hotel you feel what it means to have great served to you! It's a hotel with a twist. Fresh mint and lemon water at the entrance. Great resturant. (Order the lasagna!)Our room had a great balcony that gave us a view of newyork life. We where close to China town,little Italy,6train,Broadway. You can go anywhere and quick.Loved it I'm coming back next year.

Nolitan is a new hotel located close to Little Italy and Chinatown. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants in walking distance. If you don't know what to choose ask the staff at the reception desk - they have great recommendations and are eager to help. A few minutes walk will get you to the southern part of Broadway where you can find plenty of shops.We stayed in the Deluxe room. It was modern, with an open-plan bathroom with bathtub and shower. The room was quite small and was lacking storage space. We spent there a week and we had to keep most of our clothes in suitcases. The rooms could be better maintained - there were some spots that weren't cleaned during our stay and after we checked in we had to ask for someone to clean the floor.Deluxe rooms are dual-aspect and they have restricted view towards Midtown and the Williamsburg Bridge. During our stay there was a construction going on in the opposite building so we had to keep the curtains closed. Kenmare St. is quite busy so there was a lot noise, also at night. The hotel has a roof terrace with an almost 360 degree view - really nice if you like to shoot night panoramas. The wifi works well and is free.We would stay there again but only because of the area and the reception staff.

Rooms are small, Kenmare is a busy street--other side of Bowery is Delancey-boulevard to Williamsburg Bridge-lots of trucks come to town this way. Building under construction next store, very noisy. Bread restaurant connected-terrible service. Breakfast-no cream for coffee, no orange juice, messed up order, no salt and pepper, no coffee refill, no butter or jam until meal was nearly over. Coffee was cold when refilled. When complained to waiter he said he wasn't in charge of the orange juice. Bad management means no one is in charge. No-no. Bye-bye!

Nice hotel design. Friendly staff. Good location near attractions in the area.Small room. Noisy. No tea or coffee or complimentary bottled water in room. Bathrobe had a hole in it. Extremely limited breakfast included in roommate.

its a young hotel with different design.the room is small and good but need more electric outlets around the bed.the bathroom is with glass to the room but there is a curtain to cover it,wifi was ok and free.i stayed there only one night so i didnt have time to explore the restraunt but there are many kind for every taste.

I just spend 3 nights in the Nolitan and had a really fantastic time there. The hotel was great, room lovely, stylish, clean, bright and bed extremely comfortable. The staff could not have been more helpful and inviting, always there to advise and answer any questions we had. Location was great, lots of nice restaurants and bars in the neighborhood yet no noise issues at night. The staff are a credit to the hotel and I would highly recommend it.

We stayed while on a photography shoot in NYC! The staff was so nice accommodating us! They made it really nice for the the model, makeup artist, wardrobe, assistant, and hair stylist. They all loved it! There is also newish management for the restaurant, and it's great! And they do room service! This hotel in a must stay in NYC especially for its great location! A walking distance to so many great attractions!!!-Connor

Nice modern hotel. The rooms are clean but very noisy.The reception will give you earplugs if needed.Wifi needs to be better, really bad connection and speed.Breakfast is available in the restaurant next door (same building). We had a continental breakfast included. The continental breakfast is coffee, orange juice, a croissant and a muffin. So after a few days of muffins it gets boring...Please upgrade the included breakfast. Free bikes on request. Staff is very nice.Overall good hotel, but poor breakfast and poor wifi, lots of noise.

Very nice hotel, extreamly friendly staff, clean and modern room, great location!They have bikes to use for free. Subway is just a short walk away. Good restaurants all around. Breathtaking views from the rooftop.Would book it again.

Beautiful and clean boutique hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. We loved the style of the hotel. It is an industrial style but has great touches to make it warm and inviting. I loved the Aveda bath products! The complimentary slippers are also a nice touch. Only drawbacks are that it IS on a busy street so street noise can be loud. Thankfully, they provide ear plugs for those sensitive to noise. Also, I wouldn't recommend the hotel for a family. It is quite small. Great place to stay in NYC!

Good location for sure. Interesting design indeed and friendly staff. No question. But rooms are a bit on the "cheap side", very very small and street is extremely noisy. Of course, our previous stay was at the Standard Highline, so it is a tough comparison. But still, Nolitan is not THAT cheap either, so you could probably get a little more for the money.

The rooms at The Nolitan Hotel are modern, clean, and cozy- ok, they're tiny but pretty decent by NYC standards. Great downtown location, decent views from higher floors. Some rooms have small terraces.

I stayed at the Noalitan with a group of girls for a weekend. This hotel was the perfect place! The room was very clean had everything we needed. The location of the hotel was also great as it was walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants, and the subway. We could not have asked for better service from the staff and the restaurant next door, Bread, was the perfect spot for breakfast. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

The Nolitan was everything I expected for a small boutique hotel in a small neighborhood. Very clean and staff very friendly. The rooms are small so I cannot imagine staying longer than 3-4 nights unless upgraded to larger suite if available. The location is very good. A lot of restaurants in close proximity - the best is the Egg Shop right around corner for breakfast. The Metro is just a few blocks walking distance so easy to go Uptown at anytime of day. Would stay here again if in NYC.

Still a cool place to stay. We had a room with a balcony this time although we didn't take advantage of it. Things are really hopping in the area and with the San Genarro festival right next door it was a blast.

Boutique hotel with small but acceptable rooms. Many aspects of the room have been thoughtfully designed, but not the beds. The location of the bed and the matress are not good. The air conditioning blew directly on our faces so I ended up turning it off while we slept, which was okay since there was a ceiling fan but not ideal. Also the matress is terrible, there was no support in it at all so my bad back was in agony. I didn't sleep well or much for the seven nights we stayed there. I tried sleeping on the floor and I tried adding pillows under my body - which did improve the situation but not sufficiently enough. My husband slept perfectly fine though. I did really like the style and furnishing in the room. The room has an open bathroom but private toilet. It has a large shower (no bath) with good shower pressure but as everywhere we stayed tricky to figure out how to use. There is a tucked away well stocked minibar, iron & ironing board, haridryer, robes, slippers and glassware. The only missing amenity from the room was an ice bucket, which we were able to request along with ice via reception. We had an inredible view looking uptown and we got upgraded to a balcony room. Unfortunately we are both too scared of heights to spend time out there, especially with those all glass barriers. However, I do commend them on the design of the bench seat to best utilise the small balcony space. Stylish sunken lobby lounge with books, games and bikes available to borrow. The staff are really friendly and helpful and the area is fantastic. There is so much quality food within a stones throw from the hotel. Unfortunately, Bread, the restaurant within the hotel is not one of them (great service and awesome drinks but average menu and food). However, the Egg Shop, Butcher's Daughter and L'Asso are all great, just to name a few. Pascale Jones is also meant to be great but we didn't get a chance to try it. There is also a rooftop that you can hang out on, which is fabulous. We got up early one morning (well I was already up cause I hadn't slept) and went to the roof to watch the sunrise. It was lovely. But you could grab some take-away from Xi'an Famous Foods on Kenmare Street (another great local food option) and pick up drinks from Wine Therapy on Elizabeth Street and enjoy it all on the roof. I also recommend getting your laundry, dry-cleaning and alterations/mending done at Eco Friendly (Zhang's Dry Cleaning) on Mott Street. The only thing that is keeping me from rebooking this hotel for our next stay is the bed. Otherwise, I would be back there in a second.

Great location at the edge of Nolita but that's about the only positive thing. The room was ridiculously small. Difficult to move around. No place to put things they have to go under the bed. And the whole place is quite noisy as Kenmare Street is a remote access to Williamsburg bridge. This hotel is totally overpriced.

Lovely hotel, right in the centre of hip Manhattan (North little Italy). Modern interior with facilities to suit. Roof terrace, restaurant, bar & relaxing lounge with a great selection of reading material...

I stayed here after transferring from another hotel near by on Allen street. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. They has a nice selection of bikes in the lobby for guests, with locks so the were useful for getting around. The rooms were expected nyc size. Clean, good bedding. Lighting was great. My 2 complaints were there was a lot of street noise as the adjacent road is very busy. Also the ac unit fan was very loud. Turning it up solved the problem but it did get a little warm. I would stay here again for the location. Easy access to Soho and the east village.

I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The hotel location is fantastic, we first stayed at Times Square and after the initial awe of the lights it became clear that it wasn't 'real'. It was all geared up on the tourist dollar and it just didn't feel right. Times Square is great on your first visit, after that avoid at all costs. The Nolitan however is near Little Italy, Chinatown and within a reasonable walking distance to the Brooklyn and Williamsburg bridges. Spring street station nearby will get you anywhere you need to via Subway.The hotel is clean, the views are jaw dropping but most of all the staff make it what it is. I must mention especially Sheldon and Gene. Absolute salt of the earth guys and they are a credit to the hotel. The best member of staff however, as noted in other members reviews is Gustavo. Gustavo works tirelessly to ensure your stay is what you hope it will be. I ordered from a Mexican restaurant and they were not responsive an hour after delivery, I mentioned it in passing to Gustavo and he was kind enough to call them and speak in their language with a firm but fair attitude. The food arrived around 15 minutes later. You cannot walk through the hotel door when Gustavo is working without seeing his friendly smile and stopping for a conversation. You can easily spend an hour just chatting about everything in general and his knowledge of the area and the less tourist packed places is fantastic. I wouldn't consider staying in another hotel in future, maybe if Gustavo wasn't working here it wouldn't be the same and I would consider it, that's how much of an impact he has. Thanks Nolitan, to all the staff, special shout to Gene and Sheldon but 100% well done and thank you to Gustavo. Hope to see you guys soon.

Stayed at the new Nolitan - great area to visit with close proximity to Little Italy, 2 subway stops, Chinatown, walk to Brooklyn bridge and Manhattan bridge easily. Rooms are new , light and very functional. Shout out to staff (Toni, Stephanie, Micheal, Gabriel) - slick check in/check out, great welcoming vibe to the hotel. Cant wait to return to explore of SoHo!

June 2016 was our third visit to The Nolitan the staff are all fantastic Gustavo, Gene and Sheldon have made our stays so memorable! The location is fantastic and I have recommend the hotel to everyone! it truly is our home from home and I can't wait to return in Feb 2017

I know NYC very well because I have lived here in the past and think the Nolitan provides a great NYC feeling. I stayed here for one night in August 2016 and could not have enjoyed my stay more. Great location, amazing room and very kind staff (including the bar man). I asked before I arrived if it would be possible to get a room with a window that can be opened and the reservationist Toni upgraded me to a balcony room. Your needs are taken seriously and accommodated, which makes you feel comfortable instantly. I will be back soon.

Arrived late and found the hotel staff friendly and gave helpful advice on how to navigate the city. Jean and Dave recommended great late night food options. Hotel rooms are relatively quiet for Soho.

I come here every time I come to the city and the stay is always perfect. Great rooms, affordable and a great staff! Jean and Dave are always welcoming and helpful! Looking forward to coming back here again!

We stayed here for three nights in August 2016! I was a little disappointed at how small the rooms were but that is pretty much my only complaint! The room was super clean! The staff were really friendly! We had a few requests and they really came through! It is not the cheapest place you can get but it is quite worth it. They have a rooftop that nobody used besides us, because of the heat I assume, but it is lovely and the view is nice. There is a bar and restaurant right next to the lobby and it is within walking distance from a lot of cool places to visit in SoHo! It is a cool little hotel! Give it a try!

Nolitan Hotel, knows how to showcase the beauty of NYC. It has all the elements you look for to experience the "real NYC." It's all about the street art, boutiques, and grittiness. The staff knows NYC really well and know how to best assist you. Nolitan offers you all the amenities you actually want; 24 fitness at a real gym, bikes and long boards- for free! And it also gives you the luxury everyone wants while staying in a hotel. Thank Nolitan for actually paying tribute to NYC!

This is our second time at the Nolitan.The good: - the location is stellar. Easy access to anywhere in Manhattan and to LGA- the style is wonderful. Rooms are small but well-appointed, and very comfortable.The bad:- they cancelled the nightly wine and cheese. One can only surmise this is part of the partnership between the hotel and the adjoining restaurant, who were perhaps not pleased that the hotel was giving away food and drink. Shame.- the rooftop patio, while offering great views, is woefully under-utilized. It's a dead space that could be a wonderful meeting place.The ugly:- I hired a car to take us to the airport. The car was hired for 6PM. To me, that means that the car should be at the hotel at 5:45, at the latest. This is not a dinner reservation I'm going to; it's a flight. They won't hold the plane for me, so the hotel's job, as a service provider (and not a cheap one, as it happens), is to make sure I make my flight. Anyway, no car came by 6. I was assured that the car was coming, but they couldn't tell me exactly when.That, my friends, is unacceptable. A hotel should provide excellent service from the moment I arrive until the moment I leave. And this was a major oversight in their part. In the end, we got a cab. But we shouldn't have had to.I like the Nolitan, but I won't be back. It's just not good value for money anymore, and there are other options in this price category.Shame.

Great hotel great location beautiful decor ! Also super nice staff and you can rent bikes free of charge which is perfect! Lovely rooms with great views and an amazing city view from the roof deck! Lots of lovely restaurants and bars close by too! Stay here;)

Happy hour nibbles are free at the Nolitan and a nice touch after a long day of walking and sight seeing. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and the Boutiques are great. This was in a quiet location, rooms were smallish but not as small as they can be in NYC. Clean enough, I have never found the cleaning that great in any hotel in New York. Great shopping nearby. Excellent restaurants. Close to subway. Walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge. I booked on jetsetter.com on one of their last minute deals. It's a site that only has high end hotels for great prices.

I traveled the entire country from SF to NYC. I stayed at many hotels and saw lots of sights. I had lots of set backs. My truck broke down pulling into NYC, and I was struck by a hit and run driver on my Harley in Indianapolis. I arrived at The Nolitan disheveled to say the least. I was carrying not just my normal luggage but many of the items that I didn't care to leave in my truck while it sat outside the dealer waiting to be fixed. I was the perfect example of a hot mess. Sweaty, dirty, with 3 dogs, most items not even in luggage. Just about as bad an entrance as I could make. I believe it was Sheldon who set my mind at ease telling me I was in New York and that I could make whatever entrance I wanted and it was OK. Sheldon, Dorina and the entire staff made me and my guests feel like royalty from start to finish. When my stay, which was also my 45th birthday weekend, was over and my truck was not fixed. I was too be riding away on my Harley. They offered to hold some of my luggage until I could make arrangements to have it sent to me. Well, three weeks later here I come to claim my luggage. I was positive it was all at Goodwill by now. I almost didn't even call but I was passing by the city and figured I'd try. Of course they had my luggage still and gave it to me without any type of attitude or making me feel bad at all. I saw where they check your luggage. My bags were most definitely in their way for the last three weeks. But making guests feel bad isn't their style. I can't recommend The Nolitan highly enough. I'd give them 10 stars if possible. They are without a doubt my favorite hotel in the country and I spent a large part of the summer in $1-2 thousand dollar per night suites. Those big name chains have nothing on this cozy little SoHo hotel. I could have spent a few paragraphs telling you about the hip decor or the trendy neighborhood but quite simply the reason to stay at The Nolitan is because of Sheldon, Dorina and every member of the staff. They are second to none. But don't take my word for it. Book a room there and find out for yourself. Tell em Mr. Mister (the Harley guy) sent ya.

The Nolitan is definitely the coolest place to stay in NYC! Modern chic and industrial flair is what this is all about. Add to that the amazing location right between Nolita, SoHo, Little Italy and Chinatown, and you'll definitely not regret staying here.The roof top terrace is one of the many highlights. We can definitely recommend the suite on the 8th floor with its unique design and modern appeal!Can't wait to be back and spend some more great time at the Nolitan and in NYC!

this is the best hotel in Nolita/Soho. perfect location, friendly and gracious staff, and huge clean rooms. we've stayed here many times and each time has been absolutely wonderful. very accessible to the rest of the city. this place is a must stay!

I stayed at the Nolitan Hotel for business, and received a fantastic summer rate around $220 a night. It's in a fantastic location in SoHo - walking distance to tons of great Little Italy and Chinatown restaurants, chain store shopping on Broadway, and fun boutiques on Elizabeth Street. The hotel lobby is very hip and the rooftop offers beautiful views of the city. While the rooms are small, they are clean and modern with everything you need. The hotel staff are super friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend the Nolitan!

Arrived at 12am! The man at the desk was really nice and happy! The room was incredible! Really cool concrete ceilings, and a great layout! The views from the room were amazing! The rooms are very nicely designed... Modern but warm! Amazing!

The Nolitan is located on Kenmare Street, so super handy for the terrific bustle of Noho bars, restaurants and shops. The only negative really is the huge volume of traffic going to-and-fro the Williamsburg bridge. That said, the first thing you'll notice is that the staff are all fabulously friendly and welcoming. Anything you need, they're happy to help. The foyer is arranged with a recess where evening drinks and breakfast are on offer to guests; a nice informal touch. The room itself is clean and essential, with a post-industrial spartan finish which is fine by me. Free Wi-Fi works and is is welcome. The bed was comfortable, the shower powerful, and if you're in time, you can grab a bicycle to ride for as long as you like. Price wise, we're on a par with Hotels like Sixty Soho and The Soho Grand, so maybe a little steep, but there is plenty to be happy with here, especially if you like the slightly rougher edges of the neighbourhood.

Location: Great! As the name implies, right in Nolita, an area full of great places to eat, drink, and shop. Incredibly enough for NYC, The Nolitan is in an area where you can readily find parking on the street! Hotel: Aesthetically beautiful from the outside, thoughtfully and comfortably decorated on the inside. We were in one of their suites on the 8th floor. Super comfy bed, huge tub and shower, very chic couch in sitting area. The rooftop was spectacular as well! With an expansive 360 degree view, you can take in the Freedom Tower in one direction, the Empire State and Chrysler in the other. Perfect place to relax with a drink!Staff: Very helpful and courteous. We need some more ice: it was there in no time, and in abundance. We asked about the best places nearby to do some shopping: their recommendations did not lead us astray.Bottom line: When I come to NYC, I come to The Nolitan.

The Nolitan is a small boutique hotel.Rooms look out on the Empire State Building.Rooftop has great views of the city.Friendly helpful staffButcher's Daughter vegetarian restaurant across the streetFree bike 'hire' - spent 4 hours riding across to Brooklyn, Brooklyn Bridge Park, then a tour of the downtown.Good value by NYC standardsHighly recommended

This hotel is a great way to experience New York. The Nolitan has a great feel and style. It's just a few blocks from SoHo, so there are tons of great shops, restaurants, and stores nearby. The staff was very kind and accommodating, and the rooms are very industrial chic- from the exposed concrete ceilings, to the beautiful glass showers. The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable. I had a nice time here and will definitely come back.

I'm in love. Here it is by the numbers:1. The location is perfect. It's in Nolita, a fantastic right in the heart of several of Manhattan's best neighborhoods. It's a great basecamp for a weekend (or more) in the city. 2. Style. The did an incredible job with the style of this hotel. From the lobby to the roof, every detail adds to the style and class. The floorpans are clever — we were in a corner suite with floor to ceiling windows and a unique centrally located tub that opened to the bedroom and living area on both sides — gobs of space and natural light. And the finishes are superb! Clean, modern fixtures and tiles, exposed concrete, and vintage furniture all come together to create a package that's eclectically modern. Awesome.3. Amenities. Really, I'm talking about the roof here. A spacious deck covers the entire roof. Perfect spot to take in 360 degree views of lower manhattan. Perfect for cocktails with friends.Love this hotel. It'll be hard to ever stay anywhere else after big here.

I travel to NYC 3-4 times a year on business and stay midtown to be close to the office. Coming to the city as a tourist, I was looking for a clean, safe and well located hotel that was completely different from the big corporate chains. The Nolitan hotel and the team running it ticked all the boxes and more!The neighbourhood is great. Well located, within a 40 minute walk of Battery Park and a 40 minute walk of Times Sq. Its funky, but safe and friendly with a great selection of independent coffee shops, restaurants and interesting architecture. With Little Italy and Chinatown literally on the doorstep and the Village a short stroll away, this was a very different NYC than I normally see.We had a King Corner Room on the 7th floor. Very clean, great city views (Williamsburg Bridge, Empire State) and well equipped with a safe, well stocked fridge as well as a bath and shower. I am paranoid about bed bugs when staying in the city, couldn't find a single entry for Nolitan on the registry and the sheets were immaculate and the mattress had a cover, an undersheet and then the sheet we slept on. Pillows were amazing, very little traffic noise this high up and a choice of fan/aircon so the room was comfortable at all times. Slept brilliantly.The onsite restaurant "Bread" is now open and serves a full menu, though we only tried the wonderful croissants and muffins. Coffee could have been stronger, but the tea was good. We mostly ate around the neighbourhood, from cheap diners where we got a huge breakfast for under $20 to the higher-end where that was the starting price for a plate of eggs. This is New York after all.The staff were really helpful and friendly, answering lots of questions before the trip and making us feel very welcome while there. Their recommendations, including local restaurants, were good. At one point, one of the team lent us his metro card so we didn't have to buy one for a trip uptown. Stefanie in particular was always happy and helpful.There were a few good surprises, like the roof terrace with great views of the city in all directions and the fact that Booking.com honoured their price promise more than once as the price dropped in the weeks before the stay. There was also one unpleasant surprise - the car service the hotel booked tried to bump the price up within the first 30 seconds and then drove like a maniac. Not the hotel's fault but not the last impression we wanted from such a great stay.

I am a lover of all things Manhattan. In every neighborhood, there's a vibe. This place definitely matches the vibe of the area. Very modern, very hipster. Young staff, made our stay excellent and comfortable! The rooftop is incredible. The suite had an amazing view.Will come back soon!

Always love staying at the Nolitan!! Amazing modern hotel with tons of perks and an amazing rooftop!! Best bathtub ever!!! Yummy Nespresso for my morning coffee :) The staff is super helpful and friendly. Great neighborhood with tons of great restaurants super close!

I sometimes travel to NYC for business but prefer to steer clear of the large, chain hotels in favor of something a little different. Although the Nolitan is not a business travelers' hotel per se (e.g. there is no business center and few amenities for working in-room), the hotel itself is a delight. The rooms are modern, clean and simple. They are also very loft-like, featuring concrete ceilings, exposed duct work, wooden floors with wide planks, and plenty of natural light. I like the comfy beds and high-end showers with glass walls. The lobby is modern, inviting, and unpretentious. The staff are casual, friendly, and exceptionally helpful, especially Gustavo and Sherieka, who took care of my every need. Wine and cheese are served every evening. The hotel has a "neighborhood" feel to it, and is located within walking distance of many fine restaurants, coffee bars, and shops in SoHo and Nolita. Little Italy and Chinatown are just a couple of blocks away. Bikes are available in the lobby for exploring the local area. There is a also a newly-opened eatery just a few steps from the hotel, called Bread, which is a great place to get breakfast, lunch or dinner, since there is no restaurant onsite. Overall, the Nolitan is a modern, warm, and welcoming boutique hotel for adventurers and business travelers alike. The staff are genuinely friendly and deliver a high standard of service and quality. I will definitely come back for my next trip.

Just what I was looking for while traveling on business - close to my meetings and situated in the lively NoLita neighborhood. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and always have a smile on their face - something I usually get when staying in hostels or B&Bs, and NOT something you get from most chain hotels. The hotel gives perfect access to a huge variety of dining options, many of which have plentiful vegan options. My room was very modern and clean, albeit slightly small. The size wasn't an issue for me however, as I was there on business and spent most of my time out. They have a rooftop lounge which offers great views of the mid-town and down-town skylines, however, it was a little disappointing that they didn't offer refreshments there - seems like an opportunity missed. When I'm in lower-Manhattan again, I'll likely return to the Nolitan.

My husband and I spent a perfect weekend at The Nolitan. We drove down from upstate NY, found a spot right on the street (we can't believe it either), and fell right into the rhythm of the neighborhood. The Nolitan Hotel is right at the heart of Nolita (north little Italy) It's charming, with flares of luxury, yet unpretentious with friendly and down-to-earth staff. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by warm smiles at the reception desk. The lobby felt elegant but also inviting- pieces curated for beauty and comfort too. We spent some time sitting and sipping the complementary wine provided in the lobby. I tried the red, and was impressed. Small appetizers were provided as well, which helped take the edge off my hunger from our travel into the city. They seem like small things, but having food and wine as soon as you arrive somewhere is a marvelous start to a relaxing stay. It gave us time to unpack, explore the hotel a bit, and take time choosing where we wanted to go for dinner. Our room was incredible! We stayed in one of the corner room suites- 8th floor. The first thing that hit me was how cool and peaceful the room was when we walked in. It was a hot muggy day, noisy in the city, but the room had been perfectly prepared and cooled down before our arrival. (no fidgeting with thermostats I don't know how to work) I also noticed how quiet it was- we never heard our neighbors or folks in the hall! The layout and design of the room was breathtaking. The bathroom opens up into the living room with views straight north to uptown Manhattan, a straight shot to the Empire State building, and east to the bridge. (The bathroom has a curtain you can pull between the tub and living room for privacy, but we never wanted to obstruct the open feel of it all.) Gorgeous! Small details made us feel at home such as luxurious robes, comfy slippers, fun magazines, and a pantry full of snacks, drinks and souvenirs from the Nolitan. There was even a yoga mat! A delicious variety of Nespresso pods gave us options for gourmet coffee/espresso in bed. My favorite part of the room was the tub. It's such a beautiful highlight in the center of the suite- like something out of a Pinterest dream board! The water was perfect- great pressure, no waiting for the hot water... I drew a bath, placed a few drops of frankincense in and relaxed with a glass of wine while looking out through the floor-to-ceiling windows at the city through sunset. The location of the Nolitan Hotel is fantastic. We grabbed amazing Mexican food at La Esquina just two blocks walk with a 5 min wait for tacos etc; amazing pizza right across the street at L'asso. The Butchers Daughter, diagonal to the hotel is a great cafe where we also saw different celebs coming for brunch. Best of all, downstairs from the Nolitan Hotel is the newly opened Bread. A fabulous Italian cafe/restaurant with great cappuccinos, breakfasts, and full service all the way through dinner. It's hardly 10 steps from the lobby of the Nolitan. The Nolitan has been my favorite hotel experience yet in NYC. With so much to do and see in the neighborhood- and fun bikes you can take from the lobby to explore- it's the best boutique hotel, and really the best way to experience NYC in its truest sense.
