It absolutely gets 5 stars!

Very short NYC trip with my son. From check in to end of our stay a short two days later, the staff was fantastic. Always friendly and lots of useful info. The room was nice (corner) but roof top deck the best! Fantastic views open 24/7. Bread next door is a wonderful bar and restaurant. Would definitely return !

My husband and I travel for work quite a bit so, when choosing a place to stay for play, we like to make sure our lodging well-represents the city or neighborhood we're visiting for a true 'local experience'. Although we have stayed in the city (Manhattan) several times, we had not had the chance to thoroughly enjoy this fun 'nabe' north of Little Italy and almost directly east of SOHO. Needless to say, Nolita is a premier location for pretty much anything you have planned to do on your NYC weekender. From shopping to dining and bar hopping to people watching, the Nolitan was the perfect spot. At the hotel itself, the modern, and welcoming lobby gave way to a friendly reception desk & concierge staff. Besides being very knowledgeable about the area with plenty of great recommendations, they were extremely helpful in getting us last minute reservations to a nearby and fun speakeasy/restaurant (La Esquina) that came highly recommended as a 'must-see-and-do' from several friends (thanks Michael & Sherika!). The staff was willing to walk down to the place while we were shopping to make sure they spoke to the right person and get us on the list! We were impressed and the spot did not disappoint. The suite we booked (Suite 801) was surprisingly quite large for a new boutique hotel in the city- which are typically known for being smaller than the national average. It was in the corner of the building so it had two window-walls that flooded the room with natural light but had window treatments and black-out curtains for a restful night's sleep. I get hot very easily and it is summer so I thought a well-lit room would mean a warm-ish stay but I was so pleased at how cool the suite stayed all day and night. Besides the modern furnishings and raw concrete columns/ceilings (Eames lounger and all), the layout of the suite was clever. The living room was by the spectacular views of Midtown (with clear view of the Empire State Bldg) and the ample bed-room (king size bed) was set towards the back of the suite with the bathroom placed in between both spaces. The soaking tub and rain shower head was predominantly featured in the room to allow for light and an openness in the entire space(see picture). Yet there was an optional curtain wall that provided total privacy for more shy occupants. The suite also had all the amenities you would expect to have in a quality hotel, like terry-cloth bath robes, slippers, free wifi and a portable media console, but it also had several novel ideas that just made our stay extra special, like a yoga mat, umbrella, Nespresso coffee machine with pods, and bicycles to borrow. At sunset we would hit the rooftop lounge area to rest our feet from the day's worth of exploring, shopping, and eating! The sunset skies over Midtown and Lower Manhattan were stunning. The deck practically has 360-degree views which is rare in this city filled with buildings competing for air-space. It was the perfect little break in our evenings before heading out for dinner and drinks. The Nolitan just opened up a new restaurant off of their main lobby named BREAD, a casually-chic, modern Italian fare, which relocated here from a close-by but smaller location. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast there before check-out and were happy to see that they had an outdoor/side-walk dining option, perfect for people watching in this vibrant neighborhood. Our Nolitan weekend was even better than we hoped it would be and most of that positive experience is attributed to our stay in this amazing boutique hotel. Highly recommended! :)
user_name:
sara estefan d
Brooklyn, New York

review_body: This hotel exceeded all my expectations. Right in the center of everything you I wanted for food, drinks (La Esquina & The Ship), subway, and entertainment. The rooftop views are breathtaking. Drinks at sunset with a view of NYC in every direction... can't ask for anything more.
user_name:
JoshinNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location, Great Staff, Great Hotel.The location on Kenmore Street was perfect for getting around, especially Soho / Little Italy - subway close by, as well as plenty of great coffee shops - and of course great stores too.The staff in the hotel were very welcoming, and the rooms were furnished how you would expect from a boutique / contemporary hotel. Bathroom / Shower brilliant, great toiletries, really comfortable bed, and no outside noise, which was a great bonus!Breakfast was divine with so much choice, and great service too.Overall a wonderful experience, and would stay agin for sure.
user_name:
martyn v v
London, United Kingdom

review_body: Great Architecture. Great staff. Great Room ( I got the only suite, can't comment on others). Great bath tub great. I loved it. Will be back as soon as I can. Hip hip hip hip hooray. Why do I need to say more if can get it all done in less than 200 words? In hotel restaurant was closed but free breakfast and happy hour and great restaurants around corner, up the street and directly across the street. There is that 200?

I stayed here for 6 nights recently and was anticipating some issues after reading recent reviews complaining about the restaurant renovations and traffic noise. Ok, it would have been good to have had the option of the restaurant but, personally, I found the continental breakfast in the lobby perfectly good-and more or less what I'd have chosen anyway. When I left on Sunday, it look alike the restaurant was on the verge of re-opening.I heard no traffic noise-maybe because I was on the 9th floor?Th hotel could make much more of the large roof area-some decent seating, clean it up, maybe a small bar?Front desk staff were all friendly and helpful.

Had a wonderful Mother/Daughter weekend and was a nice surprise as to how friendly and helpful the staff was. Michael was very warm and made us feel at home. Wondered why there was no on-site restaurant, but he gave great options. Room was comfortable with amenities.

We're staying at the hotel this week. We booked this hotel for a work trip over 2 months ago. 2 days before we arrived we received an email telling us that there is no hotel restaurant and room service. Then the day before we received another email welcoming us and proudly announcing their new restaurant. Very confusing! On arrival we find that the restaurant is a building site, and that there is no room service. I'm told that it's not their restaurant, which sounds a bit weird to me. They talk about it in promotional emails and on the website, so it sounds like their restaurant to me. The hotel has offered to send out for food if we want, and there is continental breakfast in the lobby. Fair enough offer. What annoys me is the lack of honesty. I'm sure they are trying everything to keep their bookings and revenue, but that's not my problem. On the hotel website they are still promoting bed and breakfast and the restaurant and room service. The room is great, the location is good, but for $400 to $500 a night, I'd like a cup of coffee in my room. It's sparing with the truth at best and we've not been offered any form of compensation. Be honest, come up with a better solution, a Nespresso in your room, a few bucks off, an alternative room service offer properly set up with a couple of local restaurants. Maybe even put their menus in the rooms. It's all very half hearted, and don't call me a 'Nolitan' on your welcome letter when this situation is occurring. All very disappointing, when we wanted to really love this place. Shame.

I've wanted to stay at the Nolitan for a few years. This time I found a good deal to get a corner suite room for 3 nights when in town for work. The hotel has an ideal location in my mind. Close to Soho. Close to Bowery/Lower east. And, right by Elizabteh Street on Kenmare. The concept is also really nice. The lobby is a nice place to sit and work or just people watch. The Restaurant is closed and the renovation process is obviously disturbing in terms of construction noice. Also, this means there's no breakfast or dinner at the hotel. The roof terrace seems abandoned. No flowers or anything. Weird, since it could be really amazing. The corner suite is really nice in terms of furnishing. The bed is great. The details aren't really there. Seems like the contractor was not used to doing high end boutique styled builds if you look into details. Also, I know this is NYC - but the rooms are really not for light sleepers. The windows are floor to ceiling, but I've stayed at other hotels in NYC with the same type of windows where the sounds have been effectively kept out. . Here they're not... The service is great. Really think the staff do a great job so that part is 10 points. The wi-fi in my room was terrible, but Bogdan helped me get a small router to plug in my room to fix that dilemma. There are bikes and Long-boards at the front desk to explore manhattan... That's something really appreciated from me. Not having to bring my board nor go for the city bike rentals.

The prices are inflated for this hotel. It's under a major renovation so there is no bar or restaurant. Rooms claim a balcony that is more like a fire escape. The hallways are dark and feel more like a NYC apartment than a high end hotel. I wouldn't stay here again. Overall very disappointing stay.

As the title suggests, the main reason for my visit to NYC was to propose to my girlfriend. I'd spoken with the team at Nolitan before I booked and they provided great advice on how I might achieve all of the experiences I would wish to set up for my gf. Not only this, but they did everything possible to help me make reservations, arrange tickets, and advise on the best places to go. Bogdan, the hotel manager is an absolute gentleman and I really can't speak highly enough of his hotel and team. When I return to amazing NYC, I will most certainly be staying with the Nolitan again.
user_name:
Ritchie C
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I was on a solo trip in NYC to see a concert. I have always loved this area of New York for the boutiques, shops, restaurants. And now I found a delicious boutique hotel to make my home base. I splurged on a corner room with a deep soaking tub and floor to ceiling widows facing east and north which lit up the room in the mornings in a very nice way. The room had a yoga mat, a very comfortable bed, it was very clean and the bathroom well lit. The staff was super friendly and knowledgeable. I enjoyed the wine and cheese happy hour. And while the weather was cool for enjoying the outdoors, I made a stop to the rooftop and it is fabulous with almost 360o views of lower Manhattan. Summer at the Nolitan Rooftop must be great! The hotel is walking distance to wonderful places to eat and shop. I can't wait to return to the Nolitan!

So positives first: it's a great hotel in a fab location with lovely staff. The beds are super-comfy and the wine and nibbles in the evening are a nice touch. We booked a corner suite with a tub (latter main reason for booking). Cost was $377 for one night. All confirmed by phone the night before.Arrive early afternoon. Staff full of apologies, due a leak no corner suites available. So we get downgraded to next level (much smaller room, no tub), $70 off bill and a complimentary bottle of cava. Well, these things happen, but pissed that $70 just means we are simply paying the rate for a room we wouldn't have booked in the first place. Next morning rate for night being charged is $370 (after we open the envelope and look at bill while at the desk). So..... $7 off for a room we didn't want and wouldn't have booked (plus a bottle of cava we didn't drink). After checking and then complaining we get apologies for overbooking (so not a leak after all) and $70 plus taxes refunded. So essentially still paying almost full price for room we wouldn't have booked, being downgraded, lied to and then attempted overcharging. We leave. Then subsequent email full of apologies and another $100 off. But a bit late to be honest. Get your stories straight guys, and if you are going to overbook and then downgrade: 1) let us know when we ring the day before; 2) don't make up stories about leaks; 3) agree proper compensation upfront and stick to it.

I chose the place due to its position and overall customer rating. Overall it was a good choice but a few issues may be important for some travellers. The hotel faces Kenmare street (the continuation of Delancey beyond Bowery) which can be rather noisy at times. Personally I dont mind traffic noise it that it's not too direct but some people may sleep bad due to that. Second (at least the room I had) there bathroom (apart from the WC) is open-air/loft style so privacy may be reduced. As with traffic, I did not mind but again some travellers may be affected. Overall rooms seem to be a bit on the low-size edge but that's normal in ny unless you really pay a lot. There was enough storage space and room details were all fine. The lobby with its afternoon drinks and finger food is also rather welcoming. Useless to say, position is great for access to east/west village, Chinatown, financial district....and the area is full of restaurants and design stores and all you can aim to buy and see. Yes, fan is rather noisy when you activate heating/cooling while you sleep....in my case i just needed it a few hours to warm up the room so I did not mind but I imagine it could be an issue if you needed through the night.

I booked last minute and while they couldn't get me a room with a King bed, the staff was willing to upgrade me to a street-facing balcony room. While they were switching the room assignment, another staff member generously offered me a snack and wine. Their daily Happy Hour reception was wrapping up in the lobby and they wanted to be sure to save me some. So sweet! I happily obliged and headed to my room with a nice glass of champagne.The room was clean and had minimal but chic decor. The bed and shower were fantastic. Honestly though, it was the front desk staff that made this visit so special. They were warm, funny and made me feel incredibly welcome. Will be back for sure!

This review came at least 6 weeks late but I haven't forgotten ;) My husband and I got married and we wanted a weekend staycation honeymoon because we were too busy to leave manhattan (we DJ weekends and i had to work fashion week it was a crazy time). Nolitan is situated in one of the best neighborhoods in the city, walking distance to Soho, the LES, Village, FiDi, Tribeca, and even Williamsburg. If you want to get to know the cool side of town, the location is stellar. Art galleries, museums, boutiques and some of the best restaurants and nightlife in town. Early check-in and late check-out compared to other hotels so we never felt rushed. The staff is truly amazing and I believe that's what really makes this hotel super perfect. Special shout out to Gabriel as he was super helpful and made sure our honeymoon staycation was extra special!! The food at the restaurant is amazing!! Definitely have your meals there. We had complimentary breakfast during our stay. Complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings a nice touch. The hotel exudes a modern industrial vibe but very homely. The rooms are on the small side but corner room views are great, room service spectacular. I recommend an upgrade because the standard rooms were teeny for a couple. Complimentary bikes that rode beautifully, and I believe they have complimentary iPads, gaming systems, all that good stuff as well. The only issue with our stay was the heat in our room didn't work for 2 nights and it was freezing by the time we got back at 4am but they came immediately to try and fix and made sure to compensate for the trouble(thanks Eric!). It wasn't a super big deal and doesn't hinder me from giving it 5 stars. I've recommended my clients to stay at the Nolitan whenever they visit. We might have another staycation when it gets warmer so we will be back ;)

Stayed here for a last-minute trip and couldn't be happier. The design is gorgeous. Chic.... Industrial... Modern... Yet so comfortably... Like home. The plaster wall behind the bed is like art in itself. Staff was incredible. Helped answer all my silly questions. They were very helpful when picking where I wanted to order food from. Once it arrived... They even brought it up to my room. So helpful!Room was so clean too! You can really tell that they "care" about cleanliness... And that really means something. Finally.... THE VIEW! the views are incredible. Whether your room has views of Nolita... Or of downtown Manhattan.... Or of the Williamsburg bridge.... It seriously is breathtaking. If you're considering staying here...... DO IT.

great location, great room, great staff, wonderful views of the city... free wine and cheese reception... lots of great amenities for sale in the room from condoms to t-shirts snacks and drinks etc super comfortable bed and pillows ... Aveda soaps and shampoo... awesome spot if you're going to a show at the bowery ballroom

Booked this place for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. I had never stayed in the part of town, but I loved it. Well I should say it was because there was no one around. The place is right around the corner from little Italy and I always stop in at one of my favorite places there for pizza. The hotel it self was cute, great little lobby serving wine and cheese every day at 5 pm. I booked the King Corner room, so happy, floor to ceiling windows and views of the bridge leading to Brooklyn. Bathroom was amazing, great shower and very modern soaking bath tub right in the room. Fantastic for a little intimacy. Very nicely appointed robes, slippers and other little things that you appreciate. All good things about this place.

I usually stay at the Soho Grand but thought I would try something new. The prices are comparable. The rooms are trendy - industrial style chic but incredibly hot in summer especially if you have the floor to ceiling windows and a little crowded. The hotel does offer charming things like bikes you can take for a ride and an evening snacks reception. But there is just something lacking - not all the staff is trained properly. We had problems checking out and the attention to detail is not there. I feel like this could be a great hotel but it is just not there yer

This is my new favorite hotel in my new favorite neighborhood in NYC. If you do not know, Nolita is about as perfectly located as it gets for current NYC living. SOHO is a block away, Chinatown is a block away, Little Italy is a block away, the Lower East Side is just down the street... etc, etc, etc...There are so many wonderful restaurants within walking distance that you could spend several days before needing to get into a cab, Uber or subway. Having said that, the Bowery subway stop is only a block away.The rooms are small, but wonderfully designed. I have stayed for a week and never felt cramped. If there are two of you, spring for the corner room, however, as it is larger and has an awesome soaking tub in addition to the shower. The design is really outstanding - if I remodel my house, this is how I want it to be and look - simple, beautiful and efficient.The staff is also superb. They are helpful in every way and super welcoming to repeat visitors. A few things to be aware of:1. This is not particularly a business hotel - they do not have a real business center, room service, coffee makers in the room, or any of the other things you expect in a hotel catering to business travelers. Having said that, I am a business traveler and stay here anyway as everything else taken together outweighs these shortcomings2. The dining option in the hotel is extremely limited. They kind of serve breakfast after 8, but honestly, it is clearly an afterthought at this point and is not really at the level of the rest of the hotel. See point number 1. Nothing but coffee and bread products until after 8? Doesn't anybody who stays here have to get to work? Again, there are so many options within a block that I do not care and would not eat here in any case, as I would want to explore the other options.I list these simply so that you know potential downsides going in. For me, this is my favorite place to stay in the city and I recommend it without reservation.

Stayed here this past weekend, 2/6 to 2/7 and I wasn't sure how this is gonna go because it is not a typical " W" or " Hyatt". However, I was pleasantly surprised. Booked the hotel, called ahead and requested a specific floor and room speaking with Gustavo and he was very nice and informative. I got to the hotel, the girl Sharika was very kind and friendly and checked me in and as promised I was given a room on the 9th floor with a spectacular view. She also told me about happy hour that's held by the hotel between certain times with free wine and cheese, which is awesome!!!The room was clean, contemporary, comfortable and had a balcony which is huge to me as I love to stand take in the scenic views and watch the city. My lady and I went down to have wine and cheese and it was a comfortable ambiance and relaxing. Not only those two people I dealt with were nice, a gentleman named Michael was very friendly and accommodating as well, I requested a bottle of champagne when I got back from dinner as a surprise and it was sitting there chilled in my room when we got back. Loved this place and can't wait to go back and the location is the best. Thanks Nolitan Team!!

My husband surprised me with a stay at the hotel (after he heard how much I enjoyed my previous stay with my sister), and what a treat it was AGAIN! Great service, the room was great (LOVE LOVE the hardwood floors and the clean feel they give), and what a spectacular view! The pic really does not do it justice.The area is amazing as well, with great places to eat within walking distance. We had dinner at Bread around the corner, which was really cozy with really great food and a delightful atmosphere.
user_name:
Cristina M
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: I've stayed here several times with my husband. The hotel is hip and trendy without being uncomfortable. The highlight of the hotel is by far their staff, its a non stuffy environment and the staff will bend over backwards to help in any way. We got a beautiful corner room with an amazing view. Every little design and branded detail is thought out, they use aveda products in the rooms and have additional free perks that you can get from reception such as bikes and tech. The area is the best, theres so many places to eat, drink and shop and the hotel offers complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings! Wouldn't stay anywhere else!

I heard about the Nolitan from a work colleague and my wife and I decided to have a weekend hanging out downtown so this was the place we choose. Great choice. Hotel is hip without trying too hard. We had a balcony room with a great view, a little on the small size, but we were only there one night. Amenities were good - Aveda products, comfortable bed, sheets, robes etc.. and they host a complimentary wine and cheese tasting every afternoon which is a nice touch.Unfortunately the night we chose to stay was the night of the 2016 Jonas blizzard and that's when the Hotel really stepped up. The staff could not have been more helpful or welcoming. As NYC was closing down around them they remained cheerful and upbeat. In they end the decision was made to close the bar and restaurant for the evening which was a shame. They could have maybe been more prepared there with a contingency plan for a bunch of stranded travelers.However, the next morning the kitchen was up and running early and the breakfast was great (good value too). We'll certainly visit again.
user_name:
ForestHillsAnon
New York City, New York

review_body: Jan 18, 2016 - My husband and are native New Yorkers who moved out of the city a few years ago (high rent, what else!). We were looking to come back for a little getaway and boy did we get lucky to find the Nolitan! Cool design, excellent and unpretentious staff, super soft bedding, nice shower, awesome rooftop, and very reasonable pricing! Every person from the cleaning lady to the front-desk manager was kind and warm, even a fellow guest in the elevator was friendly! Something old-world happens when you walk through the doors of the Nolitan - the hotel is a class act from head to toe. We didn't get a chance to use the complimentary bikes, but they looked stylish and comfy! You could sure give some other NY hotels lessons on how to run a hotel. We can't wait to come back! Oh, and the Cantine Parisienne downstairs was outstanding!

We were in the neighborhood looking for a comfortable place to sit, have a beer and get out of the cold while we decided where to eat. We had come in from Brooklyn with our twin baby boys for a birthday dinner. We passed by the hotel and peered in the windows, thinking it was a cozy bar. We walked in a found it was actually a hotel. It was so inviting and the staff so gracious we decided, on a whim to skip an expensive meal and get a room instead.... Gabriel, Michael and Sherika (I think that was her name) invited us to look at a room. The room was great, spacious, clean, chic and VERY affordable. The staff right away brought us an extra bed for the babies and down comforters. When they heard it was my birthday they delivered an icy cold bottle of very drinkable champagne, cheese and fruit. Coming in and out, as we bopped around the neighborhood, Gabe and Sherika offered to help with accommodating the babies and us any way they could. Great vibe, GREAT STAFF. This is our new home away from home... I never write reviews but after such a great night, I felt I needed to. Stop in and just check it out, I assure you, whether your in need of a room or on a whim want a great night away, go meet Gabe, Michael and Sherika. They will hook it up!

This was my fourth (fifth?) stay at the Nolitan Hotel. I give it a 5 star rating once again. The service remains at its consistently high level of courtesy and attention from check in to check out. It is a treat to have reception staff who always greet you with a friendly smile, remember who you are and take the time to ask you how your day/evening was. (This is not a huge chain hotel.) They are ready and willing to provide you whatever assistance they can to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The rooms are tastefully appointed ... more importantly, the mattresses are very comfortable allowing me to get good night's sleep... The bathrooms are well lighted making grooming much easier. The hotel's Housekeeping staff keeps the accommodations spotless.The wine and cheese happy hour is a lovely pre-theatre /dinner activity. The hotel is located close to China Town and the Little Italy district, giving customers a wide selection of restaurants to chose from. As well, there is a restaurant located on the main floor... I had breakfast there every day .... try the crunchy French toasts! The proximity to the B,D and #6 subway lines makes getting to upper East and West Manhattan locations (museums, shopping, theatre... or to Penn Station to catch the NJ Train to Newark International airport) very convenient. If you are into cycling, there are even some bicycles available from the front desk. In short, I would not look elsewhere for accommodations .... I have already made the reservations for my April trip.

We were upgraded to a balcony room. Nice views from the hotel, especially from the roof. The staff was very attentive and friendly, willing to help us with any aspect of our trip. The room was small but comfortable. The bedding was very comfortable as well. The wine and cheese happy hour was a nice treat and something to look forward to after a full day of activity. Very convenient to the Spring St. Station. I would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here for 4 nights over the New Year's holiday. I wanted to be far away from Times Square so I chose the Nolita area. This hotel is very cool. I loved my room. It is small, and you might want to upgrade if you are 2 people. My room had a balcony, and I did go out occasionally even though it was cold. I kept my door open during NYE and watched the blinking lights of the Empire State Building. I stayed in for NYE and received a knock at my door. It was the staff passing out a bottle of champagne, 2 pair of funny glasses that said 2016, and such a nice letter welcoming me into the new year from the Nolitan Hotel. The bed is extremely comfortable, and I loved wearing the white robe with the cute little red slippers they provided. The guys who run the hotel are very nice. The restaurant was a nice place to hang out in the evening. I also enjoyed the happy hour every evening but it wasn't very crowded. Its a very quiet hotel, and not a party hotel. If you like this area, south of Houston, its a nice hotel to stay in.

I booked this online, first time in NY, didn't know what to expect. This hotel grew on us, mainly due to the staff. A bellboy/receptionist called Gabriel went out of his way to make our stay better, but all the staff were outstanding in professionalism and good customer service. The hotel is build on modern concepts (has no door to the shower-good for couples, a bit dodgy for families) but besides this, would think this property in Chinatown is worth its price.

Really enjoyed our three night stay here. Rooms are small but that's NYC. Staff are all very upbeat, young and trendy and a pleasure to have around. Rooms are trendy and cool, bar and lobby area are beautifully designed, very modern. My teen daughter loved it. The location was great if you don't want to be in busy midtown, very easy walk to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy and TriBeCa. Loved it.

The small touches are what makes this hotel great! We Spent 6 nights in the Nolitan over Christmas and were extremely satisfied with the experience. Got into the Hotel early evening and the team at reception upgraded us to a balcony room, petite but very well proportioned with everything contained, well planned and with views of the city, excellent. I was celebrating my birthday during the stay and the hotel left sparkling wine and cup cakes in my room which was very much appreciated and a thoughtful touch. The complimentary umbrellas, bikes, laptops and the wine and nibbles all added to the experience. The people are the hotels best asset from the reception team to the breakfast staff all extremely well trained and very professional. The hotel feels very hip and cool and has a very warm atmosphere that adds to your New York trip. The location downtown is first class minutes from East village, SOHO and TRiBeCa with subway stops literally one minute away. Lots of excellent restaurants and Bars all within walking distance after a day's sightseeing. This trip to NYC was special and the Nolitan played a big part. Well done Michael and the team keep it up and hopefully be back soon.

I booked a group of business travelers at The Nolitan Hotel who were traveling to Soho for a big PR event with Apple. We had 5 or 6 rooms total and the team was flying in at different times of the day. I received a call on the evening of check-in that they had oversold the hotel but that my boss, one of our chief executives who was on his way there, could be rebooked at their sister property in Midtown. My team was prepping for an important early morning meeting in Soho and they wanted to stick our COO in Midtown? Then they offered to put him at the Indigo Hotel on the Lower East Side. Not comparable AT ALL to the Corner Suite I had him booked in.Beware that they oversell their rooms and if you don't arrive early in the day, they may run out before you arrive. I wouldn't risk it and potentially have to scramble to find decent accommodation as you're driving in from LGA. Definitely won't book again for my executives.

My boyfriend and I spent two nights at this charming hotel. So much personality. The staff was very friendly, rooms were clean and well put together, and the view was amazing. Something to mention would be the complimentary slippers. We have never stayed at a hotel where the slippers actually fit. the bathroom floor can be a little slippery with them on, just be careful. Also be sure to read the list of items that are non-complimentary. We will definitely be staying there again.

I actually only stayed here for one night on a business trip, but can not wait to go back for longer. This is a well located Hotel with great staff.My room was small, as are most that i have stayed in NYC, but perfectly comfortable and had everything that i needed, along with the most comfortable bed!

I checked in to this hotel for a friends wedding over in NYC. The hotel is amazing. A short walk away from the subway. The staff are friendly and very helpful. My bag got delayed at JFK airport, which I was a little worried about - the reception staff reassured me - helped me everyway possible and even brought my bag to my room at 12:30am the same day my friend was getting married at 10am. The hotel is fabulous - the see through shower is a little worrying if you are stopping with friends as you can see everything lol. The room was clean and tidy - couldn't fault it in any aspect.The hotel has a bar on the lower ground floor which is worth a visit.

Came to the Nolitan Hotel for a short weekend trip. I am so happy I stayed here. The staff was so courteous and helpful. The rooftop views are amazing. And the Wine/Cheese in the evenings is a GREAT touch. The room design was modern, but had a very comfortable "feel". Also, can't beat the free wifi in the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

After a difficult, unpleasant stay at another hotel, the staff at the Nolitan was one of the highlights of my trip to NYC. Scrambling to get to JFK during rush hour on a Saturday night, I asked the front desk for assistance in obtaining transportation. Three different employees dropped what they were doing to help me, eventually calling a car service to take me to the airport. During this time, I was offered food and drink from their nightly wine and cheese offering, and engaged in friendly conversation by the employees. Before I left, the staff would not accept a tip for their service, which was exceptional. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC. Great location, great vibe, and rarest of all: nice, helpful people.

Our third or fourth visit. Modern clean hotel with small well equipped rooms. Views vary with floor and side of hotel. No formal dining area but attached cafe. Many excellent restaurants nearby. Great location and good value. Staff friendly. Free wifi

We stayed at the Nolitan for 5 nights in December 2014. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and accommodating. Our room was clean and tidy, if a little on the small side. The bathroom was a good side with a powerful shower (not bath) and also nice and clean. We had a nice balcony that looked out onto the road, although we didn't use it much with it being December. Our room was cleaned and bed made on a daily basis and we would return back to the room to find chocolates on our pillows and little card letting us know the weather forecast for the next day which was a lovely touch. It's not the mos luxurious hotel but it was a lovely case for exploring the city and we always felt happy to come back to the hotel to spend time in the room after along day of sight seeing. There is free wifi too which was a god send as I'm desolate without my internet access.There are little amenity shops and cafes, restaurants and bars surrounding this place so it's an ideal location for exploring Manhattan. It is right by the Williamsberg bridge and also on the cusp of china town and little Italy if I remember correctly. There are also subway stops within walking distance. We walked to the Brooklyn Bridge one morning so everything is accessible. My favourite thing about this hotel is the huge roof garden. It offers lovely views of Manhattan, especially at night and this is where my other half popped the question, with the Manhattan skyline as a backdrop. We cannot wait to return to the Nolitan in the future, hopefully for our first anniversary next year.

Modern industrial with a European vibe. Amazing attention to details. Great location and friendly staff. Can't beat the location for good eats and shopping. And while the room was New York small it was well organized and the bed was comfortable.

We just checked out after 6 nights at the Nolitan. Really enjoyed it!! Modern design, very nice and clean. Everything is new and clean. Well equipt .Friendly stuff. Great restaurants nearby. Few minutes walk to the subway. We would be happy to come back :) Go for it!!!

We were delighted to arrive at the Nolitan last week. For us, it indeed lived up to the more glowing of the Trip Advisor reviews. It was "hip" yet relaxed, "industrial chic" yet warm & welcoming. The friendly & helpful staff, lovely rooftop views, the comfy bed, the great location (around the corner from lots of great eating choices in Little Italy) all made for a most enjoyable stay. We shall return!

My wife and I recently stayed here for 4 nights. The good experiences: very helpful and positive attitude staff, great daily happy hours, great location for SOHO and Nolita, and many restaurants in walking distance. The uncontrollable experiences: small rooms even though we took a 'larger' corner room and the noisy street below even though we were on the fifth floor. The bad experiences: poor layout, who ever had a toilet / water closet located not close to the sink !! The bathtub, which I would say takes up too much valuable space and is rarely used, forced the water closet to be located next to the front door and as far away as possible from the only sink. Electrical outlets are few and poorly located. Only 2 by the sink and none by the only table/ desk/ TV stand. Though it was included, the Internet service was vey weak and slow. Could use racks or hooks for towels that were located is various spots.

We arrived in NYC at 11pm and on our way in from EWR we got a call from the Nolitan staff telling us that we could not have the room we reserved that night because they had a guest who had gotten very sick and had to stay another night and they had no other rooms. But not to worry, they put us up at the Soho Grand in a lovely room and paid for it and told us that in the morning they would come get our luggage and move us over to the Nolitan. They did all that and when we arrived back at the hotel later that afternoon we found out that they had put us in a luxury suite with an amazing view and gave us the same rate we would have paid had we gotten the room we reserved. The staff was so incredibly nice and always had something nice to say every time we came through the door. Our suite was spotless and very comfortable. We will definitely stay there again!

We were really happy with our stay at the Nolitan - Staff were helpful throughout and the evening wine and cheese was a great touch! The hotel itself is very nice, our room was great and the common area downstairs was comfortable and somewhere we were happy to sit and have a drink.Our one disappointment was a restaurant booking that we made through the concierge service which the restaurant had no details of when we arrived - and admittedly this could be the fault of either the restaurant or the hotel, and we had a good night anyway so didn't bother looking into it any further. Apart from this, we had good customer service throughout our stay. The occasional treats that were delivered to the room every now and then were a really nice touch too!Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends both for the hotel itself and the location.
user_name:
chrisbT7700JU
New York City, New York

review_body: stayed for 3 nights therethe hotel is nice, the room was fine not big but with bath and showers, a modern onewe were at 3rd floor and there is a noise from the road, and the closes are is not that nice, you have to walk to soho in my opinionwould stay there next time if i am in this area

We really enjoyed our stay at The Nolitan. We felt tucked away from all the touristy junk, and more among people who actually live in NYC. Location is amazing, 2 blocks from Little Italy, SoHo, Chinatown, & subway transportation. We had a standard room, decor was great, coming from a clean freak- I was very pleased with the cleanlinessness of our room, and I enjoyed the aveda toiletries. Major props on the Windows, you can hear some street noise sure; but we cracked our window open a few times in the morning and was shocked at how much noise was cancelled after closing it. We didn't have a whole lot of interaction with staff, but they were very friendly and down to earth. View from the roof top is great! We were there during the super moon, one of the only two complaints I have is that the cushions were not on the patio furniture, we still sat on them to watch the eclipse, but it would have been nice...the other is the wifi speed (loved that it was complimentary) BUT it was painfully slow. We will tell everyone about The Nolitan, and for our future trips, we will return and look forward to it! Thank you for a great stay!

I had a reservation for 5 nights but only stayed one. I did not like the room, which was very very dark, and the wifi simply did not work. I really need a good connection for keep working when i travel and it was not possible. So I spoke to the manager and anticipated the check out. Everything was so fast that i can't say much about the hotel itself. The staff seemed attentive. The location is not exactly the best, but it is close to the heart of Soho.

We've stayed here on each of our last three visits to NYC. It's just perfect. Amazing location in the midst of the incredible Lower East Side, moments away from Soho, fifteen min walk to the Brooklyn Bridge, etc, etc. The hotel itself is superb. Incredible staff, so friendly and helpful. Rooms are NY-small, but beautiful and clean. Views from the roof terrace worth the visit on their own. I just love the place.

Really loved it, great location. Very helpful staff, super breakfast options if you have inclusive brekkie. Loved the Happy Hour freebie drinks and nibbles. Would defo stay again!!Rooms were cozy, well appointed and had everything. Nice balcony. Has an urban, cool feel to it.

Stayed a full week to celebrate our bday with my husband (35 and 40). Amazing location as in the heart of Nolita and at the cross roads of cool places - away from the too commercial Soho. Decoration is very nice, modern. Love the bike service - we did most of Manhattan with their vintage good looking bikes :)Rooftop amazing view. A bit sad that there is nothing else than couple of chairs up there. Weather was great and wld have been nice to have cushions and a bit of decoration up there - for a 500e bedroom per night wld be nice to have a bit "more". But big disappointment was with the staff. They just seemed to not care at all. Doormen were friendly but front desk - a joke.... That's really sad because service - as always - make most of your stay....

Ok so I found it slightly strange that the shower had a glass wall, and the only privacy was a curtain that could be opened from the outside of the shower cubicle. But it was a double room....Hotel is pleasant and the pancakes for breakfast are an American classic.

My friend and I stayed at The Nolitian for 5 nights in August and we absolutely loved it! A lot of consideration went into planning the NYC leg of our trip, the big decisions were choosing the right neighbourhood and whether to stay in a hotel or rent an apartment. We couldn't have chosen better! The hotel offered the ideal balance between the flexibility and local feeling from an apartment with the customer service and ease of a hotel.Firstly the neighbourhood is ideal, great local atmosphere, plenty of reasonably priced bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. There are a few subway stations ideally located to get around the city, we mainly used Grand St to go uptown, Spring St coming back and Bowery to get to Brooklyn/Williamsberg. LES is within easy walking distance for even more bars, or a cheap taxi ride. Secondly the hotel. We had a tall order for the perfect accommodation in NYC, and The Nolitian delivered. The hotel is very stylish without feeling like a gimmick. We stayed in a balcony room which I believe is one of the smaller rooms, however the design ensured the space was where you need it. Two girls with loads of clothes and make up and we were fine. The only thing I could say is the full length mirror is directly outside the bathroom door which meant knocking on the door before coming out when one of us was getting ready. The roof deck! The roof deck was a welcome surprise. Spacious with panoramic views around the hotel. Fantastic views of midtown in one direction with famous buildings like Empire State and Chrysler, Williamsberg bridge to the right, and the financial district to the rear. The hotel have seating and tables on the roof, and you are free to take your own food and drink there, which if you are watching your budget is great. There were a few days we got so entirely lost in the city we didn't get back to the hotel until 9pm and didn't want to freshen up and head to a restaurant, instead we got take away pizza from a restaurant across the road and a 6 pack of beer and it was great! The staff, so friendly and couldn't do enough to be helpful. Great recommendations on restaurants and bars, handy tips about getting about town. They will print of subway times and stations with directions to get you to your destination quickly (although I highly recommend getting lost of the subway and seeing where it takes you!).Flexibility, we found the team at The Nolitian were flexible with what we needed from our stay. We pre-paid breakfast and were able to order breakfast (to our room at no extra cost) any time between 7am and 3pm. The food was delicious with a menu with enough options to have something different each day with some interesting dishes. We pigged out so much at breakfast we didn't eat much at lunch time most days. Monday-Saturday between 5-7pm the hotel services wine, cheese and nibbles in the lobby which is free for guests. It was lovely and sunny most days so when we were around for it we took our wine and nibbles to the roof deck, or if we were getting ready to head out up to the room. Really nice touch. Although we didn't take advantage, the hotel also has bikes, skateboards, games consoles, laptops etc for hire free of charge. I highly recommend The Nolitian to anyone, and If I'm back to NYC I'll be back for sure!

Stayed as a couple for a 5 day trip to NY. The hotel amazing. We had upgraded to a suite to ensure that we had enough room during our stay - it was all we had hoped for, and well worth the money. The location, while not the traditional touristy area (thank god) was still convenient to get to everything we needed to. There are shops nearby, and lots of amazing places to eat. The hotel itself did not do room service, but they will arrange take out for you (we did this for breakfast a few times). The staff are friendly and could not do enough to help - and the rooms were impeccably cleaned.

We had a one night stay at the Nolitan Hotel. This was our second time there, because we had to go back since we loved the first stay so much. Everything about the hotel is wonderful. Friendly staff, great rooms, excellent location. All this added up to a wonderful stay which we would highly recommend!!

Great food/resteraunt, nice staff, beautifully well priced room, very accommodating and trendy! A must visit whenever in lover Manhattan! The availability to use bikes and longboards is a great inclusion and a very nice addition! Book while you can!

My friend and I spent one night in NY and stayed at the Nolitan. From the moment we walked into the hotel we were very impressed. Its a modern, very hip lobby with artistic decor throughout. The front desk staff was so friendly and the bellman "Sheldon" was outstanding! He smiled all the time and was very helpful with directions and suggestions in NYC. The rooms are small but the amenities were abundant. We loved the wine social hour with appetizers at 5 pm and the rooftop setting. We were one block from Little Italy with great restaurants. We have now found our "new" home in NYC. Easy to walk in the neighborhood & many spots for dining and shopping! Thank you Nolitan you exceeded our expectations!!!!

I am always looking for nice boutique hotels when visiting my daughter or bringing her back to start a new year at NYU. Nolitan did not disappoint!!! What a quaint atmosphere. The staff was always welcoming and kind. The lobby is set up in a way that makes it hard to walk past and not plop down to just have a relaxing moment. Everything about this hotel is perfection. The ONLY thing I can say that we noticed that is an inconvenience is there are no major networks on the cable channels. No ABC, NBC, CBS, or FOX. But, being in NYC....we weren't there to watch television so that was minor. We will undoubtedly be back for another stay.

The Nolitan sits, as it's adroitly named, just north of Little Italy. Bridging into SoHo, it truly feels right at the very heart of one of NYC's liveliest neighborhoods. Not impressively tall, the Nolitan Hotel still boasts an absolutely stunning panoramic view of the cityscape atop its open and welcoming rooftop. From the Williamsburg Bridge to the Empire State, and yes, One World Trade Center, you really do see it all. Visit the rooftop at night to truly take it all in.The staff have mastered the art of professional familiarity, and don't hesitate when asked for assistance. The hospitality is clearly felt throughout, and it's this infectious humility that makes you feel right at home.The rooms are kept meticulously clean, and the sheets always feel crisp and fresh. Overall, I must admit my favorite addition to my personal room was the shower. It's adjustable shading, and minimalist glass panes, allowed for a relaxing and steamy shower. The Nolitan Hotel is a place I look forward to revisiting.
user_name:
Dakota L
White Plains, New York

review_body: Perfect views, amazing food, and fantastic staff. Located near some of the best restaurants and shopping NYC has to offer. The rooms are extremely comfortable. If you're like me, you appreciate a good shower and the Nolitan has a great one! The rooftop has perfect views of the Empire State Building and the Freedom tower, go out at night for the view of a lifetime.

My family and I decided to try something different this year and it turned out to be GREAT! We usually stay in more of the midtown area with too many people and too much traffic this time we decided to stay in Lower Manhattan which ended up being the best decision we made this summer. From the time you walk into the hotel you realized it was a different feel. The staff was so welcoming it was sort of surreal you would have thought we were returning guest. Stephanie the agent at the desk was very upbeat and helpful. She gave us a rundown of what the hotel provided for us and the main thing that stood out was the HAPPY HOUR. Complimentary Wine and Cheese was a Cherry on the top especially after a long day out with the kids just to unwind. During the happy hour we got to meet some other guest who let us know this is the only hotel they stay in when they come to New York City and we see why. During that time we also got to interact with the staff. Sheldon especially he was a breath of fresh air besides giving us different options on what we should do while we were in this part of the city, he provided us with a couple good laughs and made sure he kept the wine coming.Now to the Hotel Itself. It was a beautiful design From the sunken lounge in the lobby to the beautiful rooms. The rooms were not very big but what else do you expect in NYC. It was very clean and we had a balcony on the 8th floor which gave us an AMAZING view at night of manhattan. The wifi was complimentary and they also had complimentary video games and ipads for the kids and where im from that is instant daycare. Overall This was my best stay in New York City so far and the family and i look forward to staying here again

First of all, because this is NYC we re talking about, the location is perfect to explore Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy. The neighborhood is vibrating and full of life with many nice cafes and bars in a walking distance. We chose different hotels in two different locations in the city during our stay. THe Nolitan was cosier, friendlier and more personable. During our stay we had an emergency medical situation and the staff was amazing trying to help us figure things out (thanks everyone!). THe hotel has high end design in both the lobby and the rooms. We had a corner suite, perfect for a couple, great amenities, beautiful light. Every afternoon you can enjoy complimentary wine and cheese in the lobby but you can also take your coffee upstairs where there is a nice terrace (smokers you can actually smoke sitting there) with great views to the city. Room service is also very good with many options around the clock delivered from selected restaurants near by. While there make sure to stroll around the corner and have traditional italian pastry and coffee at Ferrara's pastry shop.

We have just returned from 5 nights staying here. The Nolitan is a boutique hotel in a fabulous location, on the border of Soho, Little Italy and Bowery. Fantastic restaurants, bars, cafes and interesting shops are all within walking distance. The hotel itself is lovely, with friendly and very helpful staff. There is a bar/restaurant attached to it, although we didn't eat there. Every day at 5pm-7pm, there is free wine with cheese and biscuits in the lovely reception area - a nice touch. There is also a communal roof garden with great views of the city. Our room was very clean with modern facilities and lots of nice extras. It was not huge, but this is NYC! We also had a balcony, which from the 8th floor we had a great view. There are also bikes and skateboards to borrow and gym passes for a local 24 hour gym. The subway is very close by, but you can walk everywhere from here. Financially, you pay a little more, but I feel it is worth it. Highly recommend.

I stayed at the Nolitan couple weeks ago and I felt in love with it. Its location is just perfect - in the middle of Soho & Little Italy with great little shops and restaurants very close by.The room was very modern, very clean and with amazing views of the city.The staff was very friendly and attentive. The food at their resturant Cantine Parisienne was delicious - I tried them for both lunch and breakfast - in fact, the french toast at breakfast was so impressive, I had to take a picture of it. The taste matched its presentation.The Nolitan became my new go to hotel in NYC! Can't wait to go back!

I've just stayed here for 5 nights. I'm in NYC for a few weeks and staying at different hotels to mix it up a bit. The Nolitan was a great experience. Smaller and quieter than some of the bigger hotels I've stayed in and that was welcome. The staff I spoke to were very friendly. Sometimes when I walked into reception I did feel a couple of the staff on reception could have been more attentive and perhaps looked up and said hello when I walked in. This happened on a couple of occasions and the girls I refer to weren't busy on the phone or with other customers- so I think that could be improved on. Just basis manners- but that was only applicable to a couple of people. It was outweighed by the friendliness of most of the staff. The room was a decent size. The balcony was great. It looked out onto Kenmare street and was great for people watching. It was clean and contemporary and the bed was very comfy. Loved the turn down service and the little chocolates left on my bed! The view was incredible. From my pillow I was looking at the Empire State!The roof terrace was stunning. Amazing views. Could see the whole of manhattan and the Williamsburg and Brooklyn bridges. It could have benefited from having a few sunloungers. There was some furniture up there but it wasn't the comfiest- but that's me being super picky!I love roof terraces so for me this was a huge bonus. The location is great. One street away is little Italy. And Chinatown. Soho is a couple or minutes away too. Lots of subways nearby. Some great eateries on kenmare/Elizabeth street/Mulberry/Mott. Loads of cool quirky places. Rice to Riches- the amazing flavoured rice pudding bar is on the next street! Omg! The Butchers Daughter across the road is wonderful. I have no complaints about this hotel. It really is excellent and somewhere I will be returning to.

This boutique hotel has it all; friendly, sophisticated staff, well-appointed modern rooms with fabulous Northern views of NYC's iconic midtown cityscape. The bed, sheets and pillows were luxurious with a spacious shower and great layout of our room. The interior architecture is composed of exposed concrete, glass and natural woods which gave the room a sun filled warm, laid back and comfortable effect, though out the day. Great neighborhood with trendy bars and restaurants and talk about location! Little Italy, Chinatown, the Bowery, Soho and the Village within short walking distances. This is the best part of the city for me and one feel's (or can pretend) to be a local in this unique, swanky upbeat and relaxed locale off of Kenmare street.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel, and what a treat it was! The room was great, such a cool, modern vibe. Having hardwood floors really makes a difference, now it is an item I carefully check for when picking a hotel! Thank you Nolitan for elevating my standards :) You can see and feel how clean a room is. The attention to detail was felt from the moment we walked in, great lobby area with a cool sunken library, attentive staff that offered us a drink as we happened to check in during complimentary wine and cheese. The hotel is located in a great neighborhood, in the middle of Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown. It was not hard to find amazing restaurants and unique shopping boutiques nearby. Also the hotel's restaurant was a big plus, the breakfast was amazing...I recommend the french toast. YUMM!Overall a great experience, can't wait to go back!
user_name:
Cristina M
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: Very modern, very cool place. Staff was very helpful and attentive. Rooms are small, but have very efficient layout. Very convenient location for exploring shopping and dining in SOHO, West Village, NoLita, many wonderful options for both. Look forward to returning.

Stayed at the Nolitan for 3 nights with my teen daughter and very much enjoyed the hotel. The design is very modern, with a lot of thoughtful details and quirky style. Overall, it was really comfortable, and despite being on a busy street in NYC, it was relatively quiet. The rooms are small, it's NYC for crying out loud, they all are! But they have everything you need, thoughtfully laid out, and they are impeccably clean. The furniture is ecclectic and it took me the entire three days to notice that the drawers (there wasn't a formal dresser) were in the bed base. Oh well, we lived out of the suitcase and survived it. The closet is small and has a small refrigerator that is stocked with the usual (and usual) overpriced mini-bar stuff. The OJ was welcome on a hot desperate day. In the late afternoons though, the lobby hosts a nice wine, cheese and fruit time which was a nice surprise. There's also a roof deck which was too hot during the day when we visited but I'm sure is nice in the evenings. The staff was universally nice and helpful as well. Honestly, couldn't find a thing to complain about except the pillows, which if we'd asked to have changed out for firmer/fluffier ones, I'm sure would have been accommodated. Oh and perhaps the wifi which, although free (thank you!) was sometimes intermittent and annoying. By the way, attached to the lobby is also a really nice cafe where we had a good breakfast and there are other restaurant options in the neighborhood as well.

The Nolitan is situated in a neighbourhood of trendy boutiques, shops and restaurants just off Broadway. But despite its urban location, it immediately feels calm and relaxed upon arrival. The sunken lobby has the feel of an upmarket study with leather sofas, arch lights and bookcases but doesn't feel like its trying too hard. Between 5-8pm it becomes a quiet venue for complimentary wine and cheese evenings. Staff are polite and friendly without being overbearing while the rooms are clean, cool and comfortably furnished with modern but understated furniture. Mini bar appeared well stocked while there were other neat touches like branded yoga mats and t-shirts as well as free wifi. My very brief visit to the restaurant had a speedy and polite service with well presented and tasty food.As it was summer, the rooftop terrace proved something of an oasis from the bustle of the stifling heat with great views across the city. I understand there are plans to introduce a bar here which would be an excellent addition. Some reviews have mentioned traffic noise; I was situated close to the road on the second floor but heard nothing both nights.There is currently no room service while the new in house restaurant finds its feet and there are no in-room coffee/tea making facilities but given its proximity to the wide choice of local amenities, these are tiny gripes.A great place to stay if you're looking for a taste of everything New York has to offer.

Situated in a quieter part of town, the Nolitan is in an ideal location for a traveler who likes to live it up during the day. If you're looking for a lively nightlight scene you'll probably have to take a cab to another part of town; but if you're looking for a good place to stay as you soak up NYC culture and sip some mimosas over brunch, this is the right location for you. The staff was very friendly and the hotel even offers mid-day wine and snacks for patrons free of charge. The decor is fitting for the area and adds to the NYC vibe during your stay. The room was spotless and the room fixtures functioned properly. I'd suggest getting a room with a balcony or a corner room on a higher floor. The basic rooms can be a bit tight so coughing up an extra $50-$60 for the space is worth it. The hotel also has a fantastic rooftop with uninterrupted views of the Williamsburg Bridg, the Empire State Building and downtown Manhattan. Although it's not used to it's full potential, and can appear a bit bland at first, the rooftop is what you make of it and friends of guests are welcomed. Unfortunately, the restaurant and bar were not open during my stay. I would have preferred that the hotel disclosed this to you prior to your arrival, especially if I were a patron who liked to sleep, eat and drink all in the same location; but it wasn't that big of an issue. If you're in town for a weekend in summer, I'd suggest arriving early on a Saturday to take advantage of the hotel's day-time offerings. Familiarize yourself with the neighborhood a bit and pick out some spots which appeal to you so that you can make some reservations before the dinner/brunch rush. I look forward to going back once they've made some updates to the rooftop and re-open the restaurant/bar. Overall, 8.5/10.
user_name:
scap2015
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Nolitan back in 2014 and we immediately fell in love with the place. Having previously stayed in the Novotel Times Square the Nolitan and surrounding area was a welcome break from $15 beers and 'hey guy do you like stand up comedy'. We loved it so much we booked again for our last stay, the 3rd to the 10th of July. On the 4th of July we got engaged on the rooftop at night waiting for the Macy's fireworks I couldn't have picked a better place. Each night the hotel does 'wine and nibbles' Where they lay on cheese, wines and biscuits in the comfortable, spacious and very well decorated lobby. All in the price of your room stay. The hotel rooftop offers great views all around, with plenty of seating. The rooftop is a great place to chill out and just sit staring into the city and just watching the world go by. I took my coffee and a cigarette there around 7am most mornings and felt complete nirvana at the surroundings, even with the infamous New York car horns it is a different kind of peace. The room itself was well decorated, clean and tidy and perfectly laid out. The bed was great and the shower was powerful which is a must for me wherever I stay. Basically I cannot rate the hotel high enough, and I cannot wait to get back. The months leading up to our return dragged as I was so excited and eager to get back! Finally, i have saved the best part of the hotel until last, the staff. Firstly let me say there was not one member of staff that I didn't like, they were all great that's unquestionable, the girls on the desk were cool and the staff around the hotel in general were friendly, however I cannot leave a review without noting certain staff. A good hotel cannot be great like the nolitan with poor staff, it just won't work. Whilst they were all great some stood out;Leo - the housekeeping manager, every day we would see him in the hotel with his clipboard marking off his list of rooms, everyday we were fortunate to meet one of the most friendly and happy guys you could wish to meet. There was never a time when he didn't have a smile and a few words to say. Sheldon - the first time Iv met sheldon as I don't think he was here when we stayed last year, great guy and funny too. Real funny. Hailed us a cab when we were leaving and the guy was almost in little Italy trying to pull us one down! Had a laugh talking to him about his college tutor too. Ameen - We were checked into the hotel by ameen, another friendly and pleasant guy who we spoke to over our stay about general things, was an interesting guy and really enjoyed talking to him. Gene - Gene im pretty sure was here when we stayed last year, however this time we got talking to him a lot more and he is one of the friendliest and funniest lads you could meet. Professional as he's at his place of work but down to earth too, real great guy all round. I hope the management know too that they've got a great guy in Gene. Lastly, Gustavo. - I cannot put into words what an absolute credit Gustavo is to the nolitan hotel, I'm sure they do but I hope the management know that all the staff they have are great, but Gus is on the next level. Iv seen him deal with things in a cool calm way whenever a hotel guest has asked him for help, even at midnight he was ringing up a takeout Id ordered from hurrying them up as they'd taken ages! Last time we stayed we got talking to him when we were going out or coming back to the hotel and he was friendly and funny, this time it was like seeing an old friend. We share a keen interest in the greatest football team in the world, Manchester United. I'm fortunate that staying at the Nolitan enabled me and my partner to meet Gus and i now class him as a friend. So yeah, Iv kind of got carried away, stay at the hotel and you will see why I have. You will not regret it.Thanks Nolitan staff, you've all managed to make a great vacation even better and I wish you all the best in your careers wherever they take you and hope to see you all again soon!

Spent a luxurious night in the Nolitan hotel in order to catch an early international flight. The staff, especially Gus, greeted me with warm friendly smiles and were very helpful. I felt at home right away. The coffee and the wake up call I requested were just the thing to get me out of the very heavenly bed and on my way to the airport!!!!
user_name:
dre799
New York City, New York

review_body: Not withstanding the view of industrial buildings, once you are in the lobby, it feels like an oasis with its sunken living room and comfortable chairs. I would describe it as industrial chic. I happen to arrive when the cheese/cracker/fruit/wine tray was brought out. A surprise in the room was the glass shower in the room so I could look at the midtown and uptown Manhattan skyline (Empire State Building and Chrysler Building). It doesn't bother me but I could see how others might not like it. The best surprise was the small balcony with the bench. The glass border of the terrace made it feel more expansive than it actually was. The Hotel is well located... easy and quick walk to NoLITA, Chinatown, and Lower East Side. Go to the Egg Shop around the corner for breakfast. Catch the sunset on the roof! There's a panoramic view. Such a cute and awesome Hotel.
user_name:
ClaireLight888
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent the weekend in the city and stayed here again. No complaints. Will come back again for sure! Got a room with a balcony this time. Love the sips & savories hour.Took our complimentary wine to the rooftop and enjoyed the beautiful view. Can't wait for my next stay!
user_name:
Douliketotravel
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent the weekend at the Nolitan and had a wonderful time. The staff was very attentive and the room was super clean. The bed was super comfy! Loved the complimentary wine and cheese!The location is amazing, so many great places to go to. Definitely recommend.

Small, unpretentious and everything you'd want in a mid-priced boutique hotel in a great location. Within walking distance of Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy and terrific restaurants. Didn't try the in-house restaurant so can't comment, but front desk staff was helpful and very friendly.

I used to live in NY, so when I come back to visit, I want a neighborhood that isn't touristy, that makes me feel like I'm a NYer again! The location of the Nolitan was perfect for that. You're so close to great neighborhoods, shopping and subway stops. I went to black seed bagel and the butcher's daughter, two great places to eat that I could literally see across the street from my window (we were facing kenmare).
user_name:
acp_traveller
New York City, New York

review_body: If you want to stay downtown NYC, this is a great choice. The price is on the cheap side for the location. We stayed in room 202, a corner king suite. We requested to stay on a high floor when we made the reservation, but they can't honor requests. We had our hearts set on a view and being as far away from street noise as possible. They tell you they can "take them into consideration" but it's apparent that is a company line and their policy is strictly first come first serve. The second floor ended up being nice because you can get up the stairs quickly without waiting for the elevator and the walls + curtains are thick enough to make the view quiet. The view was still nice, even if not as high as we would have liked. The bathtub is beautiful and can fit two people easily. The shower was poorly designed and impossible to turn on without getting wet. The towels are also weirdly small. If you're taller than 5 foot and weigh more than 100 pounds, it will barely cover your body. The room had two robes, which were nice. The room was big by New York standards, but most people would find it small, but having lived in the city it seemed pretty generously sized. He pictures are deceiving, the floor-to-ceiling windows just span the corner of the room, but the longer of the walls is mostly wall with the window at the end. Curtains are great and block out most light but do not black out the room. The bed was comfortable and soft, the linens were great. The radio didn't have an aux cable for your iPhone. We didn't use the TV at all. They have a wine hour with free wine in cheese in the afternoon. Room service is delivery from a ton of choices from nearby restaurants. Which in New York, means a really diverse range of options. You can order breakfast from the restaurant downstairs on a card that you hang on your door any time between 5am. The food isn't mind blowing but it's good and some of it is organic. Wasn't impressed with the freshness of vegetables. Room cleaning seemed to keep weird hours. We left at 7am and when we came back at 2pm the room still wasn't cleaned. We had to call to have someone sent up later. Amenities are quirky and fun. They have valet, which is a plus. Complimentary bikes which are decent road bikes that are new and very cute. They have yoga available to guests at a gym nearby. The roof has a beautiful view, but weird and unfinished patio furniture. This ended up being nice because we brought our own wine up there and hung out. Check out time was the only real time they dropped the ball was check out time. Check out is noon, not 1pm like listed in the website. We asked for late checkout, which was 1:30. They called us twice in the morning to check out and we had to tell them we had late check out. Felt very rushed and unprofessional. Nearby recommendations- - The Farmers Daughter: great vegan/vegetarian food and fresh pressed juices. - Two Hands: best Australian coffee around the corner - Jack's Wife Frieda: great for brunch and dinner - La Esquina: great foodie Mexican. Mal a reservation and ask to sit downstairs aTLDR: good tub, weird shower, weird cleaning hours, decent food, unreal price/location, good design, complimentary bikes, complimentary wine hour, yoga, comfortable bed, clean, good unfinished rooftop, beware of checkout time.
user_name:
Gia V
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Made a confirmed reservation over the phone with the hotel. Was quoted a rate for two nights. When I called back a week later to confirm, I was told that the rate "was variable" and that the room would cost $100 more per night! Needless to say, I canceled the reservation.

The hotel is pleasant and clean and the staff is very nice but it is WAY overpriced. Also, the Nolitan makes a point of indicating that they are conservation minded, yet in the middle of summer they only offer goose down blankets forcing their guests to keep the air conditioning on at polar temperatures in order to sleep. I usually stay in The Soho Grand, where I receive a room twice the size with more amenities and at a lower cost!

We couldn't have asked for anything more from our stay at the Nolitan. It offers a more personalized, downtown feel than any chain or Midtown hotel, and we found the staff to be warm and accommodating. They even emailed us in advance of our stay, asking if we had any special requests and provided us with a coffee maker as requested. Their personalized chocolates, stationery, slippers, robes and handwritten notes with the next day's forecast were a nice touch. The rooms are small, but super clean, thoughtfully planned out and modern without being too cold. We went to a concert at Terminal 5 located in Hell's Kitchen and walked through a lot of neighborhoods in NYC, but we found the Nolitan's location the best by far. It's walking distance to the high end shopping of Soho as well as LIttle Italy and Chinatown. We appreciate all of the smaller shops and boutiques as well. And there are a number of excellent coffee shops, brunch spots and restaurants that were always filled, even when we got in past midnight. Overall, a comfortable stay in an awesome neighborhood.

A cut above most hotels in the area, choose a corner room as high up as you can, floors 6, 7 or 8. The place is very clean and well attended too by staff. Some rooms recently redone in the last few months, great soaking tub. The lobby is clean happy hour has wine and champagne. The view from the rooftop lounge superb, Bring your drinks or smokable's with you no other services on the roof. All in all a fantastic little hotel worth choosing if the area is to your liking. We will come back here again.

A lot to like about this place: location, design, staff. Few problems though: aircon is very poor, lifts broke down (twice), corner rooms (which I paid extra for) don't have operable windows or doors, and it's pretty noisy, particularly on low-mid level floors. But the real problem is the cafe/restaurant and breakfast. To make these sorts of hotels really work, this element must be spot on, and it's actually diabolical. I gave them a couple of goes and it's just not good enough. Will I go back? Yep.

I was pleasently surprised with the overall quality. Location is perfect to walk everywhere or take metro. Rooms were very clean and tidy with a fantastic bed. Staff were very helpful and curtious. The bar /restaurant was a nice surprise for the nights we were to tired to go out. The only thing that needs improving is more closet space in the rooms and better wifi reception. Next time I am in NYC I will deffinately stay again.

This hotel was perfect, such a different experience from the midtown headache. The location was impeccable such great food and great shopping in walking distance. We were 2 blocks away from Little Italy and about a 10 minute walk from Soho, a girl couldn't ask for me. The lobby was by far the best place while we were there they always had good music playing and from 5pm-7pm everyday they serve an assortment of wines and cheese i was in heaven. The staff was outstanding Sheldon and Harley kept the wine coming and Stephanie gave my husband and i numerous good places to go eat to cap the night off. Housekeeping kept the rooms very clean and did it in a timely fashion everyday. I absolutely loved this place and can't wait to stay there again. I would recommend this Hotel to all my friends.

We stayed at the Nolitan in July 2014 on our first trip to New York City. What a great choice - the hotel was funky and the staff really friendly and helpful. Rooms were not super big, but well fitted out and really comfortable. Free drinks and snacks for 'happy hour' in the lobby and a lovely rooftop area added to the features of this hotel. Wifi was sometimes a bit undependable in our room, but better in the lobby.Fabulous location near to lots of great cafes, bars, little back streets with interesting shops to explore and browse - and of course Little Italy around the corner. Easy to walk or subway to other areas of Manhattan Island as well as over the bridge to Brooklyn. We would definitely recommend the Nolitan and will stay again on our next trip to NYC.

A lovely looking hotel on the surface, but a lot of work to be done. The air con is like a jet engine, wakes you up co scantly through the night. The staff were friendly in arrival and departure. But didn't give us the time of day for the 6 days in between, arrogant and aloof.The guy in the restaurant, a poor Ice Cube lookalike, was the worst. Slammed our coffees down and didn't look like he wanted to be there. So hasten to add that was the last time we went there.Great location but a shame about the rest of it.

Hotel is in a great location for downtown adventure. Very friendly staff.Valerie Corllo was so helpful and I enjoyed talking to her about old East Village. Everyone so nice. Gustavo and Jose also so friendly. Great mixologist at the bar. Great views. I will be back!!
