My husband and I stayed at the Nolitan in August but have been recommending it ever since. The rooms are small, but this is NY, so the room is comparable in size to other NYC hotels. The hotel and the rooms were clean with very nice shower and bath products.It was a stylish boutique hotel with a young, hip, front desk staff. They were competent and pleasant. Wine and cheese hour is a nice touch and we took our wine to the roof top seating to get a better view of the city.

I love this place. We have found the hotel to keep coming back to. Price is terrific and you get a nice (small but not for NYC standards) room with all the amenities and much more. The hotel has bikes, has happy hour of fruits,cheeses, olives, jams and crackers and yes, WINE! Pinot Noir Chardonnay and champagne, served everyday for guests from 5-7! Gotta love that! Wifi is free and so is breakfast! The room may be small, but it has everything you could want, though we did bring our own toiletries and I suggest you do the same (in case you hoped they would provide). It is a shower, not a bathtub. This hotel is priced very well and it is a great location close to SOHO and little Italy. I love it, the best part is the service. The hotel staff is amazing, and always with a wonderful smile! They serve a very yummy breakfast (included) and I have to say, the poached egg breakfast was huge! I love it, can't say enough for the service. Just remarkable. Do not pass this one up. Best for couples, or adults that don't need all the kid amenities though. I am actually still here! I love it enough to write this before we leave (after 10 day stay)!!!!!

I decided to stay at the Nolitan Hotel for my birthday and it was perfect! The hotel had a nice relaxed vibe to it and the location was great. The rooms are very chic and clean which is a major plus for me! The staff on duty( James,Jean,Osei,Stephanie and Sheldon) were very accommodating. They were very friendly and went above and beyond to make my birthday a special one! I highly recommend staying there, you won't regret it!

An amazing hotel in the most perfect location. Great spot if you are looking to explore downtown NYC (for me the best part of NY) but also very close to the subway. Numerous restaurants and bars near by. The staff were super helpful. The hotel has a relaxed, chilled vibe. I can't wait to go back!

After staying in SoHo for years I decided to try a new area. The Nolitan is where I have been staying for my last 5 visits to NY. Great Hotel, Great Area! Love everything about this place. The Lower East Side is what SoHo was 10 years ago.

When travelling to NYC, there are many options to stay in many areas of this great city. But if you want to remove yourself from the tourist mob and get the vibe of a New York neighborhood, this is the place to stay!The Nolitan Hotel is located in one of the best areas of NYC. You could easily spend a week exploring the surroundings on foot without having to go anywhere else. But if you choose to explore elsewhere, a subway station is a short distance away. Many great bars and restaurants await you within walking distance as well as incredible shopping. I highly recommend PUBLIC restaurant for a sunday brunch.The Hotel was quite nice and provides you with an intimate feel that you wouldn't get at a larger chain-type hotel. We stayed in the Nolitan Suite which was incredible with views of the Empire State Bldg and WIlliamsburg Bridge. Others have complained of noise but our room was completely quiet. The staff were also amazing with great recommendations on things to do. Really no reason to stay anywhere else. For what you pay, this hotel is a great value. I highly recommend this place.

this hotel is located in a trendy alternative area. to walking distance you could reach excellent options for food and shopping. I am use to take the metro in ny, but being in this area, during four days I only took it twice!. when you receive an email asking for your preferences about pillows, foods, and others things a day before to check in, your expectations normally rises, but you will note that this expectation are limited to your imagination or are only a result of an automated system. they gave me a room in a second floor. i couldn't open the windows because the people on the streets seems to be inside the room. Also the noises were ugly, during weekend you will not be able to sleep well. the room is nice, the bed also, a modern design with bathroom integrated to the room. i recommend the hotel only if they could assure me a highest floor.

Right next to Bowery subway stn and spitting distance to several others and the end of the Williamsburg bridge, this is a great base for a stay in NYC.Rooms are a good size (numbers 1&2 on each floor seem biggest of the regular rooms and in a weird/brilliant touch you can look out the window as you shower!).Turn down service and weather reports a really nice touch.Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby including the superb Bonnie Vee.

My husband and I stayed at The Nolitan for a couple of nights and we loved it!Here are all of my favorite things about the hotel:1) It is pet friendly! Our dog Leo was welcomed at check in with doggy treats and all the staff members were so friendly to him.2) They have complimentary wine and snacks available daily from 5PM to 7PM for the hotel guests which is great, you can have a glass of wine before you head out to dinner.3) The housekeeping and Guest Services were on point at all times, I called a couple of times for extra towels and shower gels, within 5 minutes someone was at the door with everything I asked for.4) They have a rooftop you can go to, the views of the city are beautiful and it is so perfect for photos!5) The location is just so central, located in Nolita (which I think is one of the cutest neighborhood in Manhattan) but also within minutes from Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, the Lower East Side and East village. 6) On the main floor of the hotel, there is a restaurant called "La Cantine Parisienne", I highly recommend eating lunch or dinner there, they serve delicious French food in a chic bistro setting and I was very impressed with their wine list.7) Some of the bedrooms have balconies overlooking Kenmare street which is really great, I would recommend booking a room with a balcony if available.If you are looking to stay downtown and be in a hip hotel but still feel at home I highly recommend staying at The Nolitan, you will have a memorable stay in NYC!

We stayed at the Nolitan for seven nights and it was everything we had hoped for and a little more. The front desk staff were extremely helpful (a complimentary bottle of wine on arrival was a nice touch). The room was cleaned daily (and on some occasions twice per day), my partner was a little unwell when we first arrived and the staff made sure that we had everything we required. The rooms aren't huge but compared to previous hotels I have stayed in in NYC they were of a similar size, as previously mentioned the rooms were exceptionally clean and the space was used well. The free Wi-Fi (which is not standard in all hotels) was completely reliable.The main attraction of the hotel when booking was its location, it is minutes from subways at Bowery, Spring Street and Prince Street and although we walked for miles we also used the subway lots. We didn't eat in the restaurant hotel, local recommendations would be the Egg Shop (just around the corner), Grey dog and Rice to Riches.I would definitely stay at the Nolitan again and would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends.

very good location in Nolita, very very clean, modern, urban, lot of facilities and an incredible staff! always perfect! always ready! always the best!!!!!! getting citybikenyc you can get everywhere in 15 minutes and discover NYC as your own town!!!Go to NYC and come to Nolitan Hotel!!!!!!!

We spent six days here and it was everything we needed and the best place to stay. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The room is super contemporary and very clean. It was also very comfortable. The neighborhood was really great!!!

I normally stay at Holton properties but someone else picked the hotel for this trip... So glad they did as I would have never looked at this place. The hotel was perfect in every way... The room was very clean, nice sized and very comfortable. The room was nicely laid out and appointed. Internet was easy and free. They had everything I needed in a hotel and the staff were very friendly and supportive..cant say enough about the friendly staff. The only issue was parking as they do not have a loading zone. . However, the hotel staff are ready for helping with this too... Just call in advance and a valet will come out front, help you get your bags out to a bellman and the valet will take your car to the garage.... Very nice. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and recommend it highly if you are in this neighborhood.

When I am in NYC I usually stay at the Bowery Hotel but thought I'd give the Nolitan a try. This boutique hotel has so much to offer. Great location, great shops, great restaurants all within walking distance. The rates are very reasonable and the staff is always willing to help. A special thanks to James Dixon at the front desk who went out of his way to make me feel welcome. Will definitely stay again soon!

It's been over a year since I stayed at the Nolitan, and I have been meaning to write a review this whole time. I think subconsciously I have been putting it off as I haven't wanted anyone else to go there!! I travelled to the Nolitan in September 2013 with my fiance, my sister and her boyfriend. We are all in our late 20's/early 30's. We had stayed in Midtown on previous visits, but wanted to experience a more authentic New York lifestyle this time - away from the more touristy areas. We really like the idea of Chinatown/Little Italy and came across the Nolitan. We love boutique hotels, nice sized and personal, and we were happy to pay a bit extra for what looked like a perfect place. From the minute we arrived, we knew we were going to love it. The weather was fantastic and so we headed straight for the rooftop to enjoy a nice cold afternoon drink. The view from that rooftop is just stunning and instantly, it made the place feel like home. The hotel is conveniently located for the subway, and lots of little bars and restaurants that you wouldnt usually get to visit when staying in the more touristy areas. Staff - amazing, couldnt do enough to help you. The free drinks and nibbles at 6pm were a great touch. Rooms were really decent sized for a NY hotel - everything was beautifully designed, modern and just gorgeous basically! Lovely little touched in the room again - toiletries, slippers etc. The only thing to say is that the hotel is on a busy road and it could be noisy first thing in the morning; it didnt bother us really but if you are a light sleeper, earplugs could be useful. We didnt try the restaurant in the hotel but the bar was fab and was the perfect place for a pre-dinner drink. All in all, one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in - I still cant believe we just stubbled across it. Can't wait to go back. I wouldnt even think of staying anywere else in NYC now.

Usually I stay in the Meatpacking but wanted to try something new and also be closer to my class room. Hotel was a bit noisy from the 6th floor and they construction going on was a little distracting but that's New York. The bar wasn't very inspiring for a boutique hotel. With that being said it was a good location and there was certainly many other bars and food around. It felt like more neighborhood-like than other places which was nice. The rooms were cute and overall a good experience. I'd stay there again. The staff was very friendly.

I am a New Yorker who recently relocated to California, and this is - hands down - my favorite hotel experience in NYC to date. Fantastic (not touristy, i.e. This is where real New Yorkers are, one of the few remaining neighborhoods that still embodies what the City is really about) location, really reasonable rates for quality of the overall experience. Hip-but-functional and comfortable design. Genuine and accommodating staff. Will definitely be my new "go-to" hotel whenever in NYC. Only negative (and reason for four out of five stars) was the restaurant/bar. Didn't even try it because it was just an odd vibe. But there are plenty of other fab spots within a block or two, so not a deal-breaker in any way in terms of my future booking/s. If you want real downtown NYC, this is where you want to be; everywhere else has list its soul.

Just about very good. Our arrival was in the middle of a huge party upstairs which filled the foyer and we had to queue for 2mins to get inside the front door - not the best of welcomes. Love the fact that all the local restaurants are your room service. Top location and absolutely wonderful staff. I would give this hotel another go as I feel it could do a bit better in terms of receiving guests.

Ive stayed at the Nolitan twice now and I would have to say the service has gone downhill dramatically. Our first stay was early in the hotels existance and it was fantastic, service was great amenities really solid and an overall perfect stay. This time not so much, service was non existant and it felt like we were back up in midtown at a larger hotel rather than the great out of the way place we loved so much our first trip.The best part about the Noiltan is the area, fantastic close to little italy, SOHO and walking to everything

We stayed in the basic double bed room. Good size of the hotel. New so all the interior was in perfect condition. Lobby and the adjoining restaurant was very nice and cosy. Great welcoming from the check-in staff. Room was small but that is normal in NYC. Hotel had a roof-top tererace. Location is very conveniant located with subway stations Close by and many good restaurants. Walking to Soho shopping is 5 minutes. Would definitly stay there soon again. Got an excellent price, about 120 USD per night.

THE NOLITAN HOTEL is my new favorite!!! I love the look and the feel of the whole place.They have the best customer service. They e-mailed and called to see if I needed anything before my arrival.I loved the rooms: great use of space, modern design, comfortable beds, etc...I highly recommend this hotel! The location is great, and it's short walk to the subway.The staff was amazing: Bogdan (the GM), Valerie, Joy, Jean, Osei, James, Sheldon & Kim.They even made me coffee at 4 am the day I had to leave.I can't stop talking about how much I loved The Nolitan.

I have chosen this hotel for my first trip with my boyfriend, thanks to various web comments and it was as expected : very good welcome and service (I receive few mailing before my arrival so as to greet me as a "concierge" , the lamp in the bathroom was changed immediately with a very kind person explaining me few things on it with humour), chocolates and weather forecast delivered every night in our room...delicious breakfast in the hotel.The only point is that we missed a coffee/tea machine in a the room (especially in winter) and the dressing space was very very tiny (may I suggest to put the mini bar under the desk ?)And when leaving the hotel we asked for a taxi, the answer was that we can get one from the streets...But it was clean, smell good in the lift, people were smily and the hotel very well located to lil Italy...So great souvenirs there

Loved the room itself - very modern. Location is great for nearby restaurants, cafes and shopping. The service was also very good. Very glad that we opted for a pick-up from the airport after a very long haul flight.

I stayed 3 nights at The Nolitan on a business trip and I would definitely stay there again - mostly because of the location, the price (quite decent for a hotel of that category in Manhattan). The hotel is modern, simply but tastefully decorated. Again, the location is perfect :right in the middle of Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy. You'll find nice restaurants and boutiques at a walking distance. Rooms are not huge, but clean and comfy. A/C can be a little loud, but I got used to it. Staff is friendly and helpful. Do not miss the great view on the rooftop terrace !

Excellent staff, they were very accommodating - they helped make reservations and made great recommendations for restaurants. The room was not huge but very well appointed. I would recommend this hotel.

The Nolitan is now one of my favourite hotels - really amazing friendly staff - especially Valerie and James. They really made my valentines perfect. Breakfast is delicious. Rooms are well stocked with EVERYTHING you could need for your stay. The hair dryer is powerful. The dressing gowns are perfect fitting. I had a balcony room with a beautiful view. I enjoyed the cheeky see-through shower. Perfect location. I will 100% be back!

If you're looking to stay in a hotel that can provide you a true New York City experience - the Nolitan is where you need to book your next stay. As a boutique hotel, it knows how to cater to their guests - it is by far the best hospitality and care I've seen in a long time. (I spent many years as a consultant and have stayed in many hotels). The hotel is beautiful with a hip New York feel that is different that many other NYC hotels. It also has a beautiful rooftop! You're also in one of the best neighborhoods in New York, with Bowery, Soho, the Village, Noho, Nolita all right at your fingertips. The food at Cantine Parisenne is delicious, the bar is great, the service wonderful, the rooms are so hip and cool and the best is one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. We also hosted our organizations conference at the Nolitan hotel - with approximately 45 guests staying at the hotel. We've received so much praise about the hotel and the experience the hotel was able to provide to our guests. Thank you Nolitan for creating this wonderful space for us and our guests.
user_name:
Jennifer P
New York City, New York

review_body: Overall the hotel is great. The rooms are quiet, small and functional. I was excited that we had a view of the Chrysler building. We were always greeted warmly by the staff. The location is great if you want a more local experience. It is also close to the subway. Free Wifi but it is an open network. My husband and I had kind of a lot of luggage so the room was just too small. We were able to make it work but we always felt like we were moving luggage around to find things/move in the room.Our stop in NYC was the last of a mutli-city journey. Initially we booked only 2 nights of a 5 night trip. After 2 nights we decided the location was perfect so we would book the remaining 3 there. We booked using a 3rd party site. We went down to the front desk to inform them of the new reservation when someone else called to extend their stay. The front desk quoted them $50 more per night than we paid (nearly $200/night). We liked the hotel but it was really only worth the lower price.

Being a Metro area local it's easy to get used to the city. The same restaurants, the same museums, even the same shows. My wife and I will occasionally book a weekend in the city in hopes of finding something new. Our recent visit to the Nolitan did just that. It renewed our interest in exploring the ever changing and emerging neighborhoods of NYC each with it's own personality. Nolita definitely delivers. The neighborhood is just big enough to provide a weekend of enjoyment while still placing you conveniently next to everything NYC has to offer.Nolita is a great place to eat, shop, and explore and the Nolitan hotel is definitely the place to stay. My wife and I are ridiculous when critiquing places to stay. We have more than once talked ourselves out of a place because of one negative review thinking we'll be the 1 out of 1000 that gets a bad Piña Collada at the Ritz in Grand Cayman. We chose the Nolitan based on some friends who loved it and have to say we did too. Just walking in the door made you feel more hip. It was like hanging with the cool kids in school and it felt downright awesome. It's hip without feeling like a poser. You can sum it up with one word: "authentic." It's authentic NYC, authentically hip, has authentic style and makes you feel like part of a creative and exciting neighborhood within manhattan. In the words of Nacho Libre "let's get down to the nitty gritty." This hotel is number one clean. I like bright rooms and white bathrooms because you can't hide dirt and these rooms are bright and clean. The bedding was comfortable and the bathroom linens were plentiful. The bathrooms were well stocked which is important because who wants to call the front desk for extra TP (that would kill the hip-ness acquired when you walked in). While industrial chic the rooms were warm and inviting. We did not hear anyone above or around us and we know they were there after meeting them in the elevator. We had a corner view which is almost all windows allowing you to experience the city from the comforts of your room. However, there are privacy curtains so you don't have to share every moment of your life with the world. I did see some reviews about street noise but let's be frank, you're not staying on a farm in North Dakota. You're in NYC. The staff was polite and helpful although we really did not need them for much more than checking in and out. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel which was awesome. We had a chance to meet the chef/owner who was a pleasure and added to the feeling that you belonged. Overall I highly recommend this hotel. Whether you are visiting Nolita for a long weekend or looking for a convenient location in NYC for a long term stay I think you will quickly get comfortable at the Nolitan.
user_name:
mmsa
New York City, New York

review_body: We got lucky and stayed at the Nolitan during the Feat of Gennarro, so the streets were lined with canoli, pizza, pasta, italian ice, etc for blocks. Very festive, we enjoyed the festival and people-watching. The hotel was great; they were always friendly and responsive. Had a nice glass of wine at the bar downstairs, but didn't eat there. We found it extremely easy to get around the city from this location and would definitely recommend it. As people have said, the room is small, but it was comfortable, clean, etc. The views from the roof are amazing at night, be sure to go up there, and the wine and cheese hour was much appreciated too.

I'd love to make the Nolitan my home away from home in the city. The room was small, but really clean, modern, and comfy. I had a great view from my window and the bed was perfect. The people at the front desk were wonderful, and they treated me like a long, lost friend. They were professional and kind and efficient and thoughtful. I ate lunch in the hotel restaurant and it was delicious—split pea soup. The service was great.If you're looking for a clean, stylish, and comfy NYC hotel in a great location (SoHo), I highly recommend the Nolitan. It was a great surprise and made for a fantastic weekend.
user_name:
Deidra R
Lincoln, Nebraska, United States

review_body: My Wife and I stayed at the Nolitan In Early January and from the moment we walked in we were impressed. They have a very Trendy Lobby and at the time had a beautiful Hotel dog sitting at the check in desk. The Neighborhood was fantastic we felt like everything was in walking distance from shopping to sight seeing and food. That night Sheldon, Gustavo and Osay(pardon me if its spelled incorrectly) directed us to a bunch of great restaurants. We went to Cafe Habana where we possible had the best Cuban Sandwich ever. The Rooms In the Hotel were small but very nice and having the balcony was a nice touch. being on the 9th Floor we had a great view of uptown and at night the Empire State Building was beautiful. It was a very nice stay and my wife and i plan on staying there again.

We have stayed at Nolitan two times (Dec. 2013 and May 2014) over the last couple of years, and for both stays we had an amazing time! The hotel is well-situated and the decor is modern and stylish. The Nolitan also has a roof top where guests can enjoy a wonderful view of the city. But the most amazing thing with the hotel is the one of a kind service from Dylan and the other guys at the reception! They are all about service and making guests feel at home. We love this hotel, and we will definitely go back the next time we visit NYC :-)

Nice location, close to lots of trendy bars, restaurants and shops. Easy stroll to the subway.Very helpful front office staff, especially Joy. Neat and clean rooms, minimalist style and on the small side. Buzzy french restaurant downstairs, nice for breakfast.Two small gripes, one can't be helped by the hotel, on Kenmare St opposite the hotel is a fruit and vegetable distribution centre that only comes alive in the early hours of the morning. There is a lot of noisy activity from unloading of huge trucks. Second gripe, i reported a smoke alarm in the wardrobe that was making a loud clicking noise, it was very annoying, i reported it twice on 2 consequtive days but it was never repaired. These were minor problems that did not detract from our enjoyment of the hotel and i would certainly recommend it to anyone that wants to stay in an interesting neighbourhood

Arrived in at the Nolitan last night. First, I really enjoy the location. Perfect neighborhood. The decor of the lobby and adjoining bar/restaurant is very aesthetically pleasing. We were checked in by the front desk staff. All of the staff we encountered we very accommodating and friendly. Mine and my business partners rooms were directly across the hall from mine on the seventh floor. I really enjoyed the rooms because they are very modern and clean. The amenities in the room were great also, from the comfortable bed to the soaps and towels. Slept very well in the bed. The windows are massive in the rooms providing amazing views of New York and a lot of natural light in. In the morning we ate breakfast at the cafe where I had the best oatmeal I have ever had in my life. The Nolitan in my experience was first class with a great style to it. I will be returning.

Stayed here for the first time one night last week. I was so satisfied with my stay I have already booked same place for my next trip. Great location, beautiful modern style, exceptional service and overall an outstanding experience. Special thanks to Bogdan!

While visiting relatives in January 2015, we choose to stay at the Nolitan, which was near his residence. This is a beautiful, boutique hotel. Only 3 years old, the staff could not have been more friendly. Rooms are small, but comparable in size to hotel rooms in the area. My wife and I had no problem with the layout. Convenient to Little Italy & SOHO areas.We will stay there again.

I stayed here with a small group in September 14. I concur with others' remarks about mixed service. Some of the evening staff are brilliant. The day time staff are somewhat friendly, but like another said, robotic, in their attitude. I asked to be upgraded (at my cost) as i was not happy with my room (a small room facing the bridge) and had to ask every day if there was a possibility (no!). It would have been nice if they'd reached out to me at least once in the 8 day stay to let me know the status.As suggested, my room, while comfortable, was nowhere near as lovely and bright as my friends' who faced Manhattan and was sunny and light (same room category). Mine felt dim even though it was on the top floor.It feels petty, but i can't remember the number of times i had to call reception to ask them to refill my fridge of juice. It was odd..very odd, but they just couldn't do it!Also, i ordered pizza from their nearby restaurant service and it took nearly 2 HOURS to arrive!! It was stone cold. How funny when i walked out of the hotel the next morning to realise the restaurant they had to collect the pizza from was literally across the road. Again, countless calls to reception to find out where my pizza was! They were nice about it, but no action. I guess if i could sum up the service it feels somewhat friendly, but quite disingenuous.Other than that, the location is brilliant, the bed is super comfy, the lobby is lovely (and the happy hour is fab!). Would definitely stay again but implore the owners to look at their staffing..might just need a bit of retraining there.

My husband and I have been wanting to stay here for about a year - we finally did this past long holiday weekend.The Pros:The staff - VERY friendly, helpful and happy to speak with us. They went out of their way at times, to make sure we were happy and well taken care of.The lobby - great selection of books, very warm and comfortable. Good for sitting and people watching. We spent a lot of time looking at the various books, drinking wine and just enjoying the atmosphere.The room - LOVED it. Had a corner room, with a cool tub and great view. The bed was very comfortable. Sunday was bad weather-wise, so we stayed in the room a bit before we ventured out for our show, and dinner, and it was great. I really enjoyed it.The restaurant/bar - had a great cocktail while I was waiting for husband to find a parking space. We did not have the opportunity to eat in the restaurant but the happy hour was excellent. The neighborhood - well, not much bad you can say about the great location and the ease of getting around. There is plenty to walk too, see and do. It was a perfect location!The Cons:I debated if I should even mention anything negative about this property - but I do feel that people should know as much as possible about staying at a place. I have to say, if I had to think about anything negative about the room or hotel itself - it would have been the noise from the heating system. Every time it came on - it woke me up. It is REALLY loud. I don't think there is anything that can be done about it ... you need heat and frankly - as long as I was warm and comfortable, I did not mind too much. But it's LOUD. So much so, that when watching TV or having a conversation, you could not hear anything while it was on. It only stayed on for a short time, long enough to warm up the room and then it shut off, but I could not get used to it. Street noise is expected - and there was that into the night, but I did not mind that since I requested a corner room that is practically all glass. In summary:Overall - it was a bit more expensive than we usually like to spend, but for a nice get-away and a long weekend, it was worth it. I had a very good overall experience at this property, and I am VERY picky about where I stay. The hotel really met my hopes and expectations. I would definitely recommend it and would love to splurge and stay here again sometime.

Great stay at the Nolitan - we splashed out and it was worth it. Went here for a week between Christmas and new Year with my husband and two daughters (20s) for a 60th birthday treat. Customer service was particularly good - I was contacted personally in advance by the reservations manager (Joy) to make sure we had exactly the room we wanted, which was fantastic - ours was 9th floor corner with fabulous views to Williamsburg bridge and Empire State/Chrysler Building etc in each direction and they had arranged for our daughters to stay in the next door room. Joy also booked us into some great restaurants in advance as it was Christmas period and busy. The desk staff were relaxed, very friendly and welcoming, and couldn't do enough to help - one even went and bought me a New York Times for my Sunday breakfast. The rooms are very groovy 'industrial chic' and the bed was supremely comfy. Not huge, but the space is well thought out and wonderfully light with the floor to ceiling windows. The happy hour each evening was a treat, complimentary wine, cheese and biscuits and olives etc. A complimentary bottle of cava to each room on New Year's Eve was a nice touch. The hotel restaurant does good (slightly pricy but huge portions) breakfasts with good coffee. The location was absolutely perfect, within reach of all the funky untouristy downtown stuff in Nolita, boutiques, restaurants, Lower East Side Tenement Museum (a must) and the subway less than 5 mins walk. Perfect. My only very small quibble is that there was piped rock music in the lobby and bar area that was a bit invasive, and wasn't so relaxing at times for hanging out. The volume seemed to vary, though, as did the style. If music was essential (and it seems so these days) they could have had something a little more subtle, ambient and chilled out and in keeping with the alternative feel of the place, rather than mainstream rock (not everyone's taste). . But the rooms were completely quiet, with no neighbouring room noise or street noise at all. Great sleeps! Recommend the Nolitan wholeheartedly, and grab the 9th floor corner room for the sunrises if you can get it! Thank you Joy!

We've stayed here three times, and the experience just gets better! Outstanding location, spectacular service, great food; the corner rooms have beautiful sunrise views. Equal parts romantic, hip and practical - what more could you want?

We went to the Nolitan with friends for a one night stay in the city but we wish we could have stayed longer! The location of this boutique hotel is ideal for anyone wanting to experience the real NYC - away from all of the tourist-y areas near Times Square. Situated in the Nolita section of NYC, the neighborhood is what makes this hotel so special. It borders Soho, the Village, Chinatown, and Little Italy, so within an 8 or 10 block radius, you have countless areas to explore with trendy boutiques, great shopping, some of the best restaurants in the city, cafes, bars, you name it - you can find it within a very short walking distance. Some of the negative reviews I read mentioned the size of the rooms and the noise level at the hotel. The rooms are typical NYC-sized rooms, which tend to be on the small side, and you can't stay in the city without expecting some traffic noise, but the beds and linens are super comfortable and the rooms are very modern and industrial chic. There were also nice touches like the huge soaking tub, slippers and robes in the room, and umbrellas that you can use in rainy weather. We found the front desk service at the hotel to be very friendly and helpful, especially Valerie and Sheldon. The hotel offers complimentary wine and cheese in the evening and in nicer weather, you can enjoy this on the amazing rooftop balcony. Unfortunately, it was very cold while we were there, but in nicer weather, I could have stayed on the rooftop for hours! The views are unbelievable - the Empire State Building, Williamsburg Bridge, and the Freedom Tower - an amazing view from every angle! The on-site restaurant, Cantine Parisienne, was great for breakfast or a late night drink - the latte was to die for and everything that we tried was delicious - from the fluffy omelets to the delectable french toast and pastries. We enjoyed everything about this hotel and can't wait to go back!

We stayed there during the last weekend of December. What a gem! The team was amazing, rooms really stylish with a mix of industrial and modern design and the restaurant was also excellent. Valery, one of the managers I believe, helped us with every single detail of our stay. She was friendly, funny and always available to recommend things to do and places to eat. The location is also great being so close to soho, LES, and the village. This hotel will definitely be my hotel of choice for my next nyc visits.

The Nolitan is a great stylish hotel with a modern and yet comfortable appeal. Its location is hard to beat, close to the neighborhouds of SoHo, Nolita, Chinatown and Lttle Italy. There is so much great stuff to do, nice restaurants, pubs, boutiques, retail stores, etc., everything in walking distance. The subway is also just around the corner. We had a suite on the 8th floor which was super chic with a great view to the Empire State Building and Whitestone Bridge as well as a cool layout, the bathtub and shower being pretty much in the middle of the room. Definitely to be recommended!By the way, the breath-taking view can also be enjoyed from the rooftop. The restaurant is a big plus as well. We had a very tasteful and hearty breakfast in a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Everything was very clean. We absolutely enjoyed our stay here and will definitely come back again on our next NYC trip!

I loved the location and intimacy of this hotel. The hotel rooms were cosy and the bed really comfortable. The free wine and cheese in the evenings (other than Sunday) was a really nice touch, especially for a solo traveller. Nearby the hotel are great cafes and restaurants such as the Butcher's Daughter and La Esquina. I have stayed in mid town, the Meatpacking District, TriBeCa and Gramercy Park and this is my favourite neighbourhood so far. I would have given 5 stars but for some noisy neighbours who came banging on doors really late at night.

This is where I plan to stay in NY: great, trendy location; modern hotel; good value and service. Much nicer atmosphere than a theMore classic NY hotels. Fantastic restaurants around, and the nearby subway get you anywhere uptown. But who needs uptown?!

My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Nolitan. This boutique hotel offers so much. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The room was very trendy yet comfortable and quiet. Loved the slippers and bathrobe as well as the turndown service.As we headed out for the evening we were greeted to complimentary wine and cheese in the lobby, and a nice selection of wine I must say, even champagne! There was a nice crowd relaxing and enjoying this cool perk (I have really only seen this in European hotels). Great location, we found so much to do in this neighborhood. Many nice restaurants line the surrounding streets as well as cafés , specialty shops, and boutiques. Many larger stores are just a couple of blocks west on Broadway. Little Italy and Chinatown are directly south of the hotel as well. There is so much to do within walking distance but there are two different subway lines very close if you want to go outside the neighborhood. We also ate at the French restaurant in the lobby of the hotel which we found excellent. We were told the chef and the manager are both from France and it showed, the food was authentic and delicious.Really nice menu and reasonable prices too. We liked it so much we went back for breakfast. TIP- try the french toast with fresh fruit, it's to die for. We would recommend this hotel to others and look forward to staying here again in the future.

What a great place to stay in NYC. It was recommended by a friend for the location, great beds, and lovely staff and they weren't wrong! I would stay here again in a heartbeat. My boyfriend and I loved the neighborhood and all the little perks from the yoga mat provided in the room to the incredible views from the rooftop. It felt like a place you could call home. Amazingly quiet for NYC and just a great spot if you want to sample some of NYC's best restaurants (don't miss Cafe Habana) and shopping. The reception were warm and friendly and full of great suggestions - felt like you were staying with friends - nothing generic about it. It felt swish without being stuffy. I could have hung out in the cafe/lobby all day reading. Great place.

This was our second time at this hotel and we would certainly return. The staff are friendly and helpful and its location means you are close to several subway lines with easy access to shops and attractions. The hotel is on the edge of Chinatown and Little Italy so there are also great places to eat nearby. The hotel also offers complimentary wine and cheese to guests at happy hour which is a nice touch

My husband and I wanted to stay in the SoHo / Nolita area as we were visiting family living nearby. This was not our first visit to NYC and last time we had stayed at The Mondrian. I do feel we are past staying at a hotel that has a nightclub on the roof (Mondrian) but we enjoy a classy ambience with excellent service. The Nolitan exceeded our expectations on many levels. Our room, whilst on the small side was exceptionally well equipped with a stunning view of the Empire State Building and the Williamsburg Bridge. The room had all the luxuries one would expect from a top hotel, the bed was comfortable, we had a freestanding tub and a separate powder room. There was free WIFI in our room as well as in the charming lobby area where we would meet up with family each day. The restaurant and bar provided all necessary drinks and snacks but we also enjoyed the stunning array of dining establishments in the nearby area. The staff were friendly, efficient and charmingly helpful. I would recommend the Nolitan to anyone wanting a charming, luxury small hotel located in the heart of Downtown close to all the amazing restaurants and boutiques that area has to offer.

Nolitan was relaxed, friendly and helpful. One staff member went ahead and took my bags up to my room while I was checking in and two tag-teamed getting a taxi for me at 6 am on Saturday morning when it was looking bleak. The rooms are floor to ceiling windows with plenty of light aThe actual lighting was on rheostats and most (or all?) of the rooms haveterraces. Maybe not ideal for 3rd floor facing Kenmare, but it's a nice concept.

Great spot! Nolita is in a lovely little area...just east of crazy-busy Broadway and SoHo neighborhood. One block from great Italian and Asian restaurants. Excellent boutiques and shops up and down Spring and Prince streets. The rooms are typical small New York style. Are they five-star? No. But, I have stayed in other hotels in New York and I thought this was very clean and modern and worth a four-star rating. During our last visit, we stayed in Chelsea. Yes, we could walk easily to the subway. But, there was no "neighborhood feel" like Nolita has. We walked throughout the neighborhood, to the Village, and up and down 6th Ave and Broadway. I loved staying in a hip, bustling neighborhood without the crush of people that you get in other touristy areas of the city. Easy to get the subway uptown, to a play, or to Central Park (or, insane Times Square if you like). I read the mixed reviews about staff. We found them to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel has a fantastic view of the Empire State Building, which was lit up for our Christmas visit. For simplicity's sake, we ate breakfast in the restaurant one morning. It was ok, but expensive like most other hotel restaurants. There are many other great restaurant options within a few blocks. I would definitely stay at the Nolitan again.

My husband and I stayed here for our first night after our wedding. It was amazing but went too quickly since we got in late and had to leave at the crack of dawn for the airport. We came back for a long weekend in the city on the second anniversary of when we first met and fully enjoyed every aspect the hotel has to offer. The staff is so welcoming and hospitable, they take your luggage up to your room in case you want to check in and start exploring the city. They valet your car so you don't have to worry about parking. They have delicious goodies in the morning for breakfast and Sips and Savors in the evening before dinner just for hotel guests. And if you don't want to travel for food, the in house restaurant has amazing and delicious quality food for every meal. Our room was very contemporary and clean with red accents and an awesome view of the city. I love the way the showers are in the middle of the bedroom. We slept great and enjoyed our close walk to China town, Little Italy and SoHo. If you stay here you definitely feel like you are always receiving VIP treatment. We'll be back again!

Plus:Great french resto thereIf you want to explore downtown manhattan, this hotel suitable to be used as your base.Boutique style hotel with industrial theme which i kinda like it.Minus:Inconsistent service. I read mixed review abt the hotel service. I witnessed mysefl.I noticed night time staffs are good. One guy at the reception (night time) is particulary outstandingBut day time service is mediocre to bad. The day time reception is operating in robotic manner in a way telling me that they are not keen in servicing me. My point is, dont to front line job if you dont have passion on it.The bellboy is no better. Getting a yellow cab in nyc is a bit tricky. The guy seems reluctant to wait for taxi with us. Suggesting we should walk to the next road (with our luggages) instead. Maybe its really true but the overall experience is bad... They gave us wrong room type at the beginning too.... We booked for king size bed, they gave us queen size bed... Mediocre recovery by receptionist.In summary, given choices of hotel within the price range in nyc, i think the hotel really needs to improve in their service consistency.

Decent location. This little boutique is modernly furnished, well served by excellent staff and offers free wine and chese from 5 to 7. The last bit brought this from 4 to 5 stars. Seriously. Decent wine too. If this hotek was in Ireland...well.So the rooms are a good size for NYC. Well finished in that stylish industrial way that you'll either love or hate.Worth a visit.

My husband and I are in the travel business and have stayed in many types of accommodations through the years. Our return experience at the Nolitan was, as expected, great!!!We enjoyed the 'home away from home' feeling while the convenient location allowed us to experience the city as a 'real New Yorker'.The hotel ambiance is created by the modern and sleek décor with a killer view from the roof top.When we walked out of our hotel we immediately entered the lively, artsy, and 'so not boring' community of Soho, Tribeca, Greenwich Village and China Town. All, of course with great and trendy restaurants.After a busy day we enjoyed a great night sleep in our surprisingly quiet room with a very comfortable bed. If you are looking for a hotel with a very accommodating staff, sleek and comfortable environment with location, location, location you will be glad you stayed at the Nolitan. And, by the way, the hotel restaurant offers a great dinner and breakfast menu we enjoyed both.
user_name:
patricia w
New York City, New York

review_body: Do yourself a favour and stay at this hotel just once in your life!! It will be the best decision you make.The staff are incredibly helpful and accommodating. Would highly recommend staying here, I'm dreaming of when I can go back next.

We just spent two nights here and loved the hotel, staff and location. We had a King Corner City View room with a view of the Empire State Building. The room is very clean and modern. The location was great with many different restaurants around. It is located on a busy street with loud traffic, but this is New York after all. The separate shower was very roomy and the soaking tub was downright delightful after a long day of sightseeing. We will definitely be back, we felt like we really experienced the city as a resident as opposed to staying uptown near Times Square with all of the tourists.

We stayed for five nights in early November and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is modern and stylish and the rooms whilst small are smart and welcoming. The roof terrace is a great place to watch the sunset with a drink (no bar upstairs but you can take them up from the bar downstairs). The hotel is in a great area with a real neighbourhood feel surrounded by independent bars and cafes. It is really easy to walk to the main sights, particularly lower manhattan. The subway on Spring Street is only five minutes away. The hotel bar is quite good and they do wine and cheese for guests in the afternoon which is a nice touch. The thing that causes the three star review is that we stayed in three different rooms in our five night stay. When we arrived our room type was not available as they had overbooked, but they offered us another room and a free breakfast and a move to the correct room the next day. We were moved in the morning to a room on the top floor however at night a vent next to the room made such a loud noise I had to ask for another room. They managed to turn the fan off for the night and moved us the next day. Whilst I was impressed by the customer service and the final room we ended up in, it was clearly a bit of a hassle. It's a good hotel, but there are lots of good hotels in the city so i'm in two minds about whether we would return or not.

Our second visit to the Nolitan, we pushed the boat out and stayed 3 nights this time at this petite boutique hotel. Usually I'm of the opinion that a hotel is just somewhere to put your head down and I'd rather spend the money on stuff. But my better half doesnt see it that way and I have to admit that how the room is designed and the views of the empire state building and mid-town set the hotel apart. ok , so we love the hotel. We're not rich but are willing to make the sacrifices to be here (ok its no saca-ri-fice, no sacrifice at all) and some things like your better half's approval are as they say are priceless.but I agree about the heating problem. the glass bricks design feature in the outside wall are really poor thermal insulators and the balcony door is almost as bad. the heating has only one fan setting. its noisy and inneffective and you have the choice of a cold hotel room or having a cheap noisy fan blowing lukewarm air into the room. we had it on for an hour and the temperature went from 63 to 65F- we were hoping for 70. you cant sleep with that noise so you wake up freezing. The noise from the road, theres nothing that the hotel can do about that. The other source of noise is the air exhausts on the 8th floor, set into a space between the buildings. what idiot designed that? the noise bounces around that space and amplifies like a noisy car is parked outside the window. these need to be ducted up.there was a problem with the booking which to the hotels credit they did resolve and were very apologetic about the mixup. I was a tad annoyed that I had to ask for a rebate rather than it being offered, as for the first night we got a room with a lower spec than we had paid for, but it didnt spoil my holiday.noise is a real problem for me, other than that excellent.

Stayed here for one night for a business trip. Location was great. Loved the turn down service! The room is very unique and modern, so different from any hotel I've ever stayed at. We grabbed a drink at the bar before heading out to dinner. The bartender was super personable and made a great cocktail. Wish I could have stayed longer. Highly recommend!

Having worked extensively in New York over the last year, staying at the Nolitan has been a joy. You certainly feel as you are a part of this great city staying here; the location is perfect - Little Italy, Chinatown, and Soho. It is a bustling - city that never sleeps- locationThe hotel matches contemporary style with informality and great customer care. The roof must be one of the best viewpoints in New York.

My favorite hotel in NYC -- great location, terrific (A+) staff. The Nolitan does all the little things right down to the red branding touches that tie the room together. The restaurant and bar are great--had a killer cappucino and salad for lunch. Definitely recommend.

My wife and I decided to celebrate our 5 year anniversary together in New York City this year and we are so happy that we decided to stay at the Nolitan. The entire staff was so warm and welcoming they made us feel so at home. The service was excellent and the hotel's location is perfect for touring the city. Our friends Sheldon and the rest of the front desk staff was excellent with providing transportation and answering questions for us. The next time we are in NYC will definitely be staying at The Nolitan Hotel again.

Stayed here for our honeymoon during November 2014. I'll start with the good points because unfortunately there are some bad points. Great location; there's so much you can see and do within a 5 or 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is very modern and stylish. We had a balcony room and although it was unseasonably cold, it was still great to sit out and watch the world go by. The hotel has a roof top garden which is quite simply awesome. You get an amazing view of Empire State and in particular World Trade. I imagine this roof top garden would be very busy during the summer for obvious reason though definitely one of the best things about this hotel. The room size is pretty standard for a New York room with a good sized bathroom. There were special little quirks with the hotel that all added to the experience... Down turn service between 5-7pm when you received 2 complimentary chocolates and the weather forecast for the next day. The room also had a Nolitan umbrella which is a nice extra when you forget to bring your own and it's raining outside. Very close to most subway lines if you want to leave the area but honestly, there is so much to do in Little Italy/Nolitan/ Soho. Would highly recommend the Butchers Daughter and the Egg Shop, 2 great cafes beside the hotel. I have given this hotel 3 stars as there are a few negatives... As stated this was booked for our honeymoon. The email correspondence was great before our arrival but when I was booking in, the female receptionist was impersonal and made no reference to our wedding or honeymoon, it was like talking to a robot. I had arranged for a bottle of prosecco to be in the bedroom but this was never produced. These are small points but when you are spending this much on a hotel, you expect the service to be exemplary. The room itself can get very cold as the windows are huge; heating is via the air con system which is very noisy but unfortunately you have no choice when the room is so cold. Each morning I would wake up with a sore throat as I had to have the heating on and the air con system drys the air. Consideration should be given to a better heating system. Although the room size is standard for New York there is still limited storage space. We stayed for a week and we simply had to store our clothes on the table as we only got three small drawers and a small clothes rail that we managed to squeeze about 2 coats and about 4 or 5 other garments on. Also, one evening during the down turn service, a male member of staff walked into the room having knocked then only waited no more than 5 seconds before opening the door. Thankfully I got to the door in time as my wife was getting changed. There was no need for this man to walk into our room. Also, the bedrooms face onto Kenmare Street which is a busy street. The noise levels were fine with us but for first time visitors to New York, they may wish to consider bringing some ear pops as the traffic noise never dies down. I have detailed some negatives but this is a great hotel and simply needs a few areas tweaked. The majority of staff were great and very welcoming, it was just a pity that our first experience of the hotel was with a dispassionate member of staff who didn't seem interested in us at all.

This was a great place to stay in Soho area. The location was centrally located between Lil Italy and China Town, great restaurants within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was tiny but had all the needed amenities. Our room had a great view of Empire State Building and you could see the Freedom Tower from the roof. Hope to stay again. Wished they had complimentary coffee or a room coffee maker.

Celebrating my wife's birthday for 3 nights, I booked this hotel hoping it would be perfect and it was.From the moment our cab pulled up to the end of our stay the staff was warm,friendly and engaging. The location is really special for those who want to be able to walk around some great neighborhoods in NYC. While at the hotel we walked around Nolita, Soho, Little Italy,Chinatown Greenwich Village,East Village and Chelsea.Our room had a direct view of The Empire State Building and was very clean and modern. Also, the staff did a fantastic job with the romance package. I would definitely recommend this hotels to couples. Also,The Nolitan Hotel is a 2 minute walk to The Bowery Ballroom for concert goers who want to be close to this venue.

We stayed here for a wonderful anniversary weekend! The staff truly pampers you and tries to builds a fantastic relationship with you the step you walk in, and that is what stood out to us most! Our corner room with the large garden style tub and beautiful sun lit mornings made for a perfect setting for our anniversary!Brunch at the adjacent in-house restaurant, Cantine Parisienne, is also superb! Try the Croque Madame or Eggs Benedict!

During this last trip to NYC I wanted to stay in a new neighborhood and ended up really loving the Nolitan's location. Nolita itself has a lot of small cafes and bars on offer, but the hotel's location makes it a short walk to Soho, the Financial District, and the Brooklyn Bridge. Traveling alone I felt perfectly safe walking around the neighborhood in the evening and never had trouble getting a cab. The hotel's restaurant was excellent and you can tell there are a lot of locals who go there. Rooms are industrial-chic but comfortable and while you get some street noise, that's pretty hard to avoid in New York unless you can stay on a really high floor. The customer service was also top notch, would definitely stay there again.
