Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was my base for my second NYC visit - and I wished I had stayed her the first time. The staff were wonderful, the hotel design is great and the rooms are excellent while being a bit different form the norm. The location is hard to beat - an easy stroll to great shopping and nightlife. The free bicycles meant I could explore the area at my convenience - a real bonus. I will be back.

If your going to New York and you aren't to sure where to stay... THIS IS WHERE YOU SHOULD STAY!!!! Right in the heart of all major designer, art, vintage and boutique shops this location is amazing for ALL food and shopping. Me and my partner have stayed in some of the nicer hotels around the world and even though the rooms might be a little smaller than some (keeping in mind your in New York) they are very modern, clean and functional. As far as service goes I have not witnessed better. A gentleman by the name of Jean was without a doubt one of the most hospitable hosts I have ever encountered, but to be fair all the guys that work here are fantastic, Senia,Dorina,Sheldon, Osei, & Anderson just to name a few. To be fair all the staff here have exceeded our expectations.the only downer here was the internet being very good makes it abit harder to plan things but besides from that its been a amazing place to stay.

Had a nice surprise party on the roof.It was a gorgeous night in the city to enjoy with a wonderful friends.Would definitely recommend the Nolitan for a place to gather & catch up with friends. The views from the roof top are spectacular. Best partare the Nolitan's Sips & Savories where they offer complimentary wine &snacks to enjoy up on the roof every day.
user_name:
Douliketotravel
New York City, New York

review_body: Simply put, I'm a firm believer the staff make a hotel and is no more true than in this instance. The front of house staff were so kind to my partner and I & made us feel they sincerely cared & were interested in making our stay a positive experience. The hotel is a little smaller than I had imagined based on the official website and a few YouTube clips I'd seen; however how much time do you really spend in your hotel room when you're away for a long weekend getting married? If I were to stay here again it would be down to the staff and the views of the city from the rooftop.

My best girlfriends treated me to a girls night in the city and we COULD NOT get over what a good time we had. It was a one-stop shop for a good time, (great drinks and dinner downstairs) with an ambiance to die for, and a staff that is at your service. (Sheldon was great) amazing views out of every window (we had a corner suite) and the location is wonderful. The restaurant downstairs had amazing food and service only second to the help at the hotel. I wish we were staying there again tonight. From the light fixtures, to the bathtub, state of the art armchairs and the most comfy beds. Nolitan is my number one recommendation for an elite boutique hotel downtown.

This hotel is very much to recommend. Great service, fantastic beds, relaxing & original stylish design, affordable and all of this with a customer centric mindset. Solutions for everthing & original add ons (iPad - bikes - free prints - ... available)All of this in a vibrant area of the City, with a wide choice restaurants, pubs, clubs, shops, ... within walking distance. Soho or Nolita, but even meatpacking is very close by. Good connection to 3 metrolines, with direct connection to downtown - uptown - Brooklyn etc. When back in NYC, I'll know where to stay.

This was our second visit to NYC. The hotel is stylish and the service is very good. Reception and bar staff were polite and welcoming. The rooms are ok size wise and well equipped. Our bathroom (room 201) was a good size. The neighbourhood is good, there are plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. The area was well connected to the rest of the city and felt safe and welcoming. We would definitely stay here again. The only small issues were that the fridge in the wardrobe was noisy and vibrated loudly and there was only one bedside table.

I have stayed at this hotel 5 or 6 times since it opened, and its location, service and general value remain high points. While the room furnishings are showing signs of wear, the overall ambience is cozy, modern chic. The location afforded me a few strolls around Soho between meetings, and the hotel is just a few steps away from my favorite bookshop (McNally Jackson). I can't wait to return in the spring!

We stayed here for our 10 wedding anniversary and they gave us a room upgrade and delivered champaign to the room. Not only is the hotel amazing but is located in one of the best neighborhoods in New York!

Had a great experience with this hotel booking celebrity clients here. Will never do so again after the totally rude treatment by the man answering the phone at the front desk at 11:00pm ET on Nov. 7. Refused to connect us with the manager of the hotel and was overall unhelpful.We received an email stating that we would not be offered normal check in time and that our three rooms were being offered check in at 8pm by a person named Joy who wrote a very unclear email stating that our rooms were rented for a photo shoot all day and would not be available until 8pm.Terrible last minute problems with this reservation.

The Nolitan is a great, hip, stylish but comfortable boutique hotel on Kenmare street. Cool and inviting lobby with sunken library. The rooms are a combination of modern design with super comfortable beds and bathrooms. Located smack in the middle of Nolita, which is North of Little Italy, just East of Soho, a very happening neighborhood. Great eating and shopping. The GM is a gentleman named Bogdan Docu. A fantastic customer oriented guy who I followed here from his stints at the Gansevoort Park and Meatpacking Hotels. IMHO you cannot go wrong with the Nolitan for all of the reasons above.

One of the best times ever.... The hotel is more than what my wife and I were expecting. We booked a weekend getaway to the city, during Halloween, and we were told about this place by a few friends. Their recommendations were not enough to explain how great this place was. The genuinely friendly staff, the building's great ambiance and architecture, the hotel's restaurant and it's prime location made this one of the best weekends my wife and I have had in the city. We walked around to all the great shops and destinations that are all in walking distance. After a great day walking around, we returned to get ready for dinner, to only end up going downstairs to the restaurant, which was fabulous. We can't wait to visit this place again. We booked a night here for New Year's Eve and are sure that it will be just as great. Thank you for a great time.Thank You, Mark & Vicky BuzzettoPS: The Halloween parade was a must see for next year.

Stayed at the Nolitan for four nights. This is a great boutique hotel. Super stylish, very clean, amazing service. Be prepared for small rooms and a noisy street outside - some might not like that, but to us that's just part of the experience of visiting NYC. Overall, this is the best hotel experience I've had in New York after about 6 visits here. The location is incredible. Nolita is an awesome neighborhood. You are within walking distance of Soho (which is really, really close) and the Village (a bit further, but still a nice walk). The train to Brooklyn is a block or two away. Little Italy and Chinatown are right there too. The lobby is super cool and the rooms are very modern and fun. The only issues we had - and believe me, they were minor - were the day we left. It was the end of daylight savings and we were supposed to get a wake up call (we were nervous our phones were going to forget about the time change) that we never received. Also, the car service we booked through the hotel was supposed to be all paid up front - we paid at the hotel, and then when the driver dropped us off at the airport he asked, "so who pays?" and insisted that we hadn't paid up front with the hotel. And he charged us more than the hotel said the fare was. Turned out to be the driver's fault, but seems like some extra communication is needed between the hotel and the car service. The staff at the hotel reimbursed us immediately and really the only thing we suffered was a few minutes of panic. Overall, it's a great hotel - highly recommended! Restaurants nearby to try: Black Seed for bagels, Uncle Boon's, Peasant.

Fantastic hotel in the vibrant Nolita area. Welcoming, friendly staff who were always there to help. The rooms are very clean, stylish and spacious with extreamly comfortable beds- from which you could see midtown from! Our room had a balcony with an amazing view of mid town and the Williamsburg Bridge. Rooftop offers fabulous views of lower Manhattan in addition to the above and there were plenty of areas to sit and admire the city. Close to several subways and lots of great places to eat and drink in the surrounding streets. This is a fantastic hotel with very good service. We will definately stay next time we are in New York. Thank you!

This hotel was exactly what we wanted for our honeymoon. It is a very cool, boutique hotel which offers a personal service in a great location. The surrounding bars and restaurants are superb in particular we recommend Lombardis. It is close to many subways and the staff are very friendly and helpful. In particular Kimberly helped us secure a reservation at the very popular la Esquina. Two small negatives-although the hotel is very quiet the traffic is noisy but that's to be expected in NYC also the rooms are small but well equipt with an ironing board, hair dryer etc. We had a room on the top floor and the view was incredible. We will definitely be recommending the Nolitan to our friends and family and would stay here again if we come back to NYC.

As frequent visitors to Manhattan, my husband and I decided to stay @The Nolitan which is perfectly situated in the vicinity of Nolita, Little Italy and Chinatown: slightly gritty, yet close to wonderful eats, shops on Orchard, Mott and Elizabeth Streets (yes, there are items sold that are still made in New York!). Walking distance to subway lines East (6, J/Z), North & South (B, D, F, M) and West (N, R). We reserved the Cityscape Corner Room for a splurge (yes, it is expensive). The first night, however, we had to stay in their Cityscape Room due to plumbing problems in our reserved room. The Cityscape Room is small, but I felt the layout works. Lots of space for your toiletries in the bathroom and I personally did not have a problem with the exposed shower room. Separate water closet (very stark in all white); main sleeping area has exposed concrete with fabric panel as a headboard. Watch out for the sharp corners on the bed platform and floating side tables (those tables are slightly above eye level when you're in bed). The Cityscape Corner Room is accurately illustrated on the hotel website; the oval tub is wonderful and again, we didn't have an issue with the exposed bathroom area concept. We enjoyed the view from the 9th floor (I like the use of the frosted and clear window paneling), and during our stay, we didn't hear any noise from other guests in the hallway. As fellow reviewers have stated, the only item(s) not quiet were the A/C and water closet/bathroom fans--my husband thought the motors were broken and called the front desk for a request for repairs! They are very annoying; fortunately for us, the weather could handle the running of the ceiling fan for ventilation--I pity those who visit The City during the summer and stay at The Nolitan!In any case, a couple of recommendations for the hotel:1) Fix the fans!2) Provide complimentary drinking water for guests; this should be a given with the prices charged.3) Become consistent with your turndown service in the early evening (the hotel additionally provides weather cards and chocolates, but we only received that service twice in 4 nights).4) The on-line concierge service request (a link with the reservation confirmation) was totally ignored (although I didn't need it, I thought I'd test it out and the hotel failed completely).5) Check your credit card bill when you get home; I was charged for items I didn't purchase (probably due to opening the minibar refrigerator to store cheese and olives that I had purchased).Kudos to the wonderful bath products, fluffy towels and friendly front desk folks (thanks Dorina and Kimberly!). The rooms we had were clean, stocked appropriately and electronics worked (i.e., TV, hair dryer). I also appreciated the fact that they supported local artists with artwork (albeit one piece) in the rooms. Note that we didn't access internet service, visit the rooftop bar, take in the complimentary wine and cheese social or eat at the restaurant, so I will not comment on them.Foodies in the immediate area: do have breakfast at The Fiat Cafe on Mott. Very reasonable prices with charming ambiance. Don't forget to walk over to Grand and Essex for The Doughnut Plant and Kossar's Bialys (GREAT Bialys). Pizza at Rubirosa on Mulberry is tasty (very thin crust style); I thought the Russ and Daughter's restaurant was disappointing and expensive--visit their E. Houston street location and purchase take away instead. Don't leave the area without having dinner at Balthazar; a definite "worth it" splurge.We visited the Museum of the Moving Image in Astoria, Queens (the famed movie studio is next door). Great place to visit if you love the movies and lots of creative happenings for children on weekends. The Chuck Jones exhibit is currently highlighted--it leaves in January, 2015. Thoroughly loved it!I also recommend taking a sunset cruise on the Hudson via the Adirondack schooner at the Chelsea Piers. It is a lovely way to see Lower Manhattan--plus they serve wine, beer and non-alcoholic beverages on board! Pick up little noshes at either Eataly or Chelsea Market to enjoy with the drinks.Lastly, the High Line is completed--a great walk!
user_name:
Jean H
san francisco bay area

review_body: I chose the Nolitan after getting truly bored with years of staying at expensive chain hotels in Midtown.It is a great little property, design is modern urban but not cold or over designer. Some reviewers find the rooms small, and whilst not on the large side, they are well laid out and comfortable. In NY today you have to spend $800 a night to get 'spacious'.The surrounding area is great for walking, it is a laid back part of town and the local restaurants and bars are very good indeed, all independent and with character.

Rooms are tiny, and passers-by can enjoy a clear view of your interior, including the inside of the shower if you leave curtains open. Fan from air con very noisy. casual, laid back service. Rooftop bar, with wonderful views closed at 9pm. No room service; you call in from local restaurants. Very expensive for very basic accommodation. Interior decor prison-like. There is far better value to be had not far away.

I've stayed at many NYC boutique hotels and was unfortunately disappointed with the Nolitan. The top-floor suite had no opening windows, and both the A/C and bathroom fans were as loud as motorboats. Most frustrating, however, was the sporadic internet service during my stay. I was traveling for work, and without internet access, a $400 boutique hotel room is no better then a $89 Red Roof Inn. Did I mention the lack of workout facilities? And because they have no in-hotel dining, the hotel's version of room service amounts to the hotel ordering from an outside restaurant for you and adding on their own "room service surcharge". The rooftop deck is beautiful with views of all major NYC buildings and bridges — but for that one can go to Top of the Rock and pay much less.

Nice people and helpful people at the desk. Nice, modern design. Small but functional, clean and fresh rooms. Perfect for a New York weekend.The room was smart overall. Loved the clean design and concrete ceiling. One small annoying flaw: there was not a single hook to hang up either a used shower towel or your bag with toiletries. Add some hooks to the walls and I would have nothing to complain about.The breakfast ($9.50) seemed quite weak, so we never tried it. And really, why go there when you have New York around the corner. Easy to walk to anywhere in the south of Manhattan, crossing Brooklyn Bridge, or walking to Times Square and Central Park. We didn't take the subway once.Finally, while the immediate street is somewhat shabby, you have wonderful areas just a street or two away. Prince Street, Lafayette and Broadway are all so very close.

We spent 3 nights here in October and would happily return. Other reviews set us up to fear the room size, but we ended up in a standard room and found it very comfortable -- we've experienced much smaller in NYC & London and didn't feel at all cramped. We like the industrial edge and found it to be very stylish, but understand that's not for everyone. The bed was the most comfortable I can remember sleeping in (maybe EVER) and our friends, who had a corner room, said the same. For a 'small & trendy' room, the bathroom had a lot of space and plenty of counter top, which I really appreciate. Good heavy curtains keep it dark as long as you want and we didn't get neighbor noise from any direction, including the hall -- though the air conditioning unit was quite loud (louder in 601 than 401, for some reason). It was clean and the finishes and 'accoutrements' were high quality.Other good stuff includes the small bar in the restaurant (Moet & cheese plate while waiting for friends), the 'Sips & Savories' complimentary happy hour, the friendly & accommodating staff, views from the roof (which will be fabulous when / if it is developed into a proper space), the hip & homey lobby, and the location nestled amid great bars & restaurants. The 1pm checkout is a God send, and we always love free, reliable, easy to use WiFi.The bulk of our frustrations stemmed from being downgraded: we booked (and paid in full) for a corner room 6 months before our arrival, but were told at check-in it had been sold to someone else. The Nolitan wanted to make it up to us -- they credited back a chunk of what we'd paid, gave us free breakfasts, a bottle of wine, and many apologies. A bummer, but not the end of the world. The other thing not quite up to snuff is the 'online concierge' that they will email you about if you book. I used the tool to submit preferences and requests twice in advance of our stay, but when I called to follow up neither had been received and, despite submitting the requests a third time over the phone, the little details they claimed to want to take care of (extra pillows, etc) were never seen to. Again, not the end of the world.It's a lovely hotel. We would stay again (with expectations re-set by our experience), and certainly recommend it.

I recently stayed at the Nolitan to celebrate an anniversary and loved it!! Our room, though not big, was well appointed. The decor is very industrial and trendy and the beds were extremely comfortable. Location is fantastic as it's located just north of Little Italy and within walking distance to some great restaurants. The only issue we had was with parking. While there was supposed to be valet parking available at a garage nearby, the garage was closed and our car was parked at a garage further from the hotel. There seemed to be some confusion about where the car would be taken and then it took some time to get the car back. Overall; however, our experience was good and I would definitely recommend the Nolitan.

The Nolitan's internal design is, loosely speaking, industrial chic - as in raw concrete ceilings, minimalist comfort, and the overwhelming sense that I had paid over $400 a night to stay in a room not much larger than a jail cell and not that different either. Virtually no drawer space. There was a window, Several, actually. But the one that caught my attention was the uncovered - no shade, or blinds - one in the bathroom that faced due east. So when you went to brush your teeth in the morning that eastern exposure brought the morning sun's full force smack up into your face. I would not recommend shaving before 3 p.m. in my bathroom where you are more or less blinded. The staff was pleasant, one elevator did not emit scary scraping noises, and two days out of three the chambermaids replaced the towels.

We enjoyed a week in New-York city for our honeymoon trip. The Nolitan was the perfect place to stay, due it's nice location ‘NoLita’, High class furniture & room quality, perfect service and kindness of all the staff members.We have been upgraded in the Corner Suite. Due our booking honeymoon + "long stay" and one of the highest room type booked directly at the hotel! Thanks! The suite is magnificent; the view overlooking the Empire State Building was amazing! The bathtub is a pool! + Roof top “no service but” really nice roof top terrace, quiet and cosy, with nice view on this amazing NYC! +“The happy hour” around 5pm and during 1h the hotel propose an relaxing time in the lobby with a free glass of wine “white or bubbles” + chees and more… nice touch! If you like Design “not bling bling”, but uncluttered design in good taste, The Notlitan hotel is the place to be! Regard’s from Belgium.

I stay here on business and I love the intimate feel of this hotel. It has a very Parisian vibe to it and reminds me a lot of a place I stayed in Paris. It has small elevators and small rooms with a see through shower window (keep that in mind if you are sharing) You can pull a curtain over the shower area but keep that in mind if you enjoy your privacy!The restaurant connected to the hotel is delicious and was full of models from fashion week when I was there. (Which is why I ate less than usual) :)You can rent a bike or skateboard for free to explore the city which is a great perk.This hotel is withing walking distance to the Soho and all the shopping and dining it has to offer. It is also walking distance from Little Italy and Chinatown. Overall, a lovely experience.Being a former New Yorker this place will please anyone that wants to experience the city, eat, and do some shopping. The cronut place is also within walking distance if anyone eats those anymore. Make sure you pack your walking shoes!

Cool hotel in one of my favorite neighborhoods. Nice to have happy hour with snacks and wine. Front desk was helpful with all requests. Room is cozy so not big but not too small. Only odd thing - we think it was due to their mattress cover - bed was super hot. Woke up sweating both nights. It wasn't the temperature in the room but the bed. Mild street noise so I would rate good for NYC. Cool roof top. I would return but would ask about the bed situation. If it occurred again, I would not return. So worth another try due to everything else.

From the minute u check in until the moment you check out, the nolitan offers five star service that will leave u so satisfied with your decision to stay there. Every little detail is thought of and done right. If you are looking for a chic hotel to stay at in soho this is the one!

Just stayed at the Nolitan and had wonderful stay. Staff was very friendly and attentive, room was clean and comfortable. Decor is very "industrial chic", and downtown informal. Greatest thing about the hotel is the location….so walkable to so many hip places, Nolita, Little Italy, SoHo, Lower East Side. So many places to eat and drink, concierge very helpful in recommendations and securing reservations.

My wife says this was the nicest and most convenient NYC hotel we've ever had. Rooms were trendy and clean, sheets were high quality and clean, bathroom was modern and clean, staff were friendly and helpful. The happy hour with complimentary cheese, crackers, olives, red and white wine, and champagne were the perfect combination to our busy 3 days touring the Met Museum, 911 memorial, and Brooklyn sites. Great Food in every direction. Larry S.

This Lower Manhattan boutique hotel was just as nice as we remembered. We returned to the Nolitan nearly a year after our first stay in order to celebrate our 23rd wedding anniversary. Clean, clean, clean! Every inch of the Nolitan is kept in immaculate condition. The rooms are so well kept that you feel like the you are one of the very first guests to stay. Our room had a balcony, a pleasant and rare find in NYC. We enjoyed the million dollar view from the rooftop after the sun had gone down. The hotel staff, once again, was well informed, gracious, and anxious to please. The neighborhood never disappoints and provides a plethora of dining and shopping options. We hope to come back again and again for overnight stays in NYC. Kudos to the Nolitan and staff.

New hotel that is very modern/industrial and comfortable. The rooms are spacious - especially for NYC - the beds are soft and comfy with high quality linens. Nolita is a fabulous neighborhood, but if you must leave it, the 6 and BDFM trains are 5 minutes away.
user_name:
Kathy M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: New, funky, chic....This hotel was great. The location was perfect for my needs. Don't be discouraged by the surrounding neighborhood(The Bowery)...it's a little rough around the edges but perfectly fine. The Nolitan is close to China Town and Little Italy and some of the cutest boutiques and cafes. Nolita is a great place to explore... wine shops, Whole Foods, restaurants, Washington Park...you name it it's just steps from the Nolitan. The staff was great the room immaculate with a lot of light, the bathroom was cleverly situated with a great shower. They even have robes and slippers for use during your stay. The only drawback for me was the $6. morning cup of coffee. Everything is Ala Carte at this wonderful hotel which make it a little pricy. Would I stay here again? I'm looking forward to it!

For my second trip to New York I wanted to experience downtown and the Soho area. For me, a single traveller, I chose the perfect hotel. On busy Kenmare Street in Nolita it was close enough to everything - trendy Soho shops, Little Italy, Chinatown and the little streets close by were a perfect setting for wandering around. I didn't eat at the restaurant but there are more than plenty of eateries and cafes to chose from. Plus there's a guide with local businesses who driver to the hotel.My room was a 9th floor cityscape balcony room overlooking Kenmare street. The perfect view of the Empire state and midtown manhattan. I could also see the Williamsburg bridge to the right. I had such a great view that i never closed the curtains at night, instead preferring to soak up the view of the empire state lit up in red, white and blue for labor day. I have to say I could hear the street noise outside, even on the 9th floor, but it wasn't obtrusive and it's New York! It's a lively bustling city. If you're someone who likes total quietness at night then i suggest a higher floor room (pay that bit extra). The room was decent sized, with a toilet separate from the bathroom, although directly across form it so hardly out of the way). There's a peek-a-boo shower but ha a curtain for privacy. Like I said, I'm a solo traveller so this was fine for me.Overall I am so glad I picked the Nolitan Hotel, I was on a 5 day trip and spent 3 days here and then 2 days at a hotel in Midtown but i'd have happily stayed here for the 5 days. I didn't have much dealings with the staff except for check in / check out but they were always friendly when i passed in or out of the hotel. And I suppose you could day if i didn't have any dealings with them then my stay would trouble free.I'd go back here again on my next trip, fingers crossed!!

Very Arty. Very Modern. Very Expensive! But that is expected for its location and the quality of rooms! Seems like a completely renovated old property so while the interiors are trendy the layout of the rooms leaves a really bad taste! We had two rooms 601 and 602! One overlooking Kenmore and other overlooking nothing! Very small closet where one couldn't store much! NoSpace for suitcases! Had to open doors to look for the loo! It's on its own away from the sink and shower! And a spa tub on the middle of it all which didn't need to be there except that if it's there the hotel can charge an exorbitant night rate! Not much of a view! Very noisy air conditioning! Could work out the controls! Horrible lighting as had been properly done the room would not have an arty look! Not much of anything really! The keys didn't work and we kept having to go back to the reception! Very smiley staff but irritating!! If one is looking for a place that affords a trendy address then the Nolitan is the best! But if you're looking for a good, comfortable, practical, efficient place to stay look elsewhere! Paying a bomb for that won't hurt as bad!

Funky and fabulous boutique hotel located in NOLITA. We had a CityScape room with a city view balcony. The hotel is almost sound proof which is a giant plus in NYC. They even have a nice turn-down service and when was the last time you had that in a hotel?I must not forget to mention the outstanding staff, Stephanie and the front desk manager. Class act all around.
