Betty1500
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel is well positioned, within easy walking distance from underground and must-see areas like Little Italy & China town. Its also a quieter area, which is invaluable for the jetlagged traveller. Our room was spacious, LOVED the bathtub and view towards the bridge. Wifi was a bit slow, but not unusable. The wine-and-snacks in the reception each afternoon was a welcome addition. The staff was friendly and helpful, with great suggestions on outings. The in-house restaurant serving breakfast is convenient, but expensive. I have long hair and the staff immediately placed additional towels in our rooms for me - lovely touch. Staff kindly kept a gift package for a friend at reception after we left, which we really appreciated!!Will definitely stay here again. One recommendation to staff - the curtains (although light-blocking) did not completely cover the large windows, and early morning light was a shock to the system when trying to adjust to a new time zone.

This is a great hotel, quite new and comfortable in a brilliant spot in Nolita near soho, little Italy and Chinatown. Everything in NYC easily accessed by subway.. The staff were really helpful. The only issue we had was really poor wifi every day despite multiple complaints. We basically had to go to the lobby!

Whats great about this hotel is the staff, they are so friendly and helpful! Also a great location in a less touristy and noisy part of New York with walking distance to a lot of NYC hotspots. I appreciated the great shopping in the area. The rooms were small, even though I guess if you pay more you can have a larger one, and no bathtub which disappointed me. I tend to like classic hotels with charm, this hotel was very modern and didnt give me that feeling - On the other hand there is a lovely roof-top terrace with a view over the city. The Wifi password seemed to change each day which was annoying, it also disconnected a lot.

My wife and I just spent three quality days at the Nolitan. The rooms are uniquely designed with very nice space planning. The staff is extremely helpful with a very sensitive responses to your needs as a guest. The hotel sits near both Little Italy and Chinatown, which offers a splendid array of things to do and see. The immediate neighborhood has numerous shops and restaurants which are fun and fashionable. We would recommend eating breakfast at Café Fiat as I experienced the best pancakes I have ever eaten.The hotel cost is very reasonable for the experience. One suggestion is to become familiar with using the subway as it can get pricey to get uptown by taxi. We highly recommend staying at the Nolitan.

The rooms are stylish and incredibly quiet and the restaurant is first-rate. Near the hotel within easy walking distance are 20-30 superb restaurants on very beautiful streets. A wonderful place to stay in Manhattan.

Great hotel for a great price. Room was clean and well finished. A couple funny things though. The shower had a window that faced the street, so if you got in before the glass fogged up, your body was fair game for the building across the street. No curtain on that window. Also, there was a window between the shower and the room itself. That's fine but the curtain for the shower was controlled from the room, not the shower. Which means your roommates/family could pull the curtain to the side and see you in all your glory. Lastly, if you valet your car, call the number on the ticket yourself. We called the desk as we were walking back to the hotel on a tight timeline, but the hotel staff didn't call the valet service for another 17 minutes. So we got stuck in more rush hour traffic than we would have if we had just called the valet ourselves. Overall, we would still go back to this hotel. Of course we don't have kids who could pull the curtain to the shower to peak.

We stayed here for three nights in August after coming off the Queen Mary 2. We're both professionals in our late 20's and early 30's (so not Hipsters) and we found that the Nolitan delivered the perfect base in NYC for us. From the incredibly friendly team behind the front desk through to the brilliant 'in-room dining' all of which can be ordered through them and brought to your room (apparently without a charge because you just pay 18% standard gratuity). That was one of many highlights and was so good that one day we just stayed in bed and ordered Chinese for lunch and then a Meatball Pizza for dinner, only venturing out for drinks well into the evening! The rooms have everything in them (including bathrobes), speakers etc. The see through shower which divides the room was fun. Although if you aren't romantic with the person you're sharing with, it probably wouldn't work for you! Either way they sensibly put the toilet in a separate room because unlike some hipster hangouts a dividing screen is not enough and in my humble opinion a big step too far. There was a cool balcony where we drank the complimentary wine/champagne they offer you each night in reception and listened to music while we got ready to hit the town. Overall it was just a very cool experience and perfectly suited to what we were doing in NYC (which was having fun!). As I said the staff were all incredibly friendly people and not 'too cool for school' types. Overall one of the best stays in one of the best parts of Manhattan. We'd definitely come back, maybe even in winter just so we have an excuse not leave the room and order takeout again, great, great pizza area and Chinatown on your doorstep what more could you want?...

This was a return visit as it made such an impression last year. It's difficult to say which is most impressive, the hotel or the neighbourhood. The hotel does however really suit the area. Rooms are minimally yet very tastefully furnished with a good sized tv, comfy chair and I also opted for a room with a balcony and was lucky to be on the 9th floor with an amazing view including Empire State, midtown etc. simply wonderful. Since Kenmare St can be quite noisy, I do think it is worth requesting a room on a high floor not just due to the views. Room (and rest of hotel) was very clean and it is worth heading to the rooftop too to get the amazing views. Free wifi worked perfectly. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. It is worth popping to the cheese and wine (5-7 every day I think) as it's a nice way to start the evening. Although there wasn't a great choice of food ( probably because I had been totally spoilt during my first days in the city in another hotel where cheese and wine is also offered), it's definitely a good touch and I know some guests took their drinks up to the roof. I didn't eat in the hotel's restaurant this year as there is so much choice in the neighbourhood anyway. All in all a great stay in such an interesting part of the city.

Everything was great! The location is perfect to visit NY, The hotel and the room are lovely and very stylish! The shower is fun. The view from the room (we were on the eight floor) and from the terrace is amazing! The staff is friendly and we appreciated the fact that they rent bikes.

The first thing that comes to mind when you step into the Nolitan is how city chic it is...The styling is cutting edge, and feels like your stepping into the pages of Architectural Digest.The service is fantastic with a very helpful staff that is always smiling, warm and inviting and anticipates your every needs; and their recommendations for places to eat or visit helped us see a side of NYC that only locals know (I can't say enough how outstanding the staff was).The rooms like the hotel itself are modern, unique and clean, while still maintaining warmth and comfort... (you know, the kind of room that you don't want to leave).My wife and I had the corner room on the 8th floor that offered us a spectacular view of the city with the Empire State building directly in our sites.While at the hotel make sure to visit the rooftop at sunset…spectacular!The Nolitan is at the heart of Little Italy, Chinatown, and SOHO and really did give us a different side to the city, and my wife loved running in the morning from the Hotel over the Brooklyn Bridge and back (about 4 mile round trip).Would I recommend the Nolitan…ABSOLUTELY!!!

After the reviews we were so excited to stay at the Nolitan. I had stayed at Trump Towers in Soho and wanted to stay in that location. The Nolitan was nothing short of amazing. From the location, the staff. Nothing could be faulted. I don't usually write reviews but we were so very impressed by everything about this place. Can't wait to go back. The rooftop is amazing. Tip is go to the bar downstairs and get yourself a cocktail and take it up and take in the beautiful view.

The staff was beyond friendly and helpful. I was on the 4th floor facing the street and directly across the hall from the elevators-- I was sure I wouldn't sleep. I visit the city 4-5 times a year and this is the best I have slept there. The rooms have patios and there is a rooftop for guests to enjoy (no bar/restaurant) with incredible views. I took take out up there on my first night. We also took advantage of their breakfast vouchers for the adjoining restaurant and daily fitness passes to the 24 hour fitness nearby- these amenities were above and beyond. I very much enjoyed my stay and recommend it to anyone looking to stay in a neighborhood known for food!

The Nolitan is understandably popular. It's chic and the rooms, though the smaller rooms (all 4 of the Neighbourhood/Cityscape Room/Balcony options are about the same size) are not big, are well designed and don't feel cramped (unlike the small rooms in The Standard East Village. Very clean as well. The only down sides:- the air conditioner in our room (705) was really loud - I mean REALLY loud. Fortunately I can sleep with earl plugs, otherwise it would have been a problem. We didn't say anything to the desk, though, so they may have sent up someone to try and fix it - so I can't really count it against them. - they play irritating pop music rather loudly in the lobby and restaurant - annoying enough that I vetoed eating breakfast in the restaurant. I do like plenty of current music, just not the tedious mainstream stuff they seem to like. Having said that, it is great, and they have bikes you can borrow for the day. If/when we stay there again, I'd opt for a corner room.

I was very much pleased with me at expirience at that hotel. First of all the staff is excellent. They are very professional and polite. And helpful and nice. That is important for me and thats why I went there reading comments on booking.com and I wasn't dissapointed. The rooms are very nice (we had one without a balcony on a 7th floor). The interior is awesome the bed was very good, nice shower and all the amenities, nice mini bar, working big tv and wifi. We didn't eat anything there but for breakfast highly reccomend Fiat Cafe just a block away with the best coffee we have had in New York City. And yes go to see the rooftop it's excellent espacially at dawn ;)

Nicely done hotel, rooms are small, but have balconies. Very modern. Proximity to Little Italy and Chinatown were great. Service and staff were awesome. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The views from the roof were phenomenal, and the view from our room was the Empire State Building.

The Nolitan hotel is in a great location for exploring NYC. Just north of Little Italy and close to SoHo, there is a definite "village" feel to the neighbourhood. This works well - because after a day exploring the city it's great to relax in an area which doesn't feel as big and busy as midtown. Where you can wander around and happen across a great bar or restaurant.The hotel is new and spotless. The staff are wonderfully helpful, attentive - and knowledgeable - nothing was too much trouble. Every evening there is a wine and cheese tasting hour or two - and if you take a glass up to the roof terrace - you have lower manhattan and the freedom tower to the south, and the whole of midtown with great views of the empire state and chrysler building looking north. The rooms are well designed with a good use of the available space - which, this being new york, is not huge. I found the bed comfortable, and the shower excellent. I also loved the balcony. The wifi was free and simple to connect with good speed. Overall a great location (not an area i had previously stayed in) - and i would certainly stay again!

My wife and I recently spent a weekend at this perfectly located boutique Hotel. The staff was very friendly( but not overly) and provided spectacular service. The daily complimentary wine and cheese tasting with varietals from around the world was excellent. Many services that all hotels offer were complimentary.( Bikes, Skateboards, Internet, Gym,iPads, Laptops, DVD players) There were multiple great restaurants, very reasonably priced, within walking distance from the hotel. The nieghborhood is upscale, however, the local vibe is very relaxed and comfortable. We were happy to find this little jewel for our next visit to New York.

Based on the reviews I'd read I expected to love this hotel.....and parts were awesome. The staff were super helpful and tried hard to be accommodating. However, I clearly missed the mark in thinking this hotel would be a good choice for my teenage son and I. Not one room with two beds. The bathroom provided no privacy. The air conditioner and street noise were unbearable. So even though we'd prepaid for our stay we moved after just one night.

There are a lot of great things about this hotel.. The location and the staff for example couldn't have been better HOWEVER , I was put in room 901, the air conditioner was so loud it had to be turned off to hear the TV. It's sounded like an air compressor. Everyone was very nice about it, acknowledged it was a problem in many of the rooms and they were getting to them one by one. We had to move out. Before checking in make sure you get one of the rooms that has been "rectified" ..

I spent two nights at the Nolitan Hotel. What a great choice it was! The hotel is trendy and modern. The room I had was quite small but perfectly suitable for a short trip and to New York standards. The best thing is the neighborhood: lively, trendy, full of great little restaurants where the prices are right. The roof terrace was fantastic! And free bikes and skateboards are a nice little addition to the package. Definitely recommended.

We stayed for a full week and had a lovely large (for NY) room on the 5th floor. Loved the room facilities and decor. Nice to discover the hotel has a wine and cheese tasting for guests every evening- we recommend enjoying on the roof terrace, fantastic views- and also provides a room service option where guests can order from local eateries brought straight to your room- lombardies pizza is great! Restaurant and bar were nice if a tad overpriced. Location is great for downtown- Bowery, little Italy, China town etc- lots to do, eat and drink without even getting on the nearest tube (5 mins walk). Overall we were very impressed and would stay again, only minor negative was on departure when we thought we'd pre booked a cab to the airport only to be told the hotel had forgot!

We stayed at the Nolitan for six days including the 4 th of July. We were able to see the fire works from the roof. The entire staff from the bellmanto the bartender were so kind, considerate and helpful. The hotel is very modern, it was a reasonable size for New York with many amenities. Our room faced the street and we had a balcony. All in all a great stay, Thanks Nolitan staff.

Nolitan offers a great location, convenient to shopping and great eating spots. Service was outstanding - we arrived and moments after check - in, our bellman offered to grab champagne from a nearby store. 30 minutes later we had complimentary snacks, champagne flutes and bubbles. It was a quick girls' weekend that went by fast - and the hotel was relaxing, with modern fixtures.

It was our first time in NYC and we picked the Nolitan based on the excellent reviews and location next to our friend's place. The Nolitan lived up to our high expectations in every way! From the unique attention to detail and design to the amazing service, we thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay!What made it even more special was the staff's friendliness and personability that made us feel at home in a big, new city. This was especially true of Jean, Dilan, an Osei! They were fantastic, just like the hotel's design, location and value!Other bonuses of the hotel is the rooftop balcony and free happy hour everyday! We would go back and recommend to anyone visits the city!

This boutique hotel is the perfect place to stay to get the best out of Manhattan and Brooklyn.In the heart of Nolita, you are in the heart of the bo-ho hood, with fantastic shopping, great restaurants. The hotel is with minimalistic design but tasteful. The people are great and helpful. You can borrow bikes and/or boards, and get access to Brooklyn/Williamsburg in a jiffy. Lovely place, lovely location and good people.

The Nolitan is a relaxed, funky hotel in the Soho, Little Italy, Nolitan triangle. The location is excellent with easy access to the funky restaurants and boutiques as well as the metro to uptown and Brooklyn.The hotel is boutique and does not have all of the usual services on site. However, fitness, gyms, etc.. are available for guest use. It has a neighbourhood feel and fits in well with its location. The afternoon drinks in the lobby are a nice perk. We stayed in a Neighbourhood King Room which was well designed and set out. It had views over Kenmare and was low enough to allow people watching up and down the street. The room had a sexy feel to it with a glass shower open to the room. It also has a curtain and separate wc for the more modest. The room had adequate shelf and cupboard space. Despite being on level 3 the room was relatively quiet. There was some noise but you are NYC so what else could you expect?The staff were friendly and helpful. All requests were addressed quickly.We would stay again.

I booked this hotel based on all the great reviews, so I guess I had high expectations! Let me start by saying that nothing went terribly wrong, but several things were just middle of the road (based on other hotels of comparable standard & pricing): the wi-fi only worked in half of the room so I had to bring a chair in front of the front door, the aircon wasn't cold enough (thank goodness for the additional fan) and the room and the bed were pretty small for two people (I kept on hitting the base of the bed, which became painful by the end of the week!). Lastly, the restaurant was one of the most expensive in the area, for no apparent reason. On the upside, the staff was considerate, and I loved the area.

My boyfriend and I stayed here last week and absolutely loved our time. The hotel is clean, fresh and modern looking. I definitely recommend getting a corner room, it had great views of the city and streets. The rooftop had great views of the city and it was actually really nice that there wasn't a bar up there. The seating was nice and they even had a yoga class up there one of the nights we were there. The staff was really friendly and very helpful. There was such a nice laid back vibe to the place. We'd definitely stay there again. The huge bathtub was a plus as well. My boyfriend is 6'3" and he fit perfectly stating "I haven't taken a bath where I fit in the tub in years--this is awesome." I'd say the only thing I wasn't thrilled about was the restaurant downstairs--the food wasn't that great especially compared to all the amazing food located right down the street. I loved being so close to Little Italy.

Pro1. Clean2. Vey friendly staff3. Very comfortable beds and pillows4. Good neighborhood Con1. Small rooms2. AC is either full blast or off - so room temperature constantly veered from hot to cold3. AC had complicated programming system so AC would kick on at 3 am set at 60 degrees4. Closet light was motion activated but kept turning on and off randomly - usually after @ 6 - 9 seconds5. Internet was often slow

My wife and I stayed here for three days. The hotel is new from the ground up and very ingeniously designed in a minimalist style that is very efficient. Our room on the 8th floor had a functioning balcony with a direct view of Midtown and the Empire State and Chysler buildings. Kenmare is simply an extension of Delancey which leads directly to the Williamsburg Bridge, a beautiful sight all lit up at night. And you can view it all up on the 10th floor roof, which is easy to access and set up for visitors. The staff are well-trained and truly enjoy their jobs and the guests. Each night there is a free happy hour from 5-7 pm with wine, cheese, assorted fruits and nuts and crackers. The rates are quite reasonable for what you get, and I like the Euro-feel of the place. The location is close to fine dining and easy walks to The Village or longer ones Battery Park, which took about 45 minutes. We will definitely return to the Nolitan.

The Nolitan is in the Bowery, close to Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. It's a great place to escape to after a day hitting the pavement and battling the crowds. The subway lines are a 10 minute walk, the Brooklyn bridge is a short walk as well. It's a cool, laid back hotel with fabulous non pretentious staff who make you feel like a part of the family. Nothing is a trouble. If traffic noise is a problem or you are a light sleeper, ask for a room on the 7th or 8th floor. The room size for our king was spacious and the bathroom really large by NYC standards. Plenty of amazing restaurants and off the beaten track places to eat across the street (Butcher's daughter) and on nearby Mott Street near Kenmare, Fiat Cafe, also one of NYC's best kept deli secrets on Mott north of Kenmare St, the chicken schnitzel sandwich is the size of a dinner plate! The hotel does complementary wine, champagne and nibbles between 5-7pm, they have cruiser bikes for guests to use and the doorman is a nice touch for such a small hotel. One note, they do not have water so BYO. Whole foods is a 5 minute walk but you have to pass the Bowery men's shelter to get there which can be a tad seedy after 6pm. Soho is now so full of tourists, you get the feeling the Bowery is where the locals eat, drink and hang out. What a wonderful area, truly authentic NYC.

All in all a great choice for staying in New York. I have stayed at The Nolitan twice and i am very satisfied. Excellent location in the heart of Nolita. Staff is attentive and the free wine and cheese servings in the late afternoon is appreciated. The downside is that there is terrible confusion over what is included in the breakfast vouchers. The waiters give mixed answers and the front desk staff doesn't know either. I ended up being overcharged for several days. Something I didn't realize until I came back home.The fans in the bathroom/toilet is very noisy and is automatically turned on when you switch on the light, quite disturbing!The fitness center is not located on the hotel itself..

I kind of hate to share what a sweet little hidden gem this place is. The rooms are small but VERY comfortable and well planned. Located in Nolita (North of Little Italy) and in a great location. Walking distance to SoHo, Chinatown, Tribeca...literally everywhere and close to subway. The staff are so helpful and friendly! They have a rooftop deck with gorgeous views of the city. The inhouse restaurant was awesome. This venue serves "sips and savories" from 5-7 each nite, which is comp wine or bubbly and cheese and crackers. I would highly recommend this but afraid the next time I visit I won't be able to get in!

This hotel is in the warehouse district, and you guessed it, it's an old warehouse remodelled into a boutique hotel. It's a trendy type of hotel and apparently is in the top 15 of New York hotels. The staff are extremely helpful and courteous. In our room the toilet was in one room, and the sink and shower in another. The shower had a glass window looking out to the bedroom, presumably so you can see the view out the window while you shower. There is a curtain that can be drawn for shy folks. The ceiling in the toilet and bathroom are left bare concrete as though to show what's been done to the rooms. We had a balcony where we could get some New York air if we wanted. The room was nicely air conditioned or heated as the weather warranted. There was a bar and closets with umbrellas, iron, and hair dryer. The only quibble I had was that the amenities such as shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion seemed to be dried out since I couldn't get anything out of the bottles. A small thing. The hotel is 2 short blocks from Little Italy where there are wonderful restaurants. I wonder if the location close to little Italy has something to do with the name of the hotel? The is also a rooftop garden where there are magnificent views of New York, night or day. We stayed 2 nights here and would gladly come back.

I don't really know where to begin. My trip to New York was designed to be the trip of a lifetime. What I didn't count on was that the Nolitan would be such a cornerstone of such an amazing trip. The perfect location just on the edge of the village meant that evening strolls, morning brunches and brilliant little shops were the order of the lazy days when you felt lazy. Or the proximity to the bustling city meant that within a few blocks you were right in the heart of the noise and excitement. The staff were excellent yet barley noticeable. My room was simply amazing - I could look out to the Empire State building from my SHOWER ! Every morning I had intended to nip out and get a different breakfast, however after day one and my main man Carlos looking after me I sat in and had breakfast the in great little restaurant every day, watching the traffic drift by and enjoying the low winter sun. Then I would take a coffee up to the roof top terrace, soak in NY city, then go out for the day. Every night was an absolute pleasure coming back to the Nolitan. Whether it was to crash out on the bed (after checking the forecast card on my pillow every night) of relax with a drink in the bar. The mood, the vibe and the general atmosphere at the Nolitan hypnotically soothes you and just puts you in a fantastic frame of mind. No wonder this place has such great reviews. Like nearly everyone who has stayed here I was reluctant to leave. What should have been the trip of a lifetime actually has become a quest.......how can I get back to NY and how can I get back to the Nolitan. BTW I still have the complimentary slippers almost 9 months on !!Thank you Nolitan x

This hotels excels for 2 reasons; first it is perfect. It is an unfussy, modern and extremely comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff. If you don't like your hotels to remind you of the 1980s (or even earlier) this is the hotel for you. Secondly, it's location. This hotel is located next to a huge array of fantastic shops, bars, restaurants. Having visited midtown New York whilst we stayed, we realised that staying in lower Manhattan was definitely the better choice. There's more of a vibe and tons happening, day & night. We would definitely stay here again!

We stayed for nine nights at the Nolitan in May and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel and staff.Firstly, and importantly for us, this purpose built boutique hotel has great soundproofing between walls and floors - so, no real noise from other guests/rooms. Sure, NYC is one noisy city, and the constant outside noise does seep in through the double glazing, but that's just part of being in Manhattan. If you're bothered by horns, traffic, sirens etc, I'd say go for a room on one of the top floors without a balcony (you'll also get the views over Manhattan to the Empire State from there). We tried both rooms with, and without balconies, and although the balcony is fun, it does give you a little less room space and it's a tad noisier. Anyway, the roof terrace is a fab spot for taking in the panoramic Manhattan skyline, so no need for a balcony really.The rooms are cleverly designed in a sleek, minimalist style with lots of concrete, white paint, muted tones and glass. The generous sized shower and separate toilet are nicely integrated into the room design. Air con is a bit noisy (a couple of other guests complained to us about that) but we only needed to use the overhead fan, so no problem for us. Overall, the staff were fabulous, and just on the right side of chatty while maintaining a high level of professionalism.The hotel also offers a free cocktail hour between 5-7pm in the foyer which is a great way to meet other guests and chat with the friendly and helpful staff. You can also grab your drink and some snacks and head up to the roof terrace which was never busy.The best recommendation I can give is that when we're next in Manhattan, we'll stay at the Nolitan.

Nolitan is a lovely boutique hotel. Really enjoyed the view of the Empire States Building from my room. Very friendly front desk. Lots of wonderful restaurants in close proximity! Will definitely be back

I had a hard time choosing a hotel in NYC because I was afraid we would pay a lot of money for a place that didn't have enough room to be functional or was in a horrible location. I got a balcony room at Nolitan because I wanted to have a bit more space and a reasonably view in a fun part of town without breaking the bank. I definitely got that. The rooms are small but were laid out so that everything was functionally usable and the separate WC is a huge win. The balcony itself was very tiny although it had a fun view. But the real reason to get it is that those rooms are slightly larger and if we'd had a smaller room it would have been harder to move around by far. The staff at the Nolitan were very helpful and friendly. They handled normal requests and special requests in general but there were a couple of oddities in the service (the paper we asked for wasn't delivered the first couple days, the pillows that we asked for were delivered on first ask, and turn down service only happened some nights). With a bit of additional organization the staff could easily provide an outstanding experience because these were exceptions to their great service and I assume were simply oversights. The location here is fantastic - Nolita is a really fun neighborhood and I'd say it was our favorite for walking around. Our next favorites (east village and west village) were not far at all and overall I felt like we had great access to great restaurants. It will take you an average of 20 - 25 minutes to get up to the major attractions like central park, theaters, etc. But it was worth it to stay in such a fun area. Please note that this is a hotel with a modern look - if you want traditional notions of luxury you won't find them here. I'd be happy to stay at this hotel again if I get a chance to visit.

My wife and I stayed here in the fall, we had been to every great hotel north of 40th and decided to change it up and stay in soho. What a great experience, from the moment we checked in to the wine and cheese social every afternoon. The service was amazing, decent size rooms for ny and a great atmosphere. The area was perfect foe exploring, shopping and Entertainment and it was the first time in NYC that I didn't spend uptown or midtown. I would highly recommend

For my trip to NYC last year, I thought I'd stay in an area of the city that I had not yet ventured into. The somewhat gritty, trendy and rapidly gentrifying Lower East Side definitely qualified as such. Seeing as the Nolitan borders NoLIta/SoHo and the LES, I figured the hotel would make an excellent gateway to this section of the city. And I was right. Like most things in New York, so many things were within walking distance of the hotel. Not to mention that it's a quick walk to either the Bowery Station (J,Z trains) or the Spring Street Station (6 train) to ride the subway to all points up and down Manhattan. The hotel itself is gorgeous from the outside. It's a fairly new hotel, and the architecture stands out in contrast to its neighbors. The hotel lobby is very simple and modern and lends itself well to the rest of exterior and to the rooms. Now the rooms are definitely cozy. For anyone that is visiting New York for the first time, a room like this would be a shock to your system. But seeing how it's New York, rooms of such small size are more common than not. Even with myself just traveling alone, it was a little of an adjustment for someone with a fairly large suitcase. That being said, the rooms are very functional, and designed well with somewhat of an industrial feel to it. The bed was very comfortable and the overall cleanliness of the room was superb. The coolest part of my room by far was the bathroom. The bathroom is very good size considering the overall size of the room. A completely glass wall separated the shower from the bed, which means you can see into the shower from the bed, and vice versa. I could definitely see how that would be a perk for couples. I made sure I chose a room with a balcony (whenever I can get one for not that much more money in the city, I go for it!), which overlooked Kenmare Street. Kenmare is a pretty busy street since it leads up to Delancey Street and the Williamsburg Bridge. Even considering that though, the room was fairly quiet and getting a sound sleep was not a problem at all. If you do stay at the hotel, definitely head up to the rooftop to get an amazing view of the financial district and of the Williamsburg bridge. As far as eats, the sky is the limit. After all, you're right next to Little Italy and only a block away from Lombardi's Pizza! If you choose to dine in at Cantine Parisienne, in the front corner of the hotel, you will not be disappointed. Excellent quality at very reasonable prices. And if I ever needed to make a quick run to the store for snacks/toiletries, there's a Duane Reade right next to the Spring St. subway station. Overall, I felt that this was an excellent stay. For a couple heading to the city for the weekend for a quick getaway or someone on business looking to explore the up and coming neighborhood of NoLIta, I would highly recommend this hotel. I probably wouldn't recommend it for families or for people visiting the city for the first time. There are cheaper and more attraction accessible options.

Our first stay in this area of Manhattan. A snapshot: great (friendly) customer service; we enjoyed the wine and h'ordeuvres in the lobby from 5 to 7 p.m. (every day except Sunday). Our room was on the 7th floor and we loved the view of the Empire State Bldg., the Chrysler Bldg., etc. The room was the typical NYC size but with the clear shower walls separating the sink area from the bedroom gave the illusion was that the room was larger. The hotel is within walking distance to many shops, restaurants, Chinatown, the Museum at Eldridge Street, the Tenement Museum, the Brooklyn Bridge, etc. Bring ear plugs for the late night car horns. Don't miss the rooftop view! The bed was very comfortable but beware of the platform w/ square corners (we wacked our shins on them). There are many extras for the traveler. I think that the hotel is a great addition to the neighborhood. Overall, we'd be happy to return.
user_name:
Diane E
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: If you're looking for something traditional or a corporate style hotel then the Nolitan isn't for you. It's styling may not be to everyone's tastes and will probably date in less than a decade but right now the minimilism, and mix of industrial materials with more traditional has a style which is fashionable and looks the part. On the whole I liked but couldn't help wonder whether the fashion for bare concrete ceilings in the bedroom suited the hotelier's pockets more than it did me.I had Cityscape Balcony Room (7th floor) and found it quite spacious and very clean. The open plan arrangement makes best use of the space and although having the toilet and bathroom on either side of the entry may bother some it didn't bother me. I imagine many people don't use the balcony, which is only about 3ft wide with a bench, but I enjoyed rested up with a beer after a hard days sightseeing, watching the bustle below. Having paid extra to be on floors 7-9 the promised view was a little disappointing. I suspect you really need to be on 8 or 9. It was also a shame that a 3/4 of the window was semi-opaque as well - if I wanted privacy I could close the curtain. However, the roof is amazing with near 360 view including Empire State and WTC tower one. The bed was probably the best I've slept in at a hotel, although Kenmare Street is quite busy and I wouldn't have wanted to be on one of the lower floors. On the seventh, it was just about OK but light sleepers might near ear plugs.Location is excellent. Little Italy, China Town and Nolita are virtually on your doorstep. Access to the rest of Manhattan is easy with three metro lines just a few blocks away. Bowery Street, one block away provides a link to JFK and parts of downtown though not much else (I never used it). Spring Street and Grand Street provide your main choice of routes to Uptown and Downtown and are both four short blocks away. Whatever you do. Have the pancakes for breakfast. They are the simply magnificent.

This little boutique hotel is upscale and easily accessible from the subway from Grand Central. Very modern feel, clean and nice. We had a little balcony that you could go out on for fresh air and city view. The name makes it obvious that it is in Nolita, north of Little Italy. My only negative was that the bed was very stiff and not very comfortable. Could use a pillow top or foam topper to soften it. They had cashmere throws at the end of the bed. The price was not bad, especially considering the timing overlapped NYU's graduation. Purchased an Evian water by accident as it was kind of a hidden item on their mini bar menu. At $6.75 I would have just had tap water.

I was quite disappointed with my stay at the Nolitan. There appears to be a strong focus on the design aspect of the hotel but this is not matched by the customer service or consideration to delivering an excellent customer service experience. On the positive side, the rooms are nice and spacious, look very slick and are comfortable. This is a big plus. On the downside, there was a live band in the restaurant on the Sunday night we stayed. The band played music very loud and was going until after midnight. The band also kicked off again in the early hours of the morning. This kept us awake. We were then awake at 5.30am in the morning with loud music being played throughout the hotel. We had to ask staff to turn the music down as most people like to sleep at 5.30am. The internet was patchy and kept kicking us off wifi. We had to ask the staff to reset the system. This was particularly frustrating as my partner and I were using the system to enter information which we had to repeatedly re-enter due to the problems with the internet. When checking out and leaving the hotel, there was no offer of assistance with flagging down a cab. So consequently, we decided not to tip the staff downstairs. As I say, the design of the hotel looks great but the service and attention to detail by the staff left my partner and I unimpressed. A hotel that looks this good should have more focus on delivering a great experience.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and wished we had stayed longer! Our room on the 7th floor had a balcony and we woke up to a view of the Empire State and the Chrysler buildings which was fantastic. All the staff were so polite and helpful. Dilan in particular was great and suggested a great place for a massage in Chinatown. The housekeeping staff were also great and extremely efficient when we accidentally smashed a glass in the room.The complimentary cheese and wine in the later afternoons was a real bonus and we took or drinks to the roof terrace to really enjoy the panoramic views of the city. Although we didn't eat in the adjoining restaurant we did have drinks there on our last night where they had a Brazilian love band playing! Overall a really great hotel with great staff. Felt far more personal than the big hotels and we loved the many boutique shops and restaurants all very close by. We will return!

Just spent 6 nights at the Nolitan. Amazing hotel in an awesome location. We stayed on the 6th floor the room was large and spacious with beautiful decor and very clean. The hotel staff were great, friendly and always available to help. The rooftop area was amazing with great views of NYC. The free wine and cheese from 5-7pm was fantastic and a great touch. The Nolita area is awesome with great bars and restaurants. We will defiantly be returning to the Nolitan. Thank you so much for making our stay in NYC so wonderful.

We arrived in the pouring rain having flown in from San Francisco, and the hotel had sprung a leak from the roof and water had made it's way down through several rooms and into the lobby. First they offered to move us to another hotel for the night as our room had a leaky bathroom, and then to upgrade us to the suite the following day. We opted to stay the night anyway, and got upgraded the following day. The suite was fantastic and we really appreciated the gesture, so thanks guys. This is a great neighbourhood hotel in a great where you can bed down and sample the many buzzy eateries nearby, but the reason I'm writing the review is because the staff were so friendly and accommodating.

My two daughters and I just spent five days in NYC and stayed at the Nolitan. We were very happy with our choice for several reasons. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. There was always someone at the desk to answer questions or help with suggestions. The atmosphere was hip and young and professional. The room was spotless, very modern and the beds were great! Trouble getting out of them in the morning! Because of circumstances we ended up needing a cot in our city scape room and even then it was roomy enough. The bathroom was large with a good shower. While the air conditioner unit was noisy it was a constant thing and we didn't notice it. For two this room would have been very comfortable. The rooftop was a great spot. What an incredible view! and the happy hour bubbly and snacks were a nice break after busy days. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on that. Nolita itself was wonderful. It reminded me of Europe. We walked everywhere and found everything from a sports bar for the hockey game to Karyokee to wonderful cafe's and wine bars, restaurant, shopping.... This was our fourth trip to NYC and we would definitely repeat the trip we just had. (King Corner room next time)Thank you Nolitan staff for a great stay!

We stayed at the Nolitan for one night and loved it. The rooms were clean and beautiful, service was fantastic. The hotel bar was amazing, and breakfast the next day terrific. We ordered off the menu. I loved being on a busy street, we had a balcony with a view of the empire state building and loved the hustle and bustle below. We preferred being in the area vs midtown. We explored only blocks away, Nolita, Soho, little Italy, China town etc. Great food all close by. We liked that locals ate at the restaurant which made it very diverse and interesting.

Spent a long weekend at the Nolitan. Lovely hotel, amazing location, cozy and fun room. There was some street noise and the air conditioning unit was quite noisy and difficult to configure. Closet light with movement detector was malfunctioning a bit. We expected the hotel room to contain breakfast based on previous comments on the web and by reading the booklet in the room, but apparently they have changed the policy and room prices do not include breakfast by default anymore. Other than these details, we had great stay.

I stayed for a night in this hotel. The room was nice and comfortable. The amenities are good and the the location is good. Wish the building had more floors so that you could chose higher floor to avoid evening traffic noise. Perfect place for business travel.
user_name:
Tarun S
New York City, New York

review_body: Let me start by saying the staff was very friendly and helpful. I loved the feel of the rooms and the hotel itself. The rooftop deck was really great. It was such a fun way to see the city. It was close to a ton of great restaurants/bars as well as shopping.However, I don't think I'll stay again. This is mainly due to the hotel's location. When I booked a room, I saw that there was a subway station about a block away. I didn't think about checking which subway line ran through the area. It was the J which will only take you further downtown or into Brooklyn. If you wanted to go uptown (to see a show, central park, museums, 'touristy' places) you had to walk about 4 blocks. This wasn't terrible, it just wasn't completely convenient. I actually ended up just taking a cab home from midtown most nights (about a $14 ride). It's on a busy street. Even on the 9th floor with the windows shut we still heard traffic all night. That happens in most places in New York. Finally, the room we had initially booked was flooded. So we had to downgrade. The hotel gave us a free bottle of champagne. That was nice, but I feel like when I've had similar things happen at other hotels I was comped for a night or was given a free meal at the hotel restaurant. Obviously the situation was unavoidable for them -I don't fault them for having a flooded room - but I was disappointed about not getting the room I had booked.If you're looking for an interesting and different neighborhood, I would definitely suggest this hotel. I'll probably stick to a place that is a bit more convenient for getting to all of Manhattan.

Spent 1 week for vacation with my wife. If you're tuned into Soho and Nolita's cool vibe this hotel is a great choice. It's very modern - in terms of design and mindset about what makes a great stay. It's a smart choice, with fair rates - but surprisingly it doesn't feel like an 'economy' hotel it once you're there - that's because the make the choices about what they should (and shouldn't) have. Yes: great rooms / confy bed. Yes: design! Yes: great location. Yes: super friendly and efficient staff. No: pool, sauna, gym and thing's like business centre. No: room service - but they facilitate delivery from the local restaurants (good ones around), what ends up being even better than room service.
user_name:
zelucas
São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

review_body: So we came back to the Nolitan for a quick weekend/weekday getaway to the city.We stayed in one of the Mezzanine Rooms on the 2nd floor. We were pleasantly surprised at how silent the room was especially being so close to the street. We live in Upstate NY and it was quieter in our hotel roomthan our home! The staff was awesome as usual. Always friendly and ready to offer assistance.The location is perfect. It couldn't be more convenient to everythingwe want to do on our weekend getaways to the city. Shopping, food, museums...Plus is... the hotel is not far from Chinatown, which if you're driving a car like us,there are super reasonable parking lots nearby! Can't wait to go back for our next weekend getaway.
user_name:
Douliketotravel
New York City, New York

review_body: Warm and welcoming staff, great rooftop terrace for breakfast, drinks or dinner, downstairs restaurant very popular and rightly so, try for room 4 - worth the extra for views and space - overall thoroughly recommended, can't think of one downside!

The Nolitan is perfect. Yes, the rooms are small, but unless you are planning a party in it, it doesn't matter. Well furnished, good toiletries - although they really should double the quantity - and nice robes and towels. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and knowledgeable about places to eat and drink locally. And Nolita is such a great place to stay if you want to see a really fun part of the city. Easy access to the subway in Spring Street for trips uptown and further downtown. The roof is open to guests but the bar isn't finished yet - amazing views. We would definitely stay again, and thanks to Aliye and the reservations staff for all their help.

We spent a week during Easter in Nolitan hotel and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is really well situated in NoLita which is super close to all the restaurants and shops that the area and Soho has to offer. The staff was really helpful with everything and the free drinks and cheese every afternoon was a delight! The rooms are fresh and modern and especially the rooms up from 6th floor have a wonderful view to the Empire State Building. There is a roof top terrace as well from where you have a good view to the city and both down- and uptown and to Williamsburg Bridge. I would highly recommend hotel for anyone going to NYC and especially if you are in town for shopping and dining as everything is very conveniently located.

The Nolitan was a great experience....I spent two nights here on my way home from a business trip.First up the location can't be beat right in the heart of trendy Nolita. The hotel is cool but in an unpretentious way, the lobby is excellent, modern, full of books and newspapers and place you feel comfortable hanging out in.The rooms were compact, but very modern and well designed, there was lots of natural light. I was on the third floor and had no issues with the street noise, they must have triple glazed the windows as the room was very quiet. There was a full mini-bar as well.I didn't use the restaurant.So there is no room service as such instead they have menus from restaurants around the areas so you make a call and the food comes directly from the restaurant of your choice and there were about 20 restaurants to chose from....I didn't use it because hey its New York so its not like there is a short supply of eating options in the city. But still an excellent idea.The only negatives were the fans in the toilet and the bathroom, plus the heater seemed exceptionally loud, they all worked perfectly but very loud. Also another minor point is that there was construction happening in the hotel during the day, it would have been nice to be told on check in as is usually the case with exceptional hotels...also the gym is 5 blocks away which is a bit inconvenient, especially if the weather is not so great......still these are very minor, picky faults with a very very nice hotel.The price as well was very reasonable considering it was the Easter weekend and the cities reputation for expensive accommodation.Highly recommended.

My daughter and I spent 3 nights here in April. The room at first seemed small but is designed very well and we ended up doing just fine with the space we had. We had a queen room no balcony but large windows and a great view. I would recommend getting a room with a balcony. The location is great if you want to be able to walk to restaurants and shops nearby. Subway stop is a few blocks away. Check out Fiat cafe for breakfast or Bread Nolita for dinner. The hotel has a rooftop bar and would be great for summer fun. They also had a wine reception in the afternoons that was nice to come back to after a day out. I would recommend this hotel for those who do not mind being away from the center of tourist attractions. Priced well, we will stay here again. The staff were friendly enough but could have been a little more polished.

Stayed here in mid march during NYs cold snap. First up, the location of this hotel is great if you want to be close to LES, Soho, and the surrounding areas. Its also super convenient if you're looking to hit up Brooklyn. The neighborhood is awesome, with some great boutiques and amazing eating spots.The hotel itself was a pleasant surprise - it's price range would indicate something smaller and basic, but I found the rooms to be some of the larger I've stayed in in NYC, the amenities in the room are fabulous, and the bed was ridiculously comfortable. Concierge was super helpful in helping me track down a particular store (Raleigh Denim, 5 minutes walk away) as well as giving me eating options outside of the hotel (the French Brasserie is very good however, get the club sandwich), and the whole experience was one of the better ones I've had in New York. Get away from Midtown and the chain hotels, and head here for something refreshingly simple but well executed. Highly recommended and will stay again.

We stayed at the Nolitan for 5 nights in February, what a great hotel! Great Location! We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building which was lit Red for Valentines Day. The room was very well equipped, quiet, clean and the bed was super comfy. The staff were friendly and very very helpful. They even went out and pick up chinese takeaway for us one night when we were exhausted from walking all day. I would be happy to recommend it to friends and very happy to stay there again. The happy hour with complimentary cheese and wine for the guests every evening was a really nice touch. We had a lunch and a breakfast in the restaurant and it was reasonably priced and tastyMy only negative points would be that the town car they arranged to take us back to JFK was crappy&old and the champagne and rose petals (that were a surprise from my husband) weren't there and when we were getting ready to go for dinner the guy knocked on the door brandishing the roses and champagne so the surprise was spoilt.

I've stayed at the hotel several times and it's always a pleasure to return. Usually I'm on business but this was a short vacation in the city and the first time my wife had accompanied me. For business I've stayed in the front facing cityscape and neighbourhood rooms - all have been great. However as it was a vacation and there were two of us we wanted more space and loved the idea of the suite on the 8th floor. You get three distinct areas; bedroom, living room and bathroom but the hotel's kept it pretty open plan so it feels spacious - especially by NYC standards. You also benefit from the floor to ceiling windows (some of which are opaque - allowing the light through but offering privacy). There's a great free standing bath in the middle of the suite which affords fantastic views of the city skyline including the Empire State building. The staff are incredibly welcoming and create a relaxed atmosphere which is best experienced in the lobby living room where the hotel has a complimentary wine and cheese reception every day between 5-7. It was a good chance to meet some of the staff and other guests - we got a few good dinner/lunch recommendations for some of the neighbourhood restaurants.In terms of location the hotel's worked well for business and this trip proved it works equally well for sightseeing. Both Spring St and Bowery subway stations are only a few minutes walk from the hotel and offer pretty good connections. We made it down to Wall St in 15 minutes and from there it's a short walk to Battery Park for the Statue of Liberty. Getting up town (especially East side) to the museum's is pretty straight forward from Spring St. And for shopping we literally strolled into SoHo.The Nolitan's in house restaurant was buzzing on each of our 4 nights - we can testify that the food, cocktails and wine were all up to scratch; the staff were helpful and knowledgeable about what was on offer. We also noticed that many of the guests appeared to be from outside the hotel which helped to remove the sterile feeling that often accompanies many hotel restaurants.What could have been better? Two more days to chill and better weather! But neither were the hotel's fault - and they did try to assist us through the downpours with their umbrellas.

My daughter and I spent four nights at the Nolitan last week.Everything was perfect. We had a sixth-floor king room, which was totally quiet. It was spotless. The staff provided a cot for my daughter's friend for two nights. Also, they brought a cupcake to our room for my daughter's birthday.It was fun looking out over the city from our corner room. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, as well.I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. Oh, and the location is perfect .... you can get to Soho, Chinatown, and the Lower East Side in minutes.

I loved staying at the Nolitan. It was perfectly branded and perfectly clean. And the staff were the nicest of any hotel I've ever stayed in. They even had happy hour with wines and champagnes and cheeses. Highly recommend.

We decided to book with Nolitan hotel for a weekend honeymoon. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to the suite!! What a treat! It was gorgeous, comfortable, classy and a beautiful city view. The room design was top notch. The deep bath tub is especially nice after walking around all day. We were also treated to a complimentary bottle of bubbly. The staff were lovely and you couldn't ask for a better location. We hope to return one day!!

Its clean it's neat and it's quiet. The rooms are very warm and cozy and the stuff was extremely friendly. Add to that a well located establishment near the Soho and you have everything you need from a nice boutique hotel in NYC. I love it!

We stayed for five nights. Everything about the fittings and design of the rooms in this hotel is amazing and been given a lot of attention and thought. The balcony with city view and the complimentary glass of wine in reception lounge each evening are really good bonuses. The hotel location is excellent - close to bars, restaurants and good shopping. It's near Williamsburg Bridge if you want to get a cab to Brooklyn for a change of scene. The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful - amongst the nicest staff I've come across in a hotel in a long time. We ate breakfast in the restaurant a couple of days during our stay and it was very good quality, and service was fine. But make sure you also check out Jack's Wife Freda on nearby Lafayette Street as they had an amazing breakfast menu.

I recently stayed at the Nolitan and was very pleased. Here's a recap:Pros: 1. Location - The Hotel in located in the Nolita area, just north of Little Italy. It within walking distance to the great shopping in Soho and boutiques in Nolita. There are also a ton of dining and drinking options in the area.2. Staff - Everyone was friendly and helpful. They helped me with any questions I had and helped me book a car to the airport.3. Room - The rooms are decoarted in a chic modern industrial style. The bed was also very comfortable and clean.Cons:The rooms are a bit small, but standard for New York.All in all, I wouldn't hesitate staying there again.

I really loved all of the little touches at the Nolitan. Everything from how it was decorated, to the glass showers (but separate toilet room) and the little chocolates on our bed when we first got there. The room was always impeccably clean and restocked so the staff did a great job. They offer a complimentary rental of an iPad, xbox 360 or even a bicycle! All you have to do is ask :) We had a nice view of the Empire State building and the Williamsburg bridge. We enjoyed just sitting outside and drinking New York in :) It's also close to great restaurants like Rubirosa. My one complaint was with the parking garage they unfortunately associate with. Not only did they steal some money but they also broke some of our belongings that we left in our car. I'd recommend parking elsewhere.

This hotel is WONDERFUL!!! I had my wedding there and me, my (now) husband and our guest stayed and we could not have asked for better. The rooms were brilliant, the staff was so kind and helpful and the location was perfect. I am rubbish at planning and they helped with every last detail, even booking our manicures and make-up appointments and handling all my stressed out scheduling mishaps. The wedding was amazing and our stay was brilliant!!! We definitely plan to stay again!!!

I read many positive reviews on this hotel and thought it would be a great weekend staycation. Not sure if I am just used to the trendy chic NYC restaurants and hotels, but this place felt fake. It had a nice facade and rooms were fine, but it lacked sophistication. Service was ok, nothing special. Air conditioner was loud and annoying. Rooms felt like it was on its way to getting dated and worn. I guess I am glad I stayed in it before it went totally down hill. Overall, it is disappointing and I will not return.
