Amber S
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for four days while visiting New York and we couldn't have been happier with our choice. Location is really central and the staff were excellent - extremely pleasant and helpful. The rooms are small but I didn't really expect them to be bigger. At the same time they are trendy and spotless and the hotel itself is in an excellent location just beside Little Italy. Overall, we had a great experience and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Almost don't want to share this amazing hotel in my favorite location because I want it all to myself! Great experience & extremely nice service! Thanks Jennifer for saving my husband & I when we were stranded at LGA w/an upgrade & complimentary bottle of wine! Yaaaay!

I detest NYC. But alas I often have to visit the city for work. The first time my boss sent me there I stayed at the Nolitan and now I make that a condition of my travel. This hotel is amazing! Most hotels have the same boring decor and generic staff. The Nolitan is simply beautiful and the staff is stellar!

I wish I could be writing this review about our stay at the property, but the weather has not cooperated and we had to cancel. I feel the need to write about Joy in reservations. She was amazing to speak with. She was friendly and genuinely seemed disappointed that we were not coming. I have never experienced this before - she made me want to visit the Nolitan as soon as possible another time. She described how great the neighborhood is and all the things to do when we do make it up. I am looking forward to visiting when the weather gets a bit better and meeting Joy and the other staff at this property. I was truly impressed.

Super cool, hip hotel. Fabulous position. Great staff at the front desk, great rooms, great roof terrace. A really special place to stay. Only downside is the cafe which is very unorganised, run by disinterested staff and a very poor reflection of the Nolitan. My advice would be to walk across the street to the butchers daughter (recommendation of the staff) for a delicious breakfast. Overall, great place to stay.

The Nolitan Hotel must be one of the hippest places to stay in New York City. My partner and I were looking for something pretty central with enough to keep us occupied indoors if the weather got bad. The Nolitan might be small but it is just a sensational place to stay, and it ticked all the boxes for us.Our arrival was smoothly handled by Dhillon and the rest of the reception staff, all of whom were young, friendly, professional and helpful without descending into over-casual or over-familiar. A good balance. We managed to arrive at happy hour and chilled glasses of bubbly were pressed into our hands as we checked in.Our room was pretty small – I’ve only seen smaller in Japan – but beautifully appointed and with little touches like excellent quality toiletries and red slippers and robes and plenty of storage and hanging space and good lighting. We didn't have a kettle in the room (being serious tea drinkers a kettle is essential for us) but one call to reception got us a very stylish kettle (of course) and some mugs. So just ask!We had a perfect view of the uptown skyline including the Empire State Building decked out in its red and green Christmas colours – ask for a north-facing room on a high floor. We didn’t have a balcony – some rooms do and some don’t. The balconies are tiny in any case, but in warmer weather it might be nice to ask for one.As mentioned, happy hour starts around 6pm until 8pm and you can chill out in the leather seats at reception quaffing really rather decent red, white and sparkling wine and nibbling on cheese and crackers and nuts. A nice time to relax before heading on out for a busy night in the Village.Wifi is free and the signal is strong in the rooms and at reception.As mentioned before, the staff were all great and couldn’t do enough for us. There is a restaurant on site but we didn’t eat there, just had a drink at the bar. You can borrow a PlayStation if you want to stay in, or a skateboard if you want to get around the neighbourhood a little more quickly. There are countless great places to eat and drink nearby – just walk out the door and into whatever place takes your fancy. They’re all great. But don’t miss the Bowery Diner just a couple of blocks away on Bowery Street. A sensational modern diner – and the bloody Marys and mimosas at breakfast are a great pick-me-up after a heavy night.Can’t imagine staying anywhere else in New York when we come back again next year. Oh –and don’t miss the rooftop terrace with 360 degree views of the best skyline in the world!

Nolita is a great neighborhood and this classy, stylish boutique hotel is right in the heart of everything. Trendy shops and restaurants, Little Italy, Soho, and subway stops are all within a few minutes walk - which is perfect on a freezing January day! Very helpful and friendly front desk. Don't miss their restaurant - Cantine Parisienne. We had a delicious brunch that was surprisingly inexpensive.
user_name:
NYPNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: I thought this hotel was great! Stayed here Christmas/ New Year, and everything about it is great. The location is perfect. The subway is close and there are numerous cafes restaurants and trendy shops nearby. Mulberry St is close and Broadway not too far to walk. Soho and other interesting neighbourhoods in easy walking distance.The staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms are very nice, I did not find noise from the street to be disturbing at all, and the beds are very comfortable. The room was also a good size. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary: There are a lot of enthusiastic reviews posted here. Just be advised that there are some differences with this property that you might want to know about ahead of time. This is a good hotel. Not great, not bad. You must know that the rooms are very small, and the HVAC system is loud (fan noise). On the plus side, you can often find a good price if you are flexible, it is a clean hotel, it seems safe, and it is well located.Review: I was attracted to the Nolitan, oddly, because the Butcher’s Daughter restaurant is located across the street. It is a good find, and I might stay at the Nolitan again.As to the negative, the first is that the rooms are very, very small. The hallways are exceptionally narrow and dark. Or, I should say, lightly lit. When the fan for the HVAC comes on in your room, it is loud. I actually never did get a good night’s sleep because several times an hour, the blower came on and awakened me. Ear plugs helped a bit.The Nolitan can be pricey, but if you are flexible, you can find a reasonable price. It is never inexpensive.Here are the plusses: a comfortable lobby, there are some excellent staff members that work the front desk, WIFI is available at no extra cost, it is located nicely to access fun neighborhoods like Nolita and SoHo, and also to access lots of fun restaurants (try Butcher’s Daughter, Taim, Rubirosa, Hampton Chutney, Baltazar, etc.). I love that it is very clean. I always felt comfortable at the Nolitan.I wish Trip Advisor would allow fractions on its star rating. If it would, I’d give the Nolitan Hotel 3.5 stars.

From the moment we checked in our stay was amazing. The staff was friendly and helpful, the decor was warm yet stylish and the location was perfect - close to the subway and an easy walk to shopping, restaurants etc. I've worked in the hospitality industry for years so it's hard to impress me, and the staff truly did just that.We were greeted with a bottle of wine and a hand written note from the manager on night one. When the city was hit with a snow storm impacting travel the staff was helpful in providing information on how to get around the city and options for airport transportation. Beyond the customer service the rooms were well decorated, impeccably clean, and the amenities were unique and befitting of the area of town the hotel is located in.All I can say is that I'll definitely be back, we had a wonderful stay filled with great memories.

I've stayed here twice, both on business and leisure and it is a terrific hotel with the high standard of service and attention to detail that you would expect from a boutique hotel in Manhattan. It's clean, stylish and the staff are super. One thing I would advise is to try to secure a room on the Elizabeth St side and on a higher floor, Kenmare St is an extremely busy thoroughfare for cars and lorries 24hrs a day. The other thing is, don't bother with the adjoining restaurant, there are loads of better places to eat within a stone's throw of the hotel.

We stayed at The Nolitan for one night. I'm a big fun of design hotels, and this one did not let me down. The hotel design is beautiful and modern and rooms (although quite small) are nicely furnished. Unfortunately we didn't have the chance to spend a lot of time in the hotel, but we got the chance to benefit from the friendly staff the Nolitan has. Location is great if you like being in Nolita/Soho, where small shops and cafes give the area a different (cozy) feeling. I would definitely recommend it!

We've stayed here twice during the US Open. This is a hip new hotel in the Nolita area. The staff are super friendly and seem to really like working here. The lobby is cool with plenty of places to sit and read the paper while snacking on their assortment of popcorn. The rooms are clean and modern with nice appliances, linens, and an iPhone docking station for charging and listening to your music. There's an incredible roof deck with views of the city and great outdoor furnishings. Don't miss the wine and cheese happy hour that brings the guests out of their rooms to peruse the lobby and roof. They also have cool city bikes you can ride. This is our go-to NYC hotel and I love it.

I spent a weekend in the city at the Nolitan Hotel and it was amazing!! The service was great and the rooms were very nice. The rooms were spotless. Not to mention, the view from the rooftop was beautiful. You can walk to many stores and restaurants nearby. If you are going to spend the night in the city, I would absolutely recommend staying here.

Stayed here for 4 nights in december. Location is very nice, many nice restaurants and breakfastplaces within walking distance; same goes for shopping areas and subway stations.Why only an average rating, you may ask. Well, because the other hotels in the direct neighborhood have the same advantages as the Nolitan of course and you should rate primarily on the merits of the hotel itself. Perks: they have 4 bicycles you can use free of charge and everyday except on sunday they have a "happy hour" with wine and snacks. Service is good and friendly.Problems: rooms are tiny and the airconditioning makes a hell of a lot of noise. Everytime it turned on at night it literally woke me up. This was particularly annoying, since I'm from Europe and due to jetlag I cherish every hour of sleep I can get when I'm in NYC. All the front desk could do for me was hand me a pair of earplugs; apparently this problem can't be solved which is a real pity. The prices they charge are such that I think I can do better elsewhere.Another thing is that while the temperature is comfortable in the rooms, the hallways and elevators are freezing cold in winter. When we were there it was minus 4 centigrade in NYC; so you actually wanted to take a coat to go downstairs for Happy Hour.All in all, staff is wonderful and do their very best; hotel OK, but that's it.

Loved the hotel having stayed in November, everything was cool and quirky and in a great location. I have absolutely no complaints about any of the actual features of the hotel they were just fantastic. The issue with my stay arose with the continental breakfast - very average selection to say the least, regardless we had it anyway as it was included in the package - or so we thought. After asking staff whether we had to pay extra for other things or was that all included in the free continental breakfast, we were met with the response it would be extra, so we stuck with the continental. Upon leaving we went to pay for the coffees that we had to find that the whole breakfast had been billed...... This was queried and following a quick check on my mobile phone, the website for the hotel clearly stated 'Free perks included: continental breakfast' Following pointing this out to the staff at the front desk they contested that because my booking didn't state it had a breakfast option it was chargable? What happened to the customer is always right. They even had the cheek to print out my booking and point to the fact it wasn't listed there. The fact is it was listed on their website as clear as day and should have been honoured. After spending nearly $2000 on a stay in their hotel surely they would comp a $20 bill which was because of their misleading advertising? It took the duration of my stay of arguing with them and it wasn't until they then billed me again for another breakfast which i didn't even have they refunded me the amount. Absolutely unacceptable behaviour from someone in the service industry and it would definitely put me off staying here again if they treat their paying customers like this, regardless of how nice the actual place is.

We stayed in The Nolitan for four nights in late December, splitting our time between Nolita and the Meatpacking district. On reflecting our four nights in each area, this hotel and location was our definite preference. The hotel is clean and the staff are amazingly friendly and obliging. Our room was a corner room on the 7th floor and it had an amazing view of the empire State building, lit up at night in Christmas colours. The room had large windows, some frosted and some clear and the room felt very private - we didn't feel the need to close the curtains at night, preferring instead to absorb the New York/Nolita night life below. The bed was comfortable, the toiletries lovely and the bathroom area, with a separte bath open to the rest of the room felt indulgent. The area is amazing and you feel removed from the overly touristy areas of New York and instead you are surrounded by boutiques, restaurants and cafes in the Nolita area, contrasted by the action packed ares of Chinatown and Little Italy a short walk away. We enjoyed just walking and taking in the the local area and there is easy access to uptown Manhattan via the Spring Street underground station, a short walk away.There are some amazing restaurants and cafes nearby. We enjoyed breakfast twice at The Butcher's Daughter across the road and had a great dinner at 'Public' - a Michelin star restaurnt a short walk away. Would definitely stay at the Nolitan again.

This hotel is ideally positioned in the Nolitan district. The area is positioned between Chinatown and little Italy with easy access to the Metro up into other districts.We were able to walk to Washington Square and enjoy live music at the Blue Note within only 20 minutes walk.The hotel is a quick walk from two main artaries (including Broadway) going though the heart of the island, and everything it has to offer.The hotel rooms are small, but to compensate for this, the hotel foyer offers a very cosy environment, offering free drinks and cheese and biscuits between 17.00 and 19.00 as well as free popcorn readily available at all other times.The hotel also offers free skateboards for the use of guests, but this is not useful to us.The staff are helpful and knowledgeable about the area and the best things to do and see.I would say that it is a fantastic place to stay, but there are too may other restaurants around that area to eat.There is strong wifi and kettles are available upon request.

I stayed at the Nolitan in mid-November and I didn't regret it. It's in an interesting location at the intersection of Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy. You can see elements of all three neighborhoods the moment you step out. Turn one way and there's the Italian pizza and pasta place, turn another and shop signs are in Chinese. And it's very well located for shopping at SOHO, which is barely a five minute walk away, just past the really convenient Spring Street subway station on the number 7 line. The line is great for the east side of Manhattan, taking you directly to shopping areas like Fifth and Madison, within easy walking distance of places like Bergdorf's and Barney's, though I would stick with Soho for variety and a better range of prices.The line is also very convenient to museum mile on the east side of Central Park, and you can get to the Met, Whitney, Frick etc without switching trains. There's also a really useful Citibikenyc rental station just off the Spring Street subway which is great if you want to cycle. And the hotel provides it's own bikes if you prefer.The hotel's rooms are smallish, and on the slightly expensive side compared to what you would get in other cities. But that's common in NYC, and they are very well designed to look bigger than they actually are, as there is a glass wall between the bathroom shower area and the rest of room looking toward the windows. This opens up the room considerably in a visual sense. (Don't worry there are dark curtains at the shower glass wall for complete privacy if you so desire.)The room was kept spotless all the time and even when I looked closely at the shower area, there were zero stains or dirt. For a germaphobe like me, this was important. I didn't find the room I was in on the 7th floor noisy at all, as some other reviewers had warned.The toiletries provided were also pretty good, being the same brand and range that I got in the Mandarin Oriental in Barcelona.While breakfast wasn't provided I found the pricing of the hotel's in-house restaurant reasonable and the quality quite respectable. The wait staff were friendly and efficient. The lobby was nice and there were always people sitting around reading on the sofas which is great if you would like to socialise a bit.I have to say that the hotel's staff lived up to their claims of friendliness. They were friendly and helpful to a fault. I requested tickets to a broadway show and a cruise around the city before I had even left Singapore, and they were waiting for me when I arrived, as promised. One thing I found really interesting about the hotel staff was their diversity. There were receptionists and staff of Chinese, Hispanic, Sri Lankan, White, and Black descent. I also thought Torge, who was Tibetan, was really helpful (and kinda hot!) I thought this was a great reflection of NYC itself , with it's diversity and tolerance.Some advice: There did not seem to be any difference in the internal layout and size of the rooms with and without balconies. So if you don't need the balcony, it's cheaper to just go with the standard room. There is enough light as the windows are sufficiently large. The hotel gives an access pass to a nearby public gym. It's a big gym sprawling over three levels. But if you don't like walking please note that it's a 10 minute or more walk away, which isn't great in the winter. Also, at peak periods there aren't enough lockers at the gym with combination locks, so if you are going there just after working hours, make sure to bring yr own padlock. The gym itself is very well equipped and the staff friendly and welcoming.In all, I had a very enjoyable and restful time at the Nolitan.

We enjoyed our stay here so much.Our room was smallish but very comfortable and we love the modern industrial decor. Bathroom was great and the bed was very comfortable.The are is fantastic for walking around exploring with lots of interesting shops and eating places.What made the overall experience though were the staff at the hotel, from check in to check out they were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. item was a great introduction the NYC.

The Nolitan hotel is situated walking distance from SOHO, subway etc. VERY nice restaurants in the neighborhood for breakfast and dinner!! People at the reception desk are very helpful. A nice touch is the free wine and cheese around 17.00h! You meet some of the other guests. We also borrowed their 4 bikes for a whole day, even biked to Brooklyn for a fantastic view!Rooms are good, clean. The only downside is that the rooms can be quite small and the airconditioning is loud.

Good location with a simple modern rooms. Ask for upper rooms, because lower rooms are noisy. nice view from the 8th floor were we stayed to Empire state building. No Christmas feeling (no Christmas tree nor carols).

I chose this hotel based on the wonderful reviews on TripAdvisor. This place did not disappoint. Rooms are decent size and very clean which is most important. We spent approximately 4 days there and it was well worth it. The staff here is exceptional and rooms are great size. The location was perfect or everything. Will definitely come back again. Highly recommend this hotel for couples. Great bang for your buck!

Stayed at The Nolitan for 4 nights mid December and I can highly recommend staying here.It was our first visit to NYC and our stay at the hotel added to a fantastic trip.First of all, every member of staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms, although not massive, are ample and spotlessly clean and kitted out with everything you would need. (Note for the ladies...no need to bring a hair dryer as the one supplied in the room was just as good as my own. Not one of those hair dryers that struggles to blow out any air!!!The complimentary drinks between 5-7pm are great and good way to get to know staff and other guests should you wish to.Hotel is in a great location to explore all Manhattan has to offer, central and very near subway lines and right next door to Little Italy and Chinatown.Can't wait to visit NYC again and would certainly stay at The Nolitan.

Fantastic people working there. Everyone was professional , helpful and charming.The rooms are average in size but brand new fittings. They have a happy hour from 5 to 7 pm that helped us to mingle with guests and discover new places in NY to adventure in. Even the restaurant was good. I had a very good steak and chips, unpretentious.The breakfast wasn't that good though. Recommend for the location and the staff.Enjoy.

Disclosure: traveling with spouse who is well known architect and designer making her very discriminating when it comes to the overall design and experience. Since this hotel is still relatively new, the prices are quite reasonable for what you get. The Nolitan is a design hotel. Rooms are a clean modern design but warm using a combination of wood (floors), concrete (ceilings and wall sections) and glass. The location is excellent, just on the border of Nolita ans SoHo and a five minute walk to several subway lines. The staff were EXCELLENT during our stay. The youthful front desk staff were knowledgeable about the area and eager to help and please. Clearly this is important to the management both in hiring practices and training.Upon arrival on day one, we were checked in early and the staff recommended some local restaurants that offer 15% discount if you are staying at the Nolitan. We ate at the Ken&Cook across the street which was amazing and very reasonably priced. for breakfast we hit a tiny little deli diagonally across the street called Fiat Cafe (small, owner run and cash only) which was great.Bathroom shower was nice although strangely in front of a window facing the street (don't worry, equipped with a pull down blind of course). In room safe and courtesy umbrella came in handy.Managers reception offered between 5-7pm weekdays for complimentary wine and snacks was great to take the edge off before heading to the room to get ready for heading back out for dinner.We would definitely stay here again.

We had a great time at The Nolitan. Best location to explore SOHO, NOLITA and to cross the Williamsburg bridge to Brooklyn.Surrounded by great restaurants, bars and shops. Very stylish deco, lobby and rooms.The staff is very helpful and more than happy to lend you an umbrella on a rainy day.

This is a terrific little hotel in the heart of lower Manhattan. We stayed in an 8th floor cityscape king room during the week of Thanksgiving, and the view was incredible. The rooftop terrace offers gorgeous views of uptown and downtown. I would like to stay there again during warmer weather and enjoy it more. We really loved the comfort and design of the room, which was not too small by NY standards. The bed was super comfy, everything was clean, and the little amenities such as robes and slippers, umbrellas to borrow, and good quality toiletries were nice. The glass shower in the middle of the room is kinda fun, especially because if you leave the curtain open, you can enjoy a view of the Empire State and Chrysler buildings from the shower. A unique experience! The location was perfect for the places we wanted to be near, and it's a short walk to the F train, or the NR or 6 trains in the other direction. All the staff were warm and welcoming. I wish I had tried the restaurant downstairs, it looked delicious, but we didn't end up making it.

The customer service is pleasant and kind. I asked for a PS3 in my room and it came right away and the technician was quick and very helpful. The view from the roof was incredible which had an all around view of Manhattan and highlighted the beautiful lights of the Empire State and also the liberty tower! Would come back any day!!!!

Staying south of Houston Street opens new experiences for a traveler: restaurants are more affordable and full of surprises, shops don't have designer labels but offer items you've never seen anywhere else, and you get a glimpse into the young, hip, diverse scene in New York City. The Nolitan is the perfect boutique hotel to stay: small, spare rooms with all of the amenities, a lovely lounge with a bar and restaurant, friendly staff, and views. We stayed on the ninth floor and watched the sun rise over the Williamsburg Bridge. Our friends watched the lights come on the Empire State Building. And our adult children who shared the quirky suite, saw it all. Accommodating and clean, exceeded expectations, and ironically, when I was in graduate school, I wouldn't dare walk in this neighborhood. Now it reminds me of a European city.

The Nolitan provides a sophisticated yet comfortable atmosphere for the discriminating traveler. Reminiscent of an urban European hotel, comfort meets chic. We were greeted at the front door by a friendly, knowledgable staff. Our room was immaculate. Cement walls and large windows are tempered by hardwood floors. The overnight stay was peaceful and quiet thanks to well insulated windows and thoughtfully placed room darkening curtains. Slippers, a robe, and a cashmere blanket draped over the end of the bed, added to our comfort. We appreciated the high quality toiletries provided in the sleek, modern bathroom. The Nolitan is in close proximity to shopping, sightseeing, and countless restaurants and cafés. In the evening, we lingered in the front lobby which provided attractive seating areas, books, games, drinks and snacks. We would absolutely stay here again because the Nolitan delivers a first class experience without being stuffy.

Nice hotel. I like the design and decor. Clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The view from our room on the ninth floor was excellent. We faced the Empire State Building. Nice location within walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. Perfect for shopping and restaurants. Definitely would stay here again.

The design is far more superior, modern, clean most of all its confortable people that work there are kind and the best I have ever seen compared to other hotels in new york city definitely above all other hotel I have seen

I'm sorry to have to give this hotel a poor rating as some things were great like the view, the ambience and the staff at all levels. Good location, wonderful roof terrace. The Major problem is the traffic noise. We were on the top 9th floor and hardly slept in 4 nights. The hotel is near a busy junction and New York drivers are madly in love with their horns. They blast them constantly if they think someone is slow, in their way and the list goes on. The first night was impossible and be aware the traffic never stops in 24 hours. We got earplugs which I hate and even they did not block it completely. The next issue is internet connection. Despite checking with the hotel before booking as we needed it for work and calls it hardly worked. Many calls to the desk to get it reset gave you a 50% chance but even when it worked it was so slow it drove you mad. Others complained or sat in the lobby to connect. The lan hardwire in the room did not work either. Beware cold weather too if you don't like noise as the heaters make a real racket.

We had a layover in NY before heading to Europe, and stayed at The Nolitan since we found a deal on LivingSocial. Best decision! The staff was wonderful, and surprised us with a bottle of champagne in the room since it was our Anniversary. They made sure to tell us to go up to the roof at sunset to see the view. We went and picked up some pizza and a bottle of wine, and had a wonderful, quiet dinner with the buildings of NY surrounding us. Location was great, and we can't wait to stay here again some day.

Knowing that we wanted to be close to alot of our favourite restaurants and people for a couple of nights, we checked in to the Nolitan and were not disappointed. Understated but professional service, sleek rooms, and we were lucky to have a fantastic cityscape view northward from our balcony. Steps from Soho, Noho, West Village, LES, so a great place to stay for those wanting to be in lower Manhattan.

We picked this hotel because it got such good ratings, and weren't disappointed in the slightest. Everything was extremely clean and welcoming. The staff was absolutely amazing and provided us with impeccable service. The food at the restaurant was great, the room was comfortable and quiet and the housekeeper who cleaned our room did an outstanding job, even provided us with a little card with the weather report for the following day. Stay at the nolitan you won't be disappointed.
user_name:
Terence M
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: This was the first time that we stayed downtown and loved the location; It's an easy walk to all the surrounding neighborhoods:Little Italy, Soho,& Greenwich. The hotel is a clean, modern boutique hotel and the staff is just terrific; Dilan, Stephanie, Ian & Andy were professional, very helpful & friendly. The restaurant in the hotel was quite good for a quick breakfast, lunch and even a nightcap at night; We'd definitely stay there again.

We stayed at Nolitan for five nights as a pre-christmas getaway and I really enjoyed the stay. Nolitan is a nice, relatively small boutique hotel with some nice touches (free wine and cheese in the evening, cool concierge services and the rooftop!). The rooms have a modern edge (that I basically loved) to them without losing the comfort needed after a hard day/night out. The neighbourhood was the best part – there is an endless array of interesting spots and small restaurants to be discovered. A serious option for a stylish urban stay in a more interesting milieu than midtown.

Fantastic stay at the Nolitan, Oct. 27-30. We love staying in SoHo/Little Italy/Chinatown and the Nolitan is a great addition to the downtown. Love the contrast of the modern hotel with the older buildings in the neighborhood. The staff were professional and very friendly. The hotel was very clean and welcoming. Loved the rooftop terrace. A great fit to a great neighborhood. The old men across the street at Fung Lam Produce were very friendly as were the brothers at Mott Corner shop. We'll most certainly stay again. Remember, there is much, much more to Manhattan than Midtown!!

I've stayed in this hotel 3 times and likely will return. If the boutique hotel concept appeals to you then you will love the Nolitan. The rooms are modern and the beds comfortable. The hotel itself is nicely situated, close to Little Italy, China town, and Soho....NOLITA itself is a great little borough with plenty of shops and restaurants. I hope they finally get a great restaurant to take over the space in the lobby. My only suggestion is that when a guest stays multiple times it should be acknowledged with a "welcome back" and perhaps a complimentary bottle if wine.

I just completed a wonderful first-time stay at the Nolitan this past weekend (Oct 11-14). Unless you are subway-phobic or believe Manhattan is limited to midtown, I highly recommend this location, sandwiched between Soho and the Lower East Side, just north of Little Italy and Chinatown. The rooftop view is unrestricted by nearby buildings, and provides some of the best views - both uptown and downtown - that I have seen in any hotel.I was provided a hassle-free, early check-in to a room on the sixth floor. This was much appreciated after coming in on an overnight flight. One of the former reviews suggested that this hotel has all of the ambiance of a hip, boutique hotel, but without a hint of the stuffy attitude that seem to be part of these hotels - and I fully agree.I'll leave the room descriptions to the other reviewers and oyster.com - other than to say that the room was clean, well appointed and comfortable. I am giving four stars for the fitness center - even though there is none located in the hotel - because the passes to the 24 Hour Fitness in Soho, while convenient on a rainy day, is a plus.The only potential negative is that the hotel is close to an intersection that inspires a great deal of horn honking in the late evening. If this bothers you, you should be looking for a hotel in the countryside. For me, a relatively deep sleeper, this was a positive reminder that I was in electrifying NYC, and not on a camping trip.Thanks to the Nolitan and its staff for a great weekend!

The Hotel is very well located in the Soho with good access to the subway: 2m walk. 5m walk to Broadway. 2m walk to Little Italy (or what's left of it). Fantastic views from the rooftop. Free wine and cheese in the evening and popcorn through the day. Staff very nice, polite and helpful. I stayed there for 5 nights with my wife and will come back.Rooms are small as in the rest of NY. Within walking distance you have free access to a fitness club open 24h. Lots of nice restaurants, coffe shops around and small shops of all sorts.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Nolitan hotel for my honeymoon late September. After a very long day of travelling, I arrived at the Nolitan hotel late in the evening. I was met by a very nice lady at the front desk who was very polite, professional and informative. The hotel lobby itself is very welcoming, warm and has a great atmosphere when there are people there. We were given our two room keys and we went to our room (601). The room was immaculately clean, the furnishing very trendy and the bed was very inviting. The bathroom was clever, using windows and light to create more space. We were hungry and given a few places to go and even offered room service from one of the many restaurants around Nolita. The hotel was more of a base as we were exploring NYC for the week but it was always a pleasure being there. The rooftop terrace, the Cantine Parissien, the complimentary wine and nibbles in the evening and the superb staff all led to us having a fantastic time. And to top it all off we were going to go to a plain boring 3* hotel in Times Square for almost £1000 more for the week however we took a chance on this new hotel and ending up striking it lucky. I genuinely can't recommend this hotel enough for a young couple going to New York. It's not the poshest place, it doesn't pretend to be. It is relaxed, clean, trendy and affordable with good size rooms. Don't be a sheep and go to Times Square, it is gaudy and not much there. Go to the Nolitan.

Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed here in September. I had booked two rooms for myself and my work colleague and at the same time there was a street fair on in the same street as our hotel.No one told us this would be on, it just came by surprise. When we tried to get some sleep after the first two nights of noise, I asked the duty manager if i could move my room to a quieter floor. It was a flat out NO, we were on a business trip and really needed the sleep. Stephanie didn't even offer ear plugs or anything of assistance, "just bad luck really" was her attitude. What a shame as the rest of the staff were great.I was really upset by the way she handled the situation so I emailed the general manager to explain her lack of management experience. I have not received any reply from the hotel.

We were visiting Manhattan for the third time and after staying in Midtown on previous occasions, were wanting a more local area to stay in. The Nolitan seemed an ideal location in the heart of the surrounding areas of Soho, Little Italy, Greenwich Village and the Lower East Side. Upon arrival the staff were immediately friendly and accommodating offering extras such as bike hire, 'happy hour' (complimentary cheese and wine of an evening) and even down to what time we preferred our room to be serviced. The reception area was cosy with modern decoration but ample seating for guests to enjoy their wine of an evening.The room itself (a Neighbourhood room) was compact but very contemporary with great attention to detail. The 5th floor room had a great view onto Kenmare Street, and noise was minimum of an evening taking into account you are staying in Manhattan. What makes the Nolitan a unique hotel within the area is the rooftop, located on the eleventh floor. We were taken aback with the unspoilt views Uptown (of Empire State), the Williamsburg Bridge and the Financial District. I cannot stress enough how much more special it makes the trip and because of its locations you see so much more than you would in a top floor hotel within Midtown. We stayed for ten days so although we were busy exploring we also wanted a comfortable hotel we could unwind in and recharge our batteries. The Nolitan is perfect for this and the rooftop was ideal for relaxing (you can take your complimentary wine up there, or order a drink from the adjacent restaurant earlier/later in the day). One thing that surprised us was the lack of facilities to be able to make a cup of coffee or tea in the room. The mini bar was full with alcoholic beverages, snacks etc. but when you want a coffee to wake you up, you have to get dressed and head down to the restaurant. It was mentioned on check in that we would be able to phone down and request coffee to our home, but when we did this on the third day we were advised we needed to come down ourselves. It was a minor thing and did not tarnish our stay, but were surprised it was not available in the room.As all the other reviews on here testify, the Nolitan is a hotel like no other in Manhattan. It was a pleasure staying there and we will definitely be selecting it on our visits on the future.

We have just returned from our stay at the Nolitan, and absolutely loved it! The location was perfect, in walking distance from the best shopping over in Soho and the cutest cafes, bars and restaurants. It's very easy to settle in around this area and have it feel like home really quickly. Such a cool vibe!Sure the rooms are pretty tiny - but waking up each morning to a stunning view of upper Manhattan was well worth the space sacrifice! Small rooms are pretty standard in these boutique NYC hotels, so we knew what we were expecting. There was still more than enough room for the two of us and ALL our shopping! There were some great little touches, we loved the bicycles that were free to take out. This is honestly the BEST way to see the city, and the Nolitan provided cute little bikes and locks for free! Also loved the daily wine and cheese happy hour from 5-7. The staff were lovely and always super friendly and accommodating. If you want a hotel that has a nice vibe and is in an amazing location - this is the one!We did find the shower turned off and on again during showers, but this wasn't anything hard to deal with or get used to. The air con in our first room (we changed rooms due to extending our trip) was pretty noisy on and off as well. But it's nothing we found to be too stressful. We will be back for sure! Thanks guys!

Hong Kong, null, Hong Kong

review_body: This is a fab little hotel in a great area of the city. Rooms were funky and clean, staff were ever so helpful. The drinks and nibbles provided each night in the lobby was a great little extra.The area felt safe to walk around alone and the shops were great. When we ventured to tourist attractions we were awfully glad to come back to the peace of the Nolitan.Would stay here again - simply loved it!

good location (walk to chinatown, little italy and SoHo) located on a main road (this could be a little loud depending on where the room is located, mine was facing the street)room size: tiny rooms, mine hardly fit a queen size bedclean and nice roomhelpful staffreally nice breakfast place across the roadAlso a cheaper laundromat nearby

We stayed Sept 21-28 2013 and could not fault the Hotel. We had a balcony room which I know can be a bit noisy but after a very full packed day sightseeing in new York a evening meal in little Italy our heads hit the pillow and the next thing it was Morning. Please if you do visit, the roof top is a real jewel with stunning views across the NY sky line. Me and my wife sat up there one afternoon with a couple of drinks from the bar and had a real chill out time (the wifi works up there too). We had a couple of requests while we were there and the hotel handled them all in their stride. All of the staff were helpfull and couldn't do enough for us. The Houskeeping was excelent. They must use house elfs to do it because it just magic.Again A great Hotel great location and great people.Look forward to coming again.

The Nolitan is a modern and comfortable boutique hotel. Located near to good shopping streets and restaurants, allows you to forget the terrible traffic of NYC. Staff is very friendly and professional. Good sheets, towels and a quality bed, allied to a minimalist design, makes the room a nice place to rest. However, the air conditioned and bathroom hoods of our room was very noisy. We stayed 4 nights in August in the room 94. In the last two nights we decided to turn off the air conditioned. Although warmer, we had a quieter and better night.

took a two day trip from DC to NYC - wanted to stay in SOHO. Hotel was great. clean and staff was very friendly. Great location - places to eat and shop. can walk everywhere. not as touristy as Manhattan. Would stay again. No gym at the hotel - but we got comp at a local gym. Wine tasting at the hotel. Great lobby area.
user_name:
Eric C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Nolitan has stepped right out of the pages of a glossy fashion magazine and then rooted itself in the heart and soul of its neighbourhood.First things first, Kenmare Street is busy but from our cityscape balcony room on the 8th floor there was no noise problem at all. The rooms are stylish and modern, probably average in size but light and airy and with great Manhattan views. Things we missed were free bottled water and the option of making a good cup of coffee in the room. But nice Nolitan touches include free wine and cheese daily, 5-7pm and a complimentary copy of the weekly Time Out New York magazine, so you can do the city like a local.The neighbourhood is fantastic. Across the street, on and around Mott, Elizabeth and Prince, are great independent shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. Down the street on Orchard are superb small art galleries. You have plentiful access to subway stops plus you can hire a bike for free from the hotel.New York can be impersonal and overwhelming. Avoid Midtown as an area to stay at all costs. The Nolitan and Nolita give you a boutique hotel of character and a neighbourhood of warmth, personality and manageability.Special thanks to Stephanie, Jordan and George of the Nolitan, who were helpful, efficient and friendly - just all-round nice human beings.Recommended.

We stayed at the Nolitan in August (2 couples and an infant) and we had a neighborhood balcony room and a neighborhood corner room. We really enjoyed our stay, and would not hesitate to return to this hotel next time we are in NYC.Since we traveled with an infant, we had different requests to be made upfront (water kettle, pack and play etc.). We also had to pre-arrange other things like some flowers, gifts, etc., and we had some items from on-line shopping shipped to the hotel. This meant a lot of correspondence with the hotel, but everything was handled very well by Joy, thanks again for all the help!We really liked the rooms, and you could tell that a lot of thought has gone into the design and layout of the rooms. Rooms in NYC are notoriously small, but the small details at the Nolitan, like the drawers under the bed, narrow desks, glass shower cubicle, floor to ceiling windows, slim furniture, and very minimalistic design, gave the rooms an airy feeling and the impression of a room larger than it actually was. Very well done indeed.The hotel has a fresh, clean and cool ambiance, and it really felt like the design elements of the hotel was embedded in every detail, all the way to staff appearance. Staff was really friendly, relaxed and very accommodating, suggested to take the wine and cheese to the rooftop, picked up pizzas for us one evening, all in all a very "complete" experience.The location is very good, 5-10 min. to SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy and Subway stations. There is a 24/7 Duane Reed and a Wholefoods Market close by, and a lot of small quirky shops, cafes, bars and restaurants in the streets surrounding the hotel, very "local and cosy" feeling.The rooftop is a great asset for this hotel and although it is probably going to be really nice when they get a bar going up there, it was nice to have the rooftop almost like your own private terrace.As others have mentioned, Kenmare street is not a quiet street, NYC has traffic everywhere and I usually do not mind some street noise, but here we are talking about huge trucks passing by and some of them delivering goods in the early morning for some food whole seller across the street. That said, I suspect that the main problem is the door to the small balcony, since the corner room we also had (on the same floor) was very quiet.Once again, thanks to The Nolitan and all the staff for a wonderful stay in NYC.

Had fantastic time staying at the nolitan hotel all the staff we spoke with were extremely friendly and helpful, in fact they couldn't do enough for you. Complimentary wine and nibbles whilst sitting on the roof garden was terrific, what a view to look at. Would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone travelling to NY.

If I could stay at the Nolitan every time i come to NYC, I will. It has everything you could want in a hotel. The decor is minimal and modern, and many of the rooms have balconies. The rooftop is amazing and open to all of the guests. The staff is so friendly and welcoming that you almost do a double take and wonder if you actually are still in NY. They welcomed me back the last time I stayed with them like they missed me. It was really sweet. We brought our niece to NY as a graduation present.Joy, from the Nolitan, called a few days beforehand to ask if there was anything else we needed before we arrived. Its small personal touches like that which really elevate the Nolitan above many other hotels. We stayed in the Nolitan Suite, which was on the 8th floor and had a great floor to ceiling view of the Williamsburg Bridge. The room was very spacious and the couch pulled out into a sofa bed which they set up for our niece that night during turndown while we were out. They have bikes that you can rent for free from them and take a tour of the city. Its located a few blocks from the subway which will take you wherever youd like. The Lower East Side, The East Village and Soho are all right there on your door step. And at the end of the day, you get to come back to The Nolitan, which has one of the most comfortable beds I've ever encountered. I never count down the days until i can sleep on my tempurpedic at home. The bedding itself is luxurious and soft. The rooms are an average size for NYC. I would rent the suite every time i came to NYC but as I am not independently wealthy, I will stick with a cityscape balcony, which is totally affordable. All in all, theres no downside to the Nolitan, I just wish they had a Nolitan every place I visited.

trust me when i tell you i never write reviews, good,bad,or ugly, don't have time. however i was moved to tell of my experience because they got it right without me asking. yes the room was very comfortable from every angle. i want the pillows the mattress the linens the lighting the hvac vents in the perfect location the faucet in the right place. i want the smell to be just right from the lobby to the elevator, to the room. i don't want to see stains anywhere on the carpet the mirror especially on the glassware or bedspread. they hit a home run with me because they did their job before i arrived not after a complaint. its your business, i should not have to tell you that. see you next time for sure when i'm in nyc. sis rita

Stayed here 6/28-6/30, so I am tardy in posting my comments even though we really liked the place. Could not have asked for a more knowledgeable, thoughtful and hospitable staff and front desk. The wine happy hours were nicely done. Hot nights and hotter days, so going up to the roof w/ a complimentary glass of wine @ about 6p.m. just hit the spot. The roof is "raw" (unimproved) but very appealing- great, perhaps spectacular views, comfortable seating w/ tables, and a great chance to meet other hotel guests...or not depending on your preference. Just a very comfortable space, without being highly designed or decorated.It is a treasure.Our room itself was very clean-small but fine with a nice design element. We had a balcony. I loved the look but I felt unwilling to venture out on it by the height and narrowness. My companion was fine with it. The roof didn't bother me in the least but that balcony.... The room layout was a bit odd, but it seemed to make sense. In the room the toilet was on one side of the internal hall and the sink and shower on the other. Nice fixtures with good water pressure. A yoga mat reclines in the closet. I didn't use it, but it made me feel virtuous everytime I saw it. With all the tasty food available within a very short walk from the hotel, feeling virtuous was good.We had no issues w/ the noise level. We had the a/c on, so maybe that masked it sufficiently. The halls could be a bit noisy when people were coming and going.Location, location, location. Great, in that you can get there from here. Lots of walking adventures, Little Italy, Chinatown and Soho. Shops of all stripes, restaurants galore and the subway is convenient. One downside about the location- for some reason it is really hard to grab a cab right by the hotel.In sum, we enjoyed our stay, thought it was a decent value for the money, has a great staff, a nice vibe and would go back. A great place to put up your feet at the end of the day and a good place to start from the next day.

review_body: We recently stayed at the Nolitan during our first trip up to New York from Australia. It was recommended to us by friends and I'm so thrilled to confirm that their recommendation was absolutely valid. Our room and view was amazing but to be honest the highlight of the experience was our interaction with the staff. We encountered so many individuals and were left feeling truly valued during our stay. Thanks so much for making such an amazing trip even more worthwhile!!

Stayed here for four days over January, it's a hotel that is not as fancy as some but then it does try to be. It's a modern, comfortable hotel with friendly staff. Rooms are tight in size but neat and with all the modern stuff you look for - who stays in a room in NYC?My only quibble is that the complimentary breakfast by non-American standards. However, diagonally across from the hotel is the 'Butcher's Daughter' which has an amazing range of breakfast options.Was great and would easily stay here again.

In recent years my wife and I have stayed at "trendy" hotels in the Meatpacking District, Upper Westside and Soho on our visits from California. This trip we booked the Nolitan and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It is located in an area between Soho, lower Eastside, Chinatown, and the new Bowery; and, within easy walking distance to TriBeCa, the Battery and even Brooklyn via the Brooklyn Bridge. The rooms were clean and comfortable (try to get a corner room), and the staff was helpful and friendly. We will go back on our next visit.

Hard to believe that there are still NY neighbourhoods that remain "in transition". The Nolitan was my pick for the accessibility, price, and boutique hotel independence. The location is prime. The hotel being only 2 years old is setting a great tone for Nolita. The hotel is what you would expect of a boutique: unique, service oriented in a genuine way, leading edge. The team was great across the board, especially James -- who was hugely tuned in and willing to make your trip memorable.The wine and cheese at 5pm is nice, but pretty basic. Once they get the roof top patio in full swing, it will be even more compelling. Great team, clean and efficient (yes small!) rooms -- with great touches: slippers, robes, mini-bar, balcony, etc.My expectations were exceeded on every level. Highly recommend.

We stayed here for 3 nights in June in a Cityscape Queen Room. It was my first time staying in this area and the hotel really is in tune with what is a great place to base yourself for a visit. I have tended to stay in the Meatpacking District but having stayed here I think my next trip will bring me back to the Nolitan. The hotel is surrounded by bars, restaurants, cafes and quirky shops (from furniture to jewellery makers to music stores) that work beside businesses in a way that feels more lived in. The atmosphere is very engaging (the afternoon complementary wine reception in the hotel lobby, which while modern in design, has a feel of a library to it with bookshelves and a sunken seating area is a nice idea). Free use of iPads, bicycles and skateboards you may not necessarily make use of but underline the feeling from staff that there is a genuine interest that you enjoy your stay. We were in town visiting friends so ate out every night so while the attached brasserie and bar looked nice we didn't try it out. The rooms are very modern in design but make good use of space and the toilet is seperated from the bathroom. It was large enough, with the balcony, to spend some time in. Our room was on a higher floor with a small balcony, I would book a higher floor again due to the traffic noise. There was no problem of sound when we were there from other rooms but you could hear traffic throughout the night and I was glad to be that bit higher from street level. I dont think traffic is unusual but I think the location maybe near a fire station as several times sirens were passing during the night. Wifi was complimentary as I'd expect but reception was patchy in the room.

We stayed here on the last week of August. We were visiting from California. We had great service from the staff. The room was clean and in great condition. Loved the modern feel of the room. It may have been small but it was designed so well, it felt really open. The air conditioning in the room was excellent on a hot New York day. Nice amenities in the room, like slippers!Another highlight is that it's lower Manhattan so it's away from touristy areas. We had a balcony and a great view of the Empire State Building. It was also a great location for a lot of popular restaurants. I would recommend this hotel to couples for sure, and I'd love to come and stay here again.

Stayed here for one night and will stay here again. Like most NY hotels, the rooms are small but this is set up to feel large. They also made the bathroom work be separating the toilet. Only drawback was the A/C was a bit loud.

This hotel is in a great location. Room was a good size for a NYC hotel in this area. Rooms are contemporary industrial feel but felt plenty of room for two people for a couple nights. The service is excellent. This hotel has an awesome rooftop deck with great views. Would stay here again.

Room was average size but had great bathroom, window could be opened a little, nice when the AC didnt cut it sometimes. Front desk staff very helpful, didnt know their ipads (to rent FOC) didnt have a SIM card in them. Free bike rental as well, exactly what I was looking for to explore NYC the active way.

I stayed at the Nolitan hotel for 5 nights as the first part of a NY trip. The hotel is small and contemporary in a good area surrounded by cafes restaurants boutiques etc. It's major downfall is it's location on a busy street between two sets of traffic lights and opposite some Chinese fresh produce warehouse which has noisy road train trucks unloading during the very early hours every night. Despite a giant sign on the warehouse wall telling the truckers to switch their engines off they ignored it. Even with earplugs it was impossible to sleep the whole night. The hotel rooms are small and it's difficult to find space to open a suitcase. The first night I ordered room service. My roast chicken dinner arrived in a plastic dish with a plastic knife and fork. In my tired and jetlagged state it was impossible to eat a roast chicken with a plastic knife. A VERY expensive waste of almost $30. All in all I don't really understand why this hotel gets such good reviews.

The reviews were right on this one. The service was wonderful. Very helpful young staff. Neighborhood is close to everything in soho and close enough to walk to the village. Subway stops easy and nearby for everything else. Really comfy beds. Clean decent size rooms for New york. Noise wasn't an issue for us. We loved this little hotel.

We stayed at the Nolitan for 4 nights and it was our first stay in NY. The hotel is quite modern and the staff at the front desk were friendly and made you feel welcome. The rooms are modern and clean although a quite small, but hey your in NY and to be honest we were only in the room for sleep and rest. The bathroom was clean and modern with all the perks. Although the rooms are quite dark and not a lot if light. The hotel is a couple of blocks away from Little Italy and about 15 minutes walk to the heart if Soho and the shopping along broadway. It's also about a 20 minute walk to the start of the Highline which you can take to the meat packing district. Cabs cost on average around $15 to get to Times Square, meat packing district, broadway and walk to discover other places. After a long day it was nice to come back to the hotel for canapés and drinks at 5pm, which just added to the experience. Just sitting in the foyer and chatting with the other guests. Overall we had a great experience at The Nolitan, a good place to stay for few days if you want to check out the Soho district and escape the hustle and bustle of NY. A good base for few days especially for couples.

Stayed here for 2 weeks in the hot summer. Very well positioned for tourists. Hundreds of restaurants within a few blocks, Little Italy around the corner, 3 blocks to SOHO or the East Village, subway close by, free wifi, friendly and comfortable, clean and trendy. Not a glamorous neighborhood setting but rather a real feel of living in a NY neighborhood. Does not feel touristy. Not pretentious at all. Recommended.

review_body: First we loved the location and the fact that there's 24h parking right across the street. The lower floors might be a little noisy if you're not use to it (New York never sleeps) but it's nothing earplugs can't fix. The rooms were well furnished, clean and the bed comfortable. We got upgraded to a room with balcony and that's something every Montrealer is sure to appreciate. Overall very satisfied and a big thumbs up to the staff who did a great job.

Good location to explore and enjoy the neighbourhoods of: Nolita, little italy, chinatown, tribeca & soho. Outside the hotel is concrete, but inside is nice. Rooms are small as always in NYC, but clean, good shower, tv...could be improved the isolating against noise from street.Afternoons with complimentary wine & cheese, complimentary bicycles that we use for one morning to east river park. Front desk very helpful and attentive. Neighbourhood is plenty of good cafes, restaurants..shops...if breakfast is not included in your price, go to one of those cafes.

we just returned from NYC where we stayed at The Nolitan hotel in Noho. we really wanted the experience of staying further downtown after years of staying mid town and on the Upper west side.It was a perfect place for our family especially our teenage children. The rooms were small but very well designed and extremely comfortable. We were in a very cool area, 3 blocks from Soho and in any direction exiting the hotel it was interesting and vibrant. The lobby had wine and cheese every afternoon and the people working the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful.

I had an absolutely lovely stay at the Nolitan. Not only is it stylish in it's architectural design, with a nice materials mix, (structural glazing fascade, raw concrete ceilings, wooden floors and stucco lustro treated walls) but the whole layout of the reception area and lobby has an welcoming and inviting feel to it. And then I've mentioned nothing of the huge roof terrace, free to use for all guests. It was a real treat starting of the day by doing some yoga there, alone with all Mantattan at my feet!I stayed in an ''King size neighbourhood room'' which was spacious, clean and chic. The bed was comfy and huge and the only drawback might have been the lack of closet space and hooks to hang your garments, bathrobe and so on. One should also know that the street outside is quite busy and since the New Yorkers love their car horns it might be a good idea to bring some earplugs.The hotel has a very friendly and service minded staff, not hesitating to solve problems or making you feel pampered. There's also ''the happy hour'' between 5 and 7 pm when free wine and cheese is served in the lobby. A nice feature allowing you to mix and mingle the other hotelguests. Finally, a word of advise. Since the cleaning service shedule seems to be somewhat irregular it might be a good thing to put up the ''please clean my room sign'' when going out to prevent having to wait for your room to be cleaned when returning in the afternoon.

We spent just over a week at The Nolitan and had an amazing stay. The interior design is urban chic meets minimalism. The location is perfect for shopping in soho and also in easy reach of LES, East Village etc. This hotel really pays attention to all the details, from the luxurious bath products to the complimentary afternoon drinks and snacks in the lobby. A very nice surprise. Staff were very friendly and service-minded!

We stayed at The Nolitan during SuperStorm Sandy (see my prior review). We loved the hotel, (even under the circumstances), that we decided to return on our last trip to NY. We were delighted we did! It was like visiting old friends! The staff was amazing (and remembered us!). We had a beautiful room with a city view and balcony. A lovely "return" thank you gift and note was waiting for us upon our arrival (thank you again!). They also remembered that I wanted the NY Times delivered to my room and it was at our door every morning upon waking.The hotel's "Sips and Savories", a wine and cheese gathering, is a lovely extra and a nice way to get to know the staff and fellow guests. My husband is a bike rider and the hotel gave him one for the entire day. The bike was brand new and the hotel provided a lock and a basket. My husband had a great time riding around the city. Renting bikes can be expensive in NY so this is a wonderful, thoughtful extra. The hotel is in the best area of Manhattan (in my opinion), close to all of the places that we were interested in going to and everything else is easily accessible by subway, walking or cab. Our stay was during a heat wave in NY but we were visiting from Florida so this was not much of an issue for us. The air conditioning worked amazingly well and in balcony rooms, once the door was closed, the street noise was not an issue at all. The roof deck was lovely. My only suggestion would be some large umbrellas for additional shade, but the furniture is comfortable and sunset with a glass of wine was a perfect Manhattan experience. This is a hotel for adults and couples (due to the unique shower/bath configuration). It is rare to find such a gem of a hotel in Manhattan and we are so happy that we are now Nolitan "family". We know exactly where we will be staying on our next trip to NY. This is a great hotel; clean, modern, amazingly friendly and helpful staff who are genuine and sincere. It is reasonably priced and in a great neighborhood, near everything with easy transportation close by. Try this hotel. I can't imagine that you would have anything less than a delightful stay.

Very helpful and sympathetic staff. Nice location near Soho and Little Italy. We had a corner room with an extra bed for our 15 yrs old daughter. Even though the corner room was the biggest, this was too cramped. And in the middle of the room was a bathtub. This room is suited for couples (in love). The aircondition worked well, but was very noicy. And we could hear people talking in the corridor and in the other corner room.The Internet was not good.Nice restaurant on the ground floor, but the continental breakfast was of poor quality. Nice roof terrace with a very nice view and where we could bring drinks and food from the restaurant.

This is a great hotel - first of its kind in the immediate area. Great area with lots of nice bars and restaurants nearby. Great staff who couldn't do more to help you. Sips and Savories every night ( free cheese and wine) is a brilliant idea and very welcome in an expensive city. Transport links excellent and hotel within walking distance of lots of cool sights. Will definitely be staying here when we return to New York in the future. Nice room and bathroom and general hotel décor is impressive. Lovely roof space - hope they put a bar/pool up there in the future as the views are amazing. Can't fault this hotel. Great value for money too. Well done Nolitan.

I am reading through some of the reviews and man, I have to say that most of the negative comments are way off. This place is SO AWESOME! I have stayed at The Nolitan Hotel at least 7 times. Why? Because this place kicks a$$. First of all, the staff rocks. From back of the house to the front, everyone is really cool. Very accommodating and always willing to go beyond to make sure we are comfortable. For instance, one weekend we came in and our room was not ready. We dropped our bags and did what we love to do most in the city, walk around. We were tired from partying the night before and had things to do, so I called at 3 to see if our room was ready. Much to my dismay, it was not. About 2 hours later, we went to the hotel to see if it was ready - nope. By this time, it was happy hour in the lobby (can you say, champagne????!!!!!!! awesomeness!!!!!) so we chilled and waited. It was about 20 minutes in, and our room was ready. (Side note: I never lost my cool. That was my 3rd stay, and the girl recognized me.) Well, we were upgraded to a wonderful room WITH a sweet note and a bottle of champagne waiting for us. Amazing! Every time we visit, I request a high floor and they have always accommodated. For the people complaining on size and noise - it's the city. And honestly, the noise and sounds are totally fine. No need for earplugs. We actually sleep with the window cracked a bit; we love the sounds of the city! Size is great for 2 people. I always have a gigantic bag, and I never had a problem with size. My favorite thing in the room (other than the bed) is the FAN!!!! AWESOME!Only thing I would say is something that could be "better," would be the continental breakfast. It looks a bit like what you would see at a low-end chain restaurant....I would suggest maybe giving a break on the menu items (which if you love pancakes or French toast, I would totally eat. It's AMAZING!) in lieu of the pastry spread. That's just my humble opinion. Anyway, this place rocks and I love it! See you again soon!

My husband and I stayed at The Nolitan for two nights last week. We were not disappointed! This was our second stay here and had high expectations after our last visit. The employees are very friendly and helpful, the room was spotless (a must for us), and the location cannot be beat. Our room was a city-view with a balcony on the 9th floor. There are day passes available for a 24 hour Fitness which we used one of the mornings. It was clean and had a lot of machines and free weights. We would highly recommend The Nolitan. We haven't stayed here with our two children yet, but we are planning to return with them in the fall and will look into prices of the suites. I hope we stay here!

My wife and I loved staying here. We loved the design of the building, the lobby, our room with terrific views, the shower, the bathroom amenities, the wine and cheese, etc... The staff was very friendly. The rooftop was fun. It is in a wonderful location with many good restaurants and bars nearby as well as shopping.

my husband& I stayed at the Nolitan for 4 days. Staff are very warm; property impeccably maintained+roof to escape to. Lots of nice perks--NYtimes/WSJ, wine& cheese reception daily, umbrellas, bikes. Excellent value. Very convenient location for subway, taxi. The only thing that I would add would be a noise reducing curtain as the metal hallway door transmits sound easily.

We wanted to stay in a pet friendly hotel and boy did we find it. Gizmo gives it 2 Paws up...=) My husband and I were looking for a fun weekend in the city and needed a place that would also accommodate our Gizmo. The staff was very friendly and made us all feel at home.Hotel Highlights ****Great staySlept greatComfy mattressSexy shower with privacy curtainLoved the slippers and robePet friendlyTerrific roof top viewRestaurant ****Fantastic food with healthy options and fresh juices.. I could get delicious salad, fish and tuna tartar and my husband can still get his veal smothered in a cream sauce.

This hotel had amazing customer service and great views from the roof. Around $200/night we got a small room with a bathroom, shower, sink, balcony, and desk. The views from the roof are fantastic including the empire state building and the freedom tower. This hotel also does room service from a menu in the room that includes options to order from a local restaurant and have it delivered. There is a 15-20% extra charge for this though.

My partner and I just spent 4 days at the Nolitan and its was far beyond our expectations.From check in to check out the staff was very kind and professional.Our location could not have been any better we had "gimme coffee" and "cafe fiat " around the corner on Mott street very morning and easy access to taxis and the subway. The rooms were always clean and well stocked with toiletries and the restaurant in the lobby was above par as well,and the rooftop deck was the perfect addition to our stay. My only complaint is that the before mentioned deck is not up to par with the rest of the hotel ie. barely any furniture and zero ambience but it has a great view. All in all a great time though and we will be back!

We were supposed to stay at the Nolitan last November but we were defeated by Hurricane Sandy so this July 4th holiday seemed like a great opportunity. A few days before we arrived, Joy called to see if there was anything we needed. When we got there we were given a lovely room with one small problem. The building next door -- a parking garage -- was a having a very loud DJ'ed party for the 4th and our room was literally throbbing with bass. We were so close to the party, they actually invited us over. Nice as that was, it wasn't exactly what we had in mind. Mervin, whom we contacted downstairs, was extremely helpful. He moved us to a room on the other side of the hotel complete with an adorable little balcony. If you like the LES/Nolita as we do, the Nolitan is perfect base of operations. I've stayed at both the Hotel on Rivington and the Thompson LES and the Nolitan beats both. Unless you can afford the steeply-priced Bowery Hotel, the Nolitan would be my choice. It's a short walk to the cool shops on Spring St, the fantastic Whole Foods at Bowery and Houston and any number of great restaurants including Mile End Sandwich on Bond St. and Il Buco on Great Jones St. All in all, the way to do lower Manhattan (and it's close to several subway stops as well if you plan to go to midtown, uptown or Brooklyn.)

The Nolitan is a very comfortable small hotel with amazingly helpful staff .The rooms are compact but very well designed and light. The hotel provides little wonderful extras like free wifi, a yoga/pilates mat, universal plug, water with lime at reception,and even an i-pad for free day use . The staff were ready to assist with any issue including accepting and storing lost luggage that was finally delivered by the airline while we were away for a few days. The location is tremendous, quite quiet for New York, yet in between vibrant Little Italy and Soho.The French-style restaurant next door has a lovely breakfast but the system is a little strange in that if you have breakfast included you get a voucher for a certain value from the hotel and then whatever you take from the buffet is added up and charged with that credit used towards it. It was a bit off putting to be watched as we took each item. Despite this, I would highly recommend this hotel.

I'm a former east village boy so the location of this hotel is perfect for me but it didn't stop there.....I do not have single complaint about this hotel. The staff is cool, fashionable and nice. The place is clean and my room was made before noon!!!! I hate to share this jem with the rest of the world but they deserve it!

Spent a weekend night at the hotel with my wife. This is a classic boutique hotel which treats lodgers as valued guests. The front desk and all the staff associates were absolutely the friendliest I've encountered in many years, and I've I've lodged at some very friendly hotels over the years. All service was delivered with a gracious smile and an even more gracious attitude. The French-themed restaurant catered to your every wish - very friendly and accommodating. The view at the top of the hotel was gorgeously panoramic. Shopping for food, clothing, accessories, etc. are all within walking distance. It becomes evident very quickly that the proprietor built the hotel as a place he/she would be glad to spend the night. The fixtures and bathing supplies were superior to those at expensive flag hotels. There's a beautiful umbrella waiting for you in the closet in case it rains. Looking forward to a future stay.

I typically do not take out the time to write hotel reviews, but my stay at the Nolitan was such an extraordinary experience that I had to share my thoughts.The hotel is centrally located in the heart of Nolita /Soho, close to all the action, stores, restaurants and a block from the 6 train.The room was sleek, modern, clean and frankly extravagant, featuring an open bathroom with a separate water closet, plush bedding and a balcony!The lobby lounge was great for Happy Hour drinks and the roof-top lounge sported unobstructed 360⁰ panoramic views of the new WTC and Empire State Building.The staff was extremely professional, helpful and courteous. I fully recommend the Nolitan for a truly unique experience. Enjoy!

Wife and I had a great weekend stay at the Nolitan. The hotel looks great outside and even better inside. Bed was very comfy. Room decor was modern, clean lines with rustic touches to make you feel at home.Staff was friendly and loved the turn down service in the evening. Gourmet chocolate truffles left on bed. =)Be sure to head to the roof. Great views of the Empire state building, Freedom tower and Bridge. Nite views are spectacular. Also heard a roof bar will be coming soon. Will look forward to it.Cantine Parisienne is the restaurant attached to the hotel. Had their french toast which was topped with fresh berries and the toast itself was slightly caramelized. AMAZING!!! Neighborhood:Hip Nolita neighborhood. Close to Little Italy and Chinatown, but still far enough you don't feel like a tourist.Pro: $$Great price for NYC; umbrella by door; friendly staff; pet friendly; Dwell decorNeg:None; but would suggest putting up a larger hotel name sign over entrance.We'll be back. Well done NOLITAN!!!!

Located on the corner of kenmare and grand this hotel is steps from many of our favorite food spots(Parisi bakery,dipalo's dairy,d'espana) and in the thick of "nolita" our super cool boutique shopping district.also walking distance from the sunshine theater ,a wonderful art house cinema.the neighborhood views of this area are pulse quickening!Great rooms too and a very pleasant onsite restaurant.we have already booked our next stay!!!!

This hotel not only is really neat, the staff was fantastic. From the gentleman at door, to the reception desk, this staff is great. Our room (on the 9th floor) had a super view facing uptown, and was very nice. The room had everything one would need, and was very clean. We did not have a problem at all with street nose, as another review noted. I would say the neighborhood was actually a more quite one. As far as location, awesome. The hotel sits directly in between Little Italy, and the village, which gives you walkable access to some of NYC's best areas. We will stay here again for sure.

I loved my stay at the Nolitan. The staff was incredibly friendly and personable - called before my trip to see if I needed anything. I got a high floor room with a balcony and amazing view of the city. Yes the street noise is loud even on the 9th floor but when in NY travel with earplugs. I never heard noise from another room or another room door close which is more than I can say for other boutique hotels in NY. The only let down is that there is no way to get a cup of coffee before the restaurant opens - they should have coffee in lobby or coffee makers in room for those of us who prefer to have a cup of coffee before being in public :).

Kenmare Steet is a busy thoroughfare surrounded by a network of attractive streets with real NY communities and interesting restaurants and shops, great walking. The Nolitan is quite a new small stylish oasis in the middle of it all. Comfortable well designed well equipped rooms, I had a great city view from the shower ! The staff were very pleasant and helpful and there is wine and snacks every evening from 5pm in the comfortable lobby.
