It all makes for a very enjoyable stay, can't wait to return and when the roof terrace is finished it will be spectacular. I didn't find the street noise bad and it is NY after all. The Butchers Daughter across the road does very good healthy home made food and drinks all day.

I dithered, but eventually decided to give the hotel 5 stars as I really couldn't find any fault with it. The staff were pleasant and helpful, the location is fantastic, the rooms were clean and comfortable with cool touches in the bathroom and I enjoyed the view from the rooftop terrace. There were some really nice little touches too, such as free continental breakfast in the lobby every morning, cheese and wine and funky muzak in the lobby in the evenings, free bikes to hire and some cool coffee table books and comfy chairs and couches in the lobby.I really enjoyed the area and was glad we didn't stay further uptown. There were some really lovely and unusual independent shops, restaurants and cafes all around us and I'm pleased to say we did not once eat in a chain (unless you count Balthazar which has just opened in London). We we really enjoyed dinner at L'Apicio, brunch at Public and cocktails at the Soho Grand and Standard. Aww, NYC, I miss you already!

This is a great boutique hotel with a fantastic staff. It is on busy Kenmare street which makes it a great place for hipsters but can be tough to sleep at night due to the traffic. The staff were really nice, everyone, and made the stay memorable.

The place to be in NYC!! We couldn't have picked a better place to stay! Location, staff, atmosphere, service, everything just flawless. We'd definitely come back.The location in Nolita is just perfect. One has to take the subway or cab anyway in NY for many things, but we like to stay were you can walk around in the evening for dinner & drinks. Nolita gives this very special, relaxing atmosphere with cute little restaurants and bars and boutique shops but also top end dining and shopping within walking distance from the hotel. There's a bunch of subway stations nearby to do the usual NYC attractions during the day.The staff is friendly, helpful, cool and knowledgable, and always has an optimistic 'everything will be fine'-attitude. Rooms were serviced perfectly (and that's something we haven't experienced in many hotels so far). Not to mention the daily happy hour(s) with complementary wine and snacks where one can easily connect with other guests.The roof terrace has stunning views on midtown, Williamsburg bridge and the financial district. We recognized installations for a bar, hopefully that materializes eventually…The only downturn (but it was not significant for us) was that our corner room, facing NE/SE, warmed up pretty much on a sunny morning, and the A/C was too noisy to let it run during the night. So if you're sensitive for either, you better pick a SE/SW corner or a SE balcony room. All higher floor rooms have nice views anyway.So bottom line, this was the right choice, and we definitely will come back. There's only few hotels that feature that special relaxing atmosphere next to being a very good hotel. Nolitan is one of it.

As a weekend getaway, the Nolitan is a perfect place to stay. Located conveniently in "Nolita" the hotel is centrally located from everything you want to do to relax and enjoy a cultured weekend in the city. Minutes away from bustling Chinatown or Little Italy, you can also change pace of neighborhoods just a few minute walk in the opposite direction towards Soho. The surrounding neighborhoods offer every sort of cuisine you could imagine, and endless shopping on Broadway. (Only a walk away!)Upon check in, the staff was super friendly and helpful in offering any assistance to make our stay more enjoyable. The rooms... beautiful, clean, crisp, and mod. I think it was one of the most comfortable beds I had slept in. I am highly allergic to just about everything and I couldn't have felt healthier the weekend we stayed at the Nolita.If you're looking for clean, convenient, and comfortable... I would highly recommend the Nolita. It was a pleasant surprise and we hope to return for another weekend getaway.
user_name:
Douliketotravel
New York City, New York

review_body: Great newish hotel in coolest area of New York - Nolita. Staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. Room kind of small but neat and tastefully decorated. Little noisy from the street at night but earplugs and having the fan on solved that problem - probably like this anywhere on Manhattan. Great that you can use the hotel's bicycles, skateboards etc. Due to jetlag we were kind of up early so had breakfast a few mornings in the hotel restaurant and food was good - it opens 7am unlike most places in the area which open 8.30am. All in all a great stay and will definitely be back at Nolitan next time in NYC. Hopefully they get their bar opened on the rooftop which has great views over Williamsburg bridge.

Amazing service is the cornerstone of the wonderful experience at the Nolitan. As some people know, it has been pretty horribly rainy weather in New York, and I was really dreading a couple days in the city with a 3-month old baby in tow-- waiting outside for taxis, hauling a stroller around, waiting until 3pm to check in, noise from neighbors and no room for the pack and play. However, from the moment we arrived, soaking wet and really tired, our every need was met and exceeded. We were given a room upgrade to a Corner King and the view and space were cleverly laid out and inviting; loved the small touches like a super cozy cashmere throw at the end of the bed. Best of all, they let us check in early-- total godsend when you have a baby in tow! I'm not saying they will always be able to do this, but the fact that they were willing to try to get us in ahead of time, shows flexibility and this is a sure sign of really good service. They advised us ahead of time that parking next door, instead of using a valet would save us $20/day which is really nice of them. Also, on more than one occasion, the doormen stood outside in the pouring rain to hail us a taxi. Due to the rain, there were not many available in the area but they must have waiting outside for at least 15 minutes, and it was really pouring!They had a happy hour in the lobby lounge with complimentary red wine/white wine/cava and dried fruit, two kinds of cheese, grapes, crackers, nuts and a Bed Head pyjama trunk show. This was so fun because all the staff were in pajamas for the event and the wine and snacks were delicious! The hotel is clearly aimed at hip, travel savvy people of all ages, but one may not initially think of bringing a child. I can personally say, I felt completely looked after and our baby had a good time too!This hotel is lovely, the staff is uncompromisingly kind, accommodating and fun!

We stayed here for 4 nights in Feb in the winter cold and it was beautiful. Lovely breakfasts and perfect location for exploring the nearby boroughs. Walked the whole southern end of Manhattan island and shopped every day with easy walk home and to cafes. The room was small without being cramped but that's what they all are in NYC, and you don't need much more. Modern upholsteries and all the luxury items you could want. It was great just hanging around downstairs in the lobby reading and talking to the staff for awesome local tips on eateries and bars. This place is great and recommend it highly.

Lying in bed I had an unobstructed view of the empire state building. The service was great, the new restaurant has good French cuisine. The bar is worth a visit, extensive selection. If you stay be sure to check out the fiat cafe, my pick for best cup of coffee in the city, and Pravda Russian vodka bar, great place!

My husband and I stayed here for one night, and I have to give it the highest compliment that I can come up with: thoughtful. The room and decor were absolutely amazing - the space planning was perfect in the room, and more than comfortable. Most of all, they provided everything you could imagine, with taste and grace. There was even an umbrella in our room for our use (thank goodness, because it poured rain that night). The room was spotlessly clean. The perfect view of the Empire State Building from our room was breathtaking ( also especially from the amazing roof deck!).The staff were WONDERFUL - we asked for a restaurant recommendation and they really took into consideration what kind of food we liked and were interested to try. Every place that they recommended was within walking distance, and honestly, where we ended up was one of the best meals of my life, in an absolutely charming environment. The sleep was fantastic - the pillows are like clouds - and the climate control system gave us just the right temperature all night. There was also an IPOD dock and alarm clock by the bed. All in all, this was definitely the most stylish and comfortable stay we've ever had in New York, if not all our travels. We will definitely be returning!

We´ve just arrived back home after 4 nights in New York, staying at The Nolitan Hotel. The last thing I promised Kimberley was to give an honest review in here. So here goes;As I said in the heading; what more could you want? Location was very good. In a local New York neighborhood, that gave you the feeling of being in the city itself. Yet close to Soho shopping and the charm of Little Italy. Easy to walk down to Financial district, Battery Park and Ground Zero. The room (we were on the 7th floor) was small, but stylish. And the bed was very comfy. Small terrace (that we did not use...too hot!). All amenities in place, and separate wc/bathroom is also on the positive note. Only thing that wasn´t all that good, was the a/c that made a lot of noise in the night. Sounded like a truck starting at times...Lobby and restaurant - very nice with a very cool and relaxed atmosphere. The guys at the reception and restaurant were very accommodating and service minded (like all americans are!). The complementary wine and cheese at 5pm was very nice and made for a great atmosphere. My wife injured her leg the day before we arrived, so she came on crutches and we had to rent a wheelchair. When we were leaving, Kimberley arranged for the rental agency to pick up the chair, saving us the trouble. Well done - those are the things that takes the place from good to great. A small tip though; make more out of the rooftop terrace...We had a great time in New York, and will definitely come back. Will we stay at the Nolitan next time? 100% yes.

I recently spent a night at the Nolitan and I was really happy with my stay. I was already a fan of the architecture and design from having seen photos (which, admittedly had a lot to do with my choice in booking there) and knew how great the neighborhood was so my expectations were a bit high coming in. I have to say though the reality of the experience exceeded my expectations. The building is beautiful and the room was great, comfortable and cool - the design of it belied it's compact nature so I never felt crowded. The service and staff were gracious and friendly - so rarely the case in a hip property. Highly recommended with no caveats - my new go-to in NYC.

We stayed for one fantastic night and made another reservation as soon as we checked out. The staff is amazing (especially Sire), the room extremely comfortable and cool design, wine in the lobby from 5-7 is a lovely touch, all in all wonderful place. Highly recommended.
user_name:
Pamala28
New York City, New York

review_body: Just got back from my third visit to the Nolitan and what can I say, I love it there! The location is awesome, close to everyting I adore in New York. The room is compact but well designed with a great little balcony. The staff are gracious and I very much appreciated the complimentary wine/champagne in the early evening and the umbrellas on the rainy days. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in the city. I can't wait to go back!

Just stayed here for 5 nights and had an excellent time. 1st time we have stayed in this area and will definitely choose the Nolitan next time we visit NYC (Hopefully the prices stay at the affordable level). Staff were excellent and couldn't be more helpful. Great views from rooftop and our balcony. Enjoyed the wine and cheese happy hours in reception and the umbrellas were excellent when we needed them!! Relaxed neighbourhood with lots of nice bars and restaurants on the doorstep so we didn't have to venture far at all.

We stayed 5 nights at the Nolitan for our honeymoon. The staff were all extremely nice, professional and helpful. The room, although small (but in line with New York size) was very clean and modern - impeccable. As we were on the 8th floor, it was also very quiet for a downtown location. Close to many interesting areas (SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy, etc.) and close to the Subway for all your other endeavors. Great perks like continental breakfast in the morning, daily Happy Hour with wine and cheese, umbrellas, bikes, concierge services, etc. Nice trendy atmosphere, but layed-back and unpretentious. Would definitely stay there again. Thanks to Carlos, Jordan and Mervin at the front desk for making it a memorable stay.

From the time I walked into the Nolitan to the time I left the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms are small -as you'd expect from a boutique hotel in this price range - but they have a nice modern design, are clean and very comfortable. But by far the staff was the best part of my stay. I'd recommend it if you are staying in that part of the city.

Great little hotel - I like to try different places in the city each time I stay and this hotel is at the top of my list of favourites. Really nice unpretentious staff and a great surprise to be presented with champagne, on the house, because it was my birthday.

Good location easy to Soho, Nolita (try Peasant on Elizabeth Street for dinner one night), Little Italy, Chinatown, etc.. Not too far on foot to TriBeCa and the village. Close enough to the subway to get further afield. The room I had (301) wasn't as tiny as I'd expected (other rooms might be different) and the bed was comfy. Staff were friendly and helpful. The vibe is modern and cool without the bags of attitude that spoils more famously branded (and uber-chic) places like the Mondrian up the road. I also stayed at the Mondrian recently (see separate review) and the Nolitan was much better value.

We stayed at The Nolitan for 9 nights and would highly recommend it. It's a cosy boutique hotel with lots of nice touches. The rooms are a decent size for New York where space is at a premium with very comfortable beds. We took our free copy of the New York Times for coffee and sometimes breakfast in the newly renovated Cantine Parisienne restaurant of a morning. The staff were helpful and friendly arranging a restaurant reservation for us and advice on ATM's, warning chip and pin cards hit and miss in America. Every night there is a complimentary cheese and wine from 5-7pm in the lobby where you can chat to your fellow guests or read a book. The roof terrace affords amazing views of the city and I imagine in Spring/Summer it would be a great place to enjoy a drink. The hotel is situated close to Little Italy, Chinatown, SOHO and the Lower East Side, all interesting neighbourhoods. There are bars and restaurants a plenty on your doorstep.There are several subway stations close by from which to explore the city. Special mention to visit the Lower East Side Tenement museum a 5-10 minute walk away and to walk across the Williamsburg bridge to Williamsburg, Brooklyn. I wouldn't hesitate to say there again.

I was very satisfied with my stay at the Nolitan Hotel. The place was very clean and they have all the amenities that I needed at a reasonable price. The location in southern Manhattan was very convenient with the subway only a couple of blocks away.

We stayed at the Nolitan in December for the holidays. I loved the neighborhood, There were some great little bars and so many shops. (You MUST go to the Little Cupcake Bakeshop a block or two away! But I digress..) Chinatown was also directly behind the hotel, so when we left in the morning there were some pungent fish smells! Also very close to Little Italy and all the restaurants. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, the bathroom was large and spacious, hard to find in NYC! and there was a closet to hang stuff up. We also had access to a little roof deck, which everyone can access, we just happened to have a door from our room. There was some noise with the construction downstairs, I think they were building a restaurant, but we weren't around much during the day so it didn't really bother us and never woke us. They had a nice wine reception which we went to just once. The staff was very helpful when we asked for recommendations, though seemed a bit hesitant at first, perhaps they aren't used to tourists asking for info in that neighborhood. It is rather expensive once you add in all the taxes, but hey, it's NYC and it was the holidays, so oh well!

My husband and I stayed here last November for 11 nights and we loved every bit of it. It was exactly how you see it in pictures and though small, it was very clean and had a nice cool vibe to it. Decor was minimal yet trendy and we felt like hipsters! Staff were very friendly and helpful especially in getting us a taxi to the airport during rush hour.Loved the location and was very pleased we chose this area as opposed to the busy and noisy mid town. It felt safe even on our walks back very late at night. It made us feel a little more local compared to the touristy areas, which was something we really loved.We had a room facing the main street and honestly we weren't affected by the noise at all. I would definitely recommend anyone whose looking for a trendy boutique hotel slightly off the beaten track (yet super accessible)!

Just returned from our 4th stay at the Nolitan, and looking forward to our 5th. This little gem of a hotel is located in a great neighborhood - still basically undiscovered by tourists, yet close to the best areas. The rooms are small but kept immaculately clean and the public areas are comfortable, but the best part of the Nolitan is the staff. From housekeeping to the front desk, General Manager Jennifer Villanueva has assembled a terrific cast. Warm, friendly and attentive - these people really care about their guests. A very, very special thanks to Sire and Stephanie, who went above and beyond to take care of us, and to make my husband's birthday special. Thank you so much, and we'll see you soon!

This hotel is clean and modern.The ceilings are concrete and the floors are wood. They have a rain shower with clear glass walls and a separate toilet with its own little room, for life's little emergencies. The layout is great which works out since the space is pretty small. We had a balcony overlooking Kenmare which was nice to watch traffic coming off the Williamsburg bridge and for people watching. The noise wasn't so bad as we were on the 7th floor. The employees of this hotel had to be the friendliest we have ever encountered. We got an early check in, which i had prayed for but didn't expect. They called us the day before our arrival to ask if we needed anything specifically upon check in. They offer free bikes and skateboards while you are a guest at the hotel. They have robes and slippers which are very comfortable.They offer free wifi. They now have a restaurant and bar next to the lobby. The rooftop views are amazing and breathtaking, You could see the WTC and the Williamsburg bridge unobstructed. Its centrally located, smack dab between chinatown,little italy,lower east side,east village,soho and the west village. We only had to take a cab once while we were there.I cant stop recommending this hotel on all fronts. I am definitely going to be staying there again when we go in August.

Just finished a wonderful stay at the Nolitan Hotel. While the area isn't quite as trendy as some places nearby, it does have a nice vibe and felt relatively safe even late at night (some bits of the nearby Bowery, by comparison, felt distinctly seedy). There's also a good variety of restaurants and pubs/bars nearby. The Nolitan is only a 5-10 minute walk from the great shopping on Broadway, and the nearest subway station (Spring Street) is likewise only a 5 minute walk away and will get you to midtown in less than 15 minutes on the 6 line (the entrance to the uptown platform is just next to the Duane Reade on the corner of Spring and Lafayette Streets). The rooms themselves are on the small-ish side but well laid out and very comfortable (especially for the price, which was much better than a lot of the other options in the area). The bathrooms in particular are much larger than you'd expect relative to the overall size of the room, and the glass shower looking out onto the room is unusual but helps to make the room feel bigger than it is. The bed was one of the most comfortable that I've come across in a hotel, although a fair bit of street noise does reach the rooms (unless you're a particularly light sleeper, though, it shouldn't be enough to cause problems). The front desk staff were friendly and obliging without being overbearing, and my room was always cleaned to an impeccable standard. Free wifi is available for guests, although speeds can be on the slow side. The only (very minor) downside of the location is that taxis weren't that easy to hail on Kenmare Street, but if you walk around the corner to the Bowery you won't have any trouble finding one.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Nolitan. Every staff member I met was courteous and knowledgeable in the neighborhood. The room has a quirky layout with everything you need cleverly packaged in. Bed was very comfortable.In addition to being at a nice location in Manhattan, the Nolitan is straight down the road from Williamsburg Bridge which made it very convenient for me. There's a parking garage across Elizabeth and another nearby so parking was easy.

I stayed at the Nolitan for a few nights in April, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. For me the location, between the Lower East Side and Soho, was perfect. I also love the Thompson LES, but this time I wanted to try a new hotel, and the Nolitan also seemed well priced (for NYC). Hotel rooms in New York are usually on the small side, but my room was very comfortable, had everything I wanted (except an in-room safe, but I just kept things locked in my suitcase) and I appreciated the clean, modern design. They also offer free wifi, which seems like such a small thing, but so many hotels still charge for it, so I was pleased not to have this hidden cost. Another amenity that was a nice touch is that they give guests free passes to a local gym. I loved the well-designed lobby area, and the staff were very courteous. They add little touches, like a jar of free popcorn and cold water in the lobby, as well as a free cocktail hour with wine and cheese (which I didn't try), which make you feel welcome there, creating a good ambience. Noise wasn't an issue for me, and it was easy to catch cabs in the neighbourhood. All in all I had a great stay, and would definitely stay at the Nolitan again!

Based on other trip advisor reviews, location and cost, I decided to book this hotel for my first trip to NYC. The trip was to celebrate my 40th birthday so I was a little anxious that it tick all the boxes. I wasn't disappointed. It exceeded all expectations and I can't speak highly enough of the staff, decor, vibe and location. There are fantastic restaurants and bars nearby and it's so close to fab Soho shopping and subway. Thanks so much for making my birthday special, especially the wake up visit with champagne, goodies and a great rendition of Happy Birthday organised from home!

We stayed two nights at the Nolitan with our 3 year old and we had a wonderful stay. The staff helped us unload curbside and parking was right across the street. I don't have a lot to comment about because everything went well. No bed bugs, not too noisy. Jim

This is a terrific, small hotel -- room decor is part-loft, part-industrial and all chic. Ceilings are polished concrete, sanded wood floors, very cool bathroom, bed and linens top of the line. We stayed here three nights, first two there was zero sound but the last night, there was a pitched battle in the room across the hall and there was muffled sound coming into our room around the door. When we mentioned this at check out, the clerk was very solicitous, explained that they would have preferred to bring this to their attention when it was happening, what they would have done, urged me to mention our entire experience in my review, etc etc. In other words a perfect response (at least to us). As has been mentioned in other reviews, the service was exceptional in every way. We enjoyed the breakfast in the newly opened restaurant too. Great location, very hip shops right along Elizabeth St, numerous neighborhood eateries and bars. We'll stay here next time without question.

I LOVED this hotel. The design is modern with a retro feel and great little touches throughout. The location is great being near lots of great restaurants (you Have to go to Peasant!) and in a gentrifying part of NYC. The rooftop area is great for taking photos of the NYC skyline whilst sipping their FREE wine offerings each afternoon. If you are travelling, the ability to use their bicycles is a wonderful feature of this hotel, and one of the highlights of our trip. Albeit it a little on the small side, the rooms were clean, fresh, wonderfully designed and the balcony was great for us to sit out on and enjoy some breakfast. The free wifi is also welcomed and the staff were wonderfulThe only real issue was the noise. If you aren't a city dweller, the hotel is located on a busy road (yes I realise its NYC, but this is a four lane road), and whilst the sound proofing in the room is quite good, we found ourselves sleeping with earplugs each night. I stayed at another 4.5 star hotel in midtown near Times Square for a few days before checking in to this hotel, and found it was much quieter. That said, I would have pick this hotel to stay at hands down over the other hotel for the reasons described above.I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Great location, delightful friendly staff, comfortable bed. Pleasant low-key lobby, easy to hang out there. Best of all, the bathroom lighting is actually illuminating. So many times bathrooms in hotels are way too dim. This bathroom was well designed and well lit. The only drawback was a noisy heater/ air conditioner unit--at least in the room I was in. The onsite restaurant is good but a bit pricey. Plenty of other restaurant choices nearby.
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Kathy B
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: Though the location is near SOHO, the nearby subway J train is always under construction, so public transportation is not that convenient. Kenmare street is very busy even if in midnight, so it is a little bit noisy. And I don't know why there is always honk.About the room, it is a bit small considering the price, but it's very clean and stylish. I love the bed and comforter. However, the air con fan is astonishingly NOISY. Therefore we heated up the room and then turned it off during sleeping. Although we have a balcony, the street view is not attractive. The view on the roof is superb, and you can get on the roof directly by elevator.Confidential breakfast is not impressive: few choices. I expected it would be great with this price.The doorman, Dochi, is cute and friendly.

This hotel is within walking distance of great shopping, eating and drinking. Loved the 5:00 happy hour with nice cheese, dried fruit, nuts, wine. Rooms are small, beds are very comfortable. The Cantine Parisienne is excellent.

From start to finish, the Nolitan met our expectations. Check in was quick and friendly. We arrived early and they stored our luggage. We had asked for a Neighborhood King, and when we checked in they had us in a Cityscape Queen--technically an upgrade, but we had wanted a king and they accommodated us. The restaurant that provides breakfast is good, but there are excellent options in the surrounding neighborhood, including the Fiat Cafe. In the evening, "Sips and Savories" are provided. Joy, who had been our contact, provided some great advice. Our room was immaculate everyday (though we didn't get chocolates on our pillow every night). The view from the roof is spectacular--it will be great in the spring and summer when the weather cooperates. What a terrific neighborhood...not as "touristy" as some others. I highly recommend this hotel because of its friendliness, cleanliness, and location, location, location.

From check in to check out, the people at the Nolitan got it right. Friendly staff greet you on arrival. Check in is quick and painless. The room, one with a balcony, was spacious, well designed and had everything a guest needs. A safe, plenty of drawer space, a iron and ironing board, a hairdryer, plenty of toiletries, a great sized cupboard with lots of hangers, an umbrella in case its raining outside, a well stocked minibar and even an adaptor for us non Americans. The bed was so comfortable, I slept like a baby every night. There is alot of street noise from outside- this is New York after all!- but reception can supply you with ear plugs and even a noise reduction machine! We didn't try that, cos we brought our own ear plugs, but it shows the hotels committment to make their guests' stay as comfortable as possible.The 'sips and savouries', mon-sat evening is such a lovely idea. Plates of delicious cheese, crackers, olives, dried fruit along with red, white or sparkling wine is available for guests to enjoy in the lobby. Its a great way to start off the evening, and to meet fellow guests.Breakfast is continental- not the most extensive or exotic selection that you will ever see, but the coffee is good- by American standards- , there is a good selection of breads and pastries, and the French staff are extremely friendly. One morning the waitress was on her own- and was rushed off her feet, but she maintained her cheerful and friendly attitude when lesser people would have cracked under the pressure.All the staff at the Nolitan were exemplary. helpful, polite and friendly. The area of Nolita is packed with shops, restaurants and bars. And there is the museum of Contemporary art around the corner. We loved the Mulberry bar for beer, and local atmosphere. Emporio, also nearby does a great brunch- the food was the best we had in New York.The hotel is also near really good public transport, Spring Street station, a five minute walk away will take you uptown, serving sights such as Union Street Square, Grand Central and the Met Museum of Art. Bowery subway station will take you either down to Wall Street and the World Trade Centre or over to Brooklyn.So, if you are in New York, it HAS to be the NOLITAN

We checked into our room late at night after a long night in the city and were impressed with the prompt and courteous service. Within minutes we had our room keys and were making our way to the very spacious corner suite on the 8th floor. Nice soft radio music that greeted us when we walked into the room was a sweet touch! The views from the corner suite was AMAZING- especially at night when you can make out the dazzling lights from the Williamsburg bridge from one window, and the Empire State Building in the other. And the room itself was a work of art! Absolutely loved the modern, contemporary decor. The cold, sleek concrete touched up with soft, high quality furniture makes you want to consider living there for good!The hotel staff had everything we needed, I forgot my shaving kit, they provided us with one. THe bathroom was stocked to impress! The shampoo and conditioner werent the cheap kind you find at most hotels that smell like your grandma's perfumes. Nice hygiene kit and toiletries! You could literally come without any of your own things and still feel clean and comfortable.The bathrobes were warm and comfortable and they even provide you with brand new indoor slippers! Overall, awesome stay!
user_name:
Anthony C
Brooklyn, New York, United States

review_body: Just back in SF after a fantastic stay at The Nolitan! Couldn't have been better. Fabulous room, really nice and welcoming staff, great lobby for relaxing and don't forget to check out the roof top with its wonderful views of the city. Loved the neighborhood - really close to everything. Will absolutely stay her on our next visit to NYC.

We spent 5 nights at the Nolitan and our stay was just perfect. We travel to NYC at least 2 times per year and have been staying at the James Soho or the Trump (soho) but have now found OUR hotel! The staff is super friendly and helpful, the wifi works (many hotels rave about their wifi but it's either too slow or there is an addional costs which I think is ridiculous especially if the room rate is very high), rooms are clean and modern and the location is awesome (if you like chinatown and broadway). We had an angle room on the 4th floor (which did not look out to the main road (Kenmare) and were not disturbed by the noise at all. One negative point is the breakfast which I would not book again: the continental breakfast is basically bread and jam and some pastries, no extras. If you want a coffee latte in addition, you pay. On our last day my partner and I decided to skip breakfast and only had a hot tea, our daughter opted for scrambled eggs and the bill came down to following: 3 full continental breakfasts (for 2 teas???) plus scrambled eggs (usd 16 which we had to pay extra since it was not part of the continental breakfast). When we complained, the waiter (very firmly) told us that it didn't matter what they put on our bill since it was the amount the restaurant billed to the hotel and we would only pay for the eggs anyway (that was not quite the point I would say). So great hotel, devasting breakfast service!

This hotel is in a great location. Clean, bohemian like in style, great lounge. Happy hour has some great red wine. Staff was always very helpful. I loved it here. We were on the 7th floor, and slept comfortably. The noise outside was very little, beds are comfy. Price for what you get is GREAT!

Ok, if you are new to New York or have never been in Manhattan and want to hit the ground running and shopping in the "Capital of the World," then this is the place to ease you in. If you are here on business and need to rely on alert hotel staff comfort and convienience, then book the Nolitan. I'm a New Yorker and an Up-Stater by residence now. Born and raised in Los Angeles for first 1/2 of my life. That said I'm drawn to the Nolitan because it represents the next chapter in Manhattan. In 5 minutes drive you are in Williamsburg Brooklyn the take the Spirits Tour "buy local" etc., plus you are next door to the home of fashion's shops. For you newbies that need ChinaTown and Little Italy, we won't judge you for going.  The Hotel reflects the side of New York you have only heard of. The staff are not condescending to the "clueless" tourists and can give you the resident opinion of the constantly changing food scene of lower Manhattan. As I'm writing this everyone in the lobby is bilingual mostly from the EU. Obviously everyone can have a bad day at work but I've never seen a consistently proactive group in the staff. The rooms are perfect for adult chill time. Last time I stayed was +1 year right after opening. Mostly couples stay in my opinion, if you need a kiddy pool seek life elsewhere, this is NYC. If you aren't ready for it, go to Queens or Staten Island, or maybe White Plains. Otherwise, this is the city experience like it should be.

Loved the hotel, specially the suite 801 to which we were upgraded for 1 night, great spacious room with fabulous views, you just don't want to go out! The lower corner room also nice. Hip & light feeling and good comfort. Nice shower and closet space. In 402 we heard noise from the corridor, airco can be noisy when switched on, street noise no problem. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great location near Chinatown, little Italy and hip shops, restaurants and subway. The Cantine Parisienne restaurant serves tasty modern french food in a hip urban setting. Taxi service to airport went smooth. Would stay here again!

The Nolitan is really a gem. The location is central to SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown. The decor is modern but unassuming. The staff is honestly friendly and helpful, and the new restaurant was excellent. On my last visit, we arrived early and were allowed to check-in before 9:00. The room had a small terrace that was nice to step out onto even though it was early March, and being on one of the higher floors gave us a great city-view at night. Can't wait to go back this summer.

I stayed one night while in NYC on business. Location is great, wonderful lobby, great customer service, rooms were awesome with floor to ceiling windows and black out shades if you want to sleep in. excellent bed and linens plus a soaking tub. I was upgraded to a corner room and so very pleased. Includes breakfast in the lobby. There are bikes and skateboards for rent. It was very cold when i was there. The staff asked a number of times if I wanted additional blankets

From phone res to final check-out, Nolitan did everything right. Courteous, accommodating, professional. Our room was more than clean; it was immaculate. You see a tasteful combination of raw concrete and finished, austere white wall. It's cool. Bathroom is spacious, bed and bedding crisp. And what, a heated closet? At checkout, I ask, Can we leave stuff in the room until, oh, 11:30? Man at the desk, answers, a gleam in his eye, I love that question. Because you're good until 1:00 at the Nolitan. In the adjoining restaurant, we had great coffee, oatmeal, brioche. All fine. We know where to stay now.

The Nolitan is one of the best hotels ice stayed in; I'm no novice, so let me explain why:1) location. Walking distance to soho, little Italy, Chinatown and Williamsburg. Quality locally-run restaurants, bars, delis, shops aplenty2) hotel finish. The lobby is homely, cool. Not gigantic nor impersonal. The rooms are high quality with excellent touches such as personalised truffles upon arrival, great hotel bar at reasonable prices, great touch with shower that has a glass wall - shower whilst looking at the Empire State! Or draw the curtain... Bed great quality with memory foam topper and cashmere blanket. Roof terrace with great views and bar to come soon. Private room balcony overlooking williamsburg bridge and empire state. No rooms looking directly in. Finally, free wine, sparkling wine and snacks for two hours every day. Given NYC is about £8 a glass, a welcome saver.3) staff. Courteous and helpful throughout and not because they were fishing or insistent on tips. Very welcome. Went extra mile sorting welcome packages out to make the weekend that bit more special. Not sure what the hullabaloo with going through another entrance is about. Plenty of venues in the area do this to keep out the cold. 4) cost. For what we got, very reasonable pricing versus many others in NYCSpecial thanks to Mark (barman), Sire and Jennifer. Am sure will be back sooner than I expected prior to the trip.Gordon

Great hotel, excellent location for lower manhattan with easy access to up town. Would quite happily stay again.Staff were found to be more than helpful. Rooms are not enormous, but very practical with all the facilities. Beds even came with above average linen.

Upon arrival we erroneously attempted to make our entrance using the side (restaurant) door; I asked the waitress whether we could go through to the main reception thence, the restaurant being empty - she directed us back out onto the Street, and through the main entrance, where we did struggle with the wind-flaps, useful as it was sub-zero temperatures. It was easy to access the restaurant for breakfast the next day... (apart from the arguement with a check-in lad, who informed that the Hotel had changed it's breakfast 'Policy'/broke it's Contract with us, and that we would graciously be given vouchers daily - we had paid for everything in advance !)The room was good, great views, quiet enough, but the heating system was not working, so I called their service dept., and promptly arrived the engineer; he changed the a/c. filter, but the contact pins on the wall-mounted control unit on the wall were also faulty, so we were given a room a couple of floors up - an even better view ! Unfortunately, this room's heating unit was so noisy, we couldn't use it at night, and didn't even want to whilst in the room... Some great staff (thank you Joy, George, Wilson ) and also some less memorable... Hopefully the various technical and staffing problems can be resolved.

Don't miss this gem in Nolita. Amazing rooms and style. See my pics. My only comments are related to the bellman who 2x I asked for items which were not delivered. But not a big deal. There is a brand new French restaurant attached and it was very good. Ill be staying here often.

My husband and I chose to stay at The Nolitan for a few reasons; it was recommended by someone who has great taste, it was in the perfect neighborhood, it looked cool and it had bikes for guests (husband is a big fan of biking through cities). We stayed in a room with a balcony which some people have commented that it makes the room smaller and you don't go out on it very much, but I loved having access to fresh air and a place to view the street. Our bed was amazingly comfortable and the mini-fridge allowed us to remove items so we could put our own beverages and snacks in it. We did not get yelled at for doing this (some hotels hate this). Out first night had lovely turn down service with homemade macrons instead of the usual chocolate piece. The shower is unique and may be uncomfortable for some guests; it is in the room (not separated as the toilet is). There is a curtain on the side that faces out, but if you are in a room that is this cozy, I can't imagine that you would be shy about the shower. The toiletries are by Red Flower and if you know the brand...they are quite yummy. Anything else that was needed or any request made was met with a smile and absolutely no attitude. Pride was taken in making sure that the room was spotless. The robes were cozy and I loved the slippers! A newspaper was at our door every morning. During our stay, the restaurant was still under construction. This was a bit of a disappointment but not so much so that it made our stay any less special. Mornings had coffee and tea ready in the lobby along with fruit and toast and bagels and sweet rolls. The lobby in the late afternoon was a time to have a glass of wine with the other guests and some noshes for a casual break before any evening plans. A note on the lobby; it was so lovely, especially after dark when a beautiful screen projection produced a magical atmosphere. The modernist chandelier was spectacular also. Another plus, if you care about such things; most hotels have a "library" that consists of paperbacks and bad novels left by guests. The Nolitan has an art library! An amazing selection of art and design and architecture books that you are welcome to take to your room. Oh, and I'm forgetting the roofgarden; an area that has a breathtaking view of downtown, including the yet to be completed Freedom Tower. In warmer months this feature would be a must, although even in October, it was lovely to take in the expansive view.So the reason for our visit to New York was to attend my 40th high school reunion on Long Island. The reunion was on Saturday, October 27th. We arrived in New York on Thursday, October 25th, and had reservations to return to Florida on Monday, October 29th. The reunion was terrific and although there was a bit of a concern about a storm called Sandy, no one could predict was exactly was going to happen during the next few days. On Sunday back at the hotel, the weather was not looking so great. A day to rest and listen to the news and make sure friends and family were taking this storm seriously. We had also heard from our airline that we would not be flying on Monday...oh really? So as Monday turned uglier and uglier...Superstorm Sandy had arrived. But the staff at The Nolitan could not have been more gracious. Most of them had been up all night monitoring the storm. They had brought extra clothes and looked totality professional in the chaos that was downtown. The power went out but the lobby had a generator and the elevators never stopped working. And people were scared and the staff did everything they could to clam every guest. They made phone calls, they had hot water and hot coffee and they always were sympathetic and kind. Due to the construction of the restaurant, part of the lobby was cold and threatened to be wet. So it was closed off (and those lovely art books placed somewhere safe). What was amazing was that The Nolitan was one of the few businesses that had any power and without any cell service, we were relying on our iPads and computers and the internet access on our smart phones. And every guest had at least three electronic devices that needed charging and the staff charged ever one of those devices without question.And in speaking to people who were hanging out in the lobby (there was really nowhere else to go) I found out that the staff was charging the phones and computers of their neighbors!!! This truly convinced me of how special all of the staff was! They were helping people who were not staying at the hotel because they were being good neighbors and because it was the right thing to do! And many of those neighbors were hanging out in the lobby just to be with other people as it was very scary to be alone in the dark in New York.and speaking of...I have never seen New York so dark before. It was almost impossible to go outside; no street lights, no traffic lights, no store lights; just total darkness. And somehow The Nolitan managed to keep us all safe and warm and with some light and with snacks and beverages and a feeling that we were in this together and it could have been so much worse as it was a few blocks below us and in Staten Island and Long Island and New Jersey and Queens...Our rooms did not have power, but we were given flashlights to move around and we were only in the room to sleep. The lobby became command central. The Nolitan was becoming home. At 3 AM I was in the lobby in my pj's and a sweater trying to contact the airline (JetBlue damn them!) on the hotel's landlines which were operational. In the morning the staff called at least six pharmacies for me to see if any in the area were open (note to self and those who take daily meds; pack lot's of extras!!!). None were open but they kept trying because by now we were all feeling like family. Also NYPD came to the neighborhood and began to direct traffic when the streets were finally safe to pass, but the traffic lights were still out. And where did they take breaks to use the facilities and have a nice hot cup of coffee. Well, the lobby of The Nolitan of course!!!We finally left New York on Friday, and after the most complicated trip I have ever experienced we returned to Florida around November 4th.But I can't wait to return to The Nolitan! Everyone was so kind and helpful and they put the well-being of their guests above all else. I'm sure the staff had their own personal worries, but they were there for us and always professional and kind. So I'm hoping for a trip when it is warm enough to enjoy the roofgraden and the new restaurant and take a bike and ride around the city and to say hi to all of the great staff that made what could have been a terrible situation into something where you know you have just seen the very best that people can be. Thank you Nolitan. I can't wait to see you all again (especially you Carlos :-)

I originally booked a stay at this hotel through Tablet Hotels paying for the room in advance back in the Fall of 2012. But then I became sick and was unable to go to NYC. At the time of booking, our upfront payment was not refundable but the Nolitan Hotel generously credited us for a future trip to NYC, and we rescheduled a trip to NYC in January and was able to use this credit for our January stay. I'm very grateful to Nolitan for their flexibility.Now the hotel - it was awesome. The neighborhood was fantastic - in the lower east side - my new favorite hood to hang out in - near the Williamsburg bridge. We had great eats that weekend near the hotel, including the south Willaimsburg area after a pleasant beautiful walk over the bridge. The room was bigger than expected (especially given NYC) and the bed was awesomely comfortable (check pic). The shower was "open" - meaning that the shower had glass walls into the bedroom. There is a curtain one can pull for privacy ...... though it's a bit awkward to shower some openly, it does add to the room feeling bigger as the whole space appears "open". The staff were very helpful and friendly - which added to a great stay. Love the lobby and wished I had more time to hang in it. We discovered in the late afternoon / early evening - free wine and snacks were available. The hotel had extra perks such as bike and skateboard rentals (which I think were free but I could be mistaken). Given that it was January, we're not renting bikes but still loved that they were there to use. And if you forgot your laptop, they had ipads one could use. Oh and there's a fantastic balcony ..... though too cold for us to use but I did love it.Overall, I loved it. And would absolutely stay there again. My only hesitation is that it's a bit expensive ........ but I guess it's nyc ....Thanks Nolitan.

We stayed at the Nolitan for 7days in December/January.The hotel has a very good location but we were very disapointed with the service and the quality. Rooms and bathrooms are very cold. If you turn up the heat, the noise makes it very difficult to sleep soundly. We stayed one night in a suit to share between a couple and a friend. We had asked and paid in advance for an extra bed. Upon arrival that evening we were informed that the room was not ready yet. We finaly get in our room that night but to our surprise the sofa bed was not prepared. We had to call them to request sheets for it.The next day we changed rooms as we were only a couple and our friend had left. We were put in a nice small corner room that was freezing. Again we had to keep increasing the heater at the expense of our ears.Service was very poor most of the time and the breakfast was a bit of a joke. As another reviewer put it, the staff seemed to take a position of "i am cooler than you".Might be better once they are done renovating the restaurant and during summer so you don't freeze otherwise we don't going there for the time being.

This hotel is a welcoming industrial/contemporary style boutique hotel. I found it fun, very friendly, hip and well organized. It is located in the middle of all the action of Soho. People in other reviews mention it being noisy since it is in a busy street, but I was not bothered at all. The rooms are spotless, cozy small, with high quality fixtures and nice linens. Everything is new and beautifully designed and decorated. The hotel does not have a gym, pool, or spa, but they have an arrangement with a local gym if you want to work out. The restaurant had its soft opening when I was there and it looked promising. Definitely recommend it!!

My wife and I decided on an impromptu overnight stay in the City....late Valentine Day. The Hotel is in a great location (Nolita). We spent the night at Jazz Clubs in Greenwich Village....it was awesome. We had a Cityscape room on the top floor(9th). Awesome views of the city, room had a great feel, and the room was relatively large for NYC. Only issue was noisy heating system but who cares about sleep in NYC. Would definitely stay here again!!! Next morning spent strolling Nolita taking in the sights and having lunch at Lombardi's Pizza!!!
user_name:
Joe A
New York City, New York

review_body: This is truly a beautiful, corporate style oriented hotel located. I had a chance to stay there. The rooms were very cozy and of extremely high standard. The support staffs were very friendly and helpful. Overall had a great experience out there.

Pretty pricey (I spent $300/night). Great neighborhood. Restaurant under repair (they claim it will be ready by April 2013). Not the quietest hotel in the world (lots of traffic out front), but not terrible either.

Cosy rooms with a modern, stylish touch... A bit small and noisy (as often in NYC!) but nicely organized and very comfy. Not many facilities (no gym, no pool, no spa) but a restaurant should open by the end of Feb... Till then, no real breakfast is served unfortunately, which is the only thing I was disappointed about during my stay. General atmosphere is a bit fancy but friendly. Decent value for money and, most of all, a perfect location!

The Nolitan Hotel is a beautiful, industrial/contemporary style boutique hotel located right smack in the middle of all the action of SOHO, Greenwich Village, East Village, LES. Rooms are cozy in size but outfitted with all the latest and very high quality fixtures and appliances. Everything is also brand spanking new. Staff could not possibly be friendlier or more accommodating. Can't wait to go back when their bar and restaurant open, which they say will be any week now.

Location is great. Hotel needs much improovement. The rooms are tiny (typical for ny) but also not kept very clean and VERY NOISY. Kenmare is a very busy street and this place clearly did not spring for good windows because I stayed on the 9th (top) floor and was awoken by trucks at all hours. Also, they are the first hotel I have stayed at that does not have a professional system for wake-up calls. In a 5 day stay, one day my wake-up call didn't happen, one day I got it 15 minutes late, and the clincher was one day I got an 8:45am wake-up call at 7:00am! On top of that, my bathroom products were often not refreshed, the lobby was freezing with random space-heaters everywhere and one elevator was "out of service" for half my stay, leaving me waiting for several minutes any time I wanted to enter or leave my room. Also, there is no bar or restaurant there and no room service. Just beware...

My room was very cold as was lobby. Hotel currently is developing a "concept" for food; so no room service and mediocre pastries and coffee on paper plates and cups for breakfast, consumed perched on uncomfortable chairs, an improvisation that didn't work. Promised amenities such as newspaper and turn down service did not materialize and once I had to request even regular day time clean up. Room never really felt clean. Staff varied between "way cooler than you" indifference to sort of friendly. One of the elevators was out of service the entire stay; a good metaphor for a not ready for prime time hotel. Certainly not worth the over $1000 for three days.
user_name:
Jane F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I just finsihed a sabbatical in New York city when my work sent me again for a week of work.I wanted to experience something else than Chelsea where i had spend all this time, and i chose the Nolitan. And that was a good choice. It feels like home, the staff is super friendly and helpful, the hotel attaracts beautiful people and because it is a very personal place, people tend to talk to each other and connect over the usual 6 o'clock complimentary cheese and wine. The rooms are medum size, but modern and sensual, with a little balcony and all amenities. Amazing. loved it and strongly recommend it for a good price in a great burrough and a simple and lovely place to stay. Location is just amazing, steps from soho, steps from my favourite Epistrophy cafe, steps from the best foot massages in the world and the almonds cold drinks of China Town. Really easy and nice. Thank you for your warm reception. I will come back.Danielle

We stayed in the Nolitan Suite for our wedding. The suite was on the eight floor and had amazing views - looking uptown you could see empire state building, Chrysler building, etc. and looking east you could then see the Williamsburg bridge. Although the views from the rooftop are even better. The suite its self was set up very well and the living room area is big enough that you can easily entertain a few people. The huge soaking tub, which easily fits two, and rain shower were probably my favorite part of the suite. The design was clean and modern with a slight retro feel. When our photographers were taking photos they mentioned it looked very "mad men."The staff of the hotel was very eager to please and accommodating. The night of our arrival along with our wedding night they left champagne and a note congratulating us. They also gave us a very good rate on our block of rooms including a discounted rate on the suite.The restaurant was under construction while we were there but it didn't really impact us. They offered a light breakfast, most days we just grabbed a delicious bagel, and wine and cheese in the evenings. The location was excellent and it is only a short walk to the subway (Spring St. or Canal St.). One additional big plus to the location, at least for us, is that its in the heart of Nolita which means you are just a short walk to little italy, soho, LES, etc. so there is a ton of stuff to do but you are away from the crowds of tourist.We will defiantly stay here again on future trips to NYC.

We stayed at the Nolitan with a family group for my son's wedding a few days after Christmas. We received a pretty good rate for Manhattan as a group booking, and we all had a good stay!The rooms are very small but very efficiently laid out. We said it reminded us of those sample display rooms at IKEA! The bed was outstanding, especially the linens, some of the best we have ever slept on. The shower configuration was interesting, with glass walls on opposite sides, and a curtain on the room side for privacy but none on the sink side (and no door). Having the toilet in a separate little room helps.There is no dresser or place to open a suitcase other than the bed, but the closet is large enough to store everything. We had emptied the mini-fridge (it is FULL of items to purchase!) and used it to cool our own drinks. The continental breakfast is minimal, but the items that are available are tasty. There are no tables in the lobby, but several comfy seating areas to relax and have your pastry and coffee or tea. The weather during our stay was cold and wet, so we did not use the complimentary bikes (although we saw some people returning theirs after using them in the rain!). The walk to the Spring Street subway station isn't bad, 2-3 blocks. It's a good location, as long as you are willing to use the subway or a taxi to get to Times Square and beyond. The area around the hotel is fun, with several nice shops and cafes. They were remodeling the restaurant while we were there, which included a temporary lobby entrance, but it was not a problem. We parked our car in the garage across the street and did not use it again until we left. It's not very clear (at least to us non-Manhattanites!) what the procedure is, but you pull in and stop by the office door just off the street. They will come out and give you a ticket, then park your car for you. (They will also do this from the hotel, but it is more expensive. To do it yourself at the garage is only about 20 yards further than the hotel entrance!) I only mention this because we were thinking we would be parking it ourselves, and have time to gather our things from the van at that time. Instead, we had to kind of scramble to get everything we needed out of the van to take it across the street to the hotel. Not a big deal, just something we were not aware of.We enjoyed our stay and, depending on price, would choose the Nolitan again for a Manhattan stay.

Location! Location! Location! This is a wonderful location with a contemporary New York touch. It is located at the crossroads of quite a few neighborhoods that offer the diversity that is New York life. It will be perfect when the on-site restaurant is finished although the continental breakfast and evening wine and cheese offerings are quite nice. There are, in fact, plenty of restaurants near by. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Be sure to visit the rooftop terrace. Views are beautiful. We were on the 9th floor and had great "city" views from our room. The room was very efficiently designed with King bed to meet all needs without wasting space. Will definitely be staying again.

There's really very little to complain about with regards to the Nolitan. It's got a terrific location in a really interesting, walkable neighborhood. The smallish rooms have been cleverly designed to maximize space and comfort. The staff is helpful and accommodating, and the complimentary continental breakfast and evening wine and snacks are always a nice feature.I can't quite give the place five stars, since the renovation of their restaurant space has created some noise and draft issues. Nothing dire, but temporary nuisance enough to keep the place from fulfilling its potential. I would definitely stay here again, as it's steps from terrific restaurants and shops, at an intersection of a bunch of interesting neighborhoods, and convenient to public transportation to the rest of the city. Highly recommended.

First time to NYC and very glad we chose to stay at the Nolitan! We stayed from 23rd Dec to 1st Jan - I had heard and read many good things about this hotel before our trip and it was also in the ideal location for us! We couldn't stand the thought of staying around midtown with the masses of other tourists and wanted an area that was more 'low key'.The hotel is right in the heart of downtown and walking distance to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, many fantastic restaurants, cafes, shops and the subway stops are close by in every direction you walk. The hotel is on quite a busy road but don't let this put you off, as soon as your off Kenmare street its like your in a different world! Also as mentioned not as touristy around these parts which was great for us and we felt like more of a local than a tourist.The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly - they were more than happy to give tips on whats good to do in the area and help with any querie we had.The rooms were very well designed with a good layout and very clean however they are quite small but from what I hear most rooms across NYC are small! We stayed in the deluxe queen room with balcony and were on the 9th floor and had a great view of the city and Empire State Building. I had read that people complained about the street noise level but we didn't find the outside traffic noise to be an issue at all - I'm not sure if this is more of a problem on lower levels.The hotel offers free bike rental which we thought was great and qw made use of this a couple of times, its on a first in first serve basis.Free wine and cheese daily in the afternoons was a nice touch - it was nice to pop down for a glass of wine and snack before heading out for the evening. Its also a good way to meet other hotel guests staying there and get to know the staff better.Also the hotel is the great value for money. NYC accomodation is so overpriced and I was pleasantly surprised how reasonable the room prices were considering the location, included continental breakfast, bike hire, wine and cheese etc etc.The things we didn't love was we struggled to put our suitcases anywhere in the room as it was so small and they were always in the way, especially by the end of our stay as we had four large suticases!The restuarant wasn't opened yet (which isn't a fault of the hotel) it was just disappointing that we didn't get a chance to enjoy and the lobby was more of a construction site at the time. We were told that this is meant to be up and running mid/end Jan.Continental breakfast was just okay which was served in the lobby - just juice, coffee and pastries - we only stopped by once. Maybe when the restuarant is up and running this may change and they may offer more of a selection.If we ever return to NYC we would stay here again. I think the opening of the restuarant will be a huge benefit to this small boutique hotel.

This is a 110% perfect and affordable hotel, excellent location and steps away from Little Italy which is within China Town, Nolita (North of Little Italy is steps away from Soho (South of Houston Street) world famous shopping center and near the train station to take you to theaters and Times SQ. This is the only hotel in Nolita and it is in the middle of Greenwich Village, Soho/Tribeca (Triangle below Canal Street) and Lower East Side,The staff are very friendly, breakfast was standard buffet with rich assortment of bread: muffins, bagels, croissants, pastries, also Granola serial, yogurts, cream cheese, low fat milk, soy milk and and assortment of coffee & tee, juice etc. The wine and cheese from 6PM to 8PM has the large assortment of snacks I have ever experienced in any of the hotels ever with premier choices of wine. The hotel hostess Joy is a joy to be in the company with, she will be one friend you will leave behind in New York. I remember when this hotel was building and always wanted to stay there, we loved it so much, we stayed 9 nights there and although we moved to two different hotels as part of hour holiday vacation, Nolita was the best and fun neighborhood streets to hang out in. Out of the 3 hotels that we spent out Holidays in NYC, Nolitan is the hotel we still talk about home of all the good times we brought back with us. Don't forget to check the roof top for the spectacular view of NYC.

We had two adjacent rooms at the Nolitan in very cold weather. One was on the corner of the building, with large windows and was perpetually chilly, even with the very loud ventilation turned way up. The bathroom vent fan was like a 747 taking off. The staff were very concerned when we informed them. The other room was fine. The neighborhood is of course wonderful for walking.

Second time at the Nolitan. We loved our first stay when it opened over a year ago and enjoyed it even more this time. The staff is professional and very attentive. We tried a corner room this time and were impressed with the layout and the in room tub. Our room was clean and comfortable. We spent some time in the lobby enjoying complimentary wine and cheese. There was complimentary coffee available in the lobby in the morning along with juice and pastries. We love the location of this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. The restaurant was under renovation so we hope to try it the next time we visit.

I've read a few articles and reviews of the Nolitan over the past year and had wanted to try a hotel in this part of the city. Such a good decision. We've stayed upper east side, midtown east, and upper west side, but we liked this location by far the best. Things we loved: The neighborhood was great. Kenmare is a busy and not particularly charming street, but within a block or two in any direction we found fun and funky shops, boutiques, and restaurants. We loved being in easy walking distance to the Lower East Side Tenement Museum, Little Italy bakeries, Chinatown, coffee shops, and several subway lines. Unlike a lot of NY hotels, we felt like we were in a neighborhood with locals, not a commercial district with other tourists. The rooms were great. Small, yes, but well-designed with good electronics, separate toilet and shower, good mattress/pillows. Very much liked the rough cement elements and the linens were very nice. We were on 5th floor so we heard a good bit of street noise, but on higher floors it probably wouldn't be as much of an issue. We didn't love:The work-in-progress status. We were there on a cold December weekend, and the lobby was freezing cold. The work on the restaurant (?) involved a semi-open construction area with a tarp, combined with no vestibule on the main hotel doors meant the lobby was just a cold hallway between the elevator and the street with frigid winds every time the door opened. The staff. We enountered a few bumps in our customer service road. I was getting us checked in while my husband was unloading luggage from our hired car (hello, bellhop anywhere?) and when he joined me at the check-in desk the staffer asked us a series of confused and confusing questions about if we needed separate rooms (?!). The next day we asked about getting a cab to the Theater District, and if the staff could call one for us later that evening. The bellhop suggested we just walk a few blocks and then try to hail one on the next busy street. Really?! All in all, we really did enjoy our stay, despite the staff goofs (judging from others' reviews, I gather that better service is the norm). The location is fantastic and the space is lovely. By spring, I expect the lobby and restaurant will be fixed. We'll be back next time we're in NYC.

After few days at the Andaz 5th avenue, my boyfriend and i changed location and went to the Nolitan hotel to be at the heart of Soho, Nolita, Little Italy. Overall, this is a nice boutique hotel, pretty expensive though for this period of the year. What are the good things about the hotel? This is a place with a "soul"...complementary little breakfast in the hall, wine and cheese between 6 and 8pm, where you can meet people...This is really nice...As it becomes more and more famous, the hotel will need to keep that spirit going...The rooms are very small but extremely well organized. Bed is very comfy. Bathroom is good. Last the location. Yes the hotel is not located on the most beautiful streets but this is so convenient...you are 2 minutes away from Spring Street...very cool. What needs improvements? Whilst some staff members are really nice (such as the person organizing the wine and cheese gathering), some others are really not nice and you really have this unpleasant feeling that you are bothering someone. Not good. The rooms can turn out to be very cold...and you have then to put the heat on but it makes so much noise that it would be impossible almost to sleep with it. And last, because of some construction happening in the hall (they are rebuilding the restaurant), it was just so cold there and no effort was put in place to reduce this. I would however definitely recommend this hotel.

In all fairness, a very good boutique hotel, great location, happy hour snacks, decent selection of (cold) breakfast, customer care. My biggest complaint was the way I was treated during check-out. I had been quoted a different rate by a different representative during booking (in line with internet rates) but upon check-out discovered that I was due to pay a higher rate. In subsequently explaining and clarifying the situation all the aforementioned good customer care went out the window entirely. There was background snickering, a condescending tone laced with suggestions of customer cheapness. I gave in, preferring to preserve the spirit of the holiday season. This may be specific to one staff rather than the entire hotel as an institution, but a poor experience nonetheless. Hoping this does not occur for anyone else.

If you like small boutique hotels with that special touch... look no further! Room sizes are typical of NYC. Very modern and loft feel to the guest rooms! We were welcome with a glass of wine on our arrival during their complimentary happy hour every evening. A little while after we reached our room, a staff member came to check on us with some delicious macaroons and made sure everything was to our satisfaction. There is a pillow to match every persons preference in the room. The mattresses could have been a little bit better. Complimentary continental breakfast in the morning was a nice touch. They were always ready to impress and always looking for ways to serve you better! I would definitely stay here again!

We were in New York for a week and stayed at the boutique Nolitan Hotel with our families. Given we were booking four rooms for a week we made our booking direct with the hotel.It was the first time we had stayed in this area of Manhattan and following our visit we would most definitely look to stay in the same area if, and when, we come back to New York. It proved easy to navigate Manhattan with a number of subway stations nearby. In addition there are ample bars, restaurants and shops in the neighbourhood that we made good use of and gave a real community feel that you don’t necessarily get in Times Square.We booked a Cityscape Corner room and we were allocated room 902 – would recommend. The room was both spacious and clean and from our experience of other NY hotels offered excellent value for money. We both liked the ‘industrial’ feel of the unfinished concrete ceiling. The other finishes in the room were all of high quality.The bed was both large and very comfortable and neither of us had any issues sleeping. Even the traffic noise from down below didn’t cause us any major issues although it may have been more of an issue if you had been sleeping on one of the lower floors.Both the shower and free-standing bath in our room were great. The shower was large and powerful which makes such a difference from a weak shower that gives you barely a trickle of water. The free-standing bath was large and provided great views of the Empire State Building as we lay relaxing in the tub. As it is ‘part’ of the room it may be a little strange for those who like to sit in the bath in total privacy but it wasn’t something that bothered us.As our room was on the top floor, occupied a corner position, and had floor to ceiling windows we had amazing views of the mid-town skyline (Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, etc) and also east towards the Williamburg Bridge. Equally, you could go to the roof-top of the hotel and get fantastic views in the same directions but also towards the financial district.WiFi was available in rooms (and public areas) free - as it should be! There was good coverage and we never experienced any issues connecting or major issues with speed (iPhone and iPad usage).There was a continental breakfast included free but it was only fruit juice, tea/coffee and bagels/pastries. A selection of cereals and fruit would have been a nice addition. Hopefully this will improve once the new restaurant opens later this month.Overall we would highly recommend the Nolitan Hotel. It provided a great base for us for our trip and we loved the style and feel of the hotel. Service from staff was superb and we can’t fault them. All staff from front desk to housekeeping were always happy to help you.

I loved this hotel. Small, elegant and trendy. Joy and Kimberly were very kind. I really liked the lobby with fireplace and books. So cozy. Rooms are small but well appointed and I love that everything still seems very fresh and new.

Conveniently placed within range of amazing places to eat and not far from lines 6,j,z,b,d makes it easy to get anywhere and do anything. We were on the 7th floor. From the moment we stepped foot into the hotel, the levels of service were the highest we had ever seen and not even remotely stuffy. The hotel staff were there to make our stay as great as possible. The rooms we were was compact, as you should expect in NY, but the views into uptown were amazing. We were far enough away from ther street not to be too bothered by the hooting of cars and natives, but I can understand why some guests might find it noisy. I say get used to it, NY is noisy you cant escape it. Our first day was a marathon, literally, we walked to the highline in the meatpacking district and from there into uptown and 5th avenue. Our feet were wrecked so when we got back to the hotel we took full advantage of the food concierge service where the hotel orders in food from local restaurants. What a life saver. One thing you must do at the hotel is go up to the roof and take in the views and do take the time to meet other guests at the cheese and wine gatherings in the lobby. overall Fantastic!

We stayed here for three nights in November 2012. It was out first time here, and I'd highly recommend it. The hotel is "boutique" - meaning small in size (for NY/USA), cool/eclectic in design, with quirky touches. Those touches include free bikes or skateboards, cosy wine'n'cheese each evening, and a generally friendly in-the-know vibe about it. Rooms are not large, but they are classy and well designed, with just enough space for luggage and everything else. We found it perfect, but then, we're Europeans :-) Our American cousins tend to demand larger room sizes! Our room had a working balcony (small, fun) with a view uptown or East to the bridge, and out over Kenmare Street. Neighbourhood (neighborhood) is brilliant; near to Little Italy, to ChinaTown, SoHo, to the subway and lots of bus stops. We did a lot of walking and some running, and it was a brilliant for wherever we wanted to go. It also has a roof terrace (was not is use in November, but I imagine its pretty special in Summer :-) Staff were also very helpful and made some good recommendations wrt eating/drinking in the area. Anyway - I'd use it again.In fact, can't wait!

I stayed six nights here last month and while the reviews were glowing I somehow felt let down. It certainly wasn't the service, which on the whole was very good. As was the bonus coffee and pastry style breakfast and wi-fi (though during my stay I wouldn't describe it as blisteringly fast). But it was more things mentioned by other reviewers like size of the rooms (they are smaller than I expected compared to similar hotels in New York) and the front facing Kenmare Street (which is pretty noisy in the evenings as it's a funnel to Houston) and worst was the incomplete restaurant build which left a gaping hole to the lobby, which meant it was almost inhabitable and both staff and guests had to huddle around heaters most evenings enjoying the -1 degree temperatures. Why they couldn't build a temporary wall was really beyond me. Staff told me the build was meant to be completed by mid-December. Would I come back? Well my deal was excellent but when I asked for an upgrade to a corner room (which was larger), I was told this would cost me extra and they would only be a couple of days available. Strange when for almost the entire length of my stay on the seventh floor I would guess, from the lack of papers left at front doors, the place wasn't entirely full. Anyone staying for a week should feel some level of entitlement to a better room if they're going begging.

I spend 4 great nights in the Nolitan, you have everything at walk distance. Yes, it's true that the rooms are small(like most of NY hotels) but are really comfortable, I recommend booking rooms at upper floors and dont miss the incredible view at the terrace(..and carry a bottle of champagne to drink there). I WILL BE BACK!

Lovely hotel in Nolita. Perfect for those wanting to wander around soho and lower east side for shopping and restaurants. Also perfect to avoid touristy midtown NY.
