Really nice service and very friendly staff. The rooms are small but perfectly formed. 10 minutes cab ride from Williamsburg. Nice roof terrace with beautiful views. And they give you champagne in reception from 6 to 8 every night. What more do you need?

We've stayed at a lot of the mid-range options in Manhattan, The Roger Smith, The Mansfield, The Algonquin, The Shoreham, The Iroquois, On the Avenue etc. - so we have a good idea what your money buys you and the service you can expect, generally not much!However, I'm happy to say we highly recommend the Nolitan after a recent five night stay.It was an excellent experience and we were very happy with the choice. I didn't make it to the modest free breakfast but we very much enjoyed the wine and snacks in the evening, generously from 6-8pm, thanks Joy! The staff were uniformly pleasant and several times gave me a cup of tea (at no charge) when asked as there was no tea in the room. I appreciate the tea and coffee in the lobby till noon.The room was relatively small but this is typical for NY and it was better designed than most. I liked the open shower (which made the room seem larger) and the separate loo. Loved that they had Red Flower products - thankfully paraben free!The location is wonderful, close to several subways, Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy and the LES, we loved it. Yes it's on a fairly noisy street so you'll want a room on a higher floor. This is worth paying for. We're looking forward to staying when the rooftop bar and the restaurant open I just hope it doesn't get too much more expensive.

This was my first trip to New York and after doing a bit of research I booked a room at the Nolitan. It ended up being exactly what I was looking for. There is lot to do in the neighbourhood and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. When I visit NYC again, I'm sure that I'll be staying at the Nolitan.My only regret is that I didn't go up to their rooftop patio until my last day. It was nice to be able to lounge on one of their couches and give me feet a rest after 3 days of walking across the city.

Cozy hotel with comfortable rooms. Ours was in a corner with an outstanding view. Great location within walking distance of great eats, shops, galleries and subways. Took advantage of their available bicycles for free! Great ambiance and excellent service. Loved their daily afternoon complimentary wine and cheese. They accomodated every request we made. In short, there is no reason not to stay in this hotel!

This is our first time stayed at Nolitan in New York. The wonderful experience we had during this nine days at Nolitan is unbelieable. The breakfast, afternoon wine and cheese and services are excellent. The room is comfortable that made a big different when you traveling, you feel almost like to stay at home. I am highly recomend this hotel to everyone whomever is making the vacation plan visit New York. Nolitan Hotel location is convience and easy to get every where. For sure, we will choose to stay at Nolitan again when we plan our next visit to New York. Thanks again to all the staffs for your warmest hospitality and great services.

Overall my stay at the Nolitan hotel was a very plesurable ecperience. The service was awsome and they provided you with everything u needed weather it was wine and cheese or late night snacks in your room. They have a 24 hour gym right down the blick which is convenient. The rooms were very clean and and nice. I recomend for anyone to stay at this hotel. It is in a great location near many reastruants and has many stores you can shop at near the Hotel. It was one of the nicests holtels i have ever stayed at.

I was visiting New York for a friend's wedding in the Nolita area and I kept going back to The Nolitan as the hotel to stay at due to location. I figured the rooms would be small, but I was actually very impressed with the space the room had (stayed on floor 8). The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was large and the view was amazing. The hotel had complimentary coffee, juice and bagels/muffins in the morning, then wine and cheese in the evening. The rooftop is also amazing - fabulous views of the city and beyond.

My partner and I stayed at the Nolitan on the weekend of November 16-18. We had never been to NYC before and loved staying in the SOHO/Lower East Side area. Lots of funky stores, good restaurants with ease of access to subway, etc. Hotel was fabulous: super comfy bed, well appointed room, very friendly and helpful staff and lots of nice touches. Pleasant surprise to receive a bottle of champagne to help celebrate our birthday - a lovely touch! Also very accomodating re an early check-in time to maximize our site-seeing. I will definitely be recommending the Nolitan to my friends and family.

I was there Fri - Mon and the hotel was very nice. Smaller but very comfortable rooms. Great location - easy to catch a taxi, safe area to walk at night. Happy hour and complimentary breakfast were great too. The staff was great at advising how to get around. I would highly recommend.

I stayed at the begining of November for 4 nights and have to say that The Nolitan exceeded all of my expectations! This hotel is fantastic! The location is awesome with many cool restaurants and bars with in walking distance. The staff were chatty, friendly and incredibly helpfull. The continental breakfast was basic but adequate. The room was wonderful. The views of the Manhattan skyline and the balcony made it feel like we had our own personal observation deck. The icing on the cake was the free use of hotel bicycles!

I loved this hotel - it felt more like a little apartment building than a hotel. I loved the decor, the couple of gleaming bikes in the foyer, the casually hip yet personal atmosphere. I loved the little continental breakfast and the list of restaurants from which you could order and which would delivered since the hotel restaurant is under renovation....the ONLY thing I didn't love was the heating system. I am a light sleeper, and even with earplugs I heard it starting and shutting off all night. I hope they fix this because the bed was great, the cool funky bedroom just what I Iike (loved the cement ceiling, it reminded of me of the background of a painting I just did), and the bathroom set up is cool. It is also two blocks from my son- so it is about perfect.....except for the machine noises in the night. If you are a sound sleeper this is for you.

Cleverly decorated rooms in white and red, as well as a charming and cozy lobbyLovely sweet and helpful staff, Happy hour with complimentary snacks and champagne/wine, A surprising little balcony, Proximity to so many charming parts of the lower east side, Ridiculously affordableSUPER comfy bedsSurprisingly roomy for a NY hotelAmenities like rentable bikesThis hotel was a total win. I kind of judge all other small boutique hotels against it now.

The hotel itself is nice as well as the staff. They are very friendly and helpful.The merit of the hotel is the location but it is also the defect.The hotel is situated on the road to Williamsburg Bridge which linked to Brooklyn Queens Express way - 278 to LaGuardia Airport. It bypasses all the busy traffic in the Manhattan area. Outwardly the surrounding of the hotel is not particularly nice but there are a lot of beautiful boutiques and restaurants in the small streets nearby, such as Elizabeth Street, Mott Street, Mulberry Street, Lafayette Street and Spring Street all the way to the SoHo area. They serve free wine and cheese in the lobby every day from 6 -8pm. Also the hotel also offers free skateboards and bicycles for guests on a first come first serve basis. HOWEVER because of the hotel sits on such a busy street with a lot of trucks passing by during the night and early morning the noise caused us to have a bad night sleep for couple of days UNTIL we got the ear plugs. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to avoid. The attitude of the staff was great and helped to compensate for this problem. We have mixed feelings about recommending the hotel...

We stayed here 6 days after Sandy ravaged New York City. We had a wonderful experience. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff was warm and helpful. I would definitely return to the Nolitan!

The Nolitan was our home before and after Sandy hit New York. In the days before, it was a welcome respite and a comfortable space. Perfectly located to discover all the fun nooks and crannies of south Manhattan. The staff was friendly and helpful and the "wine-o-clock" in the afternoon was great. After the storm and the loss of electricity in SoPo, they were working hard to make sure we had what we needed - information, towels, where to find food, etc. They kept the general spirits up and kept smiles on their faces despite all the turmoil. They even managed to keep on the wi-fi which we appreciated so much! We'll definitely be back and will also be recommending the hotel to all of our friends and co-workers.
user_name:
Laurel B
Manhattan Beach, California, United States

review_body: An jewel of a hotel centrally located. 5min from Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy etc, conveniently located in the middle of 3 different underground lines. Close to shopping, restaurants and bars.We booked for a week but stayed longer thanks to the hurricane Sandy. The staff were great. They were friendly and of great help, be that may with restaurant and taxi reservations or tips about eating and to get around. The hotel had its own power generator, so we had internet, elevator service and hot water. The rooms are very well equipped. not huge, but this is New York after all. We had a room on the 7th floor with a beautiful view of uptown. The lobby is cozy and feels like home.We will definitely stay there again and again.

If there is abetter hotel in Ny I'd like to know where it is. The folk behind the desk are amazing, despite the extra hassle of the hurricane they could not have done more to ensure we were looked after. With the subway down you discover what a great location this is with so many great spots near by, just a shame most of them didn't have electricity. The hotel itself is well laid out great lobby for evening drinks, we were on the 9th and the view from our bed and balcony was stunning as was the one from the roof. Book without hesitation. Stuart and Judith

The Nolitan is fantastic. clean and modern rooms, some with balconies, but these are noisier. fabulous rooftop with some of the best views in NY. you can explore LES, NoLita, Soho, Chinatown, etc all from this spot. highly recommended.

The Nolitan has been so warm and accommodating, the staff is amazing. The complimentary wine in the lobby in the evening is a nice touch.The location is perfect for exploring fashionable Soho, Nolita, Little Italy, shopping on lower Broadway.A great place you won't be disappointed!

Perfectly placed in Downtown New York, perfect customer service, you honestly could not ask for more. New in house restaurant was not i operation as yet as was the rooftop bar. However these facilities were being prepared while we were there. These would be an extra bonus.

I travel to NYC once or twice a year to visit friends and family, and was a NY resident myself many year ago. After trying numerous hotels in numerous neighborhoods, the Nolitan has become my favorite, and I have been their guest 3 or 4 times. It's small, with very attentive and friendly staff. I love the neighborhood, bustling with great restaurants and shops, walking distance to the East and West village, Soho, Tribeca, Chelsea, Meatpacking district, with easy access to subways to other parts of the city. The rooms tend to be quite small, but are very clean and freshly modern. On my most recent visit I was delighted to be upgraded to a beautiful and spacious suite on a top floor. This hotel is most ideal for couples or singles.

I love New York! I usually stay in Midtown because it's close to everything I want to see but this time, a friend talked me into trying the Lower East Side, and we chose the Nolitan after reading its terrific reviews here. It's true what they say on Tripadvisor - the staff are wonderful: friendly, helpful, polite, good humoured. We arrived very late at night after a long flight, and still received a warm welcome.I spent the first night on level 3 in what to me was a very small room. My best advice for anyone who is going to be a new guest, is request a room that is higher up as there will be less street noise. It will be worth the extra money. Go for a corner room if you can. After the first night, I complained about the noise (I am quite a light sleeper) and was offered a corner room on the top floor at a discounted price. I took it! My NEW room had a divine free-standing bath and a gorgeous view of the Williamsberg Bridge. The bed was superb, however all this does come at a price. I paid $477 a night (online) for the room on the lower floor and $75 more for the discounted room on the top floor.The Nolitan is situated in easy walking distance between THREE different Metro stops, which is by far and away the best way to get around New York. The hotel really is in a good position and it is only a few stops up to Midtown. One stop south is the beautiful Brooklyn Bridge over which I highly recommend a casual stroll. The hotel is also situated in the middle of an astonishing number of cafes, restaurants and bars in and around NoLita. There is a brilliant little Japanese restaurant around the corner (ask the staff to recommend it), a great cake shop and a really well-stocked bookshop for those of you who need a relaxing read. It would be difficult to ask for more. Oh, and there is free wine and cheese in the afternoon. That sold me.My one tiny criticism is that the continental breakfast could be a little bit more extensive.So, to sum up, if you can afford it, do it. The Nolitan is everything people say it is.

Intrigued by the very positive reviews on tripadvisor and coverage in travel magazines we booked The Nolitan for a few nights in late summer. We had a corner room in one of the upper floors. The view is breathtaking, the interior design is decidedly modernist, somewhat quirky and quite refreshing (visible concrete, stand-alone bathtub, oak flooring). The location is just great for explorations both towards the southern tip of Manhattan as well as towards the various Villages and further uptown. Nice neighborhood joints providing food and drink all around. Only down was the non-existing breakfast room (under construction when we were there) - partially compensated for by the accessible rooftop.

A great all-rounder of a hotel! Great rooms, great bedding, excellent service, fantastic location, cool guests, trendy but not intimidating, the list goes on... I will definitely be staying there again!

Our experience at the Nolitan was fantastic from start to finish - wonderful customer service, beautiful design and excellent location. The rooms are small but have a great layout, and a view of the Empire State Building from the shower... Breakfast is a small affair but perfect to grab and go before exploring the city. Would highly recommend this hotel for any downtown NYC stay.

I stumbled across this hotel thru an auction website and needed a room for the day prior to a cruise. Upon arrival I wasn't sure as it did not fit the profile of what I nomally would expect BUT the overall experience was excellent. The service was outstanding and the staff went out of their way to accommodate your every wish and need. The rooms are quite small but well appointed and the sheets, bedding and towels were excellent. The bathroom was roomy and the shower was great! Overall a very nice stay! My thanks to the staff!

This was my second stay at the Nolitan - first discovered it about 4 months after it opened. The things I love about this place: great location, simple modern decor, comfy beds, not too loud, all the nice little touches from the comp continental breakfast to wine and cheese at night to proximity door keys that I can keep in my wallet and just wave to open the door.It's been a great home base for my walks through Soho and Little Italy - as well as up to Union Square. I'd stay here every time I come to New York, except the prices have crept up from ~$350 to $465+ - so I have to now save this for special occasions...Also, make sure you hit the roof deck at night - fabulous views of the city...

For this price range, you cannot look any further than the Nolitan. In fact, I would even go as far as to say that it would compete with many hotels in the downtown Manhatten area, regardless of price. It is your classic boutique hotel without the snobbery you may find elsewhere. The rooms are small, yes, but are so quaint and designed with the utmost functionality in mind. Given it is NYC you will not be spending much time in your room anyway! If you are like me and my wife, all you want it a nice, clean place to come back to with an awesome shower. This has all that and more! It has a raw, industrial finish, with exposed shower, yet still manages to feel homely (this is helped with finishing touches like the cashmere throw and yoga mat).The location could not be better. It is within walking distance to the subways (multiple lines), great eateries and all the shopping that SoHo and the surrounding area have to offer! It is the perfect launching pad whether you are NYC initiated or not (it was our first time and we never felt far from the action).The rooms on Kenmare Street can be noisy as it is quite busy, so I would suggest some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. I didn't have a problem but my wife needed them. The black out blinds are great though.Lastly, the service is impeccable. I booked the trip as a birthday surprise for my wife, we were greeted in our room with a bottle of champagne. The advice provided by staff was fantastic and they were always helpful. The rooms were spotless. And when we forgot our passports in our safe, they were so quick to get the car service to drop them off to us at the airport (and we thankfully made our flights). I really couldn't recommend the Nolitan more. Don't forget to check out the rooftop at night!

I have now been to Nolitan Hotel three times, and I just booked my fourth visit. As previous reviewers have noted, the location is superb-- steps from Mulberry Street (one of my favorite streets in the city) and Soho. While I initially chose the hotel because of its proximity to family members who live in the city, I have (happily) discovered a lovely, quirky and ever-changing part of Manhattan. I have stayed in the neighborhood balcony room in the past two visits, and the additional light and perspective it provides is ideal. From the service to the design of the rooms-- and the price-- it is well worth a visit.

Stayed at the Nolitan from October 4th - 10th for our honeymoon. We had a high floor queen room with balcony. It was amazing, a little small but that's the way NYC hotel rooms are. The layout of the room really made the most of the space. It was comfortable and stylish. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, they even sent up a complimentary bottle of bubbly to celebrate out honeymoon. They have wine and cheese every evening which is a great way to chat to the other guests and the employees. You could bring your wine and cheese up to the roof and savor the amazing views. The neighborhood is great, plenty of good bars cafes and restaurants to choose from. It's close to the subway and a short walk to soho. You can borrow laptops and I pads and they also have free wifi. It's these extra touches that make the stay that little bit better than the rest - oh and did I mention they have complimentary continental breakfast!?This is the first time we stayed in lower manhattan and were not dissapointed. We will definately come back to the area, and more importantly back to the Nolitan!

We spent 3 nights here early October. The location is premium if you want to be in Manhattan, all subway lines within walking distance, close to LES, Soho, Shopping etc etc. Nice bathroom with separate toilet but rooms a tad small, especially if you have plenty of luggage which we did. Continental breakfast was pretty average, simple fare and not much of it however the wine and cheese hour in the evening made up for it - i just wish they would play some decent music and not current pop/electronic dance crap! It's the foyer of a funky downtown hotel for god's sake, not a teenage bedroom! I literally would have to take the food or wine up to our room as the music was that abhorrent. If management read this, track down some Mulatu, or labels like g-stone or ubiquity. These are well known and easy to find and a damn side better considering the crowd you have in your hotel!! The air conditioning in the rooms was the other bad that really let this hotel down in my opinion. It was so noisy, like a plane taking off every time the thermostat kicked in. I did complain as i am a light sleeper and during the night it came on probably 3 times an hour so it kept waking me up. (i am a light-ish sleeper). The staff were nice and offered to move us to another room, but the problem was the same across the board. For a hotel that's only a year or so old, i feel this is a big screw up for them (i think they are well aware of it too by the response we got). That aside, the hotel was decent and the rooftop that anyone can go up to offers great views.

Stayed there for a couple of nights while eloping in NYC. The room was on the smaller size, but that's expected in NYC. The staff was amazing- super friendly and helpful. Though there was no gym inside the hotel, guests get a complimentary pass for a gym a few minutes away (that also has great classes). The complementary coffee and baked goods and happy hour were a very nice bonus, as was the rooftop. I would highly recommend this place, especially for people going to NYC to get married as it is not only a great hotel but also very close to the marriage bureau.

I stayed here in May with my best friend and loved this hotel. Feels modern and industrial without being too cold. Loved the location; SoHo, the Village and the lower East side have always being my favorite areas of NYC. The staff was great, they made all our arrangements for dinner. I already booked my next stay already! :)

We stayed at the Nolitan for 8 nights at the end of August 2012 and found both the staff, location and hotel to be of the highest standard. We travelled from Sydney, Australia to New York to elope and our experience could not have been more delightful. The roof top was definetely a highlight as was the location which is in the most happening, cool and carefree area of New York. We stayed at The Plaza also on this trip but much preferred The Nolitan. Edgy but without being pretentious is how I would describe The Nolitan, we will be back.

My company surprised me by throwing me a surprise 28th birthday party here and booking me a suite after I spoke at Columbia University. The staff was incredibly accommodating of the endless amounts of cake and champagne that they had sent in and let us party (respectfully) downstairs for hours. The suite itself had a great view of Nolita and was, I'm sure, worth every penny.
user_name:
Brian A
New York City, New York

review_body: The Nolitan is in a great location. Every member of hotel staff we ran into made it a priority to ensure our stay was extraordinary. The rooms and beds were on the small side, but that's expected for a NYC hotel.

We come to NYC 3-4 times every year and have stayed all over the place. Upscale, low key, boutique and big chain hotels. The Nolitan might be our new fav spot and we hope to be regulars there.Nolita is our favorite area of the city. Small, mid-range boutiques, trendy, fun restaurants and a great, active vibe. The Nolitan is in a perfect position to explore Nolita, Little Italy, Soho and the village. We were very excited to see they were building something in the area.Kenmare St (where it's located) is not very exciting to look at but turn left or right a block away and you enter into a new world. It's not unsafe, just not much to look at.The staff at the Nolitan is friendly and solicitous. They went out of their way to make sure our needs were met.The room was relatively small but not unusual for an inner city NY hotel. The layout was so efficient and well thought out that we did not feel cramped in the least bit. The decor is trendy and modern (almost to the point of being "cold" or architectural style). It's a new hotel and the room was immaculate, linens and towels plush and the bed was quite comfortable. Our only concern about noise was that the metal doors did not create a great seal for sound and you can hear things in the hallway. There must be some molding that could fix that. There are only 7 or so rooms on each floor so not THAT much happens in the hall but I would assume it would cffect rooms closer to the elevator.The rooftop lounge was great as were the offerings of wine/cheese in the afternoon and continental breakfast in the am. When the bar/restaurant is completed, I would assume the quality of the offerings in the morning would improve but the thought was nice. We hope to return soon.

My wife and I spent our wedding anniversary at this hotel on August 29. This was our first time at a boutique hotel. I must say, it was excellent! Upon entering the hotel, we were immediately impressed with the intimate setting and extraordinary warm and welcoming staff. The staff members are a plus at this hotel. They were always wanting and willing to assist. It’s obvious that the management of this hotel invest well in its staff and this can be clearly been seen in how they served us to the best to their ability. I called to ask about restaurant recommendation. Not only that they recommend some of the best restaurants, but also want ahead a booked a great location for us. Aware of our anniversary celebration, the hotel management surprises us with a bottom of cool ice Champaign.The room was immaculate, beautiful, cool, very modern, and intimate. What I personally love was the design and the contemporary glass wall bathroom!!! This was my first time seeing this type of bathroom. To top the whole experience was the scenic rooftop paranomic view of some of the most popular sites in New York City – Empire State Building, new Freedom tower, etc. Your camera will be happy. Check out my picture collage. We will definitely return to this hotel when the opportunity presents itself.

Since the moment you set foot into this hotel, you really feel appreciated as a guest; A warm reception, refreshments, a good explanation of the facilities, wine in the room and "MACAROONS" in your pillows is only part of the amenities you will receive when you check in here.The room was small but it was spotless. Excellent attention to detail in the housekeeping department. The shower and tub are very modern and separated from the toilet. Toiletries were very good and adequate for the quality of the hotel. The beds were very comfortable, the air conditioner is very silent and the view from the room is marvelous. Closet was of a good size and it included a small refrigerator that served as a mini bar that was plentiful and not over priced.I will definitely stay again in The Nolitan Hotel, My respect to Jennifer the Manager and all the employees, You guys are doing and excellent job in this place.

Just spent 8 nights at this hotel for the second time. It continues to deliver on the hip location (just East of Soho), cool rooms with a modern industrial feel that somehow is still warm and appealing. The staff is very friendly and the free internet, wine and cheese in the evening, continental breakfast in the morning are all "gravy". The restaurant downstairs is being renovated, which cramps the lobby but hopefully will soon be done, and the roof terrace on the 10th floor is indeed a very pleasing asset with a great view of the Manhattan skyline. The price, while not cheap, is probably as good as it gets in this part of the city at this level. Access to the 24 hour gym is a 10 minute walk through the interesting part of Soho.

i thoroughly enjoyed my stay. rooms were small but nicely organized so didn't notice space. large open bath. had a room with a balcony. nice to sit outside and relax. rooftop lounge area is great and peaceful. nice views of the city skyline. i found the staff to be very pleasant, and willing to help without being invasive. you are staying in a neighborhood which is part of what i love. this is not an uber tourist section instead you are hanging with the locals. nice restaurants in the area. easy access to several subway lines. i had some challenges with wifi on my notebook. the front desk helped resolve quickly. there is continental breakfast in the morning (loved that coffee was served in to go cup) and wine/cheese/fruit around 5. didn't get to enjoy every day but nice to have as an option. i'll definitely stay there again on next nyc trip. same cost as some of those cheezy tourist nightmares in times square but ohhh so much better!

If you've ever dreamt about living in downtown NYC but missed out on that life experience for one reason or another (like me), this is your chance to do so without breaking too much of your budget. The Nolitan is one of those contemporary, luxurious, yet uber-low-key boutique hotels that you really don't want the whole world to know about. From its location to its service to its well-appointed rooms, everything is perfect. We were lucky to have one of the upper-floor rooms with a balcony, plus a beautiful view of the Empire State building and Williamsburg Bridge. Head to the rooftop with your complimentary breakfast or glass of wine and soak in the NYC skyline. Unlike some of the hotels nearby, there really is no "scene" here, which was really great for us. Our vacation just ended but we already miss our stay at the Nolitan...see you next time!
user_name:
stetienne2
New York City, New York

review_body: The Nolitan is in a convenient quiet location if you want to be in the lower east side. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They not only stored 4 very large suitcaes for us but even helped us move them to our child's apartment a block away! The linens are very nice and the bed is comfortable. Overall, the hotel is fresh and new and the staff is eager to please.

Staff was extremely helpful and very courteous. I had a couple of issues that were resolved well but two things had not been resolved. I did not get a newspaper each day, and did not have any turndown service on the second night. I arrived for the CB at 9:30am only to find nothing left but yogurt. Second day the bagels were stale. In addition, turndown service did not include tidy up - garbage not removed, glasses not replaced. I did ask about the turndown service, but I recieved no response to my query. I did love the location, the room was fabulous and the people were terrific. Loved the rooftop terrace as an oasis of serenity! Could have been a little cleaner up there.....no garbage can provided so folks just left their garbage. I will consider the hotel again, as these issues are easily fixed and not a deal breaker for me --- a request was sent for my feedback and I am looking forward to see if these issues are resolved for the future. I would definately consider booking this hotel again, the rooms, while small, are well organized, comfortable and very clean. I had the neighbourhood corner and it was truly lovely! Well appointed, huge tv - lacking a lot of tv stations though for NYC. Nice electronic amenities, free bikes and skateboards although I am not one to take my life into my hands and bike around NYC!! Traffic is a disaster at all hours. The neighbourhood is very safe - I walked alone at 1 pm at night and did not feel uncomfortable. Serviced by many subway stops, tons of amazing restaurants - this property could not be more well located to see the heartbeat of NYC! A new addition is "Happy Hour" at 6 - 8 pm - I missed it on Staurday as I had to leave early for dinner and the theatre, and it is not available on Sundays. Check out the fabulous little organic wine shop across the street - don't miss the great eats and night life in the LES - try Stanton Social --- trendy but really good!

Booked into the Nolitan last year, just after it had opened, after a rave review in the Globe and Mail and we were back again this year. It's the perfect little hip, posh hotel in a hip neighbourhood--walking distance to Soho, Greenwich village, and Little Italy with gorgeous night views of the Empire State building and the Chrysler building to the north and the Williamsburg bridge to the east. We have yet to have a bad meal in the 'hood in spite of no advance planning, and they're all within walking distance. On weekend nights some of the streets in Little Italy close and it's a street party! Shopping in the area is also excellent.The hotel itself offers organic, sustainably-sourced toiletries from the Red Flower (http://redflower.com/), comfortable robes, pillowtop beds, and a turndown service that includes cookies. The staff is unfailingly helpful and eager to please. An example from our recent stay: because the restaurant was undergoing renovations and therefore unavailable, they compensated in three ways: you could order from a group of 15 excellent area restaurants and staff would bring it to your room; there was complimentary continental breakfast each morning; and there was a cocktail hour from 6-8 that included free wine/sparkling wine and snacks. Really nice touch...this made it feel like coming home. We'd take our glass of wine to the rooftop patio, which offers fabulous views, and watch the sun go down before heading out for dinner.We'll be back!

We stayed at The Nolitan for 2 nights, since we called to do the reservation the front desk staff was amazing, we arrived and the staff greeted us like family, the room was very nice and the decorations perfect for our style, they had everything you need, Toiletries, slippers, robes....Even the continental breakfast wich took us by surprise was perfect.We go to New York every year and will sure come back to The Nolitan every year!!!2 Thumbs up!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Picked the Nolitan based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. I wanted a boutique hotel in the LES that was a guaranteed, sure-bet great exprience, and that's what we got. I paid ahead and splurged for the Corner King for a surprise weekend birthday get-away. the room was a perfect size for 2, with views of the river on one corner, and the Empire State Building the other. At night, it was spectacular! CONCIERGE:The front desk staff double as concierges - that's a new thing, apparently - so they were still a bit green around the gills helping us find some information, but they're absolutely wonderful and kind, and infinitely patient. They also managed to secure a dining reservation at Le Bernardin on a Friday night when I could not, which gets them bonus points in my book!FOOD: The continental breakfast is very basic and blah (though the coffee was good), but their restaurant was under renovation when we were there, so I'm withholding judgement on the food angle, but they do get points for arranging delivery from 15 area restaurants including famed Blue Ribbon Bakery, which they plate on-site with real silverware - a very clever 'stop-gap' measure that actually gives you access to some amazing food without the wait in line!There's a tiny Asian hotdog shop a block away that has outstanding food for cheap - the kimchee dog is great, and the corn dog was sooo good... virtually no seating, but if you're just wanting a quick bite, highly recommended. The market, 5 blocks away, has TONS of great food options for self-catering, or just for munching - it's not for tourists, it really is mostly locals... ask the front desk for directions. There's also a kosher bagel place in walking distance that caters to locals and is very bare-bones, but is amazing. LOCATION:The location is very close to all the major LES shopping streets, subway, and just blocks away from some incredible ethnic eats. In fact, we took a food tour with The Enthusiatic Gourmet, and we were able to simply walk five blocks to the old market to meet her, and spent half a day touring Jewish, Italian, and Chinese neighborhoods all in walking distance of the hotel - it was a complete blast (found her on TripAdvisor, and highly recommend it too).ROOM:The picture is just the slightest bit deceptive.... in the King Corner, the photos appear that you could see the skyline from the free-standing (AWESOME) tub - but the placement of the work desk and flat screen TV actually interferes with this, so you can see out the window to the sky, but not the skyline per se. Not a dealbreaker, just a bit of a bummer. Similiarly, it appears that the windows are floor-to-ceiling panoramic views, but in reality it's a cleverly designed window that has mostly frosted (opaque) glass, with a few key panels of clear glass giving that amazing view. This means that you have masses of beautiful sunlight, but you have about 18"-24" of actual "view" windows to see the skyline - which you can see from the bed, but it's not a sweeping panoramic view as I expected. On the other hand, you don't feel compelled to close the curtains when you shower/bathe/dress, which is nice - and I did wonder about the privacy with all-glass on the room.The toilet is separate from the sink, in the European pre-war style. The corner king had a lovely glass shower plus the awesome soak tub - it wasn't big enough for my six-footer and me to comfortably be in together, but it was wonderfully deep and perfect for my LUSH bath bombs - which I forgot to bring with, but there's a LUSH just blocks away from the hotel!The "minibar" is divided into a mini fridge in the closet, and snacks in the bedside drawer... you can choose what you want to have ready ahead of time with a clever survey on their website - where you can also request gym passes, newspapers, and other amenities. There are also myriad "adult toy" options on their menu, which I thought was a fun touch ,and optional add-ons including wine or champagne in the room, cheese plate, chocolates, and even rose petals scattered on the bed... they really have the best a la carte menu for room options I've found!The main floor has lots of seating areas for lounging and meetingup, and a functional library that is actually somewhere you'd WANT to hang out and relax - something no hotel lobby usually does for me. I didn't make it to the rooftop deck, because we always went out early and got back late, but other reviews say it's a priceless view - and considering the view we had from our top-floor room, I can only say I would agree.There's a safe cleverly built into the bedframe, which is easy to acces, and fits a standard laptop plus other stuff.The closet has the usual amenities - robes, slippers, large umbrella, etc.WIFI: we had no problem accessing wifi, included in the room price (thank you!)TAXI CAUTION: It's difficult to get a taxi FROM the hotel, just due to the location - the front desk staff know it so if you are planning to catch a plane or train, highly recommend consulting them the day before to discuss car service or other arrangements... it took us 30 minutes on a Sunday to find a taxi, and we had to walk about six blocks with our luggage to get to a street where we had a chance to find one not occupied.

I hugely enjoyed my four nights at the Nolitan. Everything was great: the location, the lovely decor, the comfortable bed, the fun shower, the balcony with a beautiful view over the Williamsburg Bridge. The staff were absolutely perfect - friendly, helpful and accommodating. The breakfasts were good and the roof terrace has one of the best views you'll find. Fantastic hotel. I'll definitely be back.

I travel often and in all my years of doing so have never written a review, even when asked. I had the most delightful time ever as a guest at the Nolitan. The rooms are beautifully crafted, super comfortable and equipped and accessorized perfectly. The bed was heavenly, sheets especially, the shower was everything you would want a shower to be, including awesome soaps and shampoo, and the Danny Macaroons that I found on my pillow (drizzled with carmel no less) were truly exquisite. To top it all off, each and every staff member of the hotel was so kind, gracious and friendly. I would welcome the opportunity to stay at The Nolitan again. It was the very best part of my trip!

We chose The Nolitan based upon all of the positive feedback on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed! The hotel was modern and clean with very friendly and helpful staff. It was less than a five minute walk from Spring St or Bowery Subway stations and a good jumping off point to explore Manhattan. Definitely check out the view from the roof!

Booked a couple of nights at The Nolitan recently because my usual favorites were sold out. I had very low expectations but love the neighborhood. I have to say, I was impressed from the first minute I walked in the door. The staff was old school accommodating and helpful, but also fun and charming. By the time I checked out I was on first name basis with the whole staff!Rooms were small but well designed. Bed was comfortable with good linens. Continental breakfast could be expanded a bit, but it was well presented and the coffee was good.I would stay here again, for sure.

We stayed in the Nolitan hotel for 9 nights in July 2012 and got a very good rate on Quikbook. Note that the hotel is having major renovation on the ground floor and there is no restaurant. We didn't hear any noise from the works though.Pros:- roof terrace. Huge and usually deserted. No umbrellas though.- Our room had a very small balcony, which was nice, although far too thin to really sit on.- wifi was free although the speed, and coverage, was patchy.- free breakfast, although just filter coffee, tea bags and some bagels, was adequate.- fantastic part of New York to visit. We ate nearly every night nearby and the restaurants were great, if expensive.- bathroom was well laid out and the shower didn't flood the bathroom. The toilet was separate, which was unusual but a nice touch.Cons:- noisy airconditioning. The filter needed changing on arrival but the hotel staff had not noticed.- housekeeping staff's knowledge of English was poor, but the standard of cleaning was good.- wifi speed was slow.- no international TV channels available, not even CNN international. So no Olympics until NBC told us we could watch it.- no space to store clothes. We had to pile things on top of the minibar fridge.- bed was tiny. If that was a Queen bed I'm a Dutchman. And for a room with a balcony which wasn't the smallest in the hotel, that room was small.

My wife and I lived in NYC for 20 years and now come back every couple months to visit friends. We've stayed at about 10 NYC hotels now, all in the $180-300 price range. Our recent stay at the Nolitan (our first time there) puts them at the top of our NYC hotel list.The room design was really fun and quirky. For example, the toilet was in its own room, away from the sink and shower. The shower had a clear glass wall to the bedroom (and a privacy curtain for the prudish). Floor-to-ceiling windows with great views from our high-floor room (8th). Bare cement ceiling and wall contrasted by high-end fixtures with other walls dressed in white plaster.Staff were helpful and nice. The team seemed down-to-earth and authentic.Continental breakfast hit the spot - bagels, cream cheese, yogurt, pastries, coffee and juices.Nolita is a great place to explore and close to the hustle of SOHO.We'll be back, soon.
user_name:
InternationalHorizon
New York City, New York

review_body: I just got back from a work trip to New York City and stayed at a (relatively) new boutique hotel in Lower Manhattan. I wasn't familiar with area, but it is a great neighborhood for walking -- small shops, great food.I got a great deal (I own my business) and will definitely be back.

Great location. Great look. Small but well-appointed rooms that effectively handles the space. Great rooftop space. Very good continental breakfast...best eaten on the roof. Enjoyed using bike...did not use skateboard because my life insurance is not paid up. There were some inconsistency with details: first shower leaked tremendously so moved into new room. WiFi did not work in our room(s). DirectTV reception was horrible...unsure whom to blame. Turn down service and morning paper were available but not provided every day. The very professional staff tried to solve problems but not all problems could be solved. Loved the place, would definitely recommend it, but Manhattan boutique hotels should be closer to perfect.

New favorite. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Conveniently located near shopping and restaurants without having high traffic in front of your hotel. Love the balcony. Very reasonably priced considering it's NYC and best part is that unlike other hotels, they do not try to rob you blind with the mini bar. Free wifi - super bonus.

Love the Nolitan and will definitely be back. We stayed for my wife's birthday and upon returning from dinner we found a card & bottle of Prosecco on ice waiting for us. What a classy customer service move. A+. The staff were all extremely friendly, helpful, and polite. No attitudes, no short answers, nothing but smiles and a genuine desire to help answer any questions we had.The room was on the small side, but was ultra modern and very clean. We loved it as it's definitely our preferred style. The bed was so comfortable we slept like babies. Everything worked great from the AC, to the tv, to the shower and toilet. No issues at all. New release movies are $18 which we found exorbitant so we didn't bother, but the mini bar prices are really good - $3 beers?? Yes please.Can't say enough about the location - two blocks west and you're in Soho, 1 block south and you're on the border of Chinatown and Little Italy. Head north and you're in the East Village in no time. 25 min walk south to the Brooklyn Bridge. Simply perfect.The rooftop deck is worth the price of admission alone. The views are seriously insane and it's open 24 hrs. We took a ton of photos and sat up there with a beer/cocktail and just soaked it all in. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. Yes, it's pricey, so perhaps not for more than 3 or 4 nights - depending on your budget, but welcome to New York prices. I had no issue paying what we did given the reasons I've stated in this review.

On planning a trip to NYC to visit our daughter, I found the Nolitan. Knew nothing about the neighborhood at all. What a wonderful surprise. The hotel was a perfect little find. Clean, good size, amazingly wonderful bed, great shower and a great, friendly, helpful staff!! Would definitely return to this hotel. loved the area. Steps to SoHo, Greenwich Village, Chinatown, Little Italy. A wonderful change from the super touristy areas of New York City. Dozens of wonderful shops and restaurants close by.

What a great place! From the moment I came, no detail of this hotel had been overlooked- you can rent their bicycles and skateboards- they have a whole list of menus that deliver to your hotel in a nice neat little packet in your room- their shower and bathing products are exceptional- the room is a bit on the smaller side but the planning is thoughtful and useful- relaxing wonderful fourth of July stay- will return!

We spent 2 very enjoyable nights here over the 4th of July. The location is great if you want to spend time in and around Soho, Little Italy, and Chinatown. Of course the subway makes it easy to get to midtown and museums in 15 minutes or less. We really enjoyed being away from the touristy Midtown/Times Square crowd. The rooms are a little small, but they are very clean and comfortable, and the staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful!

The combination of a Vacationist deal + good Tripadvisor rating + desire to stay in a new neighbourhood (we usually stay around midtown) led me to the Nolitan. I'm so glad we landed here. The service at the hotel was fantastic, we had a beautiful view of the Manhattan skyline from our balcony and we were able to explore new parts of New York. There were minor quibbles (small room...of course, it's New York!), a loud air conditioning system, and a rather light continental breakfast, but they were all minor points compared to the hotel's pluses.Hints for people looking for meals: Barmarche, just up Elizabeth Street at Spring, was a fantastic dinner choice. The Epistrophy cafe around the corner on Mott was a great place for a drink. Asia Dog, just a block west, had tasty gourmet hot dogs if you need a snack.

We stayed at the Nolitan for 3nights & we a little uncertain of what to expect, being our first trip to NYC. From what I can tell, although it wasn't cheap, it was certainly good value for money: perfectly adequate room size with decent cupboard & lovely compact bathroom & separate loo (which I find is far more functional in a smallish bathroom!). Great modern touches throughout, exceptionally comfy bed & pillows, nice toiletries, delicious chocolates on our pillows on arrival, in-room safe, great little balcony. Although in a brilliant location just north of Little Italy, adjacent to Chinatown, with amazing restaurants, cafes & bakeries right around the corner, we still loved the complimentary continental breakfast. Staff were extremely helpful & due to their assistance, we used the subway almost exclusively, even to get as far the Bronxe on our first night! Worth very penny & great modern spot out of the main tourist drag.

I usually stay in downtown Brooklyn when I travel to New York City for business. However, for my most recent trip, I was open to recommendations for lodging since the rates at my usual hotel were a bit on the extreme side. (Nearby hotels were no better.) Thus, I was told to check out the Nolitan. Not only was it reasonably priced (relative to what my usual hotel was charging), it was accessible to work via taxi or subway and very, very chic.I arrived a tad early for check-in, but the staff was kind enough to hold my bags while I sought out lunch. As soon as my room was ready, I was notified right away. I've stayed at hotels where the staff was inattentive. This was not the case at the Nolitan. From the moment I stepped through the door, I knew I would be in good hands.My room was tiny, but since I was traveling alone, this was hardly an issue. It was tastefully decorated, white with red accents. I'd almost consider it a "clean" look. What I found interesting was the open bathroom: the shower and sink area did not have a doorway. (The shower itself, however, did have a glass door!) As for the toilet? That's in a room of its own. It almost reminded me of when I traveled to Japan, so while it was a bit unusual for me to see it here in the States, I wasn't completely confused by it. The room also had a balcony, which, had I anticipated staying in my room for an extended period of time, would have served as a nice little relaxation space. Granted, I didn't have a stellar city view (I faced a mechanic's garage, among other stores), but I also don't mind people-watching. (It's worth noting here that despite having a neighborhood view, I slept well each night. Noise was not an issue.)One thing I really appreciated was the alarm clock, which also featured an iPod / iPhone dock. I have an iPhone 4S, and I have been at hotels (including my usual hotel in Brooklyn) that have clocks with iPhone docks that don't support a 4S. This may seem like a minor thing for many, but I had left my charger at home -- this was extremely helpful!If I have one teeny-tiny complaint: The A/C is LOUD. Fortunately, my room was equipped with a ceiling fan. I was just as cool, but with much less noise.So: An attentive staff. Chic, comfortable rooms. Easy access to work (and other areas, such as one of my favorites -- Soho!) Decent pricing. I think I've found my new business hotel here at The Nolitan.

I was very pleasantly surprised with the Nolitan! Pulling up, I looked around and thought, hmmm...However, through the very cool front doors I entered into a very nice lobby area, with a staff really dedicated to making your stay enjoyable. I have not experienced the high level of customer service from some of the most upscale hotels further uptown. They are wonderful!The room is new looking, great beds and linens. A lot of well thought out design, fantastic floor to ceiling windows. Continental breakfast very appetizing!I would definitely stay here again, and look forward to the opening their restaurant. In the meantime, Little Italy, Nolita and Chinatown offer a tremendous selection of great eateries! Perfect for foodies!

Perfect location for our two-night stay. We wanted to be close to Soho and the Lower East Side. Simple and modern, with lovely touches (Red Flower toiletries). Service was on point, and we felt well cared for. Staying here meant that we could splurge on our trip. We have stayed at Crosby Street Hotel in the past, and Nolitan is at least half the price! We will return here, and feel grateful to have found our home base in the city.
4N,3D stay in excellent location. especially enjoyed view from rooftop and morning coffee from outdoor balcony. service was exemplary.

I was in New York for business in early June. This was my first time at this hotel. The service was outstanding and attentive. My room was small, but elegantly laid out, with attractive furnishings.I will definitely stay here again.

I was on a quick overnighter for a spa and shopping day in Soho and the Nolitan was absolutely perfect for it! The service was super friendly, the wifi was free, the mini bar had 3 dollar beer and Soho shopping with Little Italy food are all on the doorstep. It was a little awkward to not have a door on the shower room since I was there with a friend, but it would be perfect solo or as a couple. Overall, lovely.

we enjoyed our stay very much. its a truly luxurious hotel in nolita near little italy, soho and chinatown. staff were extremely friendly and accommodating and made our stay unforgettable. great views, too. I can highly recommend to stay there on a special occasion!

I found The Nolitan thanks to Jetsetter.com, while I was looking for a different and new place to stay on a recent weekend escape to NYC sans kids. While we left them at home in Miami Beach- we thoroughly enjoyed our weekend in NYC thanks to The Nolitan and all the comforts of our home it offered us. The location is amazing especially if you love downtown NYC neighborhoods such as Soho, Nolita, LES, West Village and Greenwich Village. All are within a 10 minute walk- if not less. You have amazing amazing restaurants and bars around you- all buzzing til early hours of the morning and you have amazing little indie owned shops filled with unique fashion, art and tchotkes. The charm of the surrounding Nolita neighborhood spills into the warm walls of this hotel. The staff are all SUPER SUPER NICE! The doormen are my new best friends. Always smiling and genuine in their manner. They make you feel comfortable- like the best of friends do for you.Architecturally- the interiors boast simple finishes such as exposed concrete walls, fabric wall panels, Serge Mouille chandeliers and a sunken library lounge to check out some cool books. Rooms are small (typical of NYC hotels anyway) but offer all the comforts you need. The mini bar is affordable and well stocked- and so are the snacks! The showers are open/exposed- so you don't feel confined which I love- and the bathroom is stocked with Red Flower toiletries made with love, right up the street. The beds are heavenly soft with down pillows and best of all check-out time is 1pm- which was helpful on my hungover Sunday morning of departure.My husband was thrilled to take out a house skateboard and explore NYC on a Saturday morning while I got my beauty sleep. He was stoked to be able to skate along the West Side Highway and through the streets of the lower east side.They are currently having a new restaurant operator come into the ground floor dining space- but the continental breakfast is quite delicious!!! Big fluffy english muffins, super delish granola and mini pastries- all super simple and yummy.All in all- a hotel review is relative to who reviews it- so it's good to know that we are also very laid back people; both from design backgrounds- so we value good and simple design when constructed propertly; detest cruises, Disneyland and anything conventionally touristy or 'group oriented'; and love urban living and delicious foooood! So for us- The Nolitan was heaven.Since our May trip, I have been back to The Nolitan a few more times, on my own for work- and will continue to stay again and again. I now consider it my home away from home- in all it's minimal, laid back, urban, comfortable glory...

I have stayed many places in NYC. These include all of the boutique hotels. The Nolitan is by far my favorite! The staff is amazing! They were friendly, helpful and made sure my stay was comfortable. The views are wonderful from this hotel. I love the neighborhood as well. The rooms are quiet, clean and very design oriented. I couldn't ask for a better situation.All the "smalls" such as bath products, slippers, umbrella, etc, are all branded extremely well! It was a very consistent experience, from the booking to the arrival through the stay and finally the checkout, it was all seamless.I cannot wait to return soon!

Great hotel in a wonderful neighborhood with many great restaurants within very close walking distance. The rooms are a tad small however are very cozy and inviting. The service was impeccable yet provided in a relaxed and friendly manner. I would not hesitate to stay at the Nolitan again.
Stylish and cosy place. Very good location although the street is a bit noisy. The service was impeccable.Overall an excellent experience.

This hotel was recommended me by a swiss friend and the hotel was OK, but nothing more than that. Rooms are small, nextdoors neighbores easy to hear. I would never have complained about being here, but it is not worth the money. Coming from Europe it is a bit funny seeing that hotels are called boutique-hotels all over the place when they have small rooms. Service was polite and efficient and helpful. Not much wrong, new and fresh, but not returning - money is better spent elsewhere.

Well appointed rooms with a contemporary feel. Service is excellent, e everyone was more than friendly. Loved the free bicycle usage, such a great way to get around downtown, and being at the intersection of Soho, Nolita, Little Italy and the LES cant be beat! Rooms are almost all street-facing, which can be a tad noisy but not terrible. Air conditioning system is also a bit loud and complicated to program. But was quite happy with the stay overall.

The Greeting:I was across the street from the hotel, which is where the cab dropped me off. The doorman must have spotted me, because he left the hotel, crossed the street, helped me with my bag and welcomed me into the hotel. Check-in was a fast, smiling breezeThe Extras:Free continental breakfast every morningFree wifiFree NYT or WSJ at my door every morningFree umbrellas (there was a rainstorm all week)Plush robe, slippers, amenitiesThe Staff:Warm, kind, eager to helpThe Room:Modern yet warm. Ample space for me. Super comfy bed and pillowsGreat bathroomsThe Location:A few blocks into town upon exiting the williamburg bridgeSteps from Little Italy/Mulberry St and SoHo - great walking neighborhood.

If you want to avoid the corporate machine of midtown hotels, Noltian is your place. New, comfy, and in a great neighborhood! Also, a room with a balcony is worth it's weight in gold for people watching and views. The doorman, Felix, makes the experience perfect. He's helpful, charming, and offers a warm smile everytime he sees you. He's like having an uncle on the staff.This is one of our favorite new hotels!

The rooms are wonderfully appointed and the size is completely reasonable. Folks complaining about the size are clearly unfamiliar with NY proportions--yes, it is small, but it is still comfortable, with plenty of room to move around and a very nice size bathroom. The staff was very helpful (we appreciated the free loaner umbrella on a rainy day) and you get a lot for your money here with the 1) COMPLETELY IDEAL LOCATION, 2) free breakfast, 3) free wifi, etc. The location really couldn't be better--it is in the very cutest part of SoHo and just a quick walk from the east village, lower east side, washington square park, etc. We loved it.

We were excited to stay at the Nolitan because of all the great reviews. When we arrived we were dissapointed to find that the rooftop and restaurant are essentially non-existent..on top of that when we got to our city view balcony room it was TINY. I understand NYC hotels are small, especially in the boutique group, but this was really small. For the price tag the hotel just did not deliver. Even the rooms looked sort of tired for a newer hotel. The biggest warning and turn off was that they tried to get us to pay for an upgrade at check in. I actually almost took them up on the offer as it was only $35/night and we could get a king room. On second thought however I decided to stick with our original booking. I am glad I did - when I looked online to see what the difference in the upgrade offer room was and our booked room it was actually CHEAPER!!! They tried to get us to pay for a downgrade! I feel so uncomfortable about this. I also heard them trying to upgrade the people who came in after us. On checkout I asked the gentelman who checked us in about his offer and asked him why he was trying to get us to pay more for a downgraded room - he said he was offering a better room on a higher floor but we were already staying in a city view. When i told him that he said he was offering a corner room - it would have made sense but I specifically asked when trying to decide if we should take the offer if it was a corner room he was offering - he said No - just a king room and the only difference would be the size of the bed.Maybe it was a mis-understanding but it just isn't settling well with me. BEWARE of this tactic - it's a trick.I will say the people were friendly and service was good too - unfortunately not enough to make up for the other short comings.

The ultra cheap Jetsetter rate is what swayed me to try this new hotel and I wasn't disappointed. This hotel is cool. The Small but well appointed rooms are more than adequate after a hardcore day of shopping. The staff were friendly, helpful and were more than happy to provide any recommendations for restaurants and bars. I'd have no hesitation staying here again.

This really does live up to all the reviews, especially concerning the staff. They are among the friendliest, most helpful of any hotel staff I have encountered in my travels. Instantly, you feel like you are family. Kudos to Felix, and all the others! The hotel has a very nice contemporary design. Sure, the rooms are small, but that's typical for NYC rooms. It's just a few blocks from Little Italy, Soho and a subway stop. All the things you need for a stay in lower Manhattan. The continental breakfast is standard danish, yogurt, bagel variety, so nothing special there. The chocolate turn down treats are delicious. The staff alone rates up along side my experiences at Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton.

The staff made us very welcome as soon as we arrived. The room was great; very clean with an amazing view. The location is excellent for all the major attractions but you also feel like you are in the real New York. There are loads of restaurants and bars nearby. It is a great place to be. It has a really relaxed atmosphere but the service is first class. We spent two nights at The Nolitan Hotel and it made our trip to New York very special.

my husband and i are NYC residents but stayed in the hotel for our anniversary. it was fine... but not worth the expense. last year we stayed at the nearby Mondrian, which was amazing, gorgeous and fun (and even less expensive than the Nolitan). The rooms here were very small and the balcony overlooks ugly, busy Kenmare street. The Nolitan didn't do anything wrong necessarily, but they didn't do anything right either. Stay at the Mondrian, the Bowery or the Standard EV instead. Same price, MUCH better experience. This place is ok if you really just want a small, boxy, clean room in a good neighborhood. If you want to step into another world, go elsewhere.
user_name:
m k
New York City, New York

review_body: My second time staying at The Nolitan and it's still the best - fantastic design, friendly staff and great location in the heart of Nolita. I loved the addition of benches on the balconies - nice way to start or end the day looking out over the city.I'm looking forward to my next stay here, I can't wait to come back!

Very good. Not the cheapest, but clean, comfortable and great location. Good design and ambiance, it felt 'cool'.Staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to make us feel at home.There was a tapping noise on our first night, not only did they move us without fuss, but when we returned from dinner, they had left a complimentary bottle of wine on the side.The bar was not open when we were there, although we were told it would be open soon. This is not really an issue in NoLiTa, so many good bars and restaurants about.Very impressive, would definitely return.

We stayed two nights at the Nolitan and we had a great experience! Staff was so nice, friendly and helpful. Although the rooms were small, it is typical NYC and it did not bother us at all. Stylish interior and quality furniture- bed and pillows very comfy. Loved the veranda! Funky and good neighborhood to be in if you want to stay close to SoHo, Brooklyn, Nolita and NoHo. Free Wifi and LOVED the Mexican restaurant on the corner "El Cafe Portal"- uber tasty!

This hotel was the best my family has stayed at in years. The staff was extremely helpful as this was our 1st trip to NY City.They made us feel right at home. Hotel was extremely clean. Comp. breakfast was a nice touch. Slippers,bathrobes, you name it. Great location close to subway.Little Italy was right around the corner, a must see and dine. We have traveled a lot in our years, this is a 10 in our book!

Was looking forward to my stay at the Nolitan, after so much good reviews and excitement that was building for the last couple of years while it was going up. The experience was fair but would say the hotel has good potential of they work out some major issues. The first is the noise, which is expected to some extent in NYC but the walls are paper thin and you can hear your neighbors tv and coughing, the street noise on Kenmare street is pretty bad too, simple insulation and sound proof windows would help this if they wanted to improve this. The lack of restaurant or room service is obvious with the closing of their restaurant, but the continental breakfast each morning makes up for this somewhat. The room sizes were pretty small even for upgrade to corner room, this pales in comparison to similar priced rooms at other new hotels in NYC like the Mondrian. For the price I expected a Soho level experience and it was more on the level of Hoboken, hope they improve because it has great potential,

This newish hotel in Nolita is the best place I've stayed in NY in the past 7 years. The rooms are well appointed: clean and modern, and the location is outstanding for restaurants, shopping, and getting around the city. The staff is very friendly, takes extra care to ensure your stay is above and beyond, and goes the extra mile to gets cabs, etc. Highlights of the hotel: an amazing roof deck, nice sized rooms, great modern bathtub for soaking (in corner rooms), and hip-European vibe.
user_name:
Margaret K
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: The staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. On departing, I was dealing with getting my car out of the garage next door and the doorman who had been notified I was going to need my bags at the front door, walked over to the garage with them without being asked to do so, knowing it is a hassle in NYC to deal with the logistics of luggage and cars and traffic. That was so wonderful. I had my black lab with me the whole time and he received much affection from the staff as well.

I recently stayed at this little gem for a long weekend vacation with a friend. This place has many great features:1. The location is fantastic - Nolita is one of my favorite neighborhoods in New York, filled with great little restaurants and bars (try Cafe Habana, Bread, & Epistrophy, and a hundred others!) and unique boutiques. (See Erica Weiner, Love Adorned and Metal Pointu's if you like jewelry). It is a short walk to Soho, Lower East Side, Little Italy, China Town, etc. It's right in the middle of it all, if you want the gritty, lower New York experience.2. The hotel lobby is modern and warm. Every evening they turn on an animated art light that looks like flowering vines blowing in the breeze. 3.The front desk is helpful, and the doorman is super friendly and welcoming (hi Felix!). He remembers everyone and makes you feel like a VIP.4.The rooms are small and simple, but well-planned and bright. The bathroom was great, and there IS a curtain you can use for privacy in those infamous glass showers. Not a problem at all. My room had a balcony which was a nice touch.5. Wi Fi and The New York Times are included.My only complaints are:1. There is no operating restaurant or bar.2. The included continental breakfast is pretty minimal (and no real protein avail) Coffee was great, tho!3. Hallways are very dark.4. There was a lot of street noise in the room I was in (5th floor, Kenmare side). I'm not sure there's anything they can do about it, so I just turned on the fan and slept fine.Overall, a great stay and would definitely return!

This hotel is the most perfectly located if you want to walk to amazing coffee & treats, fun brunch and dinner places, and great boutique shopping. The rooms are small but very nice. Great bedding, nice bathroom, nice toiletries, and great staff if you need anything else. They also have a really cool rooftop with amazing views (and hopefully a future bar...looks like they might be getting ready to do something up there). We will definitely be staying here again.
Great location, staff and concierge service is just the best in class! They will help you out with anything!
user_location: New York City, New York, USA
user_name:
Henrik319
New York City, New York, USA

review_body: This hotel is just fantastic. Cool location for those who want to experience the real New York (but be near to the tourist spots at the same time). Rooms quite trendy, small enough like all New York hotels but perfectly formed. Lots of nice touches. Great beds. However, what makes this hotel so fantastic is the staff. SO helpful, sincere and friendly! They made our stay. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and will continue doing so!Thanks for a great stay :-)

We had a fantastic week long stay at the Nolitan, the staff literally couldn't be more helpful and thoughtful - when they found out it was our anniversary a bottle of complimentary Champagne was delivered to our room. Location is excellent, right in the heart of the action in terms of east village and soho, and crucially right next to a subway. Room was lovely, great balcony and everything was in order and well kept. Super comfortable bed, decent shower and being able to borrow an iPad from reception was handy too.

Stayed in a corner, cityview room, which is a little larger than most rooms and has a great freestanding bath (which is nice and deep, and open to the room) and a great view of mid-town and the ESB.The design of the room is great with an industrial-mid century feel, but despite being a larger room it still felt a little tight and awkward in parts, and the unusually high amount of scrapes and patch-up paint on some corners (for such a new hotel) made me think others found it a little awkward to get their bags in and out too. No big deal, just a shame in such a nice-looking space it wasn't thought out a little more by the architects. Also, there's only one small space for one bag in the closet, so extra luggage ends up on the floor (maybe add a bag-stand, management?). Maybe the standard size rooms make better use of their limited space? I'm just not sure of the value of paying extra for the corner room if you're after more space.The staff were lovely and gave exactly the service you want when you stay in a small boutique hotel. They remember your name, they always have a smile on their faces, they give you umbrellas when it rains, they get you take out from local restaurants and deliver it to your room! The best service I've had in a NYC hotel, with absolutely no hint of pretentiousness.The restaurant was closed while I stayed, so a simple breakfast was provided. A nice touch, though it was very basic and felt like it was temporary and kind of thrown together. Still, nice to be able to grab something before heading out for the day.Two other small things, the AC was REALLY loud and right above the bed, and made it hard to get to sleep the first few nights. The traffic here can be a bit loud, so I preferred AC over traffic, but not ideal. And they seemed to have way less cable TV channels than most hotels, which seems a bit cheap. Weird.Location is great, moments to great restaurants like La Esquina, Bathazar, and all Nolita and SoHo has to offer. Overall, I would stay again, I think I just expected a touch more on some of the details due to it's excellent ranking.

My wife and I stayed at the Nolitan during early May 2012. It was absolutely excellent. Our room on 6th floor was compact but what do you expect in NYC? As regards decor it was great. Being a relatively new hotel, everything was modern and kept spotlessly clean. The other amazing thing was that it had a balcony of it's own; great to sit with a "sundowner" after a hard days sightseeing, and watch the world go by. Not only is the physical side of the hotel great, but the staff are also wonderful, and really go the extra mile to help. particular thanks to Felix the Fixer(and word-smith), Aleah(?spelling?) and Tammy. Complimentary continental breakfast is also a great time-saver for the tourist with limited time. As regards location, you cannot do better; Little Italy and Chinatown both just around the corner. No need for taxis to the restaurant for dinner, just a five minute stroll. Keep up the great work, and thanks for making our stay so wonderful. Bryn & Jeannette.

Love the Nolitan!!! If you want noisy and impersonal - stick to the big hotels in the tourist-packed areas like Times Square. If you want a peaceful and comfortable oasis within walking distance of the best areas (Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho), stay at the Nolitan. General Manager Patrik Horstmann is to be commended for his extremely friendly & professional staff at this beautiful hotel. The rooms are kept spotless, every need is attended to immediately, and Luis the Doorman is incredibly hard-working and friendly.We will be back!!

Stayed in April 2012 & upgraded to a corner suite. A little small for a suite but understandable for NYC. Right in the middle of everything, a few blocks left to China Town, a few blocks right to Soho. Lots of bars, Pizza places, and cool restos. Would stay here again just for the perfect location.

The rooms are a bit small, but the interior is well designed and new. The personell is excellent: very nice and thoughfull! Don't forget to watch the view from the rooftop during the day, but especially at night!

The Nolitan is truly outstanding. We had a great corner room on the 3rd floor, nice views and extremely well appointed. From the welcome email we received a few days before our arrival, to the very knowledgeable and friendly staff, the Nolitan goes above and beyond to ensure your stay is amazing. Very un-pretentious yet supremely stylish. Can't beat the location and close to such fantastic shopping and dining in Soho. Rooftop patio affords amazing views of the city. Staff was so friendly and laid back. I won't stay anywhere else. Only negative was a lot of road noise - Kenmare St is an artery that feeds the Williamsburg Bridge so there was a lot of traffic, lots of honking. It seemed worse in the late afternoon while we were relaxing, but by bedtime with the curtains drawn it was only background noise. Definitely not a dealbreaker - book now!

The star attraction of this hotel is the staff. Felix was the man and helped us with everything we could possibly need to know about. All the staff made a fuss of my 12 year old daughter. She loved it. As a single mum travelling, I really felt like someone had my back! I think that is extraordinary. Our room was gorgeous. Gorgeous bath. Views of the Empire State builing and then straight down the bridge on the other side (corner room). The only bummer about their restaurant was being refurbed. However, we had great choices for room service from restaurants nearby. This will soon be remedied. I would stay again without hesitation. My daughter left her laptop in the room!! The Manager brought it to us at Penn station. I mean, seriously! Who does that! Aldo - thanks again.

Love the style of this place, and I don't mean visually, although it is cute. I mean that I like the way they operate -- totally unpretentious, meant to make things easy for the traveler, esp. for longer-term stays. Very reasonably priced hotel with free wifi, free continental breakfast, balcony that you can walk onto (in NYC!) good layout, good lighting, good toiletry items, plenty of hangers in the closet, plenty of space on the sink to lay out your stuff, big showerhead, reasonably priced mini-bar, in-room safe, slippers, robes, etc. You just show up and you're good to go! The rooms, while small, are laid out very efficiently. So while it was fine for a couple, for a solo traveler it would be excellent. They also have an agreement with a 24 hour fitness center nearby, although we didn't use it due to our short stay. The location is also great if you like the somewhat grittier side of Soho. Feels very urban, plenty of cute wine shops, Italian groceries, asian foot massages, everyday-type restaurants, clothing boutiques, etc, all within walking distance.

As said - it is a trendy hotel, in the best area of nyc with very neighbourly staff. We stayed there for seven nights: very safe and professional, and the staff know nyc very well (arranged rangers-tickets for madison sq g.).The room felt very nice, not to small for two people. We had an ordinary room at 5th floor - did hear the traffic outside, but that didnt botter me - i´m usually sensitive for sounds, but the vague sound from traffic actually made me drowsy.Though, you will hear when people are passing by in the hallway. But as soon as the entered their room, you will not hear them.The breakfast is: tea/coffee, yoghurt and bagel with cream cheese and jelly. Nothing more nothing less. It could be worse.My advice: unless you really really bothered with the gentle sound of nyc-traffic - stay at the Nolitan!
