It is a really nice place where you get to know a magnificent and genuin part of nyc (bars, restaurants, boutiques). Nolitan is personally and professional, with a very good vibe.
A fabulous haven in a great city - the Nolitan is a must for your short NYC break. Great service from their very committed staff. Excelent transport links - Book it, it's worth it!

We liked this hotel for a number of reasons. It is small so you don't feel like a number and the staff was very friendly and helpful. While the room was a little small (it is New York), it had a great view of the Empire State Bldg., Crysler Bldg., etc.. Our only complaint was the fan for the heater/ac was loud so we turned it off and opened the balcony door. We were on the 8th floor with a balcony, and the roof deck is awesome. It's a great neighborhood and close to so many things. We were in midtown one day and thanked ourselves for not staying up there. We will stay here again.

I was so happy with my stay at The Nolitan. The property is very nice - nothing over-the-top; everything functional, well designed, clean asthetics, beautiful wood. The service was exceptional. Plus it is in a very cool neighbor. It's not the Ritz, but I would much rather stay at the Nolitan again. And I look forward to it!

Wonderful new boutique hotel...staff couldn't have been any better..helpful in every way, from recommendations to directions to professionalism with ever present friendly and cheerful dispositions. Service was perfect without being intrusive or stuffy. Location is great...easy walk to Nolita, SoHo, Little Italy, East Village and a short walk to subway access for greater distances. Light continental breakfast included is plenty to hold you over until lunch. The rooms are so nicely laid out and apportioned that the size was not a factor at all. The bed was very comfortable and simple, contemporary decorating was perfect. Upon check-in, we were even asked what time we would like to have our room cleaned each day. Special touches included a hand-written note, a bag of pistachios and chocolate upon check-in, special turn down chocolates on our pillows each night accompanied by a weather forecast for the following day. The tenth floor roof-top is a beautiful place to spend a sunset or to view the city at night. The hotel is very quiet, which is a welcome reprieve to the noise and hustle and bustle of most sections of NYC. Our room was located directly across from the elevator and we were not bothered by noise even one time during our stay. We will definitely stay at the Nolitan when we return to New York and highly recommend it to all!

good localization in Soho! Staff was really caring and helpfull in a lot of ways. Room was perfect and the bed, incredibly comfortable. COmplimentary continental breakfast is ok and if you want some different choices, there are plenty nearby the hotel! I would stay at Nolitan again!!!!

I am from New Jersey now living in California. While looking for a hotel to stay at for Spring Break we found the Nolitan. We spent two nights and loved it. The people who work there are extremely friendly and helpful. Ben at the front desk made us feel like family. The doorman showed my photographer husband the roof one night and he took photos of the panoramic view. Our room (with a king bed) was good size by New York standards and beautifully appointed. There was even a yoga mat in the closet for our use. The continental breakfast was delicious. There are free bikes and skateboards to get around the neighborhood. But most of all the hotel's design and location are what we carried away with us. It is a beautiful building that blends with its surroundings. I remember this area when I was growing up and it was sketchy and unsafe. Now there are great shops, wonderful restaurants (try Public). We walked through Chinatown to the Financial District over to Tribeca up to Soho and back to the hotel. After staying in Midtown the first part of the week, Nolita is a refreshing change. I can't say enough about how wonderful this hotel is and they deserve all the praise they are getting.
I highly recommend the Nolitan for it's clean rooms, fun vibe, above and beyond amenities. I will always, always stay here on future visits.

Excellent location between SOHO, Lower East Side, Chinatown and Nolita. Fantastic architecture and design. Very personal, nice staff. Great views from the rooms on upper floors, lower floors probably noisy. Basic but good quality breakfast.

I stayed a the Nolian for my birthday. I live in New York and have been disappointed by some of the so called "five Star" hotels in the city, but this hotel was a wonderful surprise. Great, cool location on the lower east side very near many cafes, bars and fun stores as well as being right by a subway and plenty of cabs. I really admired how they utilized the space in quite small rooms to make them feel airy, light and luxurious. Loved the see through shower and mini bar treats. The manager sent up a complimentary bottle of bubbly for my birthday and a handwritten card. Really nice. Very helpful staff and just a great vibe. We met two women from Holland who had borrowed bikes from the hotel and cycled to Coney Island for the day. I have no complaints at all about this hotel. Free newspaper in the morning and breakfast (which I did not try). This pace will become my monthly night away with my wife from kids and stress. A great New York experience, even for a New Yorker. I will say if you don't like urban style and a modern concrete, glass and steel aesthetic it's not for you. Me, I loved it, as did my wife, we will be back.
user_name:
Peter M
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is located between SOHO and Little Italy and you are ony streets away from the best areas of a great city. We were here for a week and enjoyed the hotel very much. For NY standards the rooms were good and nicly laied out. We had a room with a balcony so we could enjoy the street life from above, but there is also a roof terrace where you can watch all the action from above. We are going here again!!

I spend a lot of time in hotels and many of them just fade away in memory. The Nolitan never will!! This was the single best stay I have ever had in NYC and one of my best in the world. The staff here is INCREDIBLE! From Romey at the front desk to the Director who helped with my luggage at the end everyone was fantastic. The hotel is funky architecture (very European) and the location is great. Unfortunately the restaurant has closed but there are loads of great eateries in walking distance. Free breakfast was very good and I met happy families each morning (Swedish couple, German family, etc.) Stay here, you won't regret it. I know you'll love it like I did!!!

Really enjoyed a recent stay at the Nolitan. Location is excellent, walking distance to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, Tribeca and Greenwich Village. Therefore walking distance to numerous bars, restaurants, and shopping. Staff at hotel were very helpful. Decent buffet breakfast is complimentary. No restaurant at Hotel but staff will arrange delivery from some of the local restaurants (menus in information pack in room). I would definitely stay there again.

I recently stayed in this hotel to celebrate my birthday! The hotel is in the best location for spending time in Soho, Little Italy, Tribeca, etc. It's by all my favorite streets; Elizabeth, Spring, Mott, Prince...the list goes on and on! We had a little balcony which I highly suggest paying for because we loved having our morning coffee outside, watching the sun rise over the city while people start their day. Our room was small, but clean and just what you need. The shower was cool, all glass. The hotel staff was very kind, friendly, and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to New Yorkers needing a getaway or a tourist that is looking for a wonderful hotel downtown to be in the midst of Soho.

Great hotel. Great location for access to SoHo, Lower East Side. #6 subway is convenient to get you uptown. I arrived much earlier than stated check in. It was very nice for the front desk staff to call my cell to tell me when my room was ready. Free coffee/ continental breakfast until 10:00. Full service restaurant bar not yet open. Very affordable mini-bar. My room, 306 was across from the elevator. You could hear when people were talking outside my door when waiting for the elevator. Room was small, but serviceable. Small terrace with bench. Suitable for sitting and having a cup of coffee or glass of wine. Free wireless.

I was kind of sick when arriving around 13:00pm. As the official check-in time is from15:00, the reception girl told there is nothing she can do and kept me waiting till then. I understand the rule, but such customer care is really poor in hotel business and this will never be my choice again! Try a little careful when you prepay a hotel....

What a grear hotel - was in NYC on business and stayed here 2 nights. It was quiet at night so nothing interrupted your sleep. Comfy beds, complimentary continental breakfast and super friendly and helpful staff! Will definitely come back!

I have traveled cross country and continent, stayed in many hotels and the Nolitan is one of the best. Wonderful reception staff! and they even had a dog bowl filled to top with biscuits along with a stuffed toy, frisbee and baggies waiting in my room upon check in. Rooms were very clean and modern, and the furniture wasn't flimsy like I've experienced in other boutique hotels. Rooftop view is a must-see especially at night.

I stayed at the Nolitan last weekend for my husbands birthday. Although the room was nice what really colored my impression of the hotel was what was missing. Three days before my arrival a hotel employee called to confirm my check in and noted it was my husbands birthday. She proceeded to ask if there was anything special I would like them to do for our arrival. I arranged for a bottle of Vueve Cliquot and happy birthday balloons. I was further directed to call on my way so everything could be in the room at the right time. Despite my calling ahead with my arrival time there were no champange or balloons. There was a bottle of Malbec that we did not request. Why offer services (which I was prepared to pay for) and fail to deliver?

Got there Friday morning and the very polite front desk attendant allowed me access to my room even though I was early.The room is tastefully done, but by no means luxurious. Very practical in the important ways. For example it seemed solid. I had no issues with noise from other guests, something I'm usually sensitive to. I was also impressed with the amenities: everything from hair conditioner to a yoga mat. The king-sized bed was very comfortable. I left New York more rested than when I arrived, the complete opposite of most visits.Although the restaurant was closed, the Nolitan served a Continental breakfast with very good coffee.I will return to the Nolitan at the next opportunity.

I recently stayed at The Nolitan on a whim when I found a super low rate of $143.20 on their website for a Neighborhood Room. I had been wanting to stay here since they opened, so I thought I'd take advantage of the great rate & glad I did- I really loved my room! Ben checked me in & he was a great first impression- he was relaxed, cool, super friendly & upgraded me to a Cityscape room on the top floor of the hotel, which was the 9th floor- thanks Ben! I was in room 901- my room was quite small, with cool hardwood floors, a concrete ceiling, a slim wooden desk with an awesome chair, Rose scented Red Flower Bath products that were lovely, super comfy bed with soft linens & great pillows, amazing shower, & an awesome view of the Williamsburg bridge! I loved the feel of the room & was very comfortable! When I called down I was able to extend until 2pm (check out is at 1pm, which is very nice to begin with!) & the hotel provided a delectable little chocolate treat on my bed at turndown service- really nice touch, including the weather card for the next day. However, there are a few things that you should keep in my mind when staying at The Nolitan- even though I was on the highest floor in the building, my room was noisy; not terribly loud, but I could hear traffic & people outside if my window was cracked open for fresh air- I live in the city, so this doesn't really bother me, just something to keep in mind- I can only imagine the lower floors are incredibly noisy. For a brand new building, the Elevators are noisy, I could hear a cell phone conversation two rooms away as I was sitting on my bed, the a/c & heating unit was freakishly loud, so I just turned it OFF completely, as it was a cool night in NYC & the windows & building have really bad soundproofing. Housekeeping was very loud around 9am outside of my room. None of this ruined my stay, but the hotel has really poor insulation to block the noise, which is really unfortunate for a new building.Also, the restaurant is closed, so the hotel is offering a light Continental breakfast in the lobby- the selection when I arrived around 9:45a was really low- a few pastries, yogurt, & a few pieces of whole fruit with half filled carafes of juice. The Danish I had was quite good! The hotel has no room service right now, but providing menus from local neighborhood restaurants for delivery service. The mini bar was decent, with all items reasonably priced.Overall, I'm glad I stayed at The Nolitan- I really adored my room & loved the hardwood floors, the incredible bed & the lovely rain shower! It was a room that I really didn't want to leave, as I love clean, modern lines that were used in the hotel. The only negative towards the hotel in my opinion was the lack of soundproofing- otherwise, a cool, cute hotel in an amazing part of NYC!
user_name:
patrickwNewYork_NY
New York City, New York

review_body: I selected this hotel mostly because of location--to be in easy walking distance of NoLita, Soho, Chinatown, East Village--followed by a "reasonable" price meaning under $300/night. At first, upon arrival, I thought we had entered a glorified hostel. It was nighttime and dark. The hallways are stark and there's lots of concrete. BUT, by the next morning I was pretty much enamored with our hotel. The designers did their best to make good use of the space and keep the rooms feeling as airy as possible considering how tiny most NYC hotel rooms are in general. I believe all rooms have large glass windows facing into the city. The shower has a wall of glass that looks into the room to keep light flowing, but there are curtains on both sides of the glass wall for privacy. We had a room with a balcony, which we really enjoyed. It was nice in the a.m. to open it and hear the street sounds, let in more light and have air circulating, even if it's city air. My husband and I both really liked the contemporary and minimalist styling. We found it quite comfortable for sleeping and we did not experience any noise issues that some other guests have complained about. Each night we were left with a different snack or sweet, which we liked because it was not the typical cookie cutter mint chocolate. In the mornings, complimentary tea, coffee and continental breakfast is served, not that we every ate it-- (go to Oro around the corner). With that said, the cons: the desk space is not generous so I couldn't imagine having to work for any duration in this room. And, there's not a lot of storage for clothes, bags, etc. Hard to completely unpack, especially if there's more than one person in the room. However, there is a lot of comfortable public space in the lobby that lends itself to working on a laptop and possibly hanging out. An added plus is the rooftop with 360 city views. Right now it's not functioning as anything other than a hotel rooftop--no public bar, etc-- so it's quiet and basically uninhabited. We had a nice picnic lunch one afternoon overlooking the Williamsburg Bridge. The staff is young and incredibly friendly as well as helpful. I would recommend this for a couple or friends who are not going to spend a lot of time in the room lounging around but need a clean, safe, comfortable place to stay that's in a fabulous location. FYI, the wine bar next door serves great Spanish wines at good prices. I would definitely go back as long as I can get a rate at around $200-$250.

We went with the family (kids are 14 and 17) for a college visit. Location was convenient to NYU. Thought the hotel had very cool design touches and was quite comfortable. Didn't notice noise as a problem at all (I guess the bohemian dude doesn't know how to put the fan on full time). And there is a curtain if you're worried about the "peek a boo shower." We thought the bathrooms were well equipped and had a nicely spare feel. The beds were very comfortable, and despite the hard surfaces in the room, we all thought it managed the right degree of warmth.We got adjoining rooms on the ninth floor which was great for a family. We could close off those two rooms and leave the doors between the two open. The view east on Kenmare/Delancey to the Williamsburg bridge was beautiful especially at night, and the corner room had a nice view uptown. You should especially go up on the roof. They're working on getting approval to open up a bar, but just to go up there on a nice spring night was wonderful.The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more accomodating. And we thought the complimentary breakfast was of high quality and with decent variety.All in all, we'll definitely be coming back for our next visit to NYC.

There has been an insane amount of great reviews for this place (which is just a few months old) and having now experienced the Nolitan for myself I think an injection of "reality" is needed. Here are my observations both good and bad:it's a new hotel and as such there are always gonna be kinks that need to be worked out - sadly for this hotel a lot of the kinks are design flaws and issues that are much harder to fix than training staff.first off the building is seriously fugly. I mean really, who designs these things? granted I was told the hotel sits on what was a parking lot (I hope that is true) and the strip its on isn't exactly gorgeous architecture central, however it kinda shocks me that such ugliness is still being built from the ground up. OK never mind, you can't see the building from the rooms anyways right?So let's talk rooms shall we? I was given a "neighbourhood" room with a nominal view of Delancey Street and the Williamsburg bridge. Outfitted with a king bed (very crisp and comfortable btw) a slim table and Eames chair, the rooms were designed, I believe by people who wanted the space to show well in magazines and blogs, but in reality are all cold and hard surfaces that don't exactly scream coziness or comfort. The room doors are magnetic and HEAVY, there is tons of exposed concrete and wood floors. Yes it all looks very "cool" and "hip" but you know what that means? YES - TONS of noise. All day and all night all I could hear were heavy doors slamming (the hotel was full), high heels clanking, stuff being dropped on the floor above and below and starting 8am in the morning a full compliment of housekeepers knocking, clanking and making all sorts of noise. NOW I am a heavy sleeper, but even I thought the noise level of the interior of this hotel was excessive. Like I said this is a design flaw that can't exactly be cheaply fixed. Speaking of cheap - the air conditioner was really loud and if you open the window there is tons of street noise (but of course being NYC this part is expected).Little touches were missed by the designers (who it seems have never stayed in a hotel room overnight) such as no hooks in the bathroom, shower doors that allowed water to leak all over, room safes too small for a laptop, chairs with wooden legs that were already busted (boo) and finally the shower had a glass wall between it and the room so that it was visible from the bed. Seriously? While this may be great for frisky couples, "Peek a boo" showers are so 2003 - can we please find a new bathroom trend please? This is not hotel where you can share a room with coworker or non-romantic friend or family.on the PLUS side, the location is great, the staff is SUPER friendly, outgoing and seemed to love their job, the concierge was a little fake thou... there are exactly 2 bikes for rent to cruise the hood (1 "boy" bike and 1 "girl" bike) internet is free and fast, as it should be and checkout time (for now anyways) is 2pm - very civilized.In conclusion I would say that if you don't mind the noise and all those hard surfaces and you can get a rate under $300 the Nolitan will serve you well, anymore than that I would say you are better off with the Thompson LES or Crosby Street Hotel which are closeby and offer the same proximity to Nolita/Soho/LES and are also very trendy.Also good for you to know is that this hotel will charge you (upon) check in: 1. the full amount of your stay 2. $150 per day for incidental charges. This then takes 5 business days after your stay to clear so consider yourself warned - I find this bit a little excessive and customer service unfriendly, but hey that's just me...

This was my second stay at the Nolitan. The staff was extremely helpful, cordial and super friendly. The restaurant at the hotel is currently closed but there are plenty of choices in walking distance. I will definitely stay there again!

I stayed here for five nights. I asked for a quiet room, and that is exactly what I got. It was clean, spacious by NY standards, and the staff is very nice. The location is convenient for going into SoHo, and close to interesting streets in Nolita. Subway is close by too.

Almost every year, we like to spend a few days in New York. This is, without hesitation, the best choice we've made! Great location!Immaculate rooms, design with taste! Staff is extremely nice and attentive!Great extras, like the bikes! We will definitely go back.

Believe the reviews. Just stayed at the Nolitan over the weekend (Fri-Sun) and the hotel/staff/location/service/etc. were as good as advertised, or as good as the reviews indicate. I have made several refundable reservations leading up to our weekend in NYC, and eliminated/cancelled the reservations as I read reviews on tripadvisor. As the date for our trip approached, I figured I would take a chance on the Nolitan since it didn't have as many reviews and was not in the areas we have stayed before. However, I am very glad we stayed here. The location was perfect, no more than a 5-10 minute subway ride to the heart of the city, but there really isn't a reason to leave the area for food/drinks. There are lots of great restaurants and bars in the area, a great nightlife. The views from the hotel balcony was amazing, could see the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building, and at night they were beautiful.The staff was very friendly and the amenities they offer are great. FREE internet, laptop/iPad rental, skateboard and bike rental. In addition, each night they came by and gave us chocolate and a weather card indicating the weather for the next day. The hotel and the rooms were extremely clean, and we loved the furniture. The bed was very comfortable as well, easy nights sleep. The ONLY issue is that I had ordered an "extra" at the time of booking, and this was not fulfilled; however, the hotel immediately cancelled the associated charges, and all was fine. Next time were in NYC, we will definitely consider staying here again.

We loved everything about this hotel, from the modern design to the friendly service. Great location with a fantastic view from the balcony. They thought of everything, we couldn't have been happier with our experience.

We stayed at the Nolitan for three nights. The hotel is modern and new, and caters to a younger dare-I-say hipster crowd (skateboards and iPads available to borrow), at a more affordable price point (usually) than The Standard or other popular boutique hotels.The room was small, as is typical for NYC but the space is used well. Wood floors, a lot of concrete surfaces and modern furniture. Windows are decent sized but a little high off the ground, giving the room decent light but a little bit more of a boxy feel than the floor-to-ceiling windows at The Standard or The Bowery. Because of the extensive use of wood and concrete, the acoustics on our floor were not great -- you could pretty much hear sounds from many nearby rooms. And on the 4th floor, we did get some street noise.Service was super helpful and sincerely friendly.The location is ideal if you're spending most of your time in the Nolita, SoHo, Chinatown, or Lower East Side. Subway access is convenient to the F, 6, B, and D lines -- transfer required for the A/C/E line so other locations are more convenient if you're focused on the west side.Overall, we'd stay there again so long as the prices continue to be more reasonable than other higher profile hotels.

The nolitan is comfortable, hip,well located, and friendly. The rooms are smallish but very well designed. The beds are terrific with high end linens which were much appreciated. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The gum balls at the front desk were a guilty pleasure. The ny noise wasn't bad but it exists. A great place to stay to explore soho, with many good restaurant choices nearby. I was a female traveling solo and felt perfectly safe.

i stayed at the hotel four nights 2 weeks ago. I stayed in a room with balcony at 8th floor.The room was amazing! Maybe a tad small but very comfortable and beautifully designed. When I walked in, I immediately had a great view over the city, even the big shower does not have walls but glass and I saw the empire state building through it! The bathroom was very clean and well-designed. The bed was extremely comfortable with a beautiful bedhead in marble. The balcony, made of wood and steel, has a beautiful little bench, you could just stay outside for a long time enjoying the view and the life of the neighborhood. You can find in the room a lot of amenities, a beautiful umbrella, a variety of snacks, ultra comfortable bathrobe, beverages at small prices. The lounge and the rooftop are wonderful. The rooftop, even if it was February, was enjoyable, and offered great views either towards Midtown and Lower Manhattan. There are several benches with ashtrays, ideal if you want to enjoy a cigarette after breakfast. The included continental breakfast is very good and served in the lounge which is very cozy. The staff was great too. Very kind without being intrusive. The room services are good, you get a newspaper very early and delicious chocolates for the night.The location is perfect. It is close to subway stations, so you can get to midtown quickly during the day, but for the night you are already in the best place. At walking distance you can find a lot of great restaurants, cafes and bars. Many of them newly opened and crowded! Nolita is a really great neighborhood and it is the perfect place in order to appreciate New York, especially during the week end. There are a lot of other small details, difficult to explain, that make this hotel really outstanding. It will be hard not to choose it again when I will be back to New York City.

The Nolitan is a real gem of a downtown boutique hotel: super chic, minimalist, edgy, as you would expect downtown---yet also warm, comfortable and welcoming. Yes, the rooms are on the smaller side (this is New York, after all! ). but so very stylish, comfortable and well-appointed that you don't mind. I honestly didn't want to leave my corner neighborhood king--it was like a fabulous glass cocoon, especially on a rainy night. And I loved sampling the reasonably-priced gourmet treats in the mini- bar. And since the hotel opened last summer, the service has really blossomed. It is genuinely friendly and attentive, without being over-bearing, and the entire staff really strives to meet your every request promptly. How very refreshing, and what a contrast to the usual "attitude" and complete indifference I've experienced at other downtown hotels like the Thompsons. The location is fantastic, with Little Italy, Soho, Nolita, Noho, Greenwich Village etc within easy walking distance. The shopping is divine and there are countless great restaurants---Emporio, Tartinery, Pulino's, Peasant, Public, Epistrophy, Lombardi's Pizza--- nearby. All in all, this hotel is a delightful find.

We booked through Tablet and had two room this past weekend. The front desk staff is outstanding. They called us two days prior to ask for any special accomodations that we needed. They then went and proceeded to contact our restaurant of choice for that Sat night dinner and told us how to work 'the system'.The check in was extremly quick. The rooms, though small for non NYC rooms, were very clean, comfortable with a tremendous view of NYC skyline. The bed was comfortable. The mini bar was very inexpensive ($3-4 for a Corona). Cant wait till the rooftop bar is open again for drinks 10 stories up with a view of the Trade center and empire state building.Breakfast was strong coffee and danishes.Check out was simple and easy. They called a car for us to get back to Penn Station.Around there is The Smith, yerba, McSorleys, Bleeker Street and Little Italy and Chinatown.Overall great to be in/near the village.

We first arrived before our room was ready, but we checked our bags, and they told us what room we'd be in, before we headed out to explore the neighborhood. We returned, and they put us in our room (not the same number as they had mentioned at check in), and I was NOT impressed. Really, no room for anything but the bed, with a gorgeous view of...the brick parking garage next door. Needless to say, I was very disappointed given the price that we were paying, and I called down to the front desk to ask what had happened to our original room. We didn't get a full answer, but we did get moved to a room with a view of New York. Not much larger, but at least a view. The lobby is chic and the neighborhood is young and fresh, but I think I'll stay elsewhere when I'm in New York next time.

The Nolitan was great. Perfect location in Nolita..close to Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, Losada and the East and West village. Spring Street subway stop one block away takes you very conveniently to wherever you want to go downtown or uptown. Architecturally very interesting--funky, hip and sleek. Rooms very well designed. We especially liked the corner king room with views up town to the Empire state building and a huge soaking tub. Unique approach to room service where they get carryout from neighborhood restuarants and serve on Nolitan china.Nolitan has only been open for 5 months so there were some some minor glitches with room service and a bath tub stopper. But the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Problems were addressed immediately. Every staff member we dealt with seemed genuinely interested in our well being. The Nolitan will be our first choice for any future visits to New York.

Stayed here for 1 night on a business trip and had a very pleasant stay. The room was very cool with an industrial meets luxury feel and there are many aspects taht remind you that you are in a special place. They must have used a special sound deadening glass because there was no street noise. My room had a balcony and when I went outside there was a lot of usual NYC rumble, but inside it was very peaceful. All of my interactions with the staff were comfortable and felt very real, not forced or fake. They support the local businesses and the soaps and toiletries from a fabulous store about a block away (Red Flower?) which ads to the unique one of a kind feel. The neighborhood is between chinatown and SOHO, so there is still some edge to it, which I prefer. Lot's of good places to eat and visit (but they are at the high end of the price range). You get some of the old New York feel walking around and the front desk and doormen are quick to offer their expereinces and suggestions that all turned out to be gold for me. I will stay here again.

We stayed here for the first time the other night, and we will absolutely be returning. The staff was warm, friendly, and genuinely seemed like nice people. This is a nice contrast to some of the other places I've stayed in SoHo. The neighborhood is great, and the hotel has a nice modern/industrial vibe that is still warm and inviting. One nice touch: the room had a working window. It was 60 degrees when we were there, and being able to open a window and let in some air was fantastic. I'm already looking into returning in the summer.

An excellent boutique hotel on lower east side for creative minds and food lovers. Check out the Marque Creative's branding and Grzywinski+Pons's interior design in the hotel. Lombardi's coal oven pizza is just 5 mins away; also Cafe el Portal's Mexican grilled corn with mayo, cheese and chili is the best thing in NYC; and don't forget to take a 15 mins walk to Katz's Deli for it's Jewish corned beef sandwich. Thank you so much to the hotel and Phoenix the man for the complimentary bottle of red and card for our wedding anniversary. Sweet!

I have stayed at this hotel since the opening night. I recently completed my 6th stay with them. I used to stay midtown at more ego-filled boutique hotels. The Nolitan is my home away from home. The rates are extremely reasonable, and the decor is well thought out, but not contrived. They have a great option on their website of choosing extra mattress padding, extra pillows, etc. so that when you arrive, your room is suited to your needs. Evening turndown service is nice, and they leave you a nice piece of locally made chocolate/cookie, etc. Ihome in all of the rooms for great convenience and charging (if you have an iphone). Location is conventient to get to LGA airport, and some of the best restraunts in New York are blocks away from the Nolitan. Find a restaurant you like, and The Nolitan will order your food for you, go pick it up, plate it for you, and deliver it to your room at no extra charge (except tip, of course). This service, as well as the free wi-fi are my 2 favorite amenities. Another really nice touch is that all of the soap, shampoo, and lotion products are from Red Flower. Red Flower is a great brand of home products, with a Soho location right up the street. Rooms are extremely clean, some of the cleanest I've ever stayed in.The staff is welcoming, friendly, and strives to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. Most of the staff has been there since day 1, so it's nice to go back and see familiar faces. If you are looking for an authentic New York experience, this is your place. Let the tourists stay in midtown, travelers stay at The Nolitan!

My wife and I spent February 9th - 12th at the Nolitan Hotel. I had lived in NYC in the late 80's and didn't return to visit again until 1999. I have never been one for large chain hotels and have searched most of NYC for these little hidden gems. Some of the reviews where not good but I took a chance and booked a corner king room. When we arrived there was discounted parking across the street. Upon checking in we where we'll greeted by a young man "Ben" from Liverpool UK. He was wonderful. Telling us about the hotel and the surrounding neighborhood. Upon entering our room I was pleasantly surprised to find it very Euro chic. Bathroom was amazing even though it was completely open to the room. Amenities where also great. We encountered one problem. On the 2nd night the drain on the tub broke. The next morning we stopped at the front desk and told them about it. It was fixed by the time we returned that afternoon. Some of the other reviews have said the staff where not very kind or attentive. I'm going to beg to differ. They were all wonderful! If you want the Ritz or 4 Seasons treatment then damn well stay there. I'll be enjoying myself at the Nolitan and surrounding neighborhood.

This is a beautiful little boutique hotel. The decor is great. The amenities are great as well. Maybe i'm a cheap date but I love free Wifi especially while traveling. The rooms are quite spacious for NYC. Its actually in a quiet spot but still a great location to see all that downtown has to offer.

We had a lovely stay at the Nolitan. The room (we had a king on the 6th floor) was super... The bed was very comfortable, really clean and cosy and the shower was wonderful. (all glass) The Staff are super attentive and helpful. It is wonderfully situated with Soho, Little Italy, and Noho all within walking distance.. lots of great restaurants close by too.

A very comfortable little hotel with great modern design details, from the red room slippers to the light fixtures, and local flair, such as the bathroom products from local boutique Red Flower and the Vosges chocolate on the pillow at night. The room seemed small upon arrival, but we realized the way it was layed out made for a very comfortable stay. Loved the shower with glass walls on both sides and rain shower head and our City Room balcony (9th floor room) had a fantastic view of the uptown skyline including the Empire State, and to the right, looking down Kenmare St. was a straight view down the Williamsburg bridge. Continental breakfast was nothing to write home about but was complimentary, which I didn't expect, so was a nice surprise. One of the nicest touches was a bottle of prosecco with a birthday card frl from the manager for my husband whose birthday we had come to celebrate. Will be returning again!

nolitan hotel and its staff stand out by being very friendly and caring. almost feels like staying with family. the rooms are well equipped, have great beds and bathrooms.for people who like to go shopping and like to have a great variety of both simple and high quality restaurants close by, the nolitan is situated in the perfect neighborhood.it for sure isn't the quietest neighborhood, with plenty of traffic right in front of the hotel, but if you are looking for that you might be in the wrong city anyway...a little minus is, that the doors to the rooms are not very well sound-insulated, so that one can hear plenty of action from the isle.if you expect big variety of food roomservice, the pick a different hotel, but there is so many places close by, you will not need it.but again, for us the neighborhood (and being so close to the east village, chinatown, soho and having great metro connections) was the biggest plus. you can easily walk home with your shopping, or for a quick nap before going out to dinner.

I love this contemporary downtown hotel. It has a Euro-modern atmosphere, the staff is friendly and helpful and it is in a lovely little neighborhood. We reserved through Jetsetter so we got a great deal.

Beautiful, modern, sleek, boutique hotel in Nolita. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. The hotel location is so convenient to Soho, Little Italy, the Bowery, and Noho. And subway access is also very convenient.
user_name:
Kristyn O
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: Great hotel. Has everything plus an amazing staff. My colleague called me after we both got settled in our rooms just to remark how much he loved it. We'll stay again for sure.

What I loved about the hotel is it's location (near the subway and loved the neighborhood). Also, the staff are very helpful and accommodating. The hotel itself is quite modern and new so I have no major complaints. The room is somewhat on the small side but it was fine with me. =)

I enjoyed the first stay so I thought I'd check-in again. Swayed by the staff, the accommodation and the neighbourhood I thought I'd give it another go.Three days before the trip I receive an email confirmation extending me offers that would personalise my stay and make it a memorable trip - nice! Then I miss a call but get a voicemail asking if I need airport collection or anything else to ease my journey - again a nice touch.Declining all the kind offers I arrive under my own steam and am given a different room - slightly smaller than the previous top floor corner room that I'd stayed in before (which I'd recommend especially of on vacation) but equally well appointed. The balcony is a nice touch and good for snapping a few photo's on a clear day.The staff live up to the standards they set on my first stay: friendly, attentive and happy to help me navigate my way around the neighbourhood. This time round I noticed some more of the street noise - but to be fair I'm not sure it's any more than I've experienced staying around Time Square or up by Columbus Circle and it's possibly just my jet lag causing me to be a light sleeperI ate in the restaurant for the first time - great food and reasonable prices. The bar tenders were great and I didn't feel uneasy being on my own in the restaurant.There's no gym but the complimentary pass to a great gym on the edge of Soho, 5 minutes run from the hotel, is excellent. It's much better equipped than the normal hotel gym and you get to do some window shopping on the way. (May not be so attractive doing the run in the rain - but on a clear winters day it's not a hardship to get to) I remain a buyer of this hotel - the more I stay the more I like the neighbourhood and find a few great bars, restaurants and shops that as a visitor to the city you'd normally not get the chance to frequent. For a boutique hotel it's not overly cool or pretentious - but warm, welcoming and neighbourly!Will definitely give it another go!

The rooms were on the small side, but oh so comfortable and quiet. The restaurant next door, is connected and quite good. The front desk very helpful and the neighborhood, one of the best finds in NYC.

For us it was important to have some type of out-door space which the Nolitian offered.. Very hard to find in NYC... Felix, Roney, and Aliya were AMAZING and extremely accommodating.. With this hotel being fairly new I wanted to check out a room before I booked. & when I asked them (Felix) was great about it and took me upstairs.. Can’t wait for the roof-top in the summer!! I really hope this place stays around they deserve it!! For us we wanted smaller and romantic and that’s exactly what we got.. Rooms are great and everything 1st class.. Thanks ~ Definitely be back…

The Nolitian was absolutely amazing! Everyone you come in contact with is beyond helpful, especially Cassandra their concierge she will help you with anything from dining to directions. The selection for the mini bar inside the room was great, and the option to purchase anything in the room was a surprise and different from any hotel I've stayed in before. The architecture in the lobby is very modern and the room was adorable. We also had a room with a balcony which is great because my boyfriend smokes so he didn't have to go all the way downstairs and outside. All around we had a great time!

The Nolitan occupies the grittier end of NoLiTa (North of Little Italy), close to Chinatown, SoHo, and the Lower East Side. This location is perfect if you know your way around lower Manhattan or want to stay away from the hubbub of Midtown. It exudes cool without pretension. The bellman, Felix, made us feel as if he was welcoming us into his home. The small 235-square-foot rooms have enough light and character that you quickly forget about the cramped size. But you should avoid the "accessible" rooms, which are uncomfortably small with zero room for luggage. We got upgraded to a Cityscape Balcony Room, which gave us some extra breathing room along with a breathtaking view of the Empire State Building and the midtown skyline.Side note: While the hotel staff is warm and welcoming, the restaurant staff next door at Ellabess acted like it was a chore to serve us breakfast. Despite the fact that staff members outnumbered guests 2-to-1, I had to get up to refill my coffee at the server station because no one bothered to come by for ten minutes. My server was folding napkins, zen-like, two steps away from the coffee, and he didn't even look up at me when I went over to refill my cup. Of course, no one ever stopped by to ask how the food was (delicious) or whether we wanted anything else (we did). Ellabess was a shocking contrast to the friendly Nolitan. Do yourself a favor and walk 10 minutes to Russ & Daughters for the best smoked salmon on a bagel of your life.
user_name:
livetwice
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was an unexpected weekend retreat. Stepping into the lobby and my room, I was refreshed with the variety amenities and feeling of openess combined with the modern architecture & fixtures, all located in a great neighborhood. This place is a hidden jewel! The view from our room was incredible - Williamsburgh bridge on one side, Empire State building on the other. I thought being so close to So-ho parking would be impossible, but I found a spot on Kenmare in two minutes. Try their chicken sliders at the restaurant below!

The hotel is well located off Little Italy, close to Bowery and Lafayette Street. Tiny rooms with good design, well equipped with slippers and bathrobe. But if you look for great substance look somewhere else. Rooms are too small to accomodate 2 people, heating system is very noisy and keeps going on/off al night. Cold air comes into the room from the window and noisy deliveries start on Kenmare St at 5am. Breakfast very expensive and not well assorted. Service is average :could get a good cab to the airport, did not accept credit cards even if i asked twice to do so, was waken up at night by front man coming along with pizza delivery even if "don't disturb sign was on my door". If you want a good sleep go somewhere else.

I stayed here for a film screening that I had at the Anthology Film Archives and the hotel was one of the highlights of my stay. The lobby is cosy and cool with an amazing selection of art books to peruse and each room has original affordable art for purchase. My room was small, but adequate for me and had a clean, minimalist feel that made me feel ultrahip. The amenities were all I needed and the staff was friendly, professional, personable and helpful without ever feeling like they were waiting for a tip. One staff member even helped me zip my dress! I would absolutely stay here again.

Needing a place in the city for the weekend, the Nolitan was a perfect fit. Though set in a trendy neighborhood, I found parking within two minutes just a block from the hotel. From the moment I stepped into the lobby, the staff were friendly and attentive. My corner room on the ninth floor had striking views of the Empire State Building to the left and the Williamsburg Bridge to the right. Though not spacious, the room was quite comfortable and immaculately clean. Initially needing a quiet place to get some documents read, the simple desk with late afternoon sun and stunning views of the city was ideal. In the evening, I met up with friends in the hotel's restaurant, called Ellabess. Dinner was delicious. As a group, we ordered several appetizers. Each was fixed perfectly. For my main dish, I chose the potato gnocchi with duck sausage. It was a perfect dish for a cold winter day. Getting back to my room after midnight, I slept great. The sun woke me up a little earlier than I would have liked. But that was my fault for not closing the curtains the night before. And actually it served me well. I caught breakfast at Ellabess just before their 10 am cutoff. Once again, delicious. I would regret to have missed it. Lingering unrushed with friends, it was a great start to a Sunday. I would not hesitate returning to the Nolitan the next time I am in the city.

We stayed for a long weekend and were greeted with warmth on a very cold NYC holiday weekend. Contemporary and stylish rooms with thoughtful touches everywhere. Including chocolates that were to die for. Robes and slippers that were ultra comfortable. Just north of Little Italy, the Nolitan is walking distance to just about anywhere in the east or west village and if you want to venture uptown you have your choice of three different subway lines.
Room service was super tasty, down duvet and pillows, nicely designed. Would stay here again in a second.

Spent one night in Jan 2012 on business. Staff was flexible to accomodate early check-in after long flight (shower and off to client). Upon return in the evening, bathroom had been cleaned and towels replaced. Not something you see everyday. Nice. The location and makes for a change from the midtown hotels.Do not let the naysayers put you off citing street noise: it is New York AND you have a views. Slept without a problem.I would, however, suggest to go for a corner room as they are as far away from the elevator as possible: while there is some carpet in hallway, noise carries greatly in the hotel.

My husband and I spent 2 nights at The Nolitan. The hotel is modern and well designed. Hipster, but not too Hipster. The front desk staff is extremely friendly and helpful as were both doormen. Our room wasn't ready when we got there, but we were quickly found a room that was ready and on a high floor (with a balcony!). The beds are so luxurious that next time, we're booking an extra night so we can stay in bed all day. They have turn down service with slippers and chocolates on your pillow. And the mini bar prices are actually reasonable, and they've got a good selection (Vosges chocolates, Pop Chips, et al). There are a selection of magazines for you to peruse (Vogue, GQ, Time Out) and, free Wi Fi, and bath products by Red Flower.The hotel is minutes away from Soho shopping (Tory Burch, Uniqlo, J.Crew, Madwell, Top Shop) and the New Museum, as well as great restaurants (La Esquina, Torrisi, Parm, Lombardi's, Pulino's, Balthazar, etc.). The bar at Ellabess downstairs was great. We hung out for 1/2 priced drinks and apps at happy hour. The roof is also accessible - I can imagine that it would be amazing in the summertime.We will definitely be back. So certainly, I almost want to book now before people find out how great this hotel is! Stay sweet Nolitan!P.S. Just want to give everyone a warning that the shower is clear glass, so if you forget to pull on the curtain, you can see your partner / brother / sister / child sitting on the bed. ;)

What a gem! Staff are cool, friendly and helpful. Decor&rooms are cutting edge. Had an amazing night out thanks to tips from concierge. Location is central and so much to do near by. I run my own business and expect a lot from my holiday and this is the first time I've had no complaints! We used the bikes and the skateboards. Great addition. We are a mid 30's couple who like to find the 'find' and the nolitan is defo it! Even the yoga Matt was great... Stay there!

I spent 6 nights at the Nolitan at the beginning of December for a work trip. The staff could not have more lovely, especially the doorman (didn't get his name). The room was fantastic, perfect size, comfortable bed and amazing shower with the most gorgeous products (which I subsequently bought). Having previously only stayed uptown I thought this was a great location, just a short walk to the nearest subway station and all the shops of Soho only 5 minutes away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going over to NY for work or pleasure, and I will certainly be returning!

I booked this hotel because I needed three rooms for three days near Soho and I didn't want to kill my budget. It was a very nice surprise as the hotel is very close to everything, it is quite beautiful with raw concrete, white walls and overall nice decor. The staff is warm and friendly and the price is incredible for the value.

We loved our stay at The Nolitan. We brought our puppy for the weekend. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful. The room was great - balcony, modern bathroom, even a bowl, treats and a toy for our dog. The view from the roof deck is great.

We spent 4 nights over the new year at the nolitan and we were very impressed with the hotel , location and the quality of the staff The rooms have some really nice touches the bathrooms are moderns and the exposed concrete ceilings are very different but add something to the room The staff in particular ben Cassandra and ronni were outstanding and really helpful for booking restaurants and I would recommend the hotel . We will definately be back there areaome great restaurants close by and you have easy walking access to the lower east side , bowery area and 5 mins walk from soho for shopping !!

We stayed at the Nolitan for just one night last week. Although the room was relatively small the view was superb and the furnishings just as expected - very modern with everything you needed for a comfortable stay. Great place to stay in 'Little Italy' with very friendly staff :) From the rooftop the view is magnificent - great photos!

I sayed for 5 days over Christmas. Traveling by myself, I found the hotel a delight. Minor little critisms, such as too little light to work in the room, but more than made up for , by a delightful helpful staff and comfortable set up. I can't say enough of the location; a true neighborhood amidst many; walkable to lower east side, soho, little Italy, etc. Only regret is that, if I were traveling with my husband, room size would be an issue.

We spent the Christmas holidays at the Nolitan. Our room was on the smaller side, but so nice and clean and cleverly designed that we really did not feel that cramped at all. Somehow the room design just works. The housekeeping is great too. Our room was perfect every single night when we returned and that fact was much appreciated. The front desk and restaurant staff were also gracious and helpful. The location is really great too. Close to the subway, right by Little Italy and Chinatown and generally in a nice neighborhood. We spent a day in Brooklyn and it was super easy to get there on the subway too. Reasonable rates too. We did an internet deal where we prepaid and thought that we got a great value for NYC.

My husband and I loved our stay. The Nolitan has the absolute best location. Every single staff member were wonderful to us, even the room service cleaning staff. The rooms are small, which we knew when we booked, and the style of the rooms make up for the small space. Ellabess, the restaurant is gorgeous too. The Nolitan has a really nice feel about it that I don't remember experiencing elsewhere. We will stay again for sure.

Few hotel staff remember your first name. Let alone where you went dancing, what you went shopping for the day before or the fact you went to a big fat Greek wedding two days earlier.My boyfriend and I stayed at The Nolitan for our second trip to NYC, and couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. People aside, the rooms are fabulous. Unlike some boutique hotels, it feels warm. Modern enough to make you go wow, but cosy enough to make you feel like you're in a home away from home ( the title of this thread is no joke :)On top of all that, the staff are incredible. They put out slippers for us every night, along with a selection of chocolates and even gave us a bottle of Champagne for my boyfriend's birthday. The Concierge – Felix – was incredible. By the end of the trip we saw him as more of a friend than a Nolitan staff member. He helped us with everything including opening doors, Broadway show reviews and even gave us some wisdom about his definition of luck (still thinking about that one Felix :).... His years of experience and charming personality makes him a priceless asset to The Nolitan, so make sure you say hi from us. My boyfriend and I have traveled a lot and stayed at many hotels. We can honestly say, this is our favourite place to stay on the entire planet.

The Nolitan Hotel was fantastic. It was super new and clean (opened in 2011). The staff at the front desk and the bell man were very friendly, relaxed and cool.It is in a great spot on the fringe of SoHo with close access to top restaurants and bars in Mulberry, Mott and Elizabeth Streets. Plus, if you turn the other direction you are in the heart of China Town. Nearest Subway stations are under a five minute walk.Rooms are small, but designed well with an industrial feel and a splash of colour and softness in parts.Little perks include a free paper in the morning, free wifi and free loan of ipads or a lap top.Downsides? Barely any. While I rarely experienced it, the noise in the hall way from other guests can be quite loud. I think the hard surfaces exacerbate it.I would definitely stay there again.

New Year weekend was wonderful at this property. Room layout is so well designed that you forget the size. Views from roof are stunning. Staff was friendly and efficient. They actually seem to enjoy working there. What a refreshing change in the service industry! Room service breakfast was very well prepared and delivered by friendly staff. We felt welcome from the time we walked in the front door. Love their mini bar policy of fair prices. We also loved the bar at the restaurant.

Really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is relatively small at 30 ish rooms but that suited us. I think the reason this hotel does so well is the staff, relaxed in dress code and attitude, nothing was too much trouble and they were normally a step ahead of you.We had a room on the 9th floor which gave great views over NY but you can still hear the background noise of the traffic but where can't you hear that in the centre of a large city ?The room is very well designed with everything you need.The location is great, we really enjoyed being in Soho and we walked most places.Cassandra the concierge was incredibly helpful and useful both over email before the trip and in person.We don't normally stay in the same places twice as there is too many things to see in the world but if ("when" according to my wife) we go back to NY, we will stay here again.

Excellent hotel. The staff is very efficient and extremely friendly. Get a balcony room on floors 7-9 for the views. Rooms are a little small, but well laid out. We had no problems during our four night stay. Convenient to all forms of transportation and easy walking to many neighborhoods.

What a great experience. The rooms are small, but nice with very smart use of space. The service is genuine and great. They are simply nice people who make an effort. The lounge has great hot chocolate and coffee and the restaurant looks really nice. Overall, super clean and organized and a great value. Steps away from soho, little italy and the best shopping and eating this city can offer.

There seems to be a general perception that all rooms in NYC are small, and thus travelers seem to accept that small, and "boutique" go together. It is not my experience that all NYC rooms are small, and so I don't think it is an acceptable condition. The Nolitan rooms are much too small for comfort. We were in 807 - a city view balcony. This is one of the largest rooms they have, and even at that is unacceptably small and cramped. Consider this list of things the room does not include:A sofa or other comfortable area to sit where you have a place to relax. The only option for that is the bed.A dresser to store your clothes - 2 very small drawers are under the bed, but are not nearly sufficient to store your thingsA refrigerator - to get this you must empty out the minibarA place to sit on the "balcony"A place to store your luggage - the closet does not offer sufficient space to store your luggage, so they just become one more obstacle you will need to manuever around to move about the roomRoom to move - almost anywhere you need to move, you will be squeezing past your roommate Privacy while showering, using the sink area. There is no door to these areas, so if your roommate is someone you may not feel comfortable being naked around, it would be difficultA water closet door that latches, and thus was never fully closedA closet light that stays on, instead of blinking on and offThe "inexpensive" movies they advertise. $40 for 2 movies is not inexpensiveIron and ironing boardCoffee maker (a 3-cup pot of coffee from room service cost approximately $22)I am sure that there are other items I have left off the list. We were told that the room is 250 square feet. That must include the entire room footprint, including closet, shower, etc. Simply put, the space is much too small for more than a single person, causing annoying hassles and compromises that I'd rather not make and do not expect for a room rate of $660 USD/night. There are positives:Great neighborhood just south of Soho and right around the corner from both Little Italy and ChinatownThe staff (particularly Ron) was helpful in attempts to make up for our dissatisfaction with the room size/value, and with suggestions / tips on the things we wanted to do in NYCThe city view is very nice, no doubtThe bed is comfortableWe've traveled many places and are willing to spend extra for a comfortable place to stay. This is likely the least value-oriented place I/we have ever stayed. It is simply not worth the money. There are many options in NYC. If comfort, room size, and value are important to you, I recommend looking at options other than the Nolitan.

I travelled here for three nights in early December. A lot of the details on the hotel, (modern and artsy feel, yoga mats in rooms, classy showers, try and get a balcony room) are all largely covered in other reviews. My stay was fantastic and it was great to see a new hotel doing so well. I wanted to take a moment to talk about some of the people at this hotel, who in my opinion, are what made the place for me. You can find other similar hotel rooms, you can't find another Ricky. Ricky: Ricky is the bartender. I spent two full evenings at the bar, just talking to Ricky, watching the hustle and bustle of the restaurant. Really fun guy, great to talk to, makes you feel very welcomed to the hotel in a city not known for its open arms. Pay him a visit, ask for an old fashioned. Tiffany: She was my waitress for one dinner. Again, helpful, and can be very funny if you let her. Tyler: Bar wizard. Have this man make you whatever drink he is experimenting with. It will be delicious. I had pecan infused rum. Restaurant Manger: Always paid me a visit to say hi when he saw me and made a genuine effort to be personable and welcoming. Front Desk Staff: Too many to name. I loved their casual regular attire, non stuffy feel, knowledge of the city and friendliness. Cons: The only issue with the hotel that I had was the street it is on, Kenmare, is the only street in NY where it is hard to get a Taxi. Genuinely hard. Taxis coming in off the bridge had fares, non that didn't would bother going down it unless they were leaving after their shift. I just had to walk a few blocks whenever I needed one and not a big deal. Had a great time. I will return. I hope to still see some familiar faces.

Brand new, a bit off the beaten path,The Nolitan offers a contemporary and friendly home for those looking for a new experience. Loved the rooms (small but light and airy), wonderful amenities, great service and the anchor restaurant, Ellabess, served up a delicious late night meal. Wished there were more plugs in the room for charging stuff but the very cool shower more than made up for that! I already made my rez for next month! Adjacent to some of the best shopping in the Village, I can't wait to return.

Room 601 is a standard neighborhood room of 250 square feet. The aesthetics of the room are minimalist and attractive and somewhat high end, but the closet is very small and significantly compromised with the presence of the fridge, and the drawers for storage are nearly non-existent. This makes unpacking unnecessarily challenging. We stayed for 4 nights, which is too long for such a small room, but if you are alone and only staying for one night, it's fine. I would have a problem with paying more than 275 per night for this room.The location near Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown is a great alternative to the Midtown experience. Unfortunately Kenmare Street is a feeder to the Williamsburg Bridge, and on the Friday night when we arrived, the honking horns did not stop until 3 am. We also had the ability to hear the neighbors having wild sex in the middle of the night; the room seemed to be acoustically designed such that we could hear everything next door just like it was occurring in our own tiny room. This greatly affected our quality of sleep and only in retrospect is mildly amusing. Let's just say that during our stay the girls are noisier than the guys.The king bed was very comfortable with good linen. The pillows were particularly excellent. The towels were standard. Bath products smelled of roses, which is not a very manly odor, but was of high quality and pleasant. Water pressure was mediocre, and setting the water temperature for the sink was very tricky. With ordering room service, the person taking the order could not have been more gruff, but the food was better than good. The 6 items we took from the honor bar over our 4 day stay were never replaced, and upon check out we needed to recall what we took. Still got additional charges on the credit card after our return.This place seems to be going for the hipster crowd; if you are over 35, this might not be the place for you. Front desk was friendly enough, but ultimately pseudo-engaged. They did make a great dinner recommendation.The view from the roof is worth checking out.Ultimately, would not recommend.

Great little boutique hotel on Kenmare Street in NYC. Very close to all the key areas of lower Manhattan. The rooms are small, as many are in NYC, but very clean, modern, and well appointed. I had a balcony room on the 9th floor with a great view of the city. I would definitely stay here again.

We have just returned after spending a week at The Nolitan.Enjoyed the location.Staff were friendly and helpful.Rooms were clean and comfortable.Only downside was the noisy air conditioning in the room turning on and of all night.Found the solution, turn it off and leave the fan on. Thank goodness the weather was mild.How can this happen in a brand new hotel?Street noise was not an issue for us (our room fronted Kenmare St) its part of being in NY.The view from the rooftop is fun for a late night cocktail.

We found this place almost by accident as it has only been open since August, 2011. It reminded us a bit of the Thompson LES, but this neighborhood is quieter and more accessible to restaurants and shops. The king room was small but comfy. The staff was fantastic. The lobby bar was a great place for a nightcap. We really liked the fact that we were so close to Little Italy and Soho. Our only complaint was with the HVAC system which sounded like a jet engine every time the heat came on. Other than that the room was quiet as we experienced no street noise. Assuming the Nolitan does not respond to its success by jacking up its prices, we will be back.

i stayed at the nolitan for four nights, it was perfect.....great new boutique hotel. i can not wait for the summer in order to use their roof terrace. It s also walking distance to all the best areas in Soho and Nolita and very close to the subway.I will stay there again and certainly recommend it to everyone.
What else can I say?......I'm in NYC for work often and dont want to stay anywhere else and the neighborhood is the best....feels like "Old New York"

We just returned from a long weekend in NYC. I'm an avid fan of unique, boutiqe properties and The Nolitan fit the bill. Great location for exploring lower Manahattan, easy subway access to Uptown, friendly/knowledgeable staff, fantastic rooms (ours had a great view extending Uptown including the Empire State and Chrysler buidlings), nice bar, and under utlized roof top terrace. Only minor complaint were the loud, chain smoking Europeans next door which was out of the hotel's control as we didn't make a deal out of it. Great job Nolitan, we'll be back!

We stayed at the Nolitan for a long weekend. The standout is the wonderful, accommodating staff. They are very pleasant and responsive. The site is modern and has an interesting interior. Altho the rooms are average to small, they are well arranged. My only comment would be that there is not enough room to put non-hanging clothing. I really could not unpack the suitcase. The location is great because if you are exploring the southern part of Manhattan.

The Nolitan is a small Boutique hotel that gets the basics right but is let down by one fundamental error. The rooms are a reasonable size, the room fittings are modern in design and of good quality, the bathroom area in particular is very good. The bed was comfortable with a great mattress and good quality linens. Views on the room decor will vary depending on taste, the exposed concrete ceilings for instance are supposed to be trendy however in my opinion it gives the place an unfinished, slightly cheap feel. Other positives include the free wifi, the exceptionally well stocked minibar, excellent quality robes and towels. The hotel reception area, restaurant and bar are all very nicely fitted out and the service from the staff in all areas was superb.A very slight bugbear was the lack of conveniently placed power sockets, particularly by the bed/bedside cabinets.The BIG downside is the noise - it's been mentioned in other reviews and I expect shall continue to be mentioned over and over again. I stayed on one of the higher (7th) floors facing Kenmare street. I could hear people's conversations at street level, there are non stop rumblings from the passing of trucks heading to and from the Wiliamsburg Bridge and even general traffic is loud enough to interrupt peace in the room. It would be just about tolerable if New York drivers didn't have such a love of using their horns - as an example it's 11pm whilst I'm writing this and within the past five minutes I've counted 14 horns, sometimes a quick beep but more often drivers holding down their horn for several seconds. I've also been able to dance along to the sound systems in drivers cars.Why they have not made more effort to soundproof the outer part of the building I cannot fathom - I suspect either the projects architect was cheap of the hotels developers were being cheap. If they put this right (unlikely) this would be a great place to stay. As it is I'd struggle to choose the Nolitan again over other nearby options when wanting to stay close to Soho / East Village.

The Nolitan is no doubt very cool. It's stylish decor and location in one of NYC's hottest neighborhoods guarantees that. However, Kenmare is so noisy that I would never stay there again. Starting at 5 am trucks begin deliveries on Kenmare, and all I could hear was the beep beep beep of trucks backing up all morning. Other than the fact that it couldn't actually be used for sleeping, I thought the room was a typical boutique hotel stylish room. I wasn't a huge fan of the shower that has a clear view into the room and out the window since I have no particular desire to be an exhibitionist, but it was easy enough to cover up with the drapes.One nice touch was a little packet of discounts to local upscale boutiques. One less fortunate aspect was that it's not easy to come by a taxi out front and the staff just watched me walking aimlessly around with my luggage rather than offering to hail one for me. Otherwise everyone I encountered there was friendly.Alas, the noise was a deal breaker. Although I love the neighborhood, I won't be back to the Nolitan!

My wife and I stayed at the hotel on Saturday and Sunday because we wanted to explore the Nolita/Soho area. The hotel is near Chinatown and Little Italy so there was plenty of restaurants and shops to visit. Each of the areas has a different feel but we really enjoyed the "hipster" atmosphere of the hotel and the Nolita area. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel provides bikes and skateboard for the guests to travel through the area and over the bridge path on Williamsburg Bridge. The rooms are European style but with plenty of amenities and the view of the Empire State Building is beautiful at night. We tried the hotel restaurant and can't say enough about the Venison and the Porkchops entrees. Both meats were tender and juicy which is difficult to get in porkchops. We would highly recommend a stay as a great base to explore the area shops and restaurants.

the nolitan has been recommended to us by a friend livinig in NEW YORK.We were actually searching for a cool and trendy place in a nice area of new york.The Nolitan is the best address!! right in the center of the best shopping area, great shopping at Elisabeth street, round the corner from the restaurant Gitane or some other great spots! Very friendly staff, extremply helpfull. We were very happy to meet Felix, great man!!!Thanks for all your help during our stay!Casandra the concierge at the front desk was as well very helpfull, she organised our party nights, restaurants and gave us great recommodations! Thanks !!!Our room was just a little bit small, next time we will go for a corner room! Definitely take a room on a high floor, you get great views to the city...the Empire state building, The Chrysler building - incredible! We loved it!!!

Pros1. Great location - very near Soho shops and Broadway chain shops, 5 mins from Spring St subway. Handy if you're looking to explore FiDi and Soho and Greenwich Village (20-30 mins walk). If you're looking at spending more time in midtown, I would suggest a hotel in that area. This hotel is approx 20 min subway from 59th/5th say.2. Lovely staff - very helpful3. Great turndown service - including a yummie choc!4. Room has everything - yoga mat and umbrella included. Only thing missing is iron but you can ask reception for one. 5. Great room service - delicious eggwhite omeletteCons - don't really have any except that the shower in my room was see through into the bedroom. There is a curtain but if you're not that close to your room mate, you may not be comfortable. Not sure if it was just my room or all rooms. Would definitely stay there again.

This hotel provides a warm friendly atmosphere from the moment I enter till the moment I left. The service was great. The hotel maximizes the limited amont of square feet provided in the rooms and regarding the room size, that's to be expected living in New York; but I didn't feel cluttered or cramped, it was a great room design. The beds are extremely comfortable. The thermostat was a bit noisy and kept reseting to a pre-fixed temperature but it didn't bother me although it could for some. Besides, the ceiling fan worked so well, I didn't really need to use it to regulate the room temperature. Lastly, the provided slippers were a nice addition.The location is easily one of my top reasons why I liked this place. Very close to little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, and to a subway station for further locations.Overall great stay.

I love Nolita. We've spent a lot of time in midtown and it's really nice to move south, away from the Fifth Avenue and Broadway areas. There are small shops and parks and neighborhood restaurants - it's like a refreshing world apart. When I read that a new hotel had opened in Nolita I made a mental note to look it up the next time we visited NY. And so we did mid-November and had a wonderful stay.The staff is friendly and accommodating - not a hint of attitude. Although we had booked two nights non-refundable, they graciously allowed us to stay just one night when something came up and we had to leave early. The coffee I ordered for the room came right on time.The hotel is stylish, the rooms almost minimalist (with the exception of the views, which are breathtaking). The rooms, granted, are small, but so are most hotel rooms in NY. I loved the way you could look right through the shower into the bathroom. And I loved the high-floor balcony room with views straight up to the Empire State building and over to the Williamsburg Bridge.I suppose you could complain about the price, but why bother? Every now and again it's worth a little extra to try something different. And besides, it's NY!

We spent three days over the holiday weekend and had an amazing time. The hotel is very clean and modern, uniquely situated on the border of little Italy and Chinatown. The accommodations are a real value when you consider the cost of other places and all that you can see from this location. We used the complimentary iPad to look for places to go and shop tickets. The bed was comfy and the restaurant has fantastic french toast and turkey sausage, Happy hour was great From 5 to 8pm, plenty of time to have my Brooklyn IPA and steak skewers. Next time we will definitely use the complimentary bikes to zip around and go over the Williamsburg bridge.

After transferring from a chain in the area, we walked in and we were immediately thrilled. The attention to detail in the hotel is outstanding, the customer service in unmatched, the amenities are fantastic. We booked our room through Jetsetter.com, and when we arrived early with a LOT of luggage, the staff was more than accommodating and checked them while we roamed the city. Our room was ready before the 3pm checkin, and we received a phone call from the adorable british man that works at the front desk. When we got into our room we were floored by the modern design, lovely branding touches, amenities (including robes, slippers, and a fully stocked minibar/snacks...which are not overpriced like so many hotels), and comfy bed. They even leave a card with tomorrows weather forecast, a chocolate and in our case, a thank you for the note we left them. I wish we would have stayed here all weekend instead of just one night. What a fantastic stay. We will be back!

We stayed at the Nolitan for one night. It was the worst night we have ever spent in New York. The air conditioner was so loud we couldn't sleep. The room was small and cramped. We checked out a day early and moved to another hotel. When we were leaving, we both got covered with blue paint from the front door. There were no signs or warnings to say the paint was wet. To add insult to injury, they charged us $150 for not staying the second night. When questioned they said they would give us a complimentary night stay. The last thing we want to do is stay there again.

I´ve stayed in a lot o great and bad hotels in New York, so I was really happy when I by chance found this place in Nolita. I had an amazing week here and I except great rooms I think the hotel staff was incredible helpful and very friendly.
user_name:
Daniel E
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: The service at the Nolitan was excellent, both in advance of the trip and during. The requests for items to be left in the room were all completed as requested. The hotel in Nolita is in an excellent neighborhood for exploring and the roof provides a great view of the city. The concierge Casandra was excellent including shipping a box of goodies back to Seattle for us. Worth a repeat.

This is a terrific addition to downtown NYC hotel scene. If you're planning on spending time in the Nolita, Lower East Side, Bowery, SOHO areas, this is someplace to definitely consider. The hotel is very modern so if lots of exposed concrete isn't your thing, then look elsewhere.
