However, if your tastes run in that direction and you want to be pretty much in the center of everything those neighborhoods have to offer, then this is the place.The staff is awesome from the minute you arrive; as a matter of fact it starts before you arrive. I actually got a call from the concierge a few days before my stay asking if there was anything she could do for me. I asked her if she could get me tickets to a show I really wanted to see but which appeared sold out. She said she'd give it a shot and a couple of hours later called back and I had my seat! On arrival everyone was very nice and helpful and remained so at every interaction I had.The downstairs/lounge area is really stylish and nice and the restaurant serves excellent food. It is a little quiet in the evening so if you want your hotel to have a happening scene in its bar then maybe give it a few months for things to heat up and stay at the Bowery Hotel or the Crosby Street Hotel or the Hotel on Rivington. But, I am sure it will heat up because it's a cool place in a cool hood and probably just needs a little time. Two things about the restaurant/lounge that did bug me a bit: First, the bar closed at midnight on Friday which seemed a little early for this part of the world. Second, the restaurant stopped serving breakfast at 10:30 on Saturday, which also seemed a little early, especially for a town that seems to run on brunch. They really need to keep it going until noon.The rooms are small so be prepared. However, they are very well designed and everything seems to fit just fine. As to the noise issue that many people seem to complain about let me say the following: Street noise was not an issue at all, there just wasn't any. The windows seem to block it all, save for the occasional fire truck which, come on, is to be expected in NYC. The HVAC system is a little loud but not intrusively so; it never bothered me. The one noise issue that was a little surprising was the hallway noise. They evidently didn't use noise proofing doors on the rooms and with all that exposed concrete, you do pretty much hear everything that's happening in the hallway as if it were happening in your room. Of course, the converse is also true so expect whatever you do in your room to be played loud and clear in the hallway. However, that said it really wasn't an issue as it's a small hotel and there's thus not a lot of coming and going. And, I never heard anything from anyone else's room.The minibar is jam packed with good stuff, they have nice robes, T-shirts and even a yoga mat for you. The bathroom is nice too and packed with high quality amenities. They have free wifi throughout and a nice desk which is very spacious for work. The closet is adequate but it is a bit tight so if you're a heavy packer beware. Lastly, there is a killer view uptown (at least from the higher floors); you basically look out toward all of midtown.In summary I really liked this place and would definitely stay here again.

I am a professional travel agent. My husband and I spent 4 nts here for my birthday, recently. Ultra modern hotel with chic bathrooms. Everything was very clean and new. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony on the 8th floor so we had a great view. Street noise level was acceptable. The bathroom amenities were first class, nice comfortable bed with very unusual romantic items in the nightstands! Chocolates on the pillows were a nice touch, so was the daily newspaper. Great location, within walking distance to main shopping areas, restaurants and the subway. The concierge Cassandra was particularly helpful in trying to get us dining reservations etc. There was plenty of security guys around all the time so you felt pretty safe.Cons: you had to get used to the loud noise of the a/c, luckily it was cool enough so we never used it at night. The hot water stopped one day and it took a while to get it back so we could shower. Obviously some kinks need to be worked out. Did sign up for the packing/unpacking service but we never received it. Assumed it could be due to our in/out timing but no one at the front desk brought it up. Even though there was space in the room, there was no luggage stand. The restaurant attached to the hotel was nothing to write home about. The reception messed up our car service a few times, it seemed a lot of staff did not make an effort to co- ordinate their duties.All in all, a good stay with minor hiccups. Will not mind returning again and will certainly recommend to my clients.

I cannot say enough about the location, close to subway, SOHO, Little Italy, China Town. At this price range + quality the rooms will be small, and they were, but the layout worked and did not feel as cramped as other Hotels. The front desk service was fantastic, very friendly and helpful, I received an email with info. immediately after booking. The restaurant located downstairs was okay, the service was not attentive and the food was average. Kenmare is a busy street, even on high floors if you're a light sleeper bring earplugs, the horns did not bother me, getting a taxi can be difficult as most are already taken on the way to the Wllmbrg Bridge, would have liked the doorman to be more helpful flagging down a cab (very helpful with luggage). Rooms were new and clean (hope they stay that way) - shower door needs to be properly closed to avoid water flow onto the floor - the beds were my only concern, ours sank in the middle because of a broken pillar underneath - mgmt. needs to reinforce all the beds. Overall a pleasant stay, 4/5 for location, cleanliness and service.

This is a great new addition to the NYC hotel line-up. It's an interesting location on the border of Chinatown and Little Italy - only a stone throw away from SOHO. The area is sufficiently gritty, which I appreciate, but the hotel is extremely chic. Open plan bathroom. See-through to the shower. Private balcony. Bare concrete walls and hardwood floor. Very cool reception area. Extremely good service. Free WIFI. And compared to the SOHO Grand, The W etc. the rates are very competitive! Only gripes are a) the shower would change temperature dramatically with no warning. Did wake me up, though! b) the noise from the street is quite significant - even at night. I didn't mind too much, but some would have a problem with that. Would recommend and come back. If they fix the plumbing and get triple glazing this would be my new favourite NYC hotel!

This small hotel is fabulous. Visually it is appealing it is clean design and this translates into a comfort through and through. The service is practically instant when you need something and the security and friendliness of greeters, bellman, front desk is something you cannot find at most hotels in NYC. The cost is reasonable for NYC rates, but you get so much more than staying at a large hotel. The food is great - I recommend breakfast in your room or in the lovely dining room that if full of light and modern design. If you want to hang out in the lobby, you have comfy recessed seating and wi-fi! Wi-fi for the whole hotel, makes is easy.

I have stayed at the Nolitan on two occasions. On the second stay I ended up in a top floor corner room with incredible views of downtown and the Brooklyn Bridge. Quite an experience. Furnishings and finishes are top rate and the little restaurant downstairs, while not worth going across town for, offers a tasty selection of culinary delights. Pretty good martinis, too!Overall, I would recommend this hotel. The only caveat is trying to get a cab. For some reason it can be quite a challenge to get a ride...we had to hire a car to get to the airport after the bellman spent 15 fruitless minutes trying to hail a cab.If you are in the design biz, or appreciate good design, I would recommend giving it a try...
user_name:
Mark L
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: Best thing about this place is the friendly and engaging staff. The location is a little off beat, but fun. Good skyline views from the upper floors. Be sure to grab your camera and check out the views from the roof deck.

Attention CoolHunters:This is really a hidden gem, though I doubt it will stay hidden for very long. A fun, beautiful, elegant and low-key boutique hotel. Top quality luxury at a reasonable price. We stayed here with our toddler daughter, and had a wonderful time. As hip and modern as this hotel is, I can tell you it is very kid-friendly! We found a lovely crib waiting for us when we arrived in our room! The rooms are not very big, but the design is such that you feel very comfortable and the incredible views give it a really open feeling! Because of the hotel's location, even on the 5th or 6th floor, you have panoramic views of the city!The neighborhood is amazing; probably the selling point of this hotel because there aren't any other properties of this level in the area. It is located at the south end of Nolita. Therefore you walk a block to the cutting-edge chic of Nolita. Otherwise a few short blocks to Soho. But then head south into the maelstrom of Chinatown! A grungy (though completely safe) incredible neighborhood of sights, sounds, and smells. An unlimited selection of great and cheap Chinese, Malaysian, Vietnamese restaurants and groceries. We found ourselves heading south more frequently than north!The staff at the hotel were amazing, clearly they were still getting organized as it was newly opened, but so friendly and helpful!The hotel provides lovely slippers and robes, and there are even hotel skateboards available to borrow!100% recommended!

The best part of this hotel is that it is brand new! While the wood floors and clean lines of the hotel just accentuate the freshness of this place. I took my boyfriend here for his first trip to NYC and after long flights and lots of walking he thought the place was perfect. The rooms aren't expansive, but in terms of NYC they were perfect. It was bright and cheery in the room, and there was room for us to lazily dump our clothes and packs all over the floor and still maneuver around. Something that isn't always possibly in NYC hotels. Moreover, the front desk was attentive and even let us check in early. Maybe she felt bad for us...we were sweating and carrying around daypacks.The doormen take a bit of time getting used to but they were incredibly friendly. The hotel may look nice but not once did I feel any attitude. Moreover, they let you borrow video game consoles, bicycles, and even an iPad (incredibly useful to look up nearby restaurant reviews, etc). The air conditioning can get noisy. But there is a ceiling fan that cuts the noise and keeps you cool. Trust me, my boyfriend is one of those people that gets hot when it's 50 degrees outside, and he was more than happy (during our August stay). I'm not sure if they still have specials up to entice new customers since it's a new hotel. But it might still be worth a try. Just head to their website and see if they still have some specials up! Without the special rate, the price would have been a bit steep. Since in my opinion, the hotel does lack in terms of view: we had a room with a balcony but it's more like a catwalk and the view was of some auto shop. But it is a great location: lots of fantastic restaurants nearby: Chinese, pizza, Italian, bars, etc. There's tons of markets and shops to explore, and it's in walking distance of practically everything. I notice that some people complained of noise, but not for us. I mean it is NYC there is a certain amount of street noise that is inevitable in my opinion especially when you're staying at a boutique hotel that has less than a dozen floors. The sleep we had was peaceful. The beds and sheets certainly helped. Not only was everything comfortable and fresh smelling, the pillows were fantastic. Usually my boyfriend complains about pillows being too soft and providing zero support, he was a happy camper. While I feel in love with their red cashmere throw. The reception on the TV was great. I was actually surprised at the image quality. Finally, the whole room has an open scheme. If you're taking a shower you can be seen from the bed and vice versa. It really made the room seem bigger and in NYC anything that makes a room bigger is a definite plus.

The view from our 8th floor room was amazing. Having a little outdoor balcony was awesome too. We could see the Empire state and Chrysler buildings. Rarely in NYC do you get a view of anything. The bed was so comfortable and the sheets exceptional. The reception on the BIG lcd tv was perfect. The atmosphere of the lobby restaurant was very cool and they had a nice selection of wines by the glass. Very nice staff as well.

All the right ingredients are there. The hotel has nice staff, is well designed, the rooms were clean with a comfy bed... but let me tell you, i didn't sleep a wink. The street noise was so intense in the room, that it seemed almost amplified. It spoiled my entire experience. I can't imagine I am the only one who has experienced this... i hope they figure out how to sound proof the rooms... the hotel has such potential.

A frequent visitor to NY, it's great to find a new, fresh boutique hotel in Manhattan!! The Nolitan's great place to escape at the end of a busy work day- plenty of local shops, bars and restaurants to explore - if you've got time.The 'raw' architecture (exposed concrete, polished cement) is blended with fresh bright white rooms and airy spaces that's a real change from the dark and gloomy 'boutique' forerunners. The staff are friendly and efficient - an early check-in at the end of a longhaul flight made getting to the office fresh and changed a breeze. I haven't yet had the courage to try the complimentary skateboards as a way to commute!Excellent food in the restaurant and a good choice of wines and beers in the bar. So far, nothing to fault. Keep it up Nolitan - thanks!!
Hi Edmond,My family had a wonderful time in NY and at the Nolitan Hotel. They want you to know that the staff was amazingly pleasant and kind.Luc
user_name:
cafegitane
New York City, New York

review_body: Tablethotels.com was a bit cautious in recommending this newly opened hotel. Perhaps because of its location? In this recent trip to New York, I was feeling a bit more adventurous so I picked a hotel Downtown. The room was decently chic and well styled and utilized the space to a maximum. I purposely did not get a room with a veranda anymore because that would eat up the already limited room space. I wanted a spacier room and I wasn't sleeping on the ledge anyway. So the Cityscape room with a King Size bed looking out into the Manhattan skyline proved to be an excellent choice. The bathrooms were classy in style and function and if you're into viewing the skyline while you shower, you can open the windows and just gawk through the open glass shower and watch the Empire State Building from where you're taking a bath! The room is very well laid out and the bed is super comfortable. The pillows are vast and having 6 large pillows on the king size bed made me not want to get up in the mornings to struggle having to explore NYC.The staff is not only super efficient but very friendly and accommodating as well. When you had a question, they took the tie out to answer your queries. They had a smile, they had a pleasurable decor, the concierge was perfect to a T, and even when they fumbled with my breakfast (and apologized for the delay in the order, which they later made complimentary because of their fault) - they were still profusely nice. And you don't get that kind of service in New York or in most other parts of the USA. They turn down your bed and fix your slippers (which I loved) and the Red Flower toiletries were a delight. They didn't scrimp when it came to toiletries as they provided the works - including 2 bottles of shampoos, conditioners, lotions, body baths; 2 bars of glycerin soaps; facial cottons and Q tips, razor and shaving lotion (on request without charges), shower caps, extra towels. The bars in the room were full service - from snacks to candies to sodas to liquor - and were not highly priced! And there were extra chocolates tucked in your turned down bed each night with a reminder on what the temperature and climate would be like the following day!There's free wireless internet everywhere in the hotel, there's free local calling and they don't add surcharge to long distance calls, there's the New York Times right on the doorstep of my room (even if I don't ask for it), there's free bicycle and gaming systems and even free packing and unpacking services (on request) of your clothes! They arrange for sedan pick up to and from the airport at a very affordable rate (as cheap as getting a cab but arriving in style).For everything that's good, there is a downside as well. The place is remote from many of the upscale stores in the Midtown Manhattan area. You needed to walk about 2 short blocks to get to the subway, which was a couple of stops into the doors of the Midtown madness. Chinatown is a block away and you could actually smell Chinatown after you step out the doors of the hotel. It's a relatively quiet neighborhood until the cargo trucks come blaring out of nowhere. The rooms are small (as expected), so if you're bringing even a medium size luggage, it would be hard to move about in the room. (Which is why you should just get a room without the veranda unless you want to pack and unpack outside.) And someone should go and fix the airconditioning system because it makes a blaring sound in the automatic mode. It awakens you from your comfortable sleep. I was lucky that I was there when the temperature outside was 16C, which meant I could shut the airconditioner and sleep comfortably at the very cozy comforters which allowed one to snuggle in.Breakfast is mediocre as the choices were few, but if you're not staying there for a long time, this should probably do. In short, this is a hotel that attempts to please its customers and makes you feel like you're home. It provides you with the comforts you're paying for and will take the extra mile to make you feel that you're king - even for a day or two. I would recommend this hotel hands down the next time you feel that you want to get out of the touristy areas of Times Square of Midtown Manhattan and just want to feel well rested in the concrete jungle of NYC.It feels good to be making a review for a hotel that doesn't put the brakes on what to offer to make your stay worth the bucks you pay for!

The Nolitan is just two months old and visually appealing, but has a number of issues to iron out. It is a solid place, but not the luxury hotel it claims to be.First off, most staff members (except for one guy at reception who seems pretty self absorbed) are nice and helpful. Welcome and introduction to the room felt genuine.Rooms feature a clean, tasteful minimalist design but are very small, even for New York in this price category. Very generously stocked mini bar at comparatively reasonable prices.However, several technical malfunctions made the stay hard to bear at times: Heater barely heats the room, but has the noise level of an airplane taking off. Main lighting frequently turns itself on in the middle of the night, probably because of a shared remote control frequency. Wireless internet is slow and requires re-entering of password several times a day. Noise level in room is high, not only from heating sytem, but also from street and hallway (no sound proofing whatsoever).Overall, The Nolitan is a nice contemporary place, but there is better value for money in this category in New York.

Spent 4 nights in this new hotel which is located in a great area just walking distance to all the lower east side hotspots. The hotel itself is nice, clean and new, the rooms are bright and modern but a little on the smaller side (as are most hotel rooms in NY!) and the lighting isnt great at night as there is no main light, but the beds are ridiculously comfortable!! There can be a lot of noise from the busy street outside but once the window is closed this is mostly blocked out. If you need to put the A/C on though this can be quite noisy too!! The provision of yoga mats and bikes & skateboards was great, as was the free wifi and use of ipads in the rooms! (on request). The staff were young, friendly & helpful and accommodated to our every need. The rooftop views were great but unfortunately the bar has not been set up yet and will not be until next Spring so it was just an empty space which was a pity. The restaurant seemed to have no life to it (we didnt eat there) but it looked very quiet and uninviting. The turndown service every night was a nice touch as was the NY Times every morning and the bowl of fresh apples at reception!Overall a nice, clean, helpful hotel in a great area but not much life to it if you're looking for a bit of fun!! Maybe this will change when they get the rooftop bar set up next Spring..

Recently spent several nights here in one of the balcony rooms and had great time. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the overall aesthetic of the rooms and common areas were well designed and comfortable.The rooms themselves were a decent size by New York standards. The beds and linens were comfy and the ability to use the small balcony was nice since the weather was great. The shower is glass through to the bedroom so make sure you're comfortable with who you're staying with. The minibar is overpacked with stuff at reasonable prices but it doesn't leave any room to put your own stuff in the fridge. HVAC is relatively quiet. Window and glass block panels don't open but you can get fresh air via the balcony door.The location was great although if you're planning on heading Uptown, you have a farther hike up to Houston St to get a subway station with better connections. If you're looking for a bustling lounge/bar/ restaurant scene downstairs you won't find it but there's lots of options in the area.Two problems though:1. Traffic noise is a problem. Its loud, the street outside feeds the Williamsburg bridge so its busy all hours. All rooms face the street so there's no option to get away from the noise. The front desk gave us earplugs after the first night which solved the problem but it would've been better if they used triple glazed windows and better insulation around the balcony door.2. Their free wi-fi sucks. The slowest connection known to humanity.That said, we really enjoyed our time there and would likely stay there again.

This hotel is a graphic designer's dream come true. Almost everything in this hotel is worthy of being photographed. The room was impeccable, the lobby made me feel like having a scotch, the staff was always willing to help and the mini-bar, or should I say mini-pantry, was stacked with everything from swedish fish to alcohol to intimacy kits and a Yoga mat(!)This hotel is very low priced for the amount of luxury it offers. A gem.

This place is definitely stylish. And location is pretty good; right on edge of trendy Soho scene. Rooms are cute, albeit very compact. I stay in NYC a lot for work and have basically stayed at most downtown hotels. It's also very new, so that's nice. BUT I stayed here on two separate occasions and it is the noisiest place I've ever slept in NY. It's on a relatively busy street and theres a fruit store that apparently starts receiving deliveries at around 4 am -- honking, truck engines, garage door opening ... Too bad, because the place is stylish and feels much cleaner and newer than Soho or TriBeCa Grand. Not nearly as luxe as Trump Soho, though, which is where I would recommend staying if you can afford it and want to be in this area.

Booked our stay at the last minute, after having to change plans due to Hurricane Irene. Our objective was to check our freshman daughter into NYU. Every person we came into contact with was warm and helpful. Car service was booked, boarding passes were printed, doors were opened, seemingly standard services that are not always accomplished with finesse-- were finessed! Our bed was indeed heavenly and unbelievably comfy. Hotel is well situated with Chinatown, Little Italy, NYU all within walking distance. During our busy, short stay we managed to dine at Balthazar, shop at UNIQLO and Fjallraven, discover Cuban breakfast, and indulge in Papabubble's artisanal candy. We appreciate this hotel and the extremely eager and accommodating staff and look forward to our next stay.

My wife and I recently spent 6 days at the Nolitan Hotel on our first trip to New York and we were extremely happy with our choice of hotels for a number of reasons. The Nolitan is conveniently located approximately equidistant between Uptown and Downtown and the subway is about 5 short blocks away on Broadway and Prince. Our room was excellent and extremely clean with a small but nice balcony where you could take in the sounds of New York. Our bed was very comfortable and the pillows were luxurious. The service provided by the staff was courteous and attentive. We also had an excellent view of Uptown and the Empire State building which is lit up in different colours every night. Do not forget to check out the roof top view as you can see both Uptown and Downtown, quite spectacular both day and night. In summary, we would return to this hotel in a New York Minute!

Without a doubt, the best hotel I've stayed in NY. It's a luxury to stay at a brand new hotel in NY and a plus to have such great staff. Great location in Little Italy, very convenient, next to subway stations. Easy walk to Wall Street. Loads of restaurants and cafes in the vicinity. Nice, clean rooms. Free WIFI. Nice and trendy restaurant. I just hope they can keep it going this way. I'll definitely return.

The Nolitan is located on the cusp of Noho, Soho, Chinatown, and Little Italy and accessible to further points south, meaning that it's a bit gritty but safe and rewarding for travelers who like to walk and discover NYC's downtown spirit on their own. The hotel sits at the base of streets ie Mott, Mulberry, Elizabeth with lots of great people-watching and independent shops for womenswear, vintage, shoes, and acccessories. This area is not for those seeking the midtown/skyscrapers/chain restaurants/big department store NYC experience. The Nolitan itself is a chill, friendly hotel with decently sized rooms (for NYC) that are clean and minimally but sufficiently furnished, crisp white linens/comfy bed, and a nice modern bathroom; it is a welcomed and soothing option to downtown. The lobby has a small sunken living room/lounge and restaurant. While they are still building out the food and beverage, the neighborhood is chockful of bars, coffee shops and reasonably priced restaurants, an incentive to explore.
This was one of the best hotels I've stayed at in NYC in a long time. Nice location, clean rooms, lovely amenities, friendly and helpful staff. No negative surprises.

One of the joys of transatlantic travel is waking at three in the morning. The bed in which I awoke was comfortable and the room well appointed. But imagine my reaction when I found no kettle in the room, no room service in the hotel til 7 and no 24 hour coffee shop in the area. Sad barely describes it. But how can a hotel so good in every other respect lack such a basic amenity?

Spent four nights here recently in a sixth floor balcony room. The room: very well designed with super comfortable bed, state of the art washroom and great views of the surrounding area. The location: Nolita is an exciting NYC neighbourhhood with great shops, cafes/restaurants and bars to explore (I particularly enjoyed Cafe Gitane and Public). Walking distance to East Village, Soho and Tribeca. Several subway stations are close by. The staff: amazing and super friendly. Overall it was the best hotel experience I've ever had - I can't wait to go back!

great hotel--unlike other "boutique" hotels with postage-stamp rooms, THIS hotel is beautiful and chic and the architecture makes the room feel BIG with beautifully placed windows and bright decor....absolutely loved it..the lovely young man at the front desk (who's name i can't recall?) and Felix (the doorman who we thought was a hotel manager due to how he behaved--knowledgeable and invested and ENGAGING) were both great and enhanced the experience even more!totally recommned (also LOVED the location--had great dinner at PUBLIC and saw 3 fun bands at the Bowery Ballroom--and YES we were the oldest peeps there)...

My husband and I stayed for 9 days in September 2011, a month or so after the Nolitan opened.We were nervous about stay in a new hotel in case the kinks hadn't worked themselves out yet, but were amazed at the place.Intelligently designed in every respect, it was great - roomy bathroom with plenty of space on the bench and under-bench, a REAL hairdryer, illuminated magnifying mirror, excellent light, plenty of towels every day.The bed is on a pedestal that contains clothes drawers and a safe. There's a separate closet, fridge and separate toilet, fantastic shower looking into the bedroom (curtain for privacy) with a great view from the shower !We had a city view room, had no idea this meant a prime view of the Empire State and Chrysler building, what a sight to wake up to each day, and to look at each night.The room was possibly one of the smaller ones but ample for us, our luggage and our 9 day stay.Every detail was thought through carefully by people who have obviously been irked by poor hotel room set ups in their travels, it was a joy to stay there.Free phone calls within the US, free bike, skate board and laptop hire, amazing mini bar at store prices, lovely slippers and robes, cashmere throw on the bed, and lovely staff who gave us beautiful Nolitan tshirts in fab colours and excellent quality - thanks Soriah !Really well located in groovy downtown, 3 mins from Spring St subway, it was a very interesting and safe area.We stayed on the 9th floor and the soundproofing is excellent, very good double glazing with windows that opened, bliss.The air con was a bit noisy (air sound, not mechanical noise) but the overhead fan took care of our cooling needs instead.Would have loved a kettle for tea in the morning but get the feeling I could have had one if I'd asked, nothing was a problem for the staff. The room had everything we could have wanted, just loved it, look forward to going back.
Great new hotel. Nice restaurants and bars and metro within walkable distance. Great view from the nice and quiet rooftop. Staff manage to let the guests feel welcome and take their time.

I was a little nervous about booking a new hotel for fear all the kinks would not be worked out. However our stay was near perfect. First--the service was excellent. They were all very attentive and helpful. Our room was not ready upon arrival (3pm arrival) so we left our luggage and walked around for a bit. When we returned, the room was still not ready but the gentleman immediately upgraded us to a higher floor since the original room was not available. Doormen were all helpful We did run into one issue with the access to the offsite gym. At the time they seemed to be still in the negotiation stages with Equinox. We were able to use it the first morning but the second morning was at 24hr fitness. Both gyms were fine so it was not a big deal and I was very impressed how the staff did take care of it and came to a solution. Second--the rooms were great but not for everyone. They are small but for NYC standards they are certainly not the smallest. Toilet is separate from the rest of the bathroom which I actually prefer. Shower and sink are open--no door so you need to be pretty comfortable with the person with whom you are sharing the room. The rooms are stark but sharp--bare but chic. Probably falls in the industrial chic category. The balcony was nice as well but would like to see the addition of small chairs. Third--the rooftop was great. No tables and chairs but still a great view and a nice place to enjoy a drink. The extras--we took advantage of the free bikes. We had to wait a few hours since hadn't thought to reserve ahead of time, but it was well worth it and a lot of fun. The mini bar was the best and most reasonable I have encountered. Hendricks gin for $6, Boylan tonic water $2, St Germain (!!) $6, Piper Heidsieck for a fair price. Honestly, to be able to make a good gin and tonic for $8 in NYC is a steal. I would also suggest to read the hotel book in the room because it is actually helpful and gives good information about the area. So overall, great stay. The hotel gives you every opportunity to have a fabulous stay. We got the room at a very good price off a Jetsetter ($207/night) however if they continue to provide this level of service I would pay their current price. I love this area of Manhattan and hope to return soon.

Perfect combination of luxury and modern edgy. Very friendly staff, and all services one might want for. Some street noise, but location, location, location. Not bad price at all for NYC. Would highly Recommend!

Stayed for three nights at The Nolitan and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Here are my favorite things about the hotel: 1. The Staff - the front desk people couldn't be nicer. They gave us umbrellas on the rainy days, helped with directions, had lots of maps and gave great advice on places for dinner. 2. The Location - You are right in the middle of everything! The subway is only a few short blocks away, and the restaurants and shopping in the area is great. 3. The Room - while it was on the small size, it was laid out so well. And, the cashmere blanket was a nice touch. I loved having a balcony, and even though it was a little loud with the traffic, I loved the fresh air. Plus, we turned on the fan every night and it drowned out all of the road noise nicely. We'd go back in a heartbeat (for the chocolates alone). Well done, Nolitan!

Had a great stay at The Nolitan. Their staff was great, very accommodating. Although we weren't traveling with pets, it's nice to know that the hotel is so pet-friendly. The Nolitan's great location and design touches made big impressions. Keep in mind that you're staying a few blocks from the Williamsburg Bridge; things can stay noisy outside late into the night and fire up early in the morning. Bring some earplugs if that's going to be a problem for you. The view and convenience to Nolita shopping and dining more than make up for it. Best stay I've ever had in an NYC hotel. Would stay there again at the drop of a hat!

We had the opportunity to enjoy 3 days in NoLITa last week and discover your brand new hotel.Overall, the stay in suite #502 was a pleasant one : excellent location and classy design.Though, not everything was perfect :BUT #1 : Though newly (re)built, the rooms were extremely poorly soundproofed (the AC was a nightmare you could only switch off to bear it ; and the road kind of crossed the room).BUT #2 : Small boutique-hotel rooms have their charm, especially when smartly conceived / organised. Here, some trick of the space was missing : no place to store our 2 normally sized suitcases. We had to step over them whatever the move in the room.BUT #3 : Despite the bold prices, no little “gestures” or extras. 1 tiny little bottle of soap and 1 tiny little bottle of shampoo for the two of us, for 3 nights – none added over the days, and thus not enough for the last day. The sheets were not changed and became very crumpled over the days. And caution : the 2 mineral bottles that are casually deposited on the table are not complimentary as there generally are (they are invoiced 8 dollars without notice).

I stayed at the Nolitan for the first time for ten days in late August early September 2011 when I came to town for a surgical procedure. I had a great experience (and I must admit I am the typical hotel snob who always finds things wrong). The l staff could not have been more friendly, polite, professional and caring. The hotel itself, the staff and the neighborhood are oozing with soul. I was asked several times throughout my stay if there was anything at all they could do for me. They knew I liked the chocolates at turn down service and made sure I was well stocked each night thereafter. My room (neighborhood room w/balcony) was immaculately clean, beautifully appointed with nice threads, a cozy red cashmere throw, beautiful hardwood floors (instead of the old nasty carpets you find in most hotels), a comfortable bed, good water pressure with plenty of hot water. I had a clear view from my bed of the top third of the Empire State, Chrysler building and more. I spent a lot of time in the room relaxing. Though the rooms are not exactly large, there is good flow and they feel larger than they really are. The location was perfect. I loved being surrounded by delicious restaurants, charming boutiques, cobblestone streets and a very cool yet down to earth local scene. I didn't feel the need to hop in a taxi or on the train to get to different part of town. I can't say enough good things about The Nolitan and its staff and look forward to staying there next time I'm in NY. I am in no way connected to this hotel, just a person who takes their vacations very seriously!

The Nolitan is a great little hotel - as it just opened it might not yet have the vibe of other downtown boutiques but the friendly staff more than makes up for it. From the guys at the door, the wonderful Felix and Afredo(?) to the turn-down service, everyone took the time to make sure we had everything we needed. As parents, we of course also valued that our 1-year old was so well received - no problems what so ever, rather the opposite as it felt as if The Nolitan staff were happy to have him.However, being so new, they didn't have everything down to pat and the actual service sometimes suffered. A few misses here and there (what happended to the fruitplate and our dinner reservations?) and a kitchen that closed at 10 pm despite claiming 24-hour room service keeps us from giving The Nolitan a top score but we're sure that they will work that out very soon.Finally, the complimentary Vogue, GQ and Time Out in our small, cute room (loved the hard wood floors and the Empire State Building views!) as well as the green apples in the reception made our stay even more lovely.We'll be back!

We are completely enthralled with this hotel. NYC is our favorite place to visit together and the Nolitan makes you feel like a local. The staff is EXTREMELY knowledgable and helpful; Joy in reservations is superb, Felix at the door is amazing with many years experience and Cassandra knows everything there is to do and places to go (she also makes reservations and amazing recommendations-just tell her what you like to do). There were many helpful staff members and I wish I got each one of their names to send a proper 'thank you' to. I cannot sing their praises enough for making our Anniversary weekend memorable. Five star genuine service at the Nolitan.The size of the room is perfect for two! We stayed in the neighborhood 'accessible' balcony which is 35 square feet smaller than the normal neighborhood balcony and there was plenty of space! Great storage space under the bed with a safe, too. Crisp white sheets and a pillow preference available (feather or foam). The splash of red with the cashmere blanket on the bed was my favorite and my boyfriend's favorite was the waterfall shower. There were Nolitan T-shirts for sale in the drawer and I had to have one. The balcony was perfect for people watching in the morning while eating breakfast from a bakery a couple blocks away (Oro). At turn down service, they have different pieces of sensational chocolate each night. Someone mentioned the AC service in their review, I happened to like the noise because it drowned out other sounds and helps me sleep.It was a must for us to eat at the fabulous Ellabess. We had their breakfast; split the two egg, turkey sausage and potato meal along with a large fruit platter (amazing), orange juce and coffee for ($50 including tip). I am sure everything on the menu was delicious.The amazing roof top bar may not be open yet; however, hotel guests may take cocktails up there and enjoy it.The location is the Nolitan is more than perfect if you like shopping, food and little Italy. It's quiet and walking distance to Soho. We walked to all of the restaurants Cassandra made reservations at. I may be a young traveler but I know that if this hotel keeps up their awesome work, they will forever be my go-to hotel in NY. No matter the cost.

Our stay at The Nolitan was a very unique New York experience. The room was very comfortable and the service was memorable and notable. The roof is a must see! The staff treated us with kindness and consideration. They showed personal interest and were eager to make our accommodations the best possible. When we called the front desk they were polite and tended to our needs. One of the best features of staying at the Nolitan was its location. Definitely a +. We were so close to many local places of interest. We ate breakfast in Little Italy, had lunch in Chinatown and strolled through Soho. No doubt we would recommend The Nolitan to our friends and would stay there on our next visit to NYC.
user_name:
Jim S
White Plains, New York

review_body: My husband and I were in from the Hamptons for a family event, and chose this hotel because of it's location. We enjoyed our stay immensely. The room was small, as is typical for the new boutique hotels, but was warm and comfy. The amenities were terrific and I loved the bed, pillow and blankets. We had a balcony and the view of the Empire State Building was absolutely glorious.As soon as we entered, the staff was helpful and very present, yet not intrusive. As well, we had breakfast at Ellabess, which was delicious! We look forward to being able to stay again soon. Good job Nolitan!

What a bizarre little hotel. Overall it was very good. The staff was really great, friendly, informative, all that you'd want.The lack of carpeting in the rooms was most welcome. Our room, on the 8th floor with a balcony had a quite spectacular view of Manhattan, but this was part of what was odd about it. I think all the rooms in the hotel face north and have potentially great views. but most of the north wall of the room was either glass brick or the solid door out to the balcony. Only a relatively small part of the wall was a window. It just seemed like a very strange design choice. Why block or obscure most of a really spectacular view for no particular reason?Other than that, the room was great. I did really enjoy having a balcony. The room was small but very efficient. The shower was nice and large. The hotel also has a magnificent roof terrace, completely unused -- no bar, no restaurant up there. An almost 360 degree view of Manhattan and nothing up there. How odd! The lobby was really nice, small but very inviting.

I am a native New Yorker who currently lives in DC. I am super picky about location when I visit NYC and this hotel was simply perfect. The rooms are adorable, the decor fun and luxurious enough to keep things cool and comfortable, the staff very knowledgeable and willing to go the extra mile but above all, its location is magic. Walkable to SOHO, East Village, West Village, Little Italy, Chinatown and close enough to subways should you want to venture further downtown or uptown -- a real downtown gem. My parents and our 4 month old were with us and the hotel was totally family friendly.

I booked a cityscape balcony room at the Nolitan for my holidays this august. I go often to NYC and i’m quite picky, at the first time i was concerned about the location but i was wrong, it was fab! In the middle of the action (Nolita e Soho are just the best for shops, restaurants, bars and discos!) Everything was at hand.My room was stylish and beyond the expectations: on the 9th floor with a breathtaking view of Manhattan skyline, clean, with a fresh design, so cool and a cozy!The service was the icing on the cake.The front staff was superb: exceptionally helpful and willing to make reservations for dinner or to offer advice as you desire but content to stay in the background if you don't need them.Felix at the door was amazing!Always smiling they helped me to make the best choice for exploring the neighborhood or the area of Brooklyn and Williamsburg. (Important: Williamsburg bridge is just a few steps away from the hotel and it leads to the most exciting district to visit: Williamsburg, again, the place to see before it’s too late.)I was supposed to spend just a week in NYC, but the guys at the reception and all the people of the Elabees, the brand new restaurant of the hotel, made my stay soooo amazing that i decided to extend it for 3 days more, despite hurricane IRENE...Thanks again guys, you made my stay unforgettable, i can’t wait to return.

Absolutely fabulous new boutique hotel. Great attention to every detail in the design of the rooms, which despite their medium size have every amenity we would need with terrific quality throughout. The service was extremely personable and friendly in ways that we have NEVER seen before in NYC. Given we got the very reasonable introductory rates, this was an absolutely excellent experience. Free access to the (5 minute walk) high-end gym was an absolute cinch.

My wife and I live in Soho but wanted a "night out", so we checked-in to the Nolitan, which is three blocks from our house.The design is superb and the guestrooms are very comfortable with high-thread count sheets and wonderful perks. Overall, the hotel is a perfect marriage of low-key hip and comfortable- perfect for its setting at the cusp of Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy.The staff is superb, attractive, attentive and very committed.
user_name:
WalterChatham
New York City, New York

review_body: I had a fabulous time at the Nolitan Hotel. The hotel has an understated elegance that marries industrial with modern design. The service was great from the moment I walked in till check-out, I was greeted with smiling faces.  My room was immaculate and had a modern, yet comfy feel. The bed was so comfortable, I woke up feeling refreshed and relaxed. My nightstand was filled with an array of healthy and tasty snacks. The refrigerator was also fully stocked with drinks suitable for all palates. I was greeted by a beautiful view in the morning while in the evening, I was just as pleased from the balcony on my 8th floor room. Definitely try their restaurant, Ellabess, it has great food at reasonable prices. The area shops and restaurants are great as well, it all adds to the Nolita experience. I highly recommend a stay here. If you want to be in the village area when in NYC this should be your first choice.

After much research, we chose the Nolitan for our weekend getaway. We wanted an area where we could explore boutiques and neighborhood restaurants. We waivered between Nolita, Tribeca and SoHo and I'm SO glad that we chose Nolita and the Nolitan. It is trendy and has a great vibe without being uppity - perfect for an "almost-40-something"! Cassandra, the concierge, is stellar. She was very helpful in finding us an outstanding Italian restaurant with an extensive gluten-free menu, which we would not have found on our own. The rooms are small (not a complaint - it's what you get in NY) but very well appointed. The shower is the best. The A/C is a bit loud though. Enjoyed some cocktails in the bar too - great atmosphere and service there too. Well done, Nolitan! We hope to return sometime.

Came here directly from a 6 night stay at Tribeca Grand as was blown away by the difference. Most particularly, the staff at the Nolitan are so warm, welcoming and attentive from the gorgeous doormen, the wonderful guest relations team to the cleaners - I didn't meet a staffer who wasn't genuinely lovely. If you have a question, it will be answered, a problem, it will be solved, swiftly. These are people who put the guest first and clearly take pride in their work. The location is great - a stone's throw from the shopping and eating of Soho & Nolita and easy access to the subway and cabs. Design lovers will appreciate the clean lines and clever use of space in the rooms and hotel overall. I even love the logo! The beds are like a warm hug and are further enhanced by the sweet turndown service - amazing local chocolates and weather forecast card for the coming day. Love, love, loved it!

Got the recommendation from someone who had just seen this new hotel from the outside. The inside was even better. The style is very cool and modern. The lobby, bar and restaurant is very inviting and the rooms are small but extremely well designed and practical. Small things that just makes you go "how clever". The staff on all levels are very positive, proud and professional. The location, close to SOHO, Little Italy etc. is great for recreational as well as business purposes since the transportation is easy to and from the rest of Manhattan as well as LGA and JFK.

We stayed with our family for a weekend in NYC. What a find this turned out to be. The Nolitan is new, clean and is located within steps from SoHo. The front desk was extremely helpful, gave us area maps and coupons to use in nearby stores (a plus!). It was cloudy so the doorman suggested we take some umbrellas that the front desk provided, which proved to be quite necessary! The beds are crazy comfortable, we didn't want to get out of them. Nice robes and slippers to use. We had a room with a balcony with North/South views. We ate in the restaurant Ellabess for breakfast. It was delicious, they were also very accommodating with our children's food allergies. Other times we have stayed in NYC we stayed farther uptown, but this was so much nicer. We will definitely be back!

We are from CT and wanted a weekend getaway in the city. We picked the Nolitan after reading the reviews. Loved our stay! Beautiful new property - clean, neat, upscale. Great feel. Loved the tub in the room. Exactly as pictured. Beds very comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful. Our kids used hotel skateboards as we walked around. We recommended this hotel to friends and they loved it too. Great area... lots to see and do....will definitely stay here next time we go back.

we had a great weekend at the nolitan, with no real negatives worth mentioning, except maybe that it rained the first night (they provided umbrellas). the room was great, a balcony unit with a glass shower wall that adds a open feel to the layout.. not huge, but sleek, well appointed & comfortable. the staff was friendly & helpful, i highly recommend going to see ricky at the bar for a dirty martini. i saw some other reviewers mentioned a loud air conditioner situation, i didnt notice that at all. the location is great, walk to little italy, soho, east/west village music/comedy/dance clubs plus funky cafe's & shops in the immediate area.

I have traveled to many different Countries as well as many places in the U.S., but this was my first trip to NYC. I am glad to say our experience @ the Nolitan was second to none! The Staff was extremely accomodating and went out of their way to help us with everything we needed to complete our stay. They were all knowledgeable on the entire area and were great with guiding us with where to go & what to see while in NYC. Our room was amazing! Very modern and yet very efficient. I've never stayed in any place any cleaner either! And talk about location... it is within walking distance of great shopping, dining , entertainment , and nightlife. Being right in Chinatown was a plus as it was an amazing cultural experience for my son and I. And nearby Little Italy ..... mangia,mangia! I suppose my favorite part of our stay was the sincerity of the staff,. Without their guidance we wouldn't have known to visit all the places we did. I would highly recommend the Nolitan to everyone going to NYC and we are looking forward to our next stay there !

The Nolitan Hotel provided the needed comfort to end my hectic day of running around the city. The room was small, but the clean interior lines made the room seem more spacious and I enjoyed the modern but friendly ambiance. Coming from a big city in Japan, I'm used to cramped spaces. But the room was designed well to accomodate the space. I wish more Japanese hotel rooms were designed in a similar fashion. I would say that my favorite part of the stay was the super-comfortable bed with crisp sheets, and the magnificent view of the city from the 6th floor. Its true, many other places may have a similar view, but its nice to be able to enjoy the view while you're sprawled out on your bed. I could have slept much longer, but the excitement in the neighborhood kept me from staying in too long. It was great to be able to stroll out of the hotel, right into cute little boutiques and cafes. Soho, Washington Square Park, Battery Park and Chinatown was well within walking distance. If you've done all of your sightseeing in New York and you just want to a taste of the life of a local New Yorker, I imagine that this would be a good hotel for you!

THE GOOD:The hotel was gorgeous and modern. The neighborhood is great. Very clean. Friendly staff. The views are incredible. The room and bathroom were nice in size.THE BAD:Two minor complaints. The airconditioner in the room was incredible loud. Not just your typical hotel loud but strangely loud. We also had a hard time getting a cab. They called us one so they wouldn't let us get in any of the 4 or 5 that drove by. Eventually the door guy flagged down one for us after I told him we were going to be late. Not a huge negative just slightly annoying. I would definitely stay again. Especially for the introductory price they were offering.

Just had the best weekend in NYC not only because of the city's (SoHo) flavor but because of the excellent accomodation at The Nolitan Hotel. I have been to hundreds of hotels around the world, including the newer botique hotels in Europe and I must say that The Nolitan has just become my gold standard. Yes, the fact that it is very new is a plus. Yet, the rooms have the natural feel of class -- hardwood floors that hopefully would never have the look & smell of old carpeting; modern bathrooom fixtures; and a glass-encased shower area separate from the toilet, which makes for a refreshing & relaxing hot shower. The room gives you that feeling of being in your own CLEAN bedroom at home! The bed, pillows & blanket were pure softness & comfort -- just what you need after a full day of enjoying the neighboring enclaves of good food & world class shopping! Clean, Cheerful, Convenient, Comfortable, Classy -- The Nolitan has it all! A highly recommended hotel for the discriminating travel who wants everything in a hotel. Thanks to the Management & friendly staff for a great stay.

From the minute we arrived at the garage across the street, to the minute we checked out & our car was picked up from the garage for us, this is fine service you do not find in New York city. Kudos to the staff.WHile inside, appreciate for yourself the interior.

I loved this place! The location was fantastic- walking distance to Little Italy, the East Village and more. While hotel room was on the smaller side the space was used efficiently and they had thought of everything. And it was beautiful with modern finishes, an amazing shower and cute little balcony. Everyone on staff was incredibly warm and friendly. I will definitely stay there again!
Did a mini staycation here and loved it! The staff are very friendly the rooms and hotel is brand new. Red flower amenities in the bathroom!!!!

Armani74
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is one block away from Chinatown and little Italy, very vivid neighborhood. Our room is tidy and in contemporary . And I really like the tub in the room. But the only problem is the horrendously loud AC. It woke me up each time when it turns on. So I had to switch it off. I guess the hotel knows the problem, so we have a big fan on the ceiling.
user_name:
Zzbb
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I were treated with "a night off" from the kids....We decided to stay in trendy soho....found the Nolitan, booked it, and had an AMAZING night!! We started our night off with a nice romantic dinner at the hotel restaurant. After that, we took a five minute cab ride to highline.....and strolled back to the hotel..... hotel room was very comfortable! Great pillows and bed!! I noticed the fine details that was put into the room, from the very soft bedding, to the awesome slippers(not your typical hotel slippers,they were the kind you'd actually buy in a store) and more.....I can't forget about the staff...they are very caring and considerate which made our stay even more delightful...Can't wait for another "night off".....we'll absolutely be coming back for more Nolitan!

My wife and I loved our stay at The Nolitan. Not only is it at a great location, but the staff went above and beyond to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. We highly recommend the Nolitan, you will not be disappointed.

I stayed one night and got there in the evening. When I arrived, it was quite dark in the lobby, as well as in the hallway on my floor. I stayed in a neighborhood balcony room. The room was on the smaller side--typical of many boutique hotels. But it was very clean and the decor was modern, yet intimate and welcoming. The attention to detail was great--from the toiletries, robes, red slippers, iPod dock, to a red Nolitan-branded pilates mat. There was a turn-down service available as well. The bed was very comfortable. Aside from hearing some of the traffic from the street below, I had a very comfortable night. If you're sensitive to noise, you might want to ask for a room on a higher floor. I didn't really have a problem there. I had a great breakfast the next morning at Ellabess--a must-try! The lobby was brightly lit in the morning too--a nice change from the night before.Overall, it was a great stay and I'd recommend it to others!
user_name:
stella d
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was beautiful and SUPER clean. The bed was VERY comfortable! The location of the hotel is perfect. It is close to shops and wonderful restaurants. I would definitely return to this hotel. The location, the service, the rooms and the hotel's attention to detail made our stay wonderful!
user_name:
jennyzheng
New York City, New York

review_body: I liked the location of the hotel. It is close to Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy. Plenty of restaurants and shops. I was on the 6th floor and saw the tip of the Empire State building. Get a higher floor if you want to get a better view of it. The room was very clean and bed was comfortable. The breakfast at the restaurant was good and the price was reasonable. I would stay here again.

I took my family for a long weekend in NYC and was thrilled to have found the newly-opened Nolitan Hotel. It's location is perfect: we were able to walk down the block for dinner in Chinatown, and in the other direction for morning pastries in Soho. (Though the on-site restaurant, Ellabess, also offered a very nice breakfast selection, which we enjoyed.) The hotel design is amazing, starting with the lobby, which is cozy and inviting. Room design is equally impressive, with amazing views of downtown from the floor-to-ceiling windows. (But don't forget to draw those light-blocking curtains if you hope to sleep in.) Bathrooms are sleek with clean lines and a bright feel. We loved the free-standing tub that neighbored the sleeping area: a very old-school NYC tenement idea, but this time in chic way. The staff was wonderful, and went above and beyond in all areas. Overall, the Nolitan is an amazing addition to a great NYC neighborhood. You'd be crazy to stay anywhere else.

I just checked into the Nolitan. It is a new hotel and you can tell. The room is quite small with a sort of cold feeling and nothing special. I called down to the front desk because my door wouldn't lock. I also asked if there was somewhere nearby where I could have a drink and some food that has wifi. He said Starbucks. I said no, real food and A DRINK. He said McDonald's? The lock did get fixed quickly, however.Definitely will not stay here again. Not sure what all the other rave reviews are about. I sort of wonder if they are fake. It's a lot of fantastic reviews for a new hotel.

Checked it on 29 July, the front office staff were fantastic, and made me feel at ease the moment I stepped in. The hotel rooms are very cool, with all space being used incredibly intelligently - all adding up to the "coolness" of the hotel. A very special mention has to be made of the staff - all of them (and I mean all of them) were fantastic, friendly and full of good advice. I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know (i've already recommended it to a couple of friends visiting NYC) without a second of doubt. The rooftop view in the morning is particularly special. I will be back in NYC in November and will definately be checking in again. To the Nolitan staff - keep up the good work!
user_name:
Moseph84
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: The Nolitan Hotel is a gem in NYC. Smack dab in the middle of Soho, Lower East Side,Chinatown, and Little Italy, it couldn't have a better location. Close to subway stops andwalking distance to so much! Many terrific little eateries within steps. The rooms werevery cool with a downtown vibe, not fussy or boring. But the best part was the wonderful staff. Because it's a small hotel, you feel like you are at home with friends taking care of you.If you want a crazy velvet rope scene, go to the Standard. But if you want to feel specialin a wonderful hotel in a more chill atmosphere, don't miss the Nolitan.

The Nolitan is no doubt an up scale designer boutique hotel… but in an understated and low key way. It doesn’t scream at you but welcomes you with its style and thoughtful and refined touches. This is a hotel where you want your city slicker friends to meet you at so they know you are in the know. The service is friendly from the moment you walk in. There are touches everywhere, from the apples at the checkin desk, the welcome package with discounts from local Nolita retailers, to the throwback bicycles for free guest’s use, to the a great stylish lobby and seating area to await your uptown business acquaintances or friends. The views from our room (and I think most rooms since the hotel faces north) are incredible, full Manhattan skyline with a great unobstructed view of the Empire State Building. The rooms are a cross between industrial and minimalist chic, full of nice amenities, a yoga mat, slippers, robes, flat screen TV, etc. Room were just enough space and had turn down service. The bed was super comfortable and we had a great nights sleep. There was even free wi-fi which for some reason I had trouble getting onto so the front desk immediately came up to my room and fumbled with my laptop and made it work.The hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance of most downtown spots. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant, Ellabess, which serves new American cuisine. The food was refreshing and seasonal for the summer. Service was attentive. Especially memorable was their version of the clam chowder, which is “deconstructed” and featured raw clams.Our entire stay at the Nolitan was stress free. And at the end, we felt we had stayed at a hotel that will very shortly be the talk of the town among the in crowd.

Joy the one who helps you book the rooms is excellent at her job and is more than just a person on the other line...check in was good we were early and they got us in by 2pm....then I got a text from chase that they put a 150 dollar hold on my debit card I think I should have been told at check in especially since it was a debit card....the room was awesome, really clean modern and fun. They even refreshed the room while we were out for dinner but the slamming if the door next to us by the help was unprofessional though I must note it was during the day and they did not start again til about 830am again.... The staff though were really nice and helpful but we came back to hotel for a drink and asked the bartender if he was still serving and then the night doorman came running after us and said no bar is closed and he was not nice at all no smiles no help no jokes and took care of traffic up the street better than hotel guests but the day doorman I think Felix was amazing and delightful. The only other issue now is my entire stay was credited and I have no charge so before work tomorrow I have to go to chase and find out what is going on....I would return because it was sooo clean and location and day time staff but I will book with third party like hotels.com and then give credit card for their 150 dollar hold since the billing is obviously screwy........But it was one of the nicest places in nyc
user_name:
katiejim
New York City, New York

review_body: The Nolitan is a first class hotel, and as soon as you step in the door you are greeted by a warm staff that makes you feel welcome and comfortable. The service is impeccable from the bell hop to the waitstaff at the amazing ellabess restaurant. This hotel is the full package, a home away from home in a modern shell with a bed that will make you want to stay inside and sleep all day. A serene retreat in the city that never sleeps.

From the minute we walked in the lobby we felt at home! The entire staff was friendly and made us feel comfortable. The rooms were extremely clean and the beds were very comfortable. Loved the amenities like robe and slippers. Nice complimentary Voss water. The balcony was nice to look out at the neighborhood. The entire hotel had a cool vibe. It's location in Nolita was perfect for enjoying great restaurants and sights nearby. We can't wait to return.

I came down from New Hampshire for the weekend and stayed at the recently opened Nolitan, in the downtown area of Manhattan known as Nolita (North of Little Italy). The hotel looked good from what I saw on line, but being there was far better, truly a unique experience.I travel frequently in Europe and this hotel has the details, feel, sensibility and panache of the top boutique Euro hotels one finds in Paris, Barcelona, Rome and Berlin. Virtually every accoutrement was unique - the soap, the cement ceilings, the incredibly bed and pillows with a cashmere throw, the free standing bathtub and of course the view of downtown from the room and a spectacular 360 degree view of Manhattan from the roof garden.The service was amiable without being intrusive - intuitive is a good word - and it was hard to believe the Nolitan has only been open for a couple of weeks. Free bicycles, a stint and the local health club and many extras make one feel well cared for and special.The location is perfect, at the epicenter of Nolita - with boutique shops (virtually no chain stores) of every kind along Elizabeth, Mott and Mulberry. Restaurants of every stripe abound in the area, but the best may be the one in the Nolitan, "Ellabess" simply gorgeous decor and wonderful food. The Hotel is also just above the heart of Chinatown, which provides a nice contrast to the trendy Nolitan pathways and the nearby SoHo megashops. The entire area provides hours of interesting walking.

Hip cool spot just opened, special touches with night turn down. Valet & bell staff are exceptional. Rooms are NYC chic, love the hardwood floors with area rugs, concrete ceilings. Comfortable bed, not hard or soft, bright natural lighting. So much in walking distance, Little Italy, So-Ho, Chinatown, restaurants clubs. Love the "fishbowl" shower where you can watch tv from there. I will return to this hotel on my next biz trip to Manhattan

My stay at The Nolitan was absolutely perfect. From the moment I arrived I was greeted by smiling friendly faces. Throughout my stay every single member of the staff was extremely attentive. The check-in process was quick and painless. The room exceeded my expectations, it was evident that every single detail was well thought out. I personally loved the bath & body products from Red Flower, the ipod/iphone dock, the cashmere throw and the complimentary copy of the NYTimes to name a few. Another highlight of the hotel is the location which provides some spectacular views. Make sure to visit the rooftop! Step right out and you'll find yourself right in the heart of Nolita and a few quick steps from SoHo & Chinatown. I was able to take a quick jog to the Hudson for a morning run the next day. Also, recommend Ellabess right at the hotel. While I wasn't able to go there for dinner, breakfast was absolutely delicious! Everything I tried was amazing!While I was only able to spend one night, I felt right at home. The only bad about my stay was having to leave!

Our stay at the Nolitan Hotel was an experience like no other. The attention to detail from the face of the structure to the toiletry packaging, was impeccable and first class. The hotel itself has a modern, clean-cut feel while still feeling like a cozy home away from home, with small touches like a red absolutely divine and smooth to the touch throw, daily NY Times delivery and a bowl of fresh, crisp apples waiting for you at the front desk. We just melted into the bedding and pillows at the end of our eventful day strolling through the streets of Nolita. It was the kind of sleep you can only dream of. From the before dinner relaxing on the balcony of our room, taking in the amazing view, to our midnight rendezvous up the elevator and out onto the rooftop, allowing a panoramic view of the midnight NYC skyline, the scenery and unique views from the Nolitan were truly an amazing treat. We were treated like royalty from the moment the door man let us into the hotel, introducing himself and shaking our hands, to the deligful front desk check-in and tour of the amenities in our room and amazing turn-down service, including a card left on your pillow hilighting the weather forecast for the following day-another example of how the staff strives to care for your every need, leaving only one job for you-Enjoy, relax and truly experience the life of a Nolitan!!

Hotel just opened. Since it's in Nolita, we found it to be located within close walking distance to the stores and restaurants we love. Our room was on the ninth floor w/balcony facing uptown - great views. Room was thoughtfully laid out with attention to detail. Loved the concrete ceilings, glass shower, venetian plaster, wood floors, and just right bed. Couldn't catch dinner in the hotel restaurant (ellabess) just too busy. But we managed breakfast there and it had a real wow factor including the $10 to $14 price range. Can't wait to go back. Would highly recommend!

I'm in the travel and leisure industry and have stayed in many hotels in the USA and internationally. My stay at the Nolitan was very favorable. The staff was eager to assist and received us as family. Everything is brand new and immaculately kept. The great bedding helped give me a good night sleep. I enjoyed the location with easy access to China town, great dinning in little italy, and trendy Soho. The decor is a cross over of modern and Euro Chic. Over all I was very pleased with my experience at the Nolitan and would be happy to refer my clients to stay there.
user_name:
patricia w
New York City, New York

review_body: wow what a great find! brand new hotel that has clearly had a lot of thought and effort gone into it. very cool without being pretentious, really high spec throughout which makes it feel quality and views fromthe upper floors including the roof terrace are tremendous

My wife and I recently spent a weekend at The Nolitian....Wow!Felt like a week’s vacation. Truly a "Boutique Hotel” with a luxury feel..The staff was most accommodating and made us feel special throughout our stay...FYI also loved the breakfast at Ella Bess!

I enjoyed this particular hotel immensely for various reasons such as it's atmosphere, style, service, and location. The staff was very welcoming and helpful to guests as well as supplying efficient service to us. This boutique hotel is exquisite in that the interior and exterior designs will blow you away. I personally enjoy the fact that each room is set up very prestigiously, each with an amazing view that you would undoubtedly enjoy. Finally, it's location is not too crowded and the area Nolita, where it's located, has distinguished character with many shops and restaurants. And better yet, it has Broadway street right around the corner if you're in the mood to be a tourist or a trendy shopper. All in all, the Nolitan is a must! It was made to be customized for its guests for an amazing experience in the Big Apple.

I had a great time at the hotel. All the workers were friendly. They greeted you as you were leaving and coming back to your room all the time. The beds were really comfortable i slept really well. Breakfast was delicious at ellabess. I had the eggs and i think turkey sausages. The staff was super helpful and fast when it came to resolving issues in the hotel. The key to my door did not work at first but they got that fixed quickly. i had a great view of the city from my room. Also from my bed i could look out and see the empire state building which was nice. i loved the view. Get a room on the 9th floor. Also i liked the water they offered in my room. I do not remember where it was from but it was tasty. You have to walk to Chinatown and explore the city. I got the best foot-rub for 20 bucks. Because the hotel is not so huge you really feel at home. They have a lot of really cool art books in the lobby. I am definitely going to go back next time i have to stay in the city.
